name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Royal Fantasy
description: Experimental Tech Readout: Royal Fantasy Tournament offers a complete list of the custom 'Mechs and battle armor devised for a special Solaris VII series of exhibition bouts with a familiar theme. Statistics, record sheets, and even pilot bios are included for 19 unique new experimental units, ready for play in (really) advanced BattleTech games set in the arenas of the Solaris VII Game World.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Steiner
description: Experimental Technical Readout: Steiner samples the custom and prototype designs that have begun to turn up in testing labs and top-secret proving grounds of the war-torn Lyran Alliance. Each design featured in this book incorporates some of the latest technologies developed by the realms of the Inner Sphere as the war against the Word of Blake winds toward its final conclusion. These technologies--first described in Tactical Operations --have yet to achieve widespread production, but each has been prototyped and rushed to the field for their desperate consumers. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 new experimental BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battle armor designs presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Succession Wars
description: Experimental Technical Readout: Succession Wars, Volume 1 samples some of the desperate technological experiments that the war-ravaged powers of the Inner Sphere tinkered with during the post-Star League Succession Wars period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the combination of regressing post-Star League technology levels on the BattleMechs, combat vehicles, and aerospace units that followed. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 14 BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Lamenkov's Liability
description: Lamenkov's Liability describes a lance of notable MechWarriors from the nascent Republic of the Sphere, highlighting their warriors, their machines, and their abilities both on and off the battlefields of the late 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Liability lance and a micro-campaign based on their exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Salazar Tsakalotos
description: Salazar Tsakalotos is one of many warriors who have emerged from the fires of war to join the ranks of the notable elite, forging his reputation and his destiny with the aid of his custom Thunderbolt. This dossier file provides players with the background and description of one of the BattleTech universe's upcoming elite, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game. Bring Salazar into the battles of Lamenkov's Liability (CAT#35LP001A) for an even more legendary performance, or simply employ him in your own games as a valued ally--or a deadly foe.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Youling Zhanshi
description: BattleTech Dossiers: Youling Zhanshi describes a lance of notable MechWarriors from the Capellan Confederation, highlighting their warriors, their machines, and their abilities both on and off the battlefields of the late 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Youling Zhanshi lance and a micro-campaign based on their exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dossiers – Jason Zaklan
description: Jason Zaklan is one of many warriors who have emerged from the fires of war to join the ranks of the notable elite, forging his reputation and his destiny with the aid of his custom Ti Ts'ang. This dossier file provides players with the background and description of one of the BattleTech universe's upcoming elites, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Role-Playing Game. Bring Jason into the battles of the Youling Zhanshi (CAT# 35LP02A) for an even more legendary performance, or simply employ him in your own games as a valued ally--or a deadly foe.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Dossiers – The Bounty Hunter
description: The Bounty Hunter Lance describes the notable MechWarriors who served alongside the Bounty Hunter during the early Jihad era, highlighting the abilities of these warriors and their machines, both on and off the battlefields of the 31st century. This Lance Pack dossier file provides players with the background and descriptions of all four members of the Hunter's lance and a micro-campaign based on their Jihad exploits, complete with character and BattleMech record sheets suitable for play with Total Warfare and A Time of War: The BattleTech Roleplaying Game.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Era Digest – Age of War
description: Era Digest: Age of War is a mini-sourcebook that explores the pivotal developments of the Sphere-wide fighting that ultimately led to the birth of the Star League, featuring a glimpse of life in the BattleTech universe before the age of the BattleMech, the rise of neo-feudalism, and a look at the evolution of combat from the savagery of ˆ_Ñ??total warfareˆ? to the chivalry of MechWarriors. Complete with rules and stats for several Age of War units, Era Digest: Age of War also features role-playing support for this crucial setting in BattleTech history!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Era Digest – Golden Century
description: Era Digest: Golden Century is a mini-sourcebook that describes the development of the Clans at their origin in a new series format, giving players a glimpse of early Clan life, the basics of Clan rituals, and a look at the rise and fall of Clan Mongoose. Complete with rules and stats for several Golden Century units--including the first OmniMechs--Era Digest: Golden Century also features role-playing support for this crucial period in BattleTech history!
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Tatts
description:
"Tatts" The Racecourse on the table is a simulated horse racing and gambling game from Australia published during the 1920's. Players consist of banker or " Bookmaker" and "Punters". The Punters place tokens or cash on the names of horses on the playing board. These horses are given "odds" to win. The Banker then gives a large pointer a spin which has the horses names on the board and when it comes to rest the pointer indicates the winner. The banker then pays the winner according to the odds marked on the board. Punters can back more than one horse or the top three winners.

From an Australian sporting perspective, Tatts has some historical interest. The horse names are Australian Champion Thoroughbreds from 1920 to 1921 with horse names synonymous in winning the richest races in Australia, such the Melbourne Cup, Sydney Cup, Caulfield Cup and Rosehill Guineas.

—user summary

name: Alles Augsburg...?: Das Quiz
description:
In this trivia game, one question and 4 answers about Augsburg are read out in turn. At least one answer is correct and at least one answer is wrong. The other two answers can be wrong or right. All players now guess which answers are correct. Each player can place at least one, but no more than 3, guessing stones. If you guess an incorrect answer, you do not win any points. All other players receive one point for each correct answer. The player who has collected the most points after an agreed number of questions wins the game.

—user summary

name: Manolo Chess
description:
The game is played on a round playing field with 4 x 16 squares. Due to the arrangement of the playing fields, some pieces have greater freedom of movement (queen, rook), while others are more restricted (bishop). The center line of the circle is defined as the baseline.
Otherwise, the usual rules of chess apply.

—user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Static Capture

name: Trolljakten
description:
Escape from the trolls - before it's too late. A fun and exciting strategy game for everyone.
When you and your friends are out in the woods, you are taken by the evil mountain troll and his changes. Now you are stuck down in The troll mountain and have to get out before you are transformed into a troll - or something even worse…

There are two roads out, but both paths and bridges are in poor condition and full of holes. As a team, you must collect enough different cards so that you can change to your stone and wooden plank tokens to make a way out, and at the same time avoid being stopped by the trolls…. The exciting escape can begin!

In Trolljakten, each round consists of two parts - first a card part where you pick up new cards and then play as many cards as you want: fix roads, bridges, move trolls or change cards.

When you have finished the card, roll the dice and move one of the team's three game pieces.

The game is both exciting and fun. The more you play the more you discover the different strategies you can use to avoid the trolls, and be the first team to get out of the troll mountain.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Penguin Race
description:
Be the first to bring your penguins to safety over the open sea before the ice bridges melt! The five bridges are made of real ice, so you have to put the mould for the bridge´s in the freezer before you play. There are two sets of moulds so you always have bridge´s to play with. You have to cross the bridge´s before they melt and collapses. If one bridge melts, take another way with a bridge still intact.
Sabotage by destroying strategic ice bridges by spraying water or pouring salt, or give your competitors a cold shower so they fall into the sea and start their hike again.

Two sets of bridges, so one can always be in the freezer!

A fun & different game that engages!

How the game is played:

The player that first moves their penguins across the ice to the goal has won. The other the team's start is your goal. But hurry up before the ice bridges are melting, and watch out for falling in the water!
Every time it's your turn, you should:

Roll the dice, and possibly move a penguin.
Pick up an event card.


Use one or two cards (your choice).

name: Esopya
description:
Esopya is a card game for 1-4 players. It is played on a tactical board and the purpose of the game is to defeat the rival kingdom by summoning creatures that move across the battlefield or by casting powerful spells.

Esopya is also the name of a fantasy world. During its ancient history, many different civilizations were born: Elves, Dwarves, Humans, Vampires, Ogres, Sorcerers and so many others.

From the planet, it is possible to assimilate a very powerful energy source: Mana. It is a resource that allows people to grow and dominate others. Some defend their sources, others seek for new ones.

You can build your own deck, with your own tactics, or play with a ready-to-play one.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting

name: Frankfurt-Spiel
description:
This game may be played in several different ways:

Frankfurt-Spiel (roll and move game with event cards),
Jahresereignisse sammeln (1. with collecting fact cards)
Quartette sammeln (2. with collecting sets of fact cards)
Strategisches Quartette sammeln (like 3., but the 1st to get one set of cards wins)
Frankfurt-Quiz (quiz card game)
Frankfurt-Quartett (card game)
Joker-Quartett (6. with joker cards)
Frankfurt Rommé (card game)


The game was published in 1977 as a promotional boardgame for the "Stadtsparkasse Frankfurt".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Zombie Bus: Le raton laveur
description:
Upon arrival, the raccoon immediately loses an item of equipment for each player who owns it (of your choice).

Then at the start of each turn, and as long as it remains in play, he eliminates a random token from the equipment pile.

Note: if both the raccoon and the squirrel are in play, the raccoon immediately joins the squirrel on the active player! It will remain on that player until it is eliminated.

A son arrivée, le raton laveur fait perdre immédiatement un équipement à chaque joueur qui en possède (au choix).

Puis au début de chaque tour, et tant qu'il reste en jeu, il élimine un jeton au hasard de la pile des équipements.

Note : si le raton laveur et l'écureuil sont tous les deux en jeu, le raton laveur rejoint immédiatement l'écureuil sur le joueur actif ! Il restera sur ce joueur jusqu'à son élimination.

name: Pippi Langstrumpf Pantomime
description:
This is a charades/pantomime game for 2 groups. Every group gets some cards with nice images of Pippi and her friends and explains the words on the cards to the other group without any words, but just gestures.

The group which recognizes the most cards win.

name: Pippi packt ihren Koffer
description:
This is an interesting memory game for 2-4 children.

All children have a look at the 34 cards and try to memorize them. Then the cards are shuffled and put face down on the table. The youngest child starts and says what s/he wants to put in their bag and turns one card face up. If s/he is lucky, and the card shows the correct image, s/he puts it in their bag. If not, s/he has to turn the card face down again and it's the next player's turn. The child with the most stuff in his bag when the tiles are all picked, wins

name: Nachbars Kirschen
description:
It's no cinch getting to the delicious cherries in the garden of Mr. Scrooge, the next door neighbour, because 2 dogs are keeping a watchful guard over the cherry tree. Only a child who really knows how to use a fishing line can outwit the guard dogs and hang the pair of cherries he's caught over his ears.

The game is constructed in a box with wooden cherries in pairs attached to strings inside. The is also one pair of dogs attached to strings in the box.

Children take turn using the wooden fishing pole to hook the cherries - avoiding the dogs. The game ends when the cherries run out. The child who hooks the most cherries wins. If a child hooks the dogs, the game stops and they lose.

name: Dicke Fische
description:
Big fish is a learning game for 2-6 children and requires the ability to observe well and guess the correct range of the fishing net.

Capt'n Catchem, the smart fisherman, is sitting in his small boat and is casting the fishing net again and again. Whoever can help him to move his boat to the right point and catch many fresh fish, will be rewarded with a big catch.

The game is played on the floor or table, the fish are randomly distributed, a minimum distance of 5 cm. In your turn you choose a fish and place the boat where Capt'n Catchem can catch the fish. The fish is caught when it lies in the ring without contact, the boat must not touch or move any fish, the tip should point in the direction of the selected fish, if the boat is set, it is no longer allowed to change its position. When all fish have been caught, the winner is whoever has the longest row when the fish are next to each other.

name: Mäuse-ABC
description:
This game consists of 6 small games for children to start learning letters and reading.

Game 1 - Insert letters:
The children insert letter tiles in the correct alphabetical order in the frame. This can be controlled with the ABC board. For correct letters, the kid gets a mouse cards and the one with the most mouse cards wins at the end of the game.

Game 2 - Arrange letters
The letter tiles are put face down in the frame above the ABC board according to color. The starting kid roles the dice and one letter card of the corresponding colour is revealed which s/he needs to put in the correct place.

Game 3- Guessing letters
The letters are put unordered in the cheese frame, underneath is a template sheet (inserted by a child as the game leader). Whoever thinks they can guess the letter quickly puts their mouse on it.

Game 4 - Search for a word
The letters are placed face down in the frame. The game master selects a word from the word list and the children try to find the letters of this word.

Game 5 - Reveal a word
The letters of a word from the list are to be found and uncovered in one go, everyone has to remember all the uncovered letters and their places.

Game 6 - Find a word
Words are to be formed from the revealed letters. The children can use the word list to help them.

—user summary

name: Wer zuletzt lacht...
description:
In this card game, every player gets five cards. During his turn, each player put one card face up in front of him. For every smiling face, he gets a chip and puts it on his card. For every sad face, he can take a chip from another player.
The player with most chips wins.

—user summary

name: Stormsunder: Bones of the Conquered
description:
Continue the Stormsunder: Heirs of Ruin core game adventure with the Bones of the Conquered expansion with hundreds of hours of new gameplay!

This expansion contains more than 136 minatures, 1300 cards and a 300-page campain book!

name: Stormsunder: A Pharaoh's Wrath
description:
Continue the Stormsunder: Heirs of Ruin core game and Bones of the Conquered expansion adventure with the A Pharaoh's Wrath expansion with hundreds of hours of new gameplay!

This expansion contains more than 110 minatures, 1500 cards and a 300-page campain book!

name: Stormsunder: The Faceless Expansion
description:
The Faceless expansion adds the Faceless as an additional faction to Stormsunder as a way for players to increase the difficulty of their adventure. Early on in the story, the heroes will cross paths with the Faceless and be hunted by them throughout their journey. The Faceless may arrive one or two at a time during an encounter to harass the heroes, or they may attack in full force after the heroes are already weary from combat. Regardless, the Faceless present a unique challenge for players to choose to embark upon. If you want a challenge, this is the way to go.

The Faceless Expansion includes:
- 13 Faceless Miniatures (Bakeal x1, Faceless Negator x3, Faceless Abolisher x3, Faceless Obliterator x3, Faceless Nullifier x3).
- 103 Adversary, Equipment and Other Cards.
- 48-Page Campaign Book.

—description from the publisher

name: Stormsunder: Wayward Squire Expansion
description:
The Wayward Squire expansion adds Lady Aylwen, Phelt and Frank to the world of Stormsunder. Hailing from the Tulion Wastes from a far away land, the valiant knight, her lazy squire and his adorable decoy are traveling from world to world, desperately trying to get home. Lady Aylwen and Phelt are new Wayward heroes with their own story arc that can be added to your Stormsunder campaign. Frank doesn’t have his own story to tell, but is made with a small amount of explosives, so feel free to stand between him and some vampires.

The Wayward Squire Expansion Includes:
- 3 Miniatures (Lady Aylwen x1, Phelt x1 and Frank x1.
- 198 Hero, Skill and Other Cards.

—description from the publisher

name: Auksinis protas: BLITZ
description:
"Golden mind. BLITZ is a fast and fun board game based on the Golden Mind TV game show. An intelligent board game will make you feel not only a participant in a popular TV show, but also its host.

Players ask each other questions from 108 question cards with five question categories in each: multiple choice questions, a chain, an open question, and a yes or no quiz. The goal is to collect as many rubies as possible than your opponents and become not only the smartest but also the richest winner.


„Auksinis protas. BLITZ“ – greitas ir linksmas stalo žaidimas, sukurtas pagal TV žaidimą „Auksinis protas“. Intelektualus stalo žaidimas leis jums pasijusti ne tik populiariosios TV laidos dalyviais, bet kartu – ir jos vedėjais.

Žaidėjai vieni kitiems uždavineja klausimus iš 108 klausimų kortelių, kuriose yra net po penkias klausimų kategorijas: klausimai su atsakymo variantais, grandinėlė, atviras klausimas bei taip ar ne viktorina. Tikslas - kuo greičiau už varžovus surinkti kuo daugiau rubinų ir tapti ne tik protingiausiais, bet ir turtingiausiais nugalėtojais.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: APJOK Lietuvą
description:
The witty board game "Visit Lithuania while riding the horse" is a great party entertainment and an almanac of the strangest place names. The game will make you smile and cause surprise. Here it will become clear that Vilnius is in Kupiškis district, Klaipėda is a suburb of Panevėžys, and Lithuania has both Foreign and its own Colony. These are funny, witty and unexpected place names of Lithuania country, which can be found on closer examination of the map.

Saddle your horse and surround your estates as the Grand Duke of Lithuania - be it Meškuičiai, Zuikinė or Vištytis. And your horse will definitely enjoy visiting the Sheepskin, Cabbage or Horse Pastures.

On their turn, players move around the board with horse similar to a knight in chess. Player have cards in hand with places they must visit. The game ends when first player has visited all places in his hand and returns to start/finish position. Whoever finishes first is the winner.

The board game has 3 versions of the rules: the main "Play against opponents", a team game and the "Play against the system" game.

Šmaikštus stalo žaidimas „Apjok Lietuvą“ – puiki vakarėlio pramoga ir pačių keisčiausių vietovardžių almanachas. Žaidimas privers nusišypsoti ir sukels nuostabą. Čia paaiškės, kad Vilnius yra Kupiškio rajone, Klaipėda – Panevėžio priemiestis, o Lietuva turi ir Užsienį, ir savo Koloniją. Tai – juokingi, šmaikštūs ir netikėti mūsų šalies vietovardžiai, kuriuos galima rasti atidžiau tyrinėjant Lietuvos žemėlapį.

Balnokite žirgelį ir kaip Lietuvos didysis kunigaikštis apjokite savo valdas – ar tai būtų Meškuičiai, ar Zuikinė, ar Vištytis. O jūsų žirgui tikrai patiks apsilankyti Avižonyse, Kopūstuose ar Žirgų Ganyklose. Kas pirmas apjos, tas ir laimės.

name: Duel TCG
description:
Duel Trading Card Game is a realtime online card game where players assume the role of a powerful mage, casting spells and abilities trying to reduce their opponents HP to 0 to win the duel. There are no creatures or items allowed in the Tournament of Gods, so player’s decks that they build consist entirely of spells and abilities. Duel is realtime, meaning there are no turns and both players receive 1 Mana every 5 seconds to use to draw cards and cast spells and abilities.

Cast a spell by spending the amount of Mana listed as a gold number in the top right of the card and set the projectile sideways on one of the Spell Timers in the center of the field. Set it facing your opponents, as if it was in the air on its way to hit them. Your opponent then has 10 seconds to hit that incoming attack with one of their own, (and if the one that they use is double the ATK or more of the one it collided with it not only kills the weaker one but also continues on towards the enemy’s HP.) or use a quick-play ability such as Blink or Reflect.

Players make decks of 50 cards that have no other restrictions whatsoever, just a 50 card max, but they do also have something called a Type Mastery, which is a single type (card color) that they can cast for 1 less Mana and take one less Damage from. There’s no limit to how many spells can be used against a single incoming attack, and there’s no limit on how many can be played per turn, or how many cards players can draw per turn either, the only limit is how much Mana you have.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Real-Time

name: Marché Beauvau
description:
The finest restaurants in France know that on Saturday is when you find the finest goods in the Beauvau. And not all those stalls have enough goods to fill the demand, so you will have to run between the booths to find the best deals and products for your most refined dishes.

Marché Beauvau is a board game where you will have to show your skills to choose the better products for your restaurant menu in the market.

In the game, you will have a board with different stalls from the market, and these stalls will offer you other options. You will be using your resources to bid for the best products for your restaurant. Each player will have the opportunity to buy the receipts to use these products, but beware that there will be negative points if you don't fulfil some.

The winner will be the one that hits the 3rd Michelin Star, becoming the more distinguished chef in France.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Market, Open Drafting

name: Battling Pirates
description:
An competitive action target-shooting game in which two pirate or buccaneer players shoot marbles from their cannons in order to “sink” their opponent’s two ships in the middle of the game board.

When struck just the right way, the plastic pirate ship aligns up with the slot in the board, causing them to drop in and "sink".

The player who sinks both of the opponent's ships first, wins.

name: Video Shop Algorithm
description:
Imagine if there was an algorithm that WASN’T dumb…What if there was an algorithm that didn’t deliver what it thought you’d like, but what you didn’t even know you wanted? In short, an algorithm that harnessed the chaotic discovery of a Video Shop, where chance encounters and unanticipated juxtapositions on the shelf led to new associations and experiences?

Sadly, there is no algorithm that can do that. But now, there is a game that can.

Video Shop Algorithm revives the “cognitive congeniality” of the video library, where objects and people in space combine to create fresh connections and new knowledge about film and video – ever the currencies of contemporary culture.

Working together as a team, you are rewarded for the number and complexity of connections you can draw between an ever-expanding mind map of film titles. Without access to your smartphone, you must draw deep on your memory and stored knowledge, as well as build upon that of your fellow team mates to tease out unexpected connections and ford unbridgeable divides.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia
mechanics: Action Drafting, Cooperative Game, End Game Bonuses, Line Drawing, Player Judge, Storytelling

name: Kitty Cat Clash! Deck Building Game
description:
Adoption fees have been paid and new cats (and a pig!) are entering your home for more mayhem and fun. Choose between three all new characters to add to your game, team up using new Team cards, or increase your game's challenge with new Stress cards.


New Playable Characters
New Team Cards
New Stress Cards


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction

name: Sucesos Argentinos: Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa promo pack
description:
Promo cards for Sucesos Argentinos about Argentinian board gaming events, adding more events for your timeline.


Edición de El Estanciero
Celebración del Día de la Niñez
Creación de la Tecnicatura en Recreación
Fundación de Asociación Civil La Cantera
Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa
10mo Encuentro Nacional de Juegos de Mesa

name: Heroes of the Pulp Age
description:
Will you be the first to set foot in Atlantis for thousands of years? Can you find and capture a live Yeti? Where is the hidden tomb of Alexander the Great? Only the most daring of pulp heroes can survive these adventures!

From 2-6 adventurers will play as pulp-era heroes and race from continent to continent, over oceans and seas, attempting to find priceless artifacts and mysterious locales - all in the name of fortune and glory!

Each turn, players will head towards a rumored artifact (card) on the map board, then have to deal with the Perils that protect it. Dodge deadly traps, defeat vicious guardians and overcome impossible obstacles using your stats of Brains, Brawn and Deftness with a simple d6 roll.

But don't go it alone; recruit stalwart partners and bring along useful equipment to augment your own heroic abilities. First hero to achieve 100 Glory points wins!
Will you become a legendary adventurer or a simple footnote in history?

name: Battle Skies: Sheep Raid
description:
Shepherds have led several flocks into a nearby valley to graze and breed. They had hoped to keep the whole thing a secret. Last night dragons were seen in the area and everyone knows they've come for the sheep and there is little anyone can do to stop them.

The Sheep Raid scenario turns the common strategies of Battle Skies on their head. Flying high and fast won't help you collect any sheep. Now you have to fly low to grab them and balance your need for speed with your ability to snatch sheep off the ground. This time the battle isn't to the last dragon standing but to the last sheep found and the winner is the one who has the most sheep at the end.

Sheep Raid is a scenario for Battle Skies, in which the players are dragons attempting to collect the most sheep. But beware, the shepherds have created decoy sheep filled with explosives, glue bombs, and other dangerous traps!

Contents:
1 folio cover
2 pages of sheep tokens (60 tokens total), consisting of:
16x seven-point sheep
10x ten-point sheep
8x Trap
6x Home Space
5x Net Bomb
5x Explosion
5x Dye Bomb
5x Glue Bomb
2 pages of scoring tokens (20x "2 points", 20x "-4 points")
1 scenario booklet

name: Battle Skies: Dwarven Dive
description:
A scenario for Battle Skies.

A recent earthquake near the heart of the dwarven kingdoms opened up a path down into one of their deepest treasuries. Vaults filled with gold, gems, and other valuables, a great many of which were stolen from the dragons they had driven out of the cave centuries before. Legends have it that the dragon who lived in the cave fought to defend it until the bitter end. It is said that in those last minutes he withdrew into himself and all that was left of him was a glowing crystal egg that has become known as a soul gem. Perhaps out of some strange sense of dragon pride or out of personal greed you have decided to make the dangerous run through the caverns in hopes of grabbing the soul gem.

Dwarven Dive is an intense race through a series of defended caves. The maps and defenses are set out as the game progresses to make for a different game each and every time it is played. Which dragon will be the first to make it to the vault and retrieve the fabled soul gem?

Contents:
1 folio cover
15 map sheets
Two counter sheets with 60 total counters, consisting of:
20x Dwarven Troops
15x Dwarven Priest
10x Recharging
15x Field Artillery
1 Scenario Booklet

name: Battle Skies: Mantiran the Manticore
description:
A special release character for Battle Skies.

From the back cover: "Mantiran is a majestic manticore who flits through the skies and has unique abilities in Battle Skies combat."

Contents:
1 folio cover
2 character sheets (1 young, 1 adult)
4 sheets of box minis, tokens and templates
1 rules booklet

name: Battle Skies: Corianth Dragon
description:
A special release character for Battle Skies.

From the rules booklet: "Corianths are dragons who are skipping through time and have unique abilities in Battle Skies combat."

Contents:
1 player aid
6 character sheets (2 "small", 2 "medium", 2 "large")
2 sheets of box minis, tokens and templates
1 rules booklet

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Through the Dark Portal Booster Pack
description:
Through the Dark Portal is the second set of the World of Warcraft Trading Card Game.

A storm rages in the Blasted Lands as evil stirs within the Dark Portal. Bloodshed in Azeroth intensifies as the Blood Elves and Draenei join the frey. Already, the great conflict spills over into the other world... the Burning Legion looks on and plots its next move. Grab your weapons and make ready, the darkness is upon us!

As the name suggests, this set is set after the reopening of the dark portal. As such, many new Draenei heroes and allies are found amongst the Alliance, and new Blood elf heroes and allies are found amongst the Horde. Quests and items from Outland are also first featured in this set. However, there is no strict focus on the Burning Crusade-era, and the vast majority of allies, quests and items are still from Azeroth.

319 Numbered Cards: 120 Commons, 103 Uncommons Including 18 Heroes, 80 Rares, 16 Epics
3 Loot Cards
18 Oversized Heroes

name: マーダーデュアル「審判にかけられたゾウ」(Murder Dual: The Elephant in the Courtroom)
description:
A 2 player communication game inspired by murder mystery, RPG and escape games. The game can only be played once.

The players are characters in a fairy tale world and tries to solve a case by cooperating with each other.

At the beginning, you will have to communicate "without words" to gather information.

Then the investigation proceeds by "guessing the role play of the opponent". By actively role-playing, you may get closer to the truth.

—user summary
publishers: 双子のライオン堂 (Twins Lion Do)

name: The Barricade
description:
Take turns building the barricade to keep the zombies at bay!

In this abstract dexterity game, you take on the roles of a group of survivors trying to escape a zombie apocalypse.

To keep the zombies at bay, each player needs to help build up the barricade with random pieces carefully stacked on each other. However, at times a player must also remove a part of the barricade to salvage parts for fixing the escape car.

The die adds luck to the situation which can land a player in the dreaded "blind stacking" event where they must depend on the other players' directions/clues to blindly place a barricade piece without toppling it all over. It only takes a handful of mistakes for the players to lose so keep a steady hand and focused mind. The barricade must not fall!

A game turn is comprised of 3 phases:

Barricade Phase - roll the red D6 Action die & consult the Action table (add zombies or add to the barricade)
Car Phase - roll the red D6 Action die & consult the Action table (add zombies or remove from the barricade)
End Phase - zombie check & increase the black D8 Hour die


Players loose if there are 10 zombies at the barricade.
Players win if the D8 Hour die value exceeds 8.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Social Insecurity
description:
The objective of the game is to bank £1000 of your money as you try to overcome the many problems of life on benefits, getting a job and then hanging on to it!

On your turn, you will roll a 6-sided spot dice and then move your elected character piece around the board in a clockwise direction.

Each time you land or pass the Pay Day square, you will receive either your benefit or pay (if you have acquired a job during play) from the designated Banker.

After each throw of the die, the player will turn to the corresponding Flip Chart page heading and then roll the 20-sided spot die. The number showing will then be the number of the instruction to follow on the Flip Chart.
e.g. Player lands on the Pink Elephant square, turn to PUBS chart and roll a 20-sided spot die, lets say it’s number 7, then follow the number 7 instruction.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Zombie Bus: Les motards
description:
Bikers turn around the bus! They count as 2 zombie cards around the bus.

After 3 wounds received (all of the right column or all of the left column), the card becomes only 1 zombie card.

When the back of this card is visible on the zombie pile, the sound of the engines frightens the active player's zombies: the active player recovers all his dice rolls for this turn.

Note: once the bikers are eliminated, discard this card. This card does not earn points.

Les motards tournoient autour du bus ! Ils comptent comme 2 cartes zombies autour du bus.

Après 3 blessures reçues (totalité de la colonne de droite ou totalité de la colonne de gauche), la carte ne plus que comme 1 carte zombie.

Lorsque le dos de cette carte est visible sur la pile de zombies, le bruit des moteurs effraye les zombies du joueur actif : le joueur actif récupère pour ce tour tous ses lancés de dés.

Note : une fois les motards éliminés, défaussez cette carte. Cette carte ne rapporte pas de point.

name: Zombie Bus: L'infirmière
description:
Immediately place the "Antidote" equipment on the nurse if it is not already in play.

On her arrival, the nurse immediately removes all the zombie wounds present around the bus.

Then at the start of each turn, she eliminates the wounds of the most injured zombie around the bus (player's choice).

The player who eliminates the nurse gets the Antidote.

Posez immédiatement l'équipement "Antidote" sur l'infirmière si celui-ci n'est pas déjà en jeu.

A son arrivée, l'infirmière élimine immédiatement toutes les pastilles blessures des zombies présents autour du bus.

Puis à chaque début de tour, elle élimine les pastilles blessures du zombie le plus bléssé autour du bus (au choix du joueur).

Le joueur qui élimine l'infirmière récupère l'Antidote.

name: Clifford the Big Red Dog: Pick-Up-Bones Game
description: One player grabs all the bones in one hand and drops them on the table. Players take turns removing bones as long as they don’t move any other bones. Most points after all the bones are taken win.

name: Vincent Time Pairs
description: Younger players will play by simply collecting the different sets of cards. An additional challenge for the genuine Van Gogh experts is to match the paintings to their periods.

name: Flowers Alphabet Rummy
description: Rummy with letters and pictures of flowers.

name: Modern Havok: Bongolesia
description:
Modern Havok: Bongolesia PDF is a scenario book set in a fictional country in Africa created by Michael T. Murphy. Designed for our 15mm modern miniatures line, these rules are a "tongue-in-cheek" way to play African Wars.

The PDF even has 4 starting scenarios with such themes as Arms deals, Disrupting scammers and Ransoms...

Modern Havok: Bongolesia Boxset is a scenario set and a great way to expand your play in the Chain Reaction system by Two Hour Wargames.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Modern Warfare
publishers: Rebel Minis, Two Hour Wargames (THW Game Design)

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Republic of the Sphere
description: Technical Readout: 3145 Republic of the Sphere introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, Battlemech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 The Clans
description: Technical Readout: 3145 The Clans introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table. For use with BattleTech, Total Warfare, Tactical Operations, and Strategic Operations.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Fires of Outland Booster Pack
description:
The third normal World of Warcraft TCG set is named Fires of Outland.

Rush to war as the conflict is joined in Outland! The armies of Azeroth lay siege to the mysterious world, while the Burning Legion throws its might against the Stair of Destiny. Prestige and Glory await those who are bold enough to join the fray. Let your battle cry be heard as echoes of war engulf the blood-soaked world. Will you be prepared?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: World of Warcraft Trading Card Game: Heroes of Azeroth Booster Pack
description:
The first World of Warcraft TCG set, named Heroes of Azeroth.

Horns blaze across the Eastern Kingdoms, calling the Alliance to arms. The drums of Durotar hasten the Horde to prepare for the looming conflict ahead. Glorious battles, prized treasures and dominion over all of Azeroth are on the table! The time is now; this is your battle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Hokey Pokey
description:
Hokey Pokey is a game where 2 to 4 players play on a table with metal goals at each end. One team is called Hokey and the other Pokey. Object of the game is to push a wooden puck along the table in the direction of a players goal. This is accomplished by using a thick wire with a handle at one end and a wooden disk at the other. The wooden disk slides along the table surface to push the puck along. The first person or team to score 4 goals is the winner. violation of rules such as swiping the puck instead of pushing sees the opposing team calling out their name (i.e Hokey) and receiving a free push.

The game was produced when the Hokey Pokey song and accompanying dance peaked in popularity as a music hall song and novelty dance in the mid-1940s in the UK and Australia.

—user summary

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Lyran Commonwealth
description: Technical Readout: 3145 Lyran Commonwealth introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Maya Code
description:
Fantasy + Strategy = Maya Gold

Conquer the sun platform with wits and logic and occupy it with the code of your own tribal colours. Those eliminated are dropped into the pyramid chamber. The winner obtains the eternal Maya gold. Discover new and fascinating strategies with every round.

Erich von Däniken: "While doing research work for my book 'The day the Gods arrived', I was fascinated by the vast mathematical knowledge of the Maya. Maya Code, a witty game with sparkling possibilities, recreates the way of thinking of the Maya. Intelligent entertainment!"

—description from the back of the box

This is a two-player version of Maya Code. Confusingly, the box shows a picture of the four-player version of the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Ancient, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Moving Multiple Units

name: Löwenzahn: Löwenschlau
description:
Quiz game based on Stadt Land Fluss - 55 question cards are placed in a stack with the theme side up, the letter tiles are shuffled face down and laid out. The player on the turn reveals a letter tile and all players simultaneously search for a term matching the card with the revealed initial letter. The first player to name a correct term gets the card, and the letter is removed from the game. If there are only 10 letters left in the middle, the player with the most cards wins.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Löwenzahn: Peters Obstgarten
description:
In Peter's orchard, the fruits are ripe and must be harvested. Each player must always have as many fruits in his basket as the open collection cards indicate, the type of fruit doesn't matter, but there must be no unripe fruits. Under the 12 collecting discs hide the most different numbers of pieces. Whoever's turn it is must choose one of the cards and may then turn over 2 unblocked discs - if the number of uncovered fruits is correct, you get the card, the discs are covered and the player moves 2 blocking discs. The player who has harvested 50 fruits wins.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Feeling Sheepish
description:
Play cards to manipulate the flock to your advantage. When five or more “sheep” are face up, a player may end the game instead of playing a card. Players score the sheep on their edge of the flock and the high score wins.

—user summary

name: Fulanos
description:
Walking by the big city, you personify some 'porteños' early 20th century's characters: thief, policeman, 'mina' (woman), 'guapo' (man) or bartender.

The objective of the game is to travel through the city and collect money by avoiding the conflicts that arise when turning the wheel of destiny. The first player to deposit $ 5000.- in the bank, wins the game.

On their turn, players roll a die and move to the nearest square matching the color spot. When landing at a location, they spin the wheel of destiny and deal with the conflict.
mechanics: Action/Event, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: El Fantasma
description:
Each player must place letters on the board taking advantage of the prize boxes that will grant them credits (1, 2, or 3). The first player to get five credits is the winner. However, You can become a ghost and walk away from your goal or you can object to the last player's turn or call the word as completed - causing other players to lose credits or lives.

Avoid losing your three lives, because you will become the ghost.
Get five points to win the game.

name: Squarin' Off
description:
A game based off the old childhood game of Connect-the-Dots, but played with single, double and triple-point squares to enhance a level of strategy Complete as many squares as possible by filling in all four sides of a square with pegs while trying to give your opponents as few squares as possible. The player with the most points (not necessarily the most squares) wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Wipe Out
description:
Can you draw a picture of. Scarecrow riding a horse in the jungle? Or a cowboy picking flowers on a pirate ship?

Put your artistic talents to the test with this crazy drawing game! Players battle it out to draw funny scenes based on topic cards for their team to guess. Will you be able to guess the right answer or will you be a doodle dropout?

The team that guesses the most answers, wins!
mechanics: Action Timer, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Planet Box
description:
Planet Box is a bluffing game from Japan. Players take turns placing numbered pieces into a sliding box. They are trying to bluff how many stars they are putting in. If if it is too many, and their bluff is called, the galaxy bursts and they must take back stars. The first player to clear their pool is the winner.
user summary

Publisher summary:
You are God. You are the Creator God.

This is the "star-stuffing game" played by the gods. You have to fill the mysterious PLANETBOX with stars in order and try to get rid of them before anyone else does. However, the box has a mass limit, and if you overfill it with stars, other players will spot you and penalise you.
It's a simple yet profound bluffing game where the key is to be able to spot when you have too many stars.

あなたは神です。創造神です。
これは神々がたしなむ「星詰めゲーム」。あなたは不思議な箱PLANETBOXに星を順番に入れていき、誰よりも早く手持ちの星を無くすことを目指します。ただ、この箱には質量制限があり、星を詰めすぎると他のプレイヤーに見破られてペナルティを受けてしまうかもしれません。
星の詰めすぎを見破れるかがカギとなるシンプルで奥深いブラフゲームです。
publisher's summary
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Set Collection
publishers: Umeruma Games (ウメルマゲームズ)

name: Kamelon
description:
Kamelon is a bluffing game from Japan. A baker has stolen the shells from turtles to make Melonpan (a tasty snack that looks like a turtle shell). The turtles sneak around the bakery at night to try and get their shells back. If the baker can catch them, they lose.

Players move their turtles secretly around the tiles, face-down so their backs look like the other bun pieces. Arrows on each tile indicate where they can move too, and the tiles can be rotated. The baker can search when the shop is open, by turning over a bun. If a turtle can get across the shop to get their shell, and back to the exit in time without being found, they win.
user summary

A popular melonpan baker in town. In fact, it is a bad bakery that steals shells from the turtles behind the scenes and traffics them. One day, a turtle breaks into the bakery and steals the shell. But it is already time to open the shop. The only place he can hide is in the huge pile of melon pans! The turtle tries to escape by moving from melon pan to melon pan. But when you move, you give a clue to the shopkeeper. The clerk tries to guess where the turtle is hiding, and the turtle tries to deceive him with a false route.

街で人気のメロンパン屋。実は裏でカメからコウラを奪い、密売する悪いパン屋だった。ある日、コウラを奪われた一匹のカメがパン屋店に侵入。しかしもう店の開店時間だ。隠れられるのは、大量に並んだメロンパンの中のみ！メロンパンからメロンパンへ移動して脱出を目指すカメ。しかし移動は店員にヒントを与えてしまう。ヒントを頼りに隠れ場所を推理する店員と、偽の経路で欺こうとするカメの、頭脳系推理ブラフゲームです。
publisher's summary
publishers: Umeruma Games (ウメルマゲームズ)

name: Attactics
description:
It’s a race to the center as you try to evade and eliminate your opponents throughout the maze. Move your pieces via various dice sequences and accumulate points to that help advance your Monarch.

Players start at the corner of the board and attempt to be the first to move their Monarch meeple to the center of the board or eliminate the opponent's Monarchs from the game. Players can capture their opponents' pieces to move their Monarch.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Point to Point Movement, Race

name: Submarine Boost Game
description:
Submarine Boost Game, a simple roll-and-move game, is a Subway kids meal giveaway. Each player rolls dice to move three submarines along a track, and the first player to get all their subs to the end wins. If a submarine lands on an opponent's submarine, the player gets a second turn.

The game comes with punch-out paper pieces and game board that must be assembled.
mechanics: Moving Multiple Units, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Game-a-Saurus Rex
description:
Game-A-Saurus Rex is a playful little prehistoric plush! Rex comes stuffed with a soft blanket that doubles as a playmat along with plenty of pieces that can be used to play 10 different games!

Games include: Rock, Paper, Caveman; Egg Hatch Memory; Tic-Rock-Toe; Speedy Peppers; The Great Egg Race; The Dino Run; Egg Basket; The Rex Connect; Dino Fish; and Do You See What I See?

—description from the publisher

name: ギリ、義理チョコ(Giri Giri Chocolate)
description:
Giri Giri Chocolate is a simple card game. People who got most chocolate will win, but people who got most amount of "Honmei Chocolate" will drop out from the game.

You give present cards to girls of your classmate. You choose a card from your hand and put it on the table, face down. People who shows smallest number start to give it to the girl. They have some restrictions respectively to put your cards.

After you give them gift, you pick up a card from a supply. You continue to doing it 4 times.

When Valentine's Day come, compare your present cards. People who give them most valuable present(biggest number) gains the "Honmei chocolate", and second highest present gains the "Giri Chocolate".

name: A.T.R.A.M
description: A.T.R.A.M (Advanced Reconnaissance and Attack Mission) is one of the first "Computer Aided Board Games". Players command military forces in a simulated NATO exercise against each other.

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Free Worlds League
description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Free Worlds League introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Federated Suns
description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Federated Suns introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table. For use with BattleTech, Total Warfare, Tactical Operations, and Strategic Operations.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

name: AVíO
description:
AVíO is a trick-taking game in which you must choose wisely which cards to play, and even more which one to keep, in order to win.

The cards in AVíO, as in other trick-taking games, have a value and a suit. The special feature is that they also contain an objective to be fulfilled (an avio). In each round, players are dealt 9 cards and 8 tricks are played. The card that is not played determines the objective of each player in the round and the points he/she gets if he/she fulfills it.

The first player to score 30 points wins the game.

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Draconis Combine
description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Draconis Combine introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

name: BattleTech: Technical Readout – 3145 Mercenaries
description:
Technical Readout: 3145 Mercenaries introduces the wave of new battle armor, vehicle, BattleMech, and aerospace units appearing across the Inner Sphere in the Dark Age era. Featuring new and matured technology, and presented in this series of faction-specific PDFs, these combat units will add excitement and variety to any game table.

Each title includes Record Sheets for each featured unit and its variants.

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 21
description: The march of technology across BattleTech's eras is relentless, but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic 'Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond). Allowing beloved units redesigned for the BattleTech: Clan Invasion crowd funding campaign to be competitive on "modern" battlefields, this series also includes in-universe development notes, battle histories, notable pilots, and record sheets for each 'Mech.

name: Some Bunny's Hiding
description:
The Bunnies have hidden in their holes around the game board.

Each player receives three discs and tries to match the colors on their discs to the colors hidden on the bottom of the bunny playing pieces. The first player to find all their bunnies wins! Double-sided game board features two difficulty levels that progress as your child masters memorization and color recognition skills.

name: Fastrek
description:
Fastrek is a cooperative game for kids 5 years and above that required teamwork and strategy to win. Play tested and reviewed by teachers, enjoyed by kids and loved by parents. This game can be played by 2 - 4 players.

In Fastrek, players roll their dice to move around the board. Depending on the spot they land on, players may collect items, encounter monsters, pick an event card or move to another spot on the board.

To win, all players must get to camp before nightfall AND have all the necessary camping items to set up camp.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: ワンダーワードワールド (Wonder Word World)
description:
ワンダーワードワールド (Wonder Word World) is a party game from Japan. Players are ambassadors from foreign nations. They take turns to memorise certain words, and then read a fairy tale out loud, but inserting their nation's words for key words in the story. The player giving the best and most dramatic reading is voted the winner.

The game includes booklets for five classic fairy tales, all in Japanese.
user summary

It is a memorization-type reading party game where you become ambassadors of countries with different languages ​​and take turns reading aloud while adding your own translations to the words that appear in fairy tales.

The player who remembers the strange words that increase as the story progresses and reads them aloud more steadily and dramatically than others wins.

変わった言語を持つ国々の大使となり、 おとぎ話に登場する単語に独自の訳をつけながら、 交代で朗読していく暗記系朗読パーティゲームです。
物語が進むにつれてどんどん増える、奇妙な単語を記憶して、 他の人よりよどみなく、そしてドラマチックに読み上げたプレイヤーが勝利します。
publisher's summary

name: The Drunken Idiots Present: A Night Out
description:
This three part board-style drinking game will take you through the pregame, adventures at the bar, and the drive home. Each section contains their own deck of cards based on real experiences. With up to 6 players A Night Out allows a realistic night out experience with your friends.

During their turn, a player will roll the die, move their game piece, and do what the space says but be careful! If you land on a check point, you could be sent to the drunk tank! The first player to make it to the home space wins!

Although designed with alcohol in mind, this game is compatible with non-alcoholic beverages so anyone can play!

name: Spielend durch das schöne Heimatland!
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space A (Arnsberg). The first to reach space E (Volkmarsen) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rechtschreiben
description: In the game there are 144 picture cards , each of which contains a drawn picture on the front and the written term and derivatives of it on the back. In turn, each player takes a picture card and reads the term to the next player. The next player must write it down. If he has written it down correctly, he receives the picture card. The first player to collect 7 picture cards wins the game. Additional spelling exercises are also included.

name: Bilderquiz
description:
On 3 large picture boards, objects are depicted that have certain properties (color, shape, number). A rotary wheel is used to randomly select which property (e.g. "yellow") is being searched for. The first person to point to a matching object (e.g. "lemon") wins a point. Whoever has 5 points first wins the game.

—user summary

name: Kyojuu in the Dark
description:
Kyojuu in the Dark is a strategic memory game about uniting a mythical island under your clan. Four clans make up the island: Rock, Water, Forest, and Earth.

In the darkness, quiet battles rage, with Lords, Warriors, Farmers, and even Children playing their part. Loyal as dogs, the towering Kyojuu fight alongside human masters. These mythical creatures protect their clans with unmatched strength. Remembering former times of peace, the Kyojuu are powerless in the presence of Children.

To start the game, each player places their 9 pieces face down within their designated 3x3 home area. Once placed onto the board, these pieces cannot be flipped over again except when attacking, being attacked, or by the special use of an action card. Each turn, players decide whether to roll and advance their pieces, battle another player, “pinch”, or instead play an action card. When attacking, players reveal the face of one of their pieces that is next to an opposing player's piece. The opponent then reveals their face, and the lower-ranked piece gets removed from the board. The only way to oust a Kyojuu from the board is to “pinch”, which is when two Children from any clan surround a Kyojuu. This move can be made at any point in the game. Through battles and card play, each player’s ultimate goal is to reach the center square of an opponent’s 3x3 square home territory. The first player that lands on the center square of an opponent’s territory is declared the winner.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Memory, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Booster Set #5
description:
Expansion for the Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – USS Enterprise NCC-1701-E Starter.
Contains:
3xd8 Movement Impulse dice
3xd10 Weapon Phase dice
2xd12 Weapon Photon Torpedo dice
2xd12 Weapon Quantum Torpedo dice

Each booster set contains 10 new dice to expand your ship and rulebook with rules for multiplayer battles and explaining new dice effects.

name: 秘密のオークションハウス (Secret Auction House)
description:
秘密のオークションハウス (Secret Auction House) is an auction game from Japan with some hidden elements. Players bid simultaneously with money cards in a series of auctions. But matching bids cancel each other (butting) in the manner of What the Heck?. So the auction can be won by a player with a low bid.

All bid cards are discarded, until the player exhausts their hand or spends a special token, to refill their hand. By careful choice, a player can know what cards other players have, and manage their own bids successfully.

Players spend cash when they win bids on auction items. Not running out of money too soon is a challenge.

Further, players have two secret cards of winning conditions they want to meet, such as winning different values or combos of items. For example, winning two pairs of items scores 5 bonus points, or a run of items valued 1-3 to get 3 bonus points.

At the end of the auction rounds, the player with the most points wins.
user summary
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Hand Management, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Zombie Bus: Les touristes
description:
Tourists do not count as an extra zombie card around the bus.

When they arrive, place 5 Injury tablets on the tourists. Remove one at the end of each turn.

As long as there is at least one patch left on the map, you can save these tourists by assigning them 4 action sides in a single turn. Win the card (place it under your hero).

As soon as there are no more pastilles on the map, tourists turn into zombies. They now count as an additional zombie card around the bus that you can no longer release or damage.

Note: if there is no more cheerleader to release, the tourists must also be released or wait for them to transform for the game to end.


Les touristes ne comptent pas comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus.A leur arrivée, placez 5 pastilles Blessures sur les touristes. Retirez-en une à la fin de chaque tour.

Tant qu'il reste au-moins une pastille sur la carte, vous pouvez sauvez ces touristes en leur affectant 4 faces actions en un seul tour. Remportez la carte (placez-la sous votre héros).

Dès qu'il n'y a plus de pastille sur la carte, les touristes se transforment en zombies. Ils comptent désormais comme une carte zombie supplémentaire autour du bus que vous ne pouvez plus ni libérer ni blesser.

Note : s'il n'y a plus de cheerleader à libérer, il faut aussi libérer les touristes ou attendre qu'ils se transforment pour que la partie prenne fin.

name: Elf King Red
description:
Elf King Red is a fastplay game using the Lucid Eye Engine, set in the Elf realms of the Isles of Eas, previously seen in The Red Book of The Elf King & Troll Wars. Ownership of those two books is not essential as this is a standalone product, but they contain lots of colourful background and setting information which some players may find useful. Elf King Red uses similar sized armies to Savage Core, which is around 7 figures or so, seven being a mystical number for the Elves. The game has been written to provide a playable experience with a low commitment entry point.

This free rulebook provides all the basic rules needed to play and includes stats for all of the Factions, otherwise known as Circles in Elf King Red.

So once again strap on your Faeblade of Starmetal, don your Glamourbound Armour and prepare your magick, for Red War and The Fall of All.

name: Obscure War
description:
Obscure War is a tabletop miniature board game in which Warwulf Cabal and Vampyric Cabal fight for the control of Obscure Plane Domains. The game takes place in a contemporary Dark Fantasy universe with a rather spectacular mechanic of Power Cards that interact directly on the Game zone and affect the Characters in game.

You have 3 phases in a Turn : Activation, Power, and Dissolution.

During his/her activation, a Character (miniature) can perform 4 types of Optional actions : Power card Action, movement action, attack action, and control action. Each Cabal activates its Characters one after the other until the activation of all the 8 Characters deployed on the Game zone.

In the Power phase, each Cabal gains 1 Power Point for each Obscure Plane’s Domain it controls.

In the Dissipation phase, all the Power Cards are discarded and placed in the Discard.

To win Obscure War, a Cabal must have the highest Power point score after 3 Turns.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Map Deformation, Zone of Control

name: Klix Snap Action Baseball
description:
As pitcher and batter, you and your opponent try to outmatch each other. Just like the real thing! This is a cat and mouse contest between pitcher and batter. Both pitcher and batter actively choose either a black chip or white chip for each at-bat. When both have chosen, reveal your choices at the same time. If the colors match, then the batter is OUT. If the colors do not match, the batter gets a HIT. If it is a HIT use the "Snap Action Dice" and reference the chart to see what happened. PLAY BALL!!

The player with the most runs wins.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Alice the Train: The Board Game
description:
Alice the Train is a light-weight, pick-up and deliver board game that is based on the children's book of the same name. In this game, you play as trains with the mission of picking up animals and dropping them off at the zoo. You will build and manage your train cars based on how many animals each can hold while in the "vores" variant, separating the carnivorous tigers from the herbivores of the game. Collect stars when dropping off animals at the zoo with the winner being the player closest to 15 stars.

—description from the designer

name: The Devil's Level:  Expansion Sets
description:
This set includes five expansion sets for The Devil's Level card game, totaling 144 cards. The Expansions are:

Not Safe for Work: 36 cards that let you steal from your boss and waste time. And you can mess up your customers and other people at work.

Legacy of Boodleheimer: Let's you use Boodleheimer's spirit to control stuff that happens in the game. It gives you cat powers and cat functions.

Sorry I'm Sorry: 36 cards that are about screwing up and breaking stuff all the time. Because it happens to me.

Foil Pack: KS exclusive Foil backed cards.

Admin Pack: KS exclusive pack of ultra-powerful cards designed by the Admin to sneak into your hand during play, unbalance the game, and make your friends mad.

name: Vyapar
description:
Vyapar is a game of trading using the random outcomes of dice and cards. It's a mid-level game for ages +10 and above as involves calculation and strategies to spend less and earn more with multiple trading opportunities to earn.
The time limit of the game varies from 30 min to 90 min depending on the random outcome.

The synopsis of the game is similar to a stock market scenario where you will buy and sell Commodities of Gold silver and copper
The game is played on the board where you will land on buy/sell or change rate or power lot multiples by the random outcome of the custom dice and based on the action you will do the activity
There is a set goal to reach the end by having the minimum required quantity of certain commodities and above so that winner is declared. the fluctuation in the market makes you rich or bankruptcy.

name: RathaYatra
description:
The game mechanics are a race game kind of but with certain Rules like One cannot move earlier to the place before the other and there are chances that it will come back lose a turn kind of actions in it

This game is inspired by Rathayatra pulling of chariots and a few rules that Jagannatha Ratha cannot surpass the other 2 and Balabadara will start followed by Subhadra and Jagannatha ( here it is colored Ratha ).

This can be played solo and the design has been made to accommodate 8 players with their own path

The game consists of a central Dice tower, a path to move the chariots, 2 custom dice(one to the chariot and the other no of places forward or back), and action cards to change the course of the game.

The player movement is based on the Random outcome of Dice and Random action cards.

name: Amrutha
description:
A game-based on card random pick to create a deck (set of Components) to form based on a Quest card or achieve Requirement as defined during the start of the game (combination of 108 water cards(sum)and 2 ingredients of each type)
The winner is the fastest to complete with the least possible deck set of the Ingredients

The game is played between 2-6 players.
It's a mid-level game for ages +8 and above as involves calculation and strategies to make sure you win with lesser cards and fastest to do the calculation and submit the set of cards
The time limit of the game varies from 10 min to 30 min depending on random outcome and level of gameplay.
There are various levels involved in this game to increase the complexity of calculations, increase the difficulty, and also to have killing strategies to make the opponent rebuild his complete deck thereby increasing the chance to win.

The game has 2 variation sets with 8 levels in the game from simple to advanced combination of ingredients

The advantage and limitation is both the calculations as you need to calculate the combination by mind mathematics(this majorly helps the children to do fast calculations of addition and multiplication).

name: Operation Khedda
description:
Max 4 Players (solo variant to multiplayer variant)
the game has a setup of Tile laying (every time a new random Board is created using hexagon terrain tiles)and Actual movement of chasing elephants after on the terrain with the advantage of the terrain and the player character

Co-operative resource placement of the operational component
Co-operative actions to capture the wild elephant (3 wild elephants out of 4 elephants)
Random elephant movement (4 X 2 (custom dice) directional dice to work this mechanism on direction and no of places to move in that direction)
Placement of campsites (only in the first turn) and Capture mechanism by a player in subsequent rounds as actions by the player
Placement of capture mechanism by each player every round (excluding some terrain and based on terrain type.

Once all the player places the mechanism is done. a random player rolls the dice(Elephant movement dice) using Dice tower and based on the outcome the elephants move towards the indicated direction

If there is an obstacle it cannot move that direction(excluding a few obstacles and group movements)
The game continues until all or min 3 elephants move to Khedda or all campsites destroyed by the movement of elephants(Detailed rules on win is there in the rulebook)

name: Rescue Punda
description:
A cooperative rescue operation game to safeguard the little naughty elephant to its family
this game is an extended edition of Operation Khedda and uses the same tiles and few characters to play

as earlier indicated the game is played on the same components of Operation khedda( Terrain Tiles and obstacles are the same) with certain changes to accommodate the fantasy theme of rescuing little Naughty Elephant. Here the player instead of capturing works on a clearing of a path for the elephant to join its heard from starting point to endpoint ( currently 2 sets of rules one with timed/ 24 rounds co-operative game and the other with one player as a ranger to capture and second player as a rescuer)
and win is the same Elephant rescued/captured or lost in the woods ( co-operative strategy).

name: Sala
description:
A game based on the folklore of the start of the Hoysala kingdom.

Kannada folklore tells a tale of a young man, Sala, who saved his Jain guru, Sudatta, by striking dead a lion or tiger he encountered near the temple of the goddess Vasantika at Angadi. The word "strike" literally translates to "hoy" in Old Kannada, hence the name "Hoy-sala".

The game is played on terrain consisting of forest gurukul, school village, and farmland with the terrain of water stream pathways (a graphic of terrain and to consider a single terrain board or randomizer of terrain tiles work is in progress)

There will be the hero who is making a choice to consider the advice given by the guru, student, village lady, and a farmer based on the sighting of a lion (random cards) and based on the movement outcome of the dice/cards MP the sala can move to the desired location on the map and place obstacles (traps and fence mechanism)

A random Cards mechanism (a staged order) will provide the sighting of the lion after Sala movement and placement. there will 5 lion appearances and movements using the Dice and directional outcome-based of the card. If you are able to capture the lions before it hits the central temple Sala wins( co-operative team) else lost.

name: Robots: Juego de Asociación
description:
Robots is a matching card game that invites you to observe, compare and focus your attention.

Goal of the game:
Be the first to get rid of all the cards in your hand. Each player will be able to get rid of their cards every time they find matches in eyes, mouth or nose with the card that is face up on the table.

To play between 2 or more, from the age of 5.

name: Ratz Fatz Ich und Du
description:
This game consists of a serious of 4 educational games where children learn more about themselves and their friends.

1. Ordering
This is a cooperative ordering game where all cards are put face up on the table. An adult asks the children to find all cards belinging to one category (eg. all cards with something eatable)

2. Sorting
This is a cooperative game where all children try to categorize cards one by one.

3. Taking
All cards are put face up on the table. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards is mentioned in the story, the kids should take the corresponding card. The fastest kid with the most cards wins.

4. Remembering
7 cards are put face up on the table. The remaining ones are put in the box. An adult reads a story. As soon as one of the pieces on the cards which are in the box is mentioned in the story, the kid shouts out. If it's correct and the card is in the box, the child gets one of the cards on the table. If it's wrong and the piece is on the table, the child has to put one of his cards back on the table.
The kid with the best memory and therefore the most cards wins.

name: Zauberbaum
description:
The game contains 3 games about the magic tree, its fruit, a caterpillar, a blackbird and a cat.

1. Classifying
This is a cooperative game where the wooden fruit and the animals should be classified and inserted into the game board.

2. Simple Dice Game
The children are taking turns in rolling the dice. When the dice shows one of the fruits on the tree, the child gets this fruit. When all fruits are taken from the magic tree, the child with the most fruits wins.

3. Searching
All puzzle pieces are put face down on the table. The children are taking turns in revealing the pieces. The kid who is the first one in recognizing any differences to the board game and finds the correct place, gets this piece. The child with the most pieces wins.

name: Schere Stein Papier
description:
The game is based on the classic game of chance (scissors, stone, paper): Scissor beats paper. Paper beats stone. Stone beats scissor.
Every player selects one of the symbols on his board. When all players are done, the privacy shields are removed. All players calculate their scores and the next turn starts. As soon as one player scores 10 points, he wins.

—user summary

name: Sandmännchens Gute Nacht Spiel
description:
This is a short game before going to bed.
The starting player rolls the dice and moves the sandman accordingly and puts a star on all the fields he passes by. Now it's the next player's turn who rolls the dice again and puts stars on the board.
When all stars are on the board, the next round begins: The starting player rolls the dice again, but this time he turns all the stars face down. When all stars are face down, the job of the sandman is done and the kids can go to sleep.
The kid, whose stars are the last face up, wins.

—user summary

name: Stop & Shop
description:
Stop & Shop is a shopping game.
The player puts one of his dice tokens face down and moves his meeple. If the meeple is in front of a shop, he can go into the shop and buy as much as he can. He can put all the stuff he bought on his shopping card. As soon as he has fulfilled all the requested items on the shopping card, he can turn the shopping card face down and put the goods back in the supply. The player who is th first one to finish his shopping cards wins.

—user summary

name: Overruled By Cats
description:
A cat themed card game that is as simple to play like UNO but you can perform fast-paced combos with smooth interactive gameplay.

Each player starts out with 8-10 cards depending on the amount of people playing. The goal is to get rid of your hand as fast as possible but if someone goes out that won't necessarily end the game. Drawing cards is not a punishment. If another player plays a counter active card against the player that went out then that player won't win and that will give someone the opportunity to either stop that player or steal the win from that player.

The unique factor of this game creates simple interaction during any player's turn where the game still flows forward without ever stalling or back tracking which brings an enjoyable experience for everyone.

The possibilities can be endless and unpredictable. Every card was developed to never start out with a bricked hand, which will bring the quality to the game where no one ever feels as if they're at a disadvantage to win.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Chaining, Impulse Movement, Real-Time, Take That

name: JOME
description:
A Malaysian-made card game that incorporates strategy and competitive gameplay. Players accumulate trophy cards by winning battles. This addictive and fun game is guaranteed to light up your day. (description at back of box)

The game consists of trophy cards which are worth point values, and duel cards, which have duel points and are used to compete for the trophy cards. At setup, a number of stacks of trophy cards are laid out to match the number of players. Players are dealt 6 duel cards.
