During play, players take turns to play duel cards next to the trophy stacks. Duel cards have different strengths and abilities. Once a third duel card is played next to a trophy stack, that stack is evaluated and the player with the highest duel card strength wins the stack. The stack is then replenished.

Duel cards come in different suits, and each type of trophy stack only accepts specific suits.

The game ends when the trophy deck runs out. For a shorter game, play to a fixed number of points instead.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Kill Steal, Push Your Luck

name: Kalle Ankas bokstavsspel
description: Flip a subject card in the pile, then flip a letter card from the other pile. Start the timer at 3 minutes. Everyone writes down words they can think of about the subject and the letter to collect points. The one with the most points after 5 rounds wins. The game was included in the comic magazin "Kalle Anka & C:0", nr. 8, 18 February 1991 (Kalle Anka is the swedish name for Donald Duck).
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Word Game

name: Spöktåget
description:
In Spöktåget (the Ghost Train), it is important to figure out which Disney passenger is in which ghost carriage and conquer as many passenger pieces as possible.

In turn, you choose a piece with a Disney passenger, put it in a ghost carriage and push it into one of the three ghost tunnels. When there are three ghost wagons in each tunnel, the game starts. Before the next turn player pushes a new ghost carriage into a tunnel, the player must guess which Disney passenger is in the ghost carriage coming out of that particular tunnel at the other end first. If the player guesses correctly, he gets the passenger piece and is allowed to continue. If the guess is wrong, the piece is put back in the pile of Disney passengers and the next player takes over. So the game continues. Guess which passenger comes out and pushes a new carriage into that tunnel. Lose and win pieces. The game is over when all ghost carriages are empty. The one with the most pieces wins.

A game with a ghost theme that was included in "Kalle Anka & C: o", no. 45, 8 November 1993 (Kalle Anka is the Swedish name for Donald Duck).

name: Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers
description:
Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers is a scenario-based competitive sci-fi strategy game for 2-4 players where each scenario brings you into one of the many battles going on in a galactic-wide war. During the game you will build a thriving economy to fuel the battle while expanding your area of control with fleets of ships.

Gameplay:
In Galaxis: Stellar Frontiers, you assume the role of one of four unique galactic factions fighting for resources and territory. At the beginning of every turn, you collect resources from fields you control which you can spend on constructing Buildings on Planets, buying Ships, and researching Ship Upgrades to improve them. By moving your Ships into new fields, you expand your reach to get more resources and trigger Events which help you grow even faster. By growing your economy, you’re able to unlock new building tiers to bring the war the next level. Each faction follows their very own goals in the scenarios to gain Influence, and the one with the most influence points at the end wins the battle and one day, possibly the war.
categories: Dice, Fighting, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Castle: Deck 1
description:
Welcome to Castle, the game of fighting creatures and obstacles.

Start off with 40 points and see who will be the winner in the end! The first one who loses all their points, loses the game!

Players draft 1-2 cards to battle and inflict damage on each other. Object cards can increase or decrease a player's stamina. The first person to lose all 40 of their stamina points, loses the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Single Loser Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Trading

name: Althing: Coronation promo card
description:
Promo card that can be obtained during boardgames events.
It can replace the basic Thing / Althing card.

It shows the coronation a little closer, but requires different conditions to be reached.

Thing - promo side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 2 bones
Althing - promo side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 4 bones

name: Althing: Butik Promo Card
description:
Promo card that can be obtained as a goodies when buying the game or picking up the game pre ordered in a game shop.
It can replace the basic Thing / Althing card, the last step of the race.

It represents a game shop in a viking village, and requires the same conditions than the Althing: promo card to be reached.

Thing - Butik side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 2 bones
Althing - Butik side : requires 3 gold, 3 wood, 4 bones

name: Disgruntled Decks: Navy Edition
description:
From the publisher's website:

Disgruntled Decks is a card game for military service members and grizzled Veterans who enjoy laughing together about their time in the service. With a unique blend of descriptive language and military themes, Disgruntled Decks gives one more reason for service members and Veterans to talk about their shared experiences while having fun in the process.
We strongly believe that humor is healing, and some Veterans still have a good amount of healing left to do. We hope to provide some of that humor with Disgruntled Decks.
Disgruntled Decks can be played by itself or used as an unofficial military Cards Against Humanity ® third party expansion.

Disgruntled Decks
The Original Card Game For Veterans.™
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Nautical, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: 2020: The Board Game – 2021 Extension Pack +
description: With the 2021: Extension Pack +, players will encounter 54 exclusive social media cards that give players the opportunity to keep their game current with events inspired by the year 2021.

name: Somethingly
description:
Somethingly is the new, side-splittingly silly, party game from Toffee Hammer. Players perform Do This! actions in a ‘Somethingly’ way for other players to guess: Dance like you’re at a disco… suspiciously! Mime drinking tea… angrily! Shake hands with someone… mysteriously! Anyone who likes charades, will love Somethingly!

Included in the box are suggestions for three different types of gameplay: ‘Inclusively’ for families and mixed ability groups; ‘Rapidly’ for fast-paced team play; and ‘Competitively’ for individual players.

With 250 Somethingly cards and 150 Do This! Cards there are over 35,000 different possible combinations – making this a game that will last a lifetime. Cards are colour coded for difficulty
so it is easy to adapt for different groups.

—description from the publisher

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – AFFS
description:
Field Report 2765: AFFS describes the state of House Davion's Federated Suns just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: AFFS closely follows the format of Field Report: AFFS but with two new WarShip designs also included along with record sheets for each.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – DCMS
description:
Field Report 2765: DCMS describes the state of House Kurita's Draconis Combine just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: DCMS closely follows the format of Field Report: DCMS, but with two new WarShip designs with the respective record sheets.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Mind on the Movies
description:
Mind on the Movies is about creating movie titles and letting your friends pitch the ideas. You are either the writer that must create the movie idea using word cards or you become the producer giving the thumbs up or down for movie ideas. It has more customization and imagination than any popular voting game, but still very easy to pick up.

All One80 Games proceeds go to Campus One80 Ministries, a Christian leadership and outreach mission that serves the colleges of the US.

—description from the publisher

name: The Nutty Squirrel
description: You play as a squirrel and collect as many nuts as you can. Watch out, there are cars to hit you that make you lose your nuts. Plus, you can steal nuts, roll the dice and get more nuts, also skip players. The goal is to get a total of 60 nuts before anybody else.

name: Gobby: Phrase Expansion Pack
description: Rude and crude expansion pack for Gobby. Contains 50 phrase start and finish cards giving you 2500 new possible phrase combinations bringing the total up to 10,000 when added to the base game.

name: Torneo!
description:
Two knights challenge each other in a tournament. A bidding system allow to win each turn. Winning two turns in a row means that the opponent is unsaddled: a knight on saddle has bonus on his bets against an unsaddled one. The player winning three turns more than the opponent wins the game.

—description from the designer

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #10.
categories: Bluffing, Educational, Fighting, Math, Medieval, Renaissance

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – FWLM
description:
Field Report 2765: FWLM describes the state of House Marik's Free Worlds League just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: FWLM closely follows the format of Field Report: FWLM but with one new WarShip design also included along with record sheets for each of its variants.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – LCAF
description:
Field Report 2765: LCAF describes the state of House Steiner's Lyran Commonwealth just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of one of the Great Houses that would eventually survive the collapse of the Star League and face a new age of endless war.

Field Report 2765: LCAF closely follows the format of Field Report: LAAF but with one new WarShip design also included along with record sheets for each of its variants.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Field Report 2765 – Periphery
description: Field Report 2765: Periphery describes the state of the four great Periphery States just before the events described in Historical: Liberation of Terra (Part 1), including the overall military and logistical condition of the fringe powers--including the infamous Rim Worlds Republic, whose House Amaris would bring about the collapse of the Star League that would eventually plunge the rest of the Inner Sphere into a new age of endless war.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: ROAARR Challenge
description: To be the best at Roaarr Challenge, you will have to speak up and make sure you’re the first to be heard! Budding impressionists will need to fine-tune their best animal calls to win! This hilarious game for children from 4 years old is a game of speed where observation skills and concentration are key to success. Each player takes on the role of an animal: they can only express themselves through their cries. The aim of the game? Win the most cards by being the fastest to scream out whenever 2 identical cards appear on the table! Things are about to get loud!
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Push n Push
description:
Push n Push is an abstract board game that combines elements of strategy and push-your-luck where players push each other's pawns to get rid of other players' pawns by pushing them out of the game board area.

The game is played in a way where players can move their pawns a distance from the tile that is determined from the number of dice they have rolled, player pieces can only move in a straight line (forward or backward) according to the direction of the arrow on their pawn (unless their pawns are pushed by another pawn). the player can push the opponent's pawn out of the game board area, the direction of the arrow of the pawn being pushed does not have to be the same as the pawn pushing it, a pawn can push more than one pawn. Players cannot push their own pawns out of the game board area.

The goal of the game is to push 9 (2 players) or 6 (4 players) opponent pawns off the game board area.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Dice, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Measurement Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Crypto Card Game: NFT
description:
In the Crypto Card Game - NFT, we play the role of collectors of digital works of art and pictures from famous collections who are looking for the interesting NFTs for themselves to buy.

The place of competition for players in the game is the NTFs market and the players' task during the game is to buy this type of tokens from other players. The game is played according to the following rules.

All players reveal their own card at the same time and look for the same symbols and pictures on the cards with the rest of the players. The player who finds an identical picture on one of his opponents calls it loudly and takes its card back to his pile of cards.
Each picture on the game cards is original and represented in the real and virtual world of the NFT. To begin with, each player should recognize and correctly name all NFTs in the game. During the game, the names of the pictures can be given in full or shortened names.

The game ends as soon as one player collects all his opponents' cards and becomes the winner.
mechanics: Market, Matching, Pattern Recognition, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Knavel Assault
description:
The Four Kings of Clonedovia have one thing in common; their love of the jester. He travels from Kingdom to Kingdom amusing the kings...

However, something terrible has happened. Someone has attacked the Jester. Who would do such a thing? Who is guilty of the Knavel Assault?

Knavel Assault is a guessing game where each player takes a suit, chooses one card to be their "suspect", and then attempts to be the first to guess one of their opponents' suspects. They do this by playing cards from their own deck to make guesses while keeping track of the cards their opponents play in an attempt to make more educated guesses through process of elimination. The first person to guess an opponents card correctly gets a point, and a new round begins, with the first to score three points winning the game.

name: Cardfrontation
description:
In the taberns of Aguacatata, mercenaries play a unique card game: Cardfrontation!

Each player controls two pawns. Move them to gather resources and craft weapons, equip these weapons on the left or right hand an attack your opponent to bring their life to 0!

Cardfrontation is a position based and resource management card combat game where two players compete in order to do the maximum damage to the opponent. Use strong weapons, powerful staff and tricky artifacts to win in this strategy driven game.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Medieval, Print & Play

name: Improving Games: Monopoly
description: We had 4 Monopoly role cards to spice up everyone's favorite game (haha). Each has a whole bunch of new things going on. They have a special die roll, a starting corner / dollar amount, a special color where they gain extra money, and a big crazy special ability.

name: Improving Games: Scrabble
description: We made a cool little Scrabble variant that plays both competitively and cooperatively. I don't know if Bananagrams have points on their letters, but if they do, this would be great to slip inside that little banana case. Either way, you can challenge other players and press you luck with larger destination tiles, or you can lead your friends along to words that may be within reach. We also included our simple fix / rule change about using up to 1 blank (upside down) tile in a word. Other words can share the blank but the same blank replacement letter must work for both words.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Word Game

name: All About Altoona
description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the gameboard from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Altoona, PA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

description:

name: Pokémon Scratchees: The Ultimate Test
description:
Pokémon battle arena game with fighting, rocks, ground, and water Pokémon. "Gotta scratch 'em all!"

In this scratch off game, two players scratch off challenge spaces revealing Pokémon, Team Rocket, treasures, et. Depending on the revealed icon, players get to scratch off other sections of the card. For example, a duel icon means that you will face off against your opponent in the arena. Each player scratches a space and scores points based on how close the icon is to the player's own power type. The first to reach 25 points is the winner. If all the spaces are scratched off before that happens, the player with the most points is the winner.

In solo mode, the player plays both sides to see who wins. There are 8 scratchee cards in the box.

name: SmasHockey
description:
The aim of the game is to score the most points by sending the puck into the opponent's goal.

Played facing each other, two players alternately hit the wooden puck with their mini hockey stick. A game is played in 3 rounds and the round ends when one player has accumulated 7 points. Each goal is worth 1 point

name: Plushie Pier
description:
What does it take to be a victorious vendor of Plushie Pier? Selling lots of plushie sets, letting buyers haggle a bit, and boosting POMP! POMP is a local acronym for “place On My Pier.” It basically reflects the popularity, charisma, and overall esteem of your Craft.

Using the cards overlapping mechanic, player for prices of plushies on the pier for sale.
Each time you make a sale, you get a score card matching the icon and quantity of that set. If a player has sold their 8th Plushie, players complete the final round and score.

—description from the designer

name: Makrobrains
description:
This game was made by wholesale store "Makro" (or "Metro" in Germany) for their 25 year anniversary in the Netherlands. You play this trivia game with 2 to 4 teams of each 2 to 4 players in it. Every team put their pawn (a brain) on the start position. The first team to reach the finish wins.

During your turn you will pick the top card from the pile. On each card there are 2 themes, one on each side of the card, and you have 10 seconds to decide which side you want to play.

After choosing the side you want to play, you get 60 seconds to guess the words written on the card which belong to the theme on the top of the card (Dutch writers, capital cities, Makro employer titles, types of cheese). The team to the right of the playing team is the control team, which tallies how many correct answers are given.

The answers are written on the card but have a red coating over them which makes them almost invisible to read, the game also features a pair of sunglasses with red-tainted glasses which can see through the coating and can read the correct answers (this pair of sunglasses is for the control team).

If no correct answer is given in the first 30 seconds, the first answer is given by the control team as a hint, this answer does not count towards the score. After the 60 seconds are over, the playing team moves their pawn as many spots as their score and then the control team becomes the new playing team.

Furthermore, some spots on the board have a special action like "Go back 3 spots", which goes into effect immediately when a team lands on it, or "if you can at least 5 correct answers next turn, move one extra spot forward" or "Lose a turn", which goes into effect on their next turn. The board has 48 spaces, including the start and the finish space.
mechanics: Action/Event, Lose a Turn, Race, Real-Time, Semi-Cooperative Game, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Time Track

name: Spel van het Jaar 1996
description:
In this game, each team/players tries to collect the 5 different coloured chips in the game which correspond to the questions on the quiz cards.

All questions are questions about what happened in the Netherlands and the World between October 1995 and October 1996.

The player/teams who rolls the black side of the die starts the game.
On a team/player's turn, they roll the die (yellow, red, purple, blue, green and black).
If they roll the black side, their turn is forfeited.
Otherwise, they have to answer the question on the quiz card which corresponds to the colour they rolled.
Is their answer correct, they gain the chip in that colour.
Is their answer incorrect, the turn goes to the next player.
If a team/player rolls a colour they already have a chip in, they have to answer the question connected to that colour and if they are correct, they may roll again. (normally this isn't the case after a correct answer)
Their turn continues until they either roll the black side, when they answer a question incorrectly or when they obtain a new coloured chip.

name: EUrotour
description:
In this Trivia game about the European Union and its member states, players try to answer questions correctly in order to continue their turn, but if they guess wrong, they might give their opponents an extra turn!

Every player starts on the starting spot.
The player who rolls the highest with the die starts the game.
In your turn, you roll the die and move that amount of places.
You can land on either:

a flag from a country, you then answer a question about the country who belongs to that flag
a spot on the map of a country, you then answer a question about that country
a Star, you then answer a question about the European Union


If you guess correctly, you get and extra turn and can roll again.
If you guess wrong, the next player can try to answer correctly, if any of the other players guess correctly, they save up an extra turn that they can use after their normal turn, but they do not move right now and the turn of the current player is over (unless they saved up an extra turn between their last turn and this one).
If no one answers the question correctly, the turn of the current player is over, unless that player has saved up extra turns between their last turn and this one.
You can save up at most 2 extra turns.

Questions from countries can be in their native language (Finnish, Swedish, Danish, English, German, French, Luxembourgian, Austrian) or they are in Dutch.

When a player reaches or goes over the finish spot, they have to answer one last question about the European Union to win the game. If they answer incorrectly they stay at their spot and get a new question about the European Union the next turn, if they guess correctly their next turn, they still win the game.

—user summary

name: Mimikus
description:
Each player receives a set of dice, which instead of points have faces in different expressions. The players roll all the dice and place them on the matching starting squares. A special die specifies which die faces may be moved in that round. This die is changed each round. The six different dice faces also offer action possibilities. The winner is the first to draw his 6 dice with different expressions onto the target fields.

—user summary

name: All About Columbus, Georgia
description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. The first player to return to his residence with travel cards for all locations on his shopping list wins the game!

Game board is map of Columbus, GA depicting roads, highways, places of interest, businesses and billboards. Businesses used this game as an advertisement. Came with coupons for businesses advertised.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Schweine Roulette
description: A roulette variant with pig motifs on the bidding cards and on the roulette wheel. Each player has 4 cards in hand, with one suit and one pig position, he can bid up to four suits. Then the wheel is spun, for the winning color with matching pig position there is a winning pig and the bet card, for the right color with wrong pig there is a triple chance card, for the wrong color and the right pig there is a single chance card, but you have to give up the bet cards. If nothing is right, you give away all the cards you have bet. Whoever has a winning pig can challenge another owner and bets on a pig position, if he turns the right one, he gets the opponent's pig, otherwise he loses his own to the opponent. The first to own three winning pigs wins.

name: All About Philadelphia
description:
The object of this game is for the players, using dice and playing pieces, to travel on the game board from a Residence Square to the shopping locations shown on their shopping lists. name: Das große Schlümpfe-Rennen
description: In this running/dice game the Smurfs organize a race, each player chooses a figure, the Smurf cards are placed face down on the game board at the beginning. The player on the turn rolls the dice once and moves on by the number of dice rolled, whoever rolls a 6 may roll the dice again and move, foreign figures are skipped, there can be several figures on one field. At the end of the turn, you perform the event that belongs to the square you landed on - on some squares you get cards that bring you to Gargamel's castle or save you from it. The first player to get his figure back to the start/finish square is the winner.

name: Alfa Beta
description:
Hooks are in the game, but the game has no hook, but works well! How? Well, you are supposed to fish for the most points and this happens with the longest words possible. In the game there are hooks with two ends, each hook carries a letter, the 74 orange hooks the common letters with value 1, the 14 green hooks the already somewhat more difficult letters with value 2 - B, F, G, H and K - and the 12 red hooks provide the problem cases with value 3 - C, J, P, Q, V, X, W and Z. The underlines on some hooks are wildcards for every other letter. The underscores on some hooks are wild cards for every other letter.

In turn, everyone thinks of a word, preferably with the reachable letters, takes the first letter from the pile, holds the hook vertically and fishes the next letter from the pile with the lower hook, until you have formed a valid word. The letters must be strung in the correct order and direction, otherwise the turn ends. If a letter falls from the hook, the turn also ends without points, letters are always put back. As I said, you can only use reachable letters and must not shuffle the pile. If you have a valid word, you keep it. If all letters are used up or no meaningful word is possible anymore, you win with the most points from the collected words.

A creative variation of the word-building games! Of course, it gets harder as more and more letters go out of play, but in return you may be able to form shorter but more valuable words as difficult letters are uncovered. Creativity, vocabulary and a steady hand are required and deliver fun!

name: Ensnared
description:
2-6 players take the roll of jungle animals learning the art of escape using the wisdom of their mentors. While hanging upside down in snares, players play oxygen sets or runs on themselves and blood sets or runs on an opponent.

When a player has played all of their cards, the player with more oxygen than blood is the master of escape.

—description from the designer

name: Zp9 "Abfahren!"
description:
The trains start at the upper right corner (train depot). Movement is determined by a die. On an uneven roll the train has to follow the blue arrow, on an even roll the red arrows. On some spaces signals und signs affect movement. Naturally the trains can not pass each other on the tracks.

The first player to get his train to the destination station (below the depot) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Red Book of The Elf King Rules
description:
This A4 softcover rulebook allows players to play a game which details the Elf Civil War, set in The Isles of Eas.

Contains full-colour illustrations, lore, & narratives from the Isles of Eas; with detailed rules, stats, & scenarios for every Circle and Wyrd Meeting within the Isles.

—description from the publisher (edited)
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Lucid Eye Publications, Lucid Raven Productions

name: Monopoly: Penrith Edition
description: The traditional Monopoly board game but featuring locations from the Penrith area within the state of NSW, Australia.

name: The Second Book of The Elf King Troll Wars Rules
description:
Writer of the cult hit The Red Book of The Elf King, Rick Priestley presents the first expansion to the game since its release! The Second Book of The Elf King explores the Outer Isles, with a whole new Campaign, leading to a Hellish conclusion. Players will rewrite the History of Eas in their wake. The game features a total of six new Circles being introduced into the game, alongside Scenario characters. and a vast new array of spell lists and rules adding on to the base game. Requires the first Book - The Red Book of The Elf King - to play.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Ambershyft
description:
Ambershyft is a 2-6 player cooperative game.
This game features a unique enemies turn into resources loot system.


when you kill blue enemies, you flip their tiles over, and they become ammo.
when you kill green enemies, they turn into movement.
when you kill amber colored enemies, they turn into energy.
when you kill earth colored enemies, they turn into health.


Bounties are how you get upgrades, how enemies spawn, and how enemies become stronger. You must work together to collect bounties before they expire.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Chaining, Chit-Pull System, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Investment, Movement Points

name: Das Expedition Natur Spiel
description:
Explore nature, actually at any time of year, but best from April to October. Properly dressed and well equipped, take order cards, explorer badges and ink pads. The players form teams and draw three order cards per round. Then they all try to complete their missions quickly and correctly and bring them to headquarters. If they succeed, they get a stamp point in their explorer badge. For each order, you have to present a found object; for orange orders, you have to show or describe exactly where it was found. In case of doubt, the game leader decides. The team that collects eight stamp points first wins.

—user summary

name: Die bunte Bande
description:
Own circles should be connected by different colorful shapes.

Each player has four circles of one color - blue, pink, gray and yellow-green. One circle of each player is placed in the center together with the circle of the other players so that these circles touch each other, so to speak, form a square. The remaining circles are laid out in a circle around this center square with about a hand's width between them; there should be space between the circles and circles of the same color should not be directly adjacent or too close together. The 36 shape cards in six colors - yellow, orange, blue, purple, dark green and red - are laid out in an unordered pile, with each shape once per color.

The active player rolls the dice and takes any shape card of that color and places it on the table so that it touches a circle or another already existing shape card. If there is no matching shape card left in the supply, take any card of that color from the table and place it somewhere else. In this way, each player tries to be the first to connect his own circles with shape cards. The player who succeeds first is the immediate winner.

Cheerful, colorful, simple and an enjoyable, loose practice of spatial imagination and use of space; for example, you can put the fish and the starfish mouth to tip, or put the head of the gobbler in the crook of the starfish or mushroom - so you can overcome long distances, or avoid making it too easy for the other players to connect their own circles faster.

name: Corners of the Earth: Dawn Edition
description:
2-4 players try to gain points over four rounds of play. This is achieved by playing cards overlapping “Corner” cards on the play area to balance habitats. Players may gain a bonus on their turn when their personal habitat is in majority.

A card is played and a new drawn each turn to gain points on the habitat track. Once a player reaches the 16th point on the track, the round ends. After the fourth round, the player with the greatest score from all rounds is the winner.

The game comes with 60 domino style cards and 5 pawns while fitting in a portable poker tuck box. The original version was published on The Game Crafter in 2020 with different art, packaging, and did not include cards to keep score.

name: Lingering Hues
description:
Abner and Hazelponi Hue must stop the Kimriyr before they reach the tombs of Naphal in this game of survival. This is a solo dice game in which victory is achieved by rolling dice to equal an enemies K.O. Points.

Getting past 12 enemies,(fewer for easier difficulty) will ensure victory. This is achieved with the aid of abilities and traits to provide re-rolls. The game includes eye catching dice and plastic flame token for tracking.

On a player's turn, a hand card is played and a new card drawn. With each card played, the enemy movement markers moves a step. When the marker is moved off the last mark, the enemy is encountered. All six dice are rolled in an encounter in an attempt to match the K.O. Value. The game ends when the player loses all capacity points or finished the last encounter with at least one capacity point remaining.

Changes from the 2015 edition include:
Tthe 16 custom candle dice concept in the 2015 version is removed. The new version has six standard dice and uses three tracking cards.

Movement is no longer tracked by cards, rather tracked with a token.

A main character had 1 ability in the 2015 version while the new version has 8 to purchase and use by playing cards.

name: Virusalarm in Bleibhausen
description:
It is a beautiful spring day when two people return from their skiing holiday in the 100-inhabitant town of Bleibhausen. What neither of them know: They contracted the new NOSO virus (STILL SO a virus) while on vacation! Only after three days of incubation do they feel sick and stay at home. But how many residents have the two infected meanwhile unnoticed?
Can a major virus outbreak still be prevented?

Virusalarm in Bleibhausen is a free game for children and adolescents from the age of 12 that was developed with scientists from IST Austria and the Max Planck Institute for Evolutionary Biology. By reenacting the spread of a fictional virus in a city, players will explore and understand what countermeasures can take to contain viruses. In the Home Edition for the home, the players slip into the role of scientists ( game variants “simulation” and “vaccination ”), or into the role of politicians who have to weigh the advantages and disadvantages of restrictions on public life ( game variant “Challenge ” ).

Chips symbolize people, yellow ones are sick, white ones are still healthy. They are distributed in different buildings on a game board that depicts the fictional city of Bleibhausen. If there are white chips with yellow ones in a building, e.g. the restaurant, they become infected and turn yellow.

Players try to minimise the spread and earn points depending on how well they control the disease. The player/team with the most points, wins.

Es ist ein schöner Frühlingstag, als im 100-Einwohner Städtchen Bleibhausen zwei Leute vom Skiurlaub zurückkommen. Was die beiden nicht wissen: Sie haben sich im Urlaub mit dem neuen NOSO-Virus (NOch SO ein Virus) angesteckt! Erst nach drei Tagen Inkubationszeit fühlen sie sich krank und bleiben zuhause. Aber wie viele Einwohner_innen haben die beiden inzwischen schon unbemerkt angesteckt?
Ist ein großer Virenausbruch noch zu verhindern?

name: WATO (What Are The Odds...)
description:
The game of What are the Odds where you don't need to think about what scenario of odds to give your friends next.

We're not saying your going of friends is boring, but, we're saying it takes a little bit more effort to create an unforgettable night. So, that's why we've come up with 130 ridiculous scenarios that will embarrass everyone one card a time and you'll find yourself belly laughing on the ground not caring that someone just pee'd there.

The game goes a little something like this:

Person A picks up from the deck and reads the card aloud to everyone "What are the Odds?" Person B (The person to their right aka righty) chooses the odds to make this between. This cannot be any higher than 10 or any lower than 2. The closer to 10, the less chance of the odds being chosen. The closer to 2, the more change of the odds being chosen because yeah...it's a one in two chance.

Person A & B think of a number between those odds set by Person B. Everyone counts 3,2,1....then at the same time Person A & Person B say the number they were thinking between those odds given.

If they say the same number, then Person B must do the task for the points or risk loosing points. If they don't say the same number, then it moves on to Person B pulling a card and reading it to Person C. (or back to Person A if you are playing with 2 people)

The name of the game is to get the most points and win. You decide on how many points that is as a group before starting.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Big-Bobby-Car-Sicher im Verkehr
description:
Traffic education with Big Bobby Car.

Each character starts in house A or B. The car and road cards are divided into two piles. Everyone tries to get to school or kindergarten as quickly and safely as possible.

The first player answers a question about the traffic cards - if the answer is correct, you roll the dice and move on. You stop on a red field (road crossing!). The road can be crossed in the next turn with "green" of the traffic light dice. Unsecured crossings can only be crossed by revealing a free street. With a crossing guard you cross the street with a 4, 5 or 6.

The first player to reach their destination, wins.

name: Würfelschlange
description:
The game contains 7 different, very simple dice games. It's mostly about achieving certain dice combinations first or with the fewest rolls. Since the individual games are played with up to 13 dice, it is advantageous to recognize combinations or patterns.

—user summary

name: "Frösi"-Denkspiel
description:
Each player has 8 pawns and 20 tokens of the same color. Taking turns the players place one pawn unto the gray spaces on the game board. Whenever a player places the 4th pawn around a scoring space, he puts a token on this space and scores the number of points indicated there. When all pawns have been placed on the board the moving phase starts. The pawns may move one apace in any direction or jump over any other pawn to a free space behind this pawn, trying to encircle more scoring spaces. Only 1 jump is allowed per turn.
When all scoring spaces are covered with tokens, the meeples have to reach the home spaces of their color. The game ends, when the first player has reached all 8 home spaces. Each pawn on a home space scores 3 points. The Player with the most points wins the game.

name: Lotniczy Biznes
description:
In the Lotniczy Biznes game, we become the president of a new airline, it is an extremely hermetic market and it is difficult for us to "enter the showrooms", especially since other airlines are opening with us, and our friends become their CEOs!

For our lines, every round opens the possibility of making one flight, on which you can either earn or lose, in case few passengers use your line! To make such a flight you have to negotiate the price with other CEOs, whoever gives the most rolls the dice.

Before game starts players draw a card with their main airport, a 'special ability' card and get one aircraft. Players can upgrade their aircraft, take a loan, and bids on flying to a destination. The player who wins the auction rolls the dice to see if they've made a profit. The first player to collect a billion Euro wins the game.

How much and whether you earn on the connection made depends on several factors, such as the economy of your plane, what airport is your home base, random events such as damaged landing gear and especially on how many passengers will use your line! By managing risk well, wisely investing in modernizing your machines or rejecting unprofitable connections, you will develop your airline and achieve success in this hellishly difficult aviation business!

The expanded edition contains : +10 random event cards +2 starting airports cards (this means 7 players can play the game), +2 special ability cards (as above), +20 destination airports (60 vs 40, longer game), aircraft service fee (which you have to pay every round, depends on aircraft type), loans


W grze Lotniczy Biznes, stajemy się prezesem nowej linii lotniczej, jest to niezwykle hermetyczny rynek i ciężko Nam "wejść na salony", zwłaszcza, że razem z nami otwierają się inne linie lotnicze, a ich prezesami zostają Nasi znajomi!Światowe lotniska są coraz bardziej zatłoczone i coraz popularniejszy jest handel slotami na lotniskach, im popularniejsze lotnisko, tym więcej trzeba za taki slot zapłacić, jednak jest to okazja dla linii, ponieważ mogą oni podnieść cenę biletu oraz liczyć na większy zarobek! Najdroższą taką transakcją w historii, był zakup połączenia na Heathrow, American Airlines zapłaciło aż 60 milionów dolarów linii SAS, za ich miejsce!

Dla naszych linii co rundę otwiera się możliwość wykonania jednego połączenia, na którym możecie albo zarobić albo stracić, w przypadku gdy mało pasażerów skorzysta z Waszej linii! Aby wykonać taki lot musicie negocjować z innymi prezesami cenę, kto da najwięcej, rzuca kostką.

To ile i czy zarobicie na wykonanym połączeniu zależy od kilku czynników, takich jak ekonomiczność Waszego samolotu, to jakie lotnisko jest Waszym portem macierzystym, zdarzeń losowych takich jak uszkodzone podwozie! A zwłaszcza od tego, ilu pasażerów skorzysta z Waszej linii!

Dobrze zarządzając ryzykiem, mądrze inwestując w modernizacje swojej maszyny czy odrzucając nierentowne połączenia rozwiniecie swoją linie i osiągniecie sukces na tym piekielnie trudnym lotniczym biznesie!

Grę wygrywa gracz, który jako pierwszy zgromadzi miliard Euro.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Score-and-Reset Game

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 22
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 22 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Battle Cobra T/F/G/I/J/X
Doom Courser Prime/A/B/C/D
Night Gyr T/F/G/X
Goliath GOL-3M/3M2/7C/7K/7R
Jade Phoenix Prime/A/B/C/D/E
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Sicher ist Sicher
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wine Rating Pocket
description:
Wine Rating Pocket is a re-working of Wine RATING as a one or two player game. It is not possible to use two copies of Wine Rating Pocket to play Wine Rating. Whilst the gameplay is the same, the cards are changed in the Pocket game.

User summary
In the game of Wine Rating, you are a wine critic. You give a rating to wines from various countries, while investing in wineries to monopolize the market.

This game uses 4 investment tokens per player and 16 cards. On the table, there is a space to hold 16 cards in 4 x 4 square grid, and each row and column represents reputation of a winery in which players may invest. Each turn, you have two options: you may place a rating card, which ranges from -3 to +5, in the square grid, affecting two wineries; or you may place two investment tokens on any wineries.

At the end of the round, the investor on each winery takes the reputation score on that winery. After the third round, the investor calculates their total score.

Although the cards have Japanese text, you can play Wine Rating ignoring the text. There are two types of cards: winery cards and rating cards. Winery cards are written in English and Japanese, and all Japanese text on the Rating cards are just flavor. They gorgeously describes a wine in wine critics' comments. Japanese players can enjoy the text, but it is not necessary for gameplay.
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Wir wandern nach Halle
description:
A number of dominoes are dealt to the players, who take turns adding dominoes to the display after the starting player has placed a domino on the table. If a player hasn't a matching domino to add, he has to take a domino from the stock. The first player who adds his last domino to the display has reached Halle and wins the game.

The dominoes show buildings, landscapes and hiking symbols.

—user summary

name: ΛICE
description:
ΛICE, a combination of the greek "Lamda" and "dice", is a trick-taking game for 3 to 4 players. The cards show the traditional suit and rank, but the illustration in the middle shows the card's rank made out of the sum of 1 or 2 die faces. In addition to playing a card to a trick, a player may also play a die. If they do, after everyone has played a card, the players who also chose to play dice roll them and choose one of the eligible places on their card to place the die; it could change the value of the card up or down. The card also becomes the color of the die.

Players earns points for hitting their bid of how many tricks they expected to win as well as tricks won and dice collected. The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

name: Old World: Roll and Write
description:
Old World - Role and Write is a tabletop roll and write game set in the fictional world of "old world".

The aim of the game is to get the most points by placing races from the old world into the most optimal parts of the land. Some races love the mountains, other dwell in the forest. Some need to live close by to each other to survive, others like to live in solitude.

The game was created as a free print and play to be downloaded over the holidays of 2021, with the aim of bringing people together.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: 絑々 (syusyu)
description:
絑々 (syusyu) is a 2-player abstract strategy game from Japan (the theme is lipstick pieces).

At the start of the game, each player selects their six player pieces one by one. They have already received a card which restricts the placement of pieces, and so must select pieces from the pool to help their intended strategy. All pieces are visible to each player.

Then players take turns to place a piece on the grid board, such that the piece cannot be the same colour just payed, and they cannot break their own restriction card.

The player who cannot place a piece loses the game.

The game was launched at the Autumn 2021 Tokyo Game Market, with early reservations getting a special edition of pieces with little bows on them.
user summary
mechanics: Single Loser Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: 桜儷 (Sana)
description:
桜儷 (さな) (Sana) is a 2-player co-operative game from Japan. Players are apprentice Spring fairies, tasked with bringing the cherry blossom (Sakura) to flower. Both fairies don't want to let on that they are apprentice, and so do not talk as they work. The more flowers they can make bloom, they better they succeed.

The game title Sana is a contraction Sakura Narabu, meaning Line Up Blossoms. The kanji 儷 (Narabu) is remarkably obscure. Hence the publisher has added the more simple hiragana さな to help readers as a furigana (pronunciation indicator).

The board shows ten open spaces for Sakura, each space being for five petals. Players will build up complete flowers on the spaces to win.

Each player has a number of petal pieces, showing 1 to 4 petals. They secretly take a petal in hand and show them together, without discussing what they are choosing.

If they have chosen different pieces, then they each place their chosen petals on the board. But an existing piece must be taken off the board to a storage area.

If they have chosen the same pieces to play (butting), again they place their pieces, but may now bring a piece from the storage area onto the board.

When places their pieces, the players can talk so to get optimal placement. But they cannot discuss what pieces they have left, not what to choose next turn.

There are also some placement conditions depending upon the number of petals. For example, a 3 petal piece can only go to an empty space.

Once a flower is complete, it cannot be changed. Pieces that cannot be placed are returned to hand.

The game ends in certain ways:
When a player runs out of pieces.
When all ten flowers are complete.
When the storage area has five pieces.

Then the players see how many flowers they have completed and praise or chastise themselves accordingly.
user summary

name: BattleTech: Experimental Technical Readout – Phantoms
description: Experimental Tech Readout: Phantoms samples a number of high-technology designs developed for use by elite covert operatives and special military forces found throughout the Inner Sphere in the late-Jihad period. Each design featured in this book demonstrates the advanced and experimental technologies found in Tactical Operations. Statistics and Record Sheets are included for 13 BattleMechs, vehicles, aerospace units, and battlesuits presented in this book, ready for play in advanced BattleTech games.

name: Panama Canal Trivia Game
description:
This unique trivia challenge with a Panama Canal theme is designed to be enjoyed by up to four players.

Contestants roll a die to move around a pathway with spaces named for locations on or near the canal: Gatun Locks, Balboa, Gaillard Cut, etc. Question cards are color coded like playing cards: Ace, King, Queen, Jack, and Ten. The first player to obtain a "Royal Flush" is declared the winner.

Includes board, rules, question cards, tokens, a die, and information about the Panama Canal Museum.

name: BattleTech: Bruderkampf
description:
Bruderkampf was designed to teach new BattleTech players. It contains a mini-campaign (a series of six connected scenarios) of increasing complexity that do not require the players to possess any additional products beyond a single boxed BattleTech starter set.

The scenarios are designed to be played using only the maps and BattleMechs from the Introductory box.

name: When Gods Collide
description:
This is a fantasy themed 4-player version of MetaCheckers: Battlefield with all-wood, laser cut pieces. Play as one of four ancient gods:
• Zeus / Greek temples
• Odin / viking ships
• Amun-Ra / sphinxes
• Marduk / Babylonian ziggurats

Each player gets 6 board tiles - four squares each - which they take turns placing on the field of play, connecting the tiles to form a unique battlefield. Players place their 12 checkers strategically on the squares of their tiles, with the kings hidden, face down at the beginning of the game. Eliminate your opponents by capturing their god / king.

On their turn, players roll two dice to determine how to move a checker. One die has the symbols for chess pieces, the other is a standard d6 numbers die. Whenever a 6 is rolled, the player may opt to reroll with the HERO Die and the numbers die for 6 additional useful moves.

Players eliminate their opponents by capturing the hidden god / king of the opposing army, which then leaves the board. Last player standing wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Tile Placement

name: Stick 'Em Up
description:
A western outlaw game where you draw from two decks, racing to accumulate 50 total gold.

Players take turns drawing cards, laying gold bag cards face up and leaving any others in their hands. This is where the element of cheating comes in, you only have to reveal your hand if someone draws The Jig is Up card, then all players reveal the hands and pay their debts/loss of turns.

This is the second edition of the game. I added what was to be the first expansion to just be part of the base game, adding an additional 54 cards that really brings the "bad guy" feel to the game.

—description from the designer

name: Ringfrei
description:
Each player starts with 5 colored rings on his game piece, which should move from there to the personal ring tray as quickly as possible. To do this, questions about the topics of body, mind and soul must be answered and tasks must be solved. Through wrong answers and events you have to put new rings on your figure. The first player to collect at least 8 rings on his ring tray and only carry a maximum of 2 rings on his game piece wins.

—user summary

name: What's Next?: A Life-Size Game
description:
What's Next? A Life-Size Game will hold the interest of your kids, and to give everyone the chance to share something truly valuable with them — laughter and family fun for all ages!

Fill your home with smiles, active entertainment, and endless joy.

It's the perfect addition to your family's game night. Bond with your kids and leave the screens behind.

name: Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate
description:
Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion x Cat & Chocolate is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the Code Geass: Lelouch of the Rebellion anime.

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the CODE or the GEASS team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

name: Rain-Bo
description:
From the box:

Rain-Bo is the racing rainbow card where gray skies are going to clear up & you put on a happy face.

In Rain-Bo, players race to be the first to fill their hand with the seven colors of the rainbow.

To do this, they clear their clouds away & let the sun shine in by strategically swapping & saving cards!

There's no numbers, no complex rules, just fun for everyone!

___________________________________________

Play starters with a pile of cloud cards & each turn they select a sun card from the centre. The player then exchanges their cloud cards that match that sun cards color.

The first player to have a sun card of each color is the winner!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Party Game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Matching, Memory, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Trading

name: Ridley's Games Room: The Name Game Quiz
description:
A quick-fire guessing game suitable for all ages. Describe the famous person without using the words on the cards and see just how many your team mates can guess to win the game

Players take a card which lists a famous person and 5 words, titles, etc. which they are identified with. Players describe the famous person without using the words on the cards. Whoever guesses the person wins the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game, wins.

name: Het ANWB vakantie spel
description:
When going on vacation you do a lot of fun stuff like flying kites, swimming or building sandcastles. But be sure to pick up your beloved items at the ANWB-shop and be the first player to deliver all your items at your vacation home.

Throw the colored die to see how far you can drive your car and strategically place traffic lights to block your opponents roads.

—user summary

name: Love Match
description:
In Love Match it's all about love, friendship, romance, fun and surprises. Learn new things about love and be smarter than your opponents and be the first one to find your love match.
But it's not only about knowing the most about love. Sometimes you have to complete challenges in order to win hearts.

When it's your turn, throw a dice. Where you land determines what you must do that turn. You can either answer a trivia question about love or friendship. When it's good you stay on your spot, when you answer it wrong you go back to the place you came from. You can get questions about how well you know the other players. Or you can lend on a duel. Where you must try to match the answer that the other player picks. Each time you succeed you will get a heart. If you are the first player to reach the end of the heart shaped track with three hearts you are the winner.

—user summary

name: Noordhollands Dagblad spel
description:
In this game you play a journalist who tries to collect news stories in different places. The more news you manage to gather, the more ads you will get. And you will need those ads in order to make a complete newspaper.
But beware, not every lead will give you a story worth writing about, sometimes it's a dead end.

On the board you see a map of the province of North Holland. Across you will see roads with different color circles on it When it's your turn you throw a dice and move your pawn that many spaces. On the news article cards you will see the name of the place you have to go to in order to collect them. There are six different categories of news: Regional news, World news, Economics, background stories, Culture and Sports. Each one with their own color. You have to gather an article from every category and four ads in order to win.
The top card from the ad deck lies open for everyone. It shows the required colors of the news categories you need to have in order to get the ad.

—user summary

name: キャット＆チョコレート: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition)
description:
キャット＆チョコレート: Gachapin x Mukku (Cat & Chocolate: Gachapin Challenge Edition) is a standalone game that uses the same gameplay as Cat & Chocolate with characters, items, and situations from the children's television programs "Hirake! Ponkikki" and "Ponkickies".

Each turn, the active player must use 1-3 items in hand to avoid threats, creating a convincing story that incorporates these somewhat random objects. After you tell the story, everyone else votes on whether or not you succeeded. If a majority backs you, you keep the threat card; otherwise, you don't. Each player secretly belongs to either the Gachapin or the Mukku team, and you naturally want to vote for the players on your team, but no one knows who is on which team.

After a certain number of threats, the game ends, players reveal which team they belong to, and each team tallies the number of threats that their members escaped. Whichever side avoided more threats wins!

name: The Game of Heroes and Events
description: Players compete to be the first to complete a complete suit of cards. Each card recounts a Hero or Event from US history. Players travel around the game board, collecting and exchanging cards until they have complete the suit.

name: Invocación Fronteras: Campeadores
description:
Summoners battles always had that gallantry of taking the summons with the greatest potential as a trophy by winning a demonstration, but they know that this summon has sworn loyalty to its summoner... but the supreme summoners learned to break those bonds, to bend the will of emperors and gods, marking who rules in this territory...

Advanced game mode expansion for Invocación Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Domador del Craken (12 - Water): Lower 3 Power to all Fire and Earth.
Eva (36 - Fire): If this card is Invocation destroy 2 Mana from a players reserve.



High difficulty for Summoning Masters

In this game mode, summoners will be forced to prove their ability on the battlefield. The number of cards in play is limited but will have new tactical resources to use to your advantage. In this new game mode, trophies can be used so points are scored separately.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Print & Play

name: Sucesos Argentinos: 3 Presidencias promo card
description:
A promo card for Sucesos Argentinos about the 3 middle presidencies in Argentinian "5 presidents in a week" collapse, adding one more event for your timeline.


Ramón Puerta
Eduardo Camaño
Adolfo Rodríguez Saá
categories: Card Game, Educational, Expansion for Base-game

name: Asteroids Chasers
description:
Will you be able to mine the most from asteroids without dying?

Be careful, 3 active mines and the asteroid field explodes, along with your profits!

Avoid pirate ships that paralyze your probes.

Objective:

Your goal is to play all the cards from your deck, and make the best score.

To do so, you play each card from your deck with the following rules:

the card can never cover a previously played card
the card must be placed adjacent (horizontally, vertically or diagonally) to the previously played card.


You lose the game if there are no legal moves and at least a card is not played, of if there are 3 active Mines at the same time in the playfield.

You win the game if you managed to put all cards from the deck in the play field.

Includes solo, 2 player competitive & 2 player cooperative modes.

name: Keine Panik!: Family Edition
description:
This is the family edition from "Don't Panic".
There are category cards as in the base game, but each has 3 categories with one of the levels hard, medium and simple.
At the beginning of the game a level is set for each player, easy for children, hard for adults with many knowledge.
It's also a timed game, but each round the active player gets only 1 category and has to name 5 words, which match this category. The timer is stopped and the remaining number are the points he gets for this round.
3 times each player is allowed to ask for a new category (3 chips are available for each player to mark this)
After 5 rounds the player with the highest number of points wins.

—user summary
categories: Deduction, Educational, Party Game, Real-time, Trivia, Word Game

name: Ratz Fatz Lieder-Spiel-Kiste
description:
This children educational game is driven by the 29 children songs which are on the included CD.
The children may sing the songs while playing. There are multiple variants which can be played, e.g. grabbing the right wooden figure (30 included) or carton tile when it's named in the song.
This game should help learning the German language, concentration and reaction.

—user summary

name: Bingo Bongo
description:
This is a combination of a traditional memory game and Tic Tac Toe.
Each player has his own Tic Tac Toe board with animals and fruits on the fields.
On players turd, he has to find pairs as in normal memory, but only the images on hios Tic Tac Toe board are relevant.
If he finds one of his, he covers this image.
Who first covers 3 in a row on his Tic Tac Toe board wins the game.

—user summary

name: Fox Kids
description:
In Fox Kids each player gets a board with 8 different cartoon character on them. You can also find these characters on a pile of circle shaped tiles that are in the middle of the table. Each player blindly chooses 5 tiles and try to see if they match any of the characters you have on your board. If so you can keep them, if not you return them face up, so everyone can see which characters is on that tile. Luckily there are a few wild cards among the pile which you can use to fill in a missing character on your board.

If you want to try to make it a bit harder, you can play level 2. You flip over your board and instead of the preprinted characters you get 8 empty circles on your board. On the added notepad every player picks for themselves 8 different characters they try to collect. In this way you can't really know what characters your opponents try to find. Whoever get's all of their characters first wins the game.

—user summary

name: Geef oma een kus
description:
Don't you just hate that grandma always wants to give you those big wet kisses. You are not the only one who doesn't like this.
In this game everyone shares the same pawn that goes along a 12 step track. In order players play cards from their hands. On the cards are different types of actions that can either impress or disgust grandma. When you impress her the pawn moves up the track, when you disgust her the pawn goes down the track. And the end of your turn you take cards from the pile until you have 4 cards in hands again.

A player that plays a card which lands the pawn on step number 12 gets a big wet kiss from grandma. There is a lip shaped stamp and a lipstick you can use to create your own grandma's kiss on your cheeks.

The first player to get three kisses loses the game.

—user summary

name: Les Simon
description:
Each summer you spend your vacation with cousins in the mansion of grandpa, Hector Simon, the greatest adventurer in the world! This evening, he is absent and all his enemies will take the opportunity to take revenge. But they didn't count on you!
Search the mansion, create traps and save as many treasures as possible from the clutches of the Jealous!

Setup : choose a character and draw a random personality.
Phase 1 : the Jealous come inside, draw the first Clock card, it indicates the the number of Jealous to enter the mansion.
Phase 2 : Search the manor, every player draw Object cards.
Phase 3 : Assemble your objects to create traps.
Phase 4 : Reduce the resistance of the jealous by triggering your traps to save treasures.


For each trap, you need to explain its operating mechanism out loud! Make way for the imagination and the pain!Phase 5 : All the Jealous still in the mansion will be able to steal Treasures cards.

The game ends when one full turn of the clock has been completed.

The game also ends immediately when 10 treasures have been stolen by the Jealous. You have all lost then and Grandpa will be very disappointed.

name: Toggolino: Activity – Die Oktonauten: Erforschen, Retten, Beschützen
description:
Childrens version of activity based on the "Die Oktonauten" TV series from Toggolino (SuperRTL, Toggo plus).
It's a under water submarine race. There are characters and things known from the series. These are described by one player with pantomime, drawing or description. Only the players who finds the right answer can move forward.
It can be played in 2 teams or cooperative.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Dragonscales: Promo Pack
description:
Limited edition promotional cards for Dragonscales. Includes powerful new items and artifacts for the Treasure deck!

Cards are:
Temporal Shifter - Once per round, you may pay 1 dragonscale to allow any player who is moving to move 1 additional space

Gem of Warding - Discard to cancel any attack against any player

Potion of Silence - Discard during the choose actions step when any player reveals their dice. That play may re-roll all of their rage outcomes

Counterspell - Discard at any time to cancel any villainy card as it is being played

Dragondmend Scroll - Discard the card to make all other players return one dragon wound of their choice back to the dragon’s head

name: Das große "Oh wie schön ist Panama" Spiel
description:
Each player is given a piece to roll to Panama and back as quickly as possible. On the way there are special fields on which you have to test your memory by revealing the matching tile to the field you have reached. If none of the 3 revealed tiles is correct, you have to travel back to the next special field. The first player to return home (after reaching Panama) wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Galaktion: Messengers of the Void
description:
Galaktion: Messengers of the Void is a tactical co-op sci-fi story-driven dungeon crawler game for 2-5 players, with an option for solo play.

The game will take you to the far future of the Milky way, where a team of renegades are hired by a shadowy corporation to fix a messy experiment with galactic proportions.

Unique setting, armed with tight game rules, allows you to “learn-as-you-crawl” through the dungeon maps and master your strategy against the game. Randomly spawned enemies and skill based characters will allow you to choose from variety of skills and abilities to find your best game style cooperating with your team mates. In Galaktion: Messengers of the Void, the team play means survival.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Dice, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simultaneous Action Selection, Square Grid

name: MAKALOT
description:
"The Different Game"

The game is promoted as "fast moving, surprising - different". It is played by four players on a 13x13 multi-coloured checkered board. On each side of the board, there is a role (producer, doctor, politician, and opportunist). One of these roles is assumed by each of the four players. Playing time is presented as being one to two hours. The board also states that the game is "a game of skill", played with "no dice or cards".

MAKALOT was published by Modern Games Company in Oaktown, Indiana. The copyright date is 1937, held by Roy A. Beard. A "patent pending" notation is shown on the game board.

name: Kanzleramt
description:
Nowhere are the opposites of good and evil more evident than in politics. And in this board game.

Honest, committed and capable rulers oppose lying, cheating and scheming fellow citizens. In the struggle for power in the role of Chancellor / Chancelloress, some people will use any means.
As a member of politics, you must assert yourself in this - often unfriendly - environment and also be able to deal with unfair means of competition in order to decide the question of the next Chancellor for yourself.
Based on real political events, you will experience this tension and all these contradictions in Kanzleramt.
Your path to the chancellor's office is long and rocky, and it always leads through the Bundestag. It is important that you get as many members of your own party as possible into the Bundestag. Because in this parlor game they elect the chancellor at the end.

As in real life, the path to this position is practically never straightforward and is marked by both positive surprises and setbacks. Luck, skill, fighting spirit and a wide variety of political events influence the path of your party's politicians to the Bundestag.

—description from the publisher (translated)
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: HackBots
description:
HackBots is a strategic card game of sabotage for 2-5 players. The object of the game is to raise your opponents’ device risk and hack their devices before they hack you.

Each player lays out three Device Tokens in their playing area. Next, deal 4 cards face down to each player. Place the remaining deck face down to create the Draw Pile. Then, flip over the top card to start the Discard Pile.

On your turn, draw one card from the Draw Pile or Discard Pile. Play one card from your hand. You can ATTACK an opponent by raising the risk on one device, DEFEND one of your own devices by lowering or resetting the risk, or DISCARD one card if you cannot or do not want to play a card.

When a device’s risk reaches level 4, it may be hacked. Once a player has three hacked devices, that player cannot win the game. However, they remain in the game and continue to attack the remaining payers until there is a winner.

The last player remaining with at least one unhacked device wins the game!

name: リカー・フォー・レディ (LIQUOR for LADY)
description:
リカー・フォー・レディ (LIQUOR for LADY) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The theme has the players trying to buy the right cocktail for woman at a nightclub. Each player chooses a card in secret and reveals it simultaneously. If the difference between the values on the cards is more than 3, then the lower card wins (the lady liked the drink offered).

The player that favours the most woman at the bar is the winner.
user summary

name: 子リスのほっぺ (Korisu no Hoppe)
description:
子リスのほっぺ (Korisu no Hoppe) is a card game from Japan. Players are young squirrels, trying to collect acorns, but under the effect of action cards.
user summary

name: ¡Yo No Tomo!
description:
¡Yo No Tomo! (I do not drink!) is a hilarious card game that appeals to competitiveness and is designed for meetings with friends where drinks and the desire to have a good time are present.

The game challenges each team to get all the cards in their BAR before another does or before they have had enough to give up. In the attempt, each team must defend themselves with the cards they have in their possession to avoid getting drunk, while at the same time they can attack their opponents with cards that make them drink. This game is designed and optimized to be played in teams, but its optional individual version also works very well and is just as fun.

¡Yo No Tomo! is just as fun and competitive without alcohol, and for this it is recommended to draw the TRAGO cards.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Elefant, Tiger & Co. Das Zoo-Spiel zur Serie
description: The 5 zoo area cards are laid out, the animal cards are added, all other cards are stacked face down, each player has 7 cards. Whoever's turn it is rolls the dice and moves the game piece, then he can lay or discard cards and draw new ones. Whoever completes a row with food, baby animals, scales with the animal keeper or regardless of cards laid with the veterinarian takes the row for victory points. When all the animals in an area are cleared, the player who has collected the most cards wins.

name: オルカコール (Orcas' Call)
description:
オルカコール (Orcas' Call) is a 2 player Japanese co-operative communication game. The players are orcas looking for a romantic relationship. But each Orca has a different personality, and they cannot use words. So they convey their feelings using sounds (calling cards).

Both players try to control their scoring on two feelings; crush and comfort. Each player will choose a calling card in secret and show it, and then match them an emotion card. The way the different calls relate, and how they are effected by emotions, make their feelings rise and fall.

As the players get to know each other, unexpected things can happen. The important thing is to keep their feelings together. Will they be united by a love deeper than the sea?

届けたい、この想い。2人専用協力コミュニケーションゲーム！
『Orcas' Call』は、2人専用・協力型のお見合い風カードゲームです。

それぞれ違う性格のシャチとなり、お互いに求愛をして恋仲になることを目指します。
ただし、シャチは言葉を持たなので、コールカード（シャチの発する音波）で想いを伝え合います。
カードの組み合わせによって上下する「ときめき」と「やすらぎ」の２つの気持ちをコントロールしながら、お互いの仲を深めましょう。
時には思いもよらないハプニングも発生するかもしれません。

大事なのはしっかりと想いを合わせること。
あなたたちは海よりも深い愛で結ばれることができるでしょうか？
publisher's summary

name: Terror en la Noche
description: An old suspense and horror game for kids and adults.

name: Doblejuego: Grand Pursang & Zodíaco
description:
A collection of 2 family games:

Grand Pursang

Spectacular horse race with a minimum of 3 players and a maximum of 6. Before starting, the participants will decide how many races they will run per game. Each one receives an initial sum of money, with their objective being to obtain the highest capital at the end of the game. Each player, once received and studied his cards, bets on the horse that he considers can win, this choice is secret and is kept in reserve until the end of the race. Then, according to his card playing skills, his audacity and his luck with the dice, he will try to get his favorite horse to cross the finish line in 1st or 2nd place.

Zodíaco

Original, easy and exciting betting game where, starting from an initial sum that each player receives at the beginning of the game, the objective of each one is to conquer the greatest fortune. From 2 to 6 players participate and it is played without a time limit since only the luck of each one will determine the permanence of it. Let's try Zodiac and good luck!
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: Wild Assent: Daughters of Draketh
description: The Daughters of Draketh adds a new narrative-based campaign to Wild Assent. War is brewing in the Wilds and the key to peace rests in the hands of the Daughters of Draketh, a secluded tribe of ashcarii dragon riders. Choose a side and adventure deeper into the Wilds than ever before, battling (or fighting alongside) new creatures and mercenaries. This product will ship with Wave 2. Requires the Wild Assent Core Game only.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Wild Assent: Waterways of the Wilds
description: Waterways of the Wilds adds 28 new miniatures, including the massive XL Slithering Devourer and two new Assents/Seekers. It also adds a new double-sided gameboard with two different maps, each with their own terrain with unique effects.
