As per usual, there will be new scout cards, creature and wild creature cards, etc so the miniatures can be used in both the Hunt and Arena modes as well as new equipment pulled from the depths below. Wild Assent core game required.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Square Grid, Team-Based Game

name: Dome
description:
A cataclysm wiped out part of the global population and compelled all survivors to live hidden due to the harsh weather.

You are one of them and you heard some rumors about a dome build somewhere in the East. A place where you'll be able to start all over again and try to plant the seed for a new society.

Dome is a surviving deckbuilding game for 1 to 4 players in which every action you'll take will be critical. Your journey to Dome will be tough, whereas you'll try to find food, parrain new members for your crew or barter items for your survival.

Each player starts with the same deck. At your turn, you will play ALL your hand :

"Exploration" to reach Dome or send explorer to quest,
"Food" to cook skewered frogs,
"People" to use their special skill if you feed them, otherwise they will starve to death...
"Hope" to convince people to join your team or barter items.


When a player reach Dome or when three piles of cards are empty, the last turn occurs. The player with the most Influence Points on all the cards they acquired during the game wins.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Gladiators
description:
Now's your chance to compete against your favourite Gladiator, with this exciting new three dimensional, action-packed board game. This game enables you to recreate the Gladiators Arena in your very own home. With easy assembly instructions, each of the 7 events have been minituarised to recapture the spectacle, and of course glamour, that is The Gladiators!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling

name: アングレット (unGret)
description:
アングレット (unGret) is a 2 player card game from Japan. The publisher calls it 'psychological warfare' and 'mind-reading'. Each player has four cards numbered 1 to 4 and some markers. The players choose only card to go face-down. They must deduce which of their opponents cards is face-down and can spend markers to expose remaining hand cards. The game is balanced by the cost of markers against the chance of success.
user summary

name: Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Legends of the Sand
description:
Tiles of the Arabian Nights: Legends of the Sand is an exclusive expansion that was included with every pledge and won't be offered at retail.

Contents: Mythical Monsters set, Perils of the Desert set, Hero of the People set, The Grand Bastions set, Lost Treasures set, The Queen's Favour set, Mysterious Ruins set

It is uncertain if these were included in any of the copies that made it to retail in Europe after company bankruptcy.

name: Fix
description: Players are given dice with symbols and minus or plus points. The dice are rolled simultaneously. Whoever rolls a red emoji may place it in the center of the game (if there are not already 3). A die with a green emoji must be passed on to the next player. A round is over when there are 3 red emojis in the center. Then each player counts his current plus or minus points and gets paid chips accordingly. Otherwise, the players continue to roll the dice. Whoever has collected the most plus points after 7 rounds wins the game.

name: Bimbo ist entlaufen
description:
Bimbo the monkey starts on a black space on one narrow side of the game board. The two keepers start on two black spaces on the opposite side. The monkey moves diagonally forward or backward. The Keepers may only move diagonally forward.

To win the game, the monkey has to pass the keepers to escape. The keepers win, if they enclose the monkey, so it can't move anymore.

name: 札束と溶鉱炉 (Satsutaba to Youkouro)
description:
札束と溶鉱炉 (Satsutaba to Youkouro) is a 2 player bluffing card game from Japan. The players take two roles; one is building a road and the other is building on the road side. The designer likens the game to Skull. The game title translates as "Bankrolls and Blast Furnaces". The player who most recently fell into a blast furnace gets to go first.

One player arranges five good tiles (bankrolls) and one bad tile (a blast furnace) in a face-down line. The other player turns them over from left to right until they want to stop.

The turning player gets a point for each good tile they turned over, a bonus two points if they stopped just before the bad tile, and no points at all if they turned over the bad tile.

The placing player gets a point for each good tile they placed before the bad tile (i.e. each one that the turning player had an opportunity to take), plus a bonus two points if the turning player turned over the bad tile.

Swap places and do it again, do all of that three times with double points in the last round, whoever has the most points wins.
user summary

name: 七福廊 (Shichi Fukurou)
description:
七福廊 (Shichi Fukurou) is a 2 player card game from Japan. Players are trying to collect seven wise owls to win, or lose getting the five unhappy cats. The publisher says the English title is Seven Lucky Owls. The Japanese title is likely a reference to the Shichi Fukujin (七福神), the Seven Lucky Gods; replacing the word fukurou (梟; owl) with a clever combination of fuku (福; luck, fortune, blessing) + rou (廊; corridor, hall, tower).

Players choose two hand cards face-down and reveal them together. One gets to choose whether the high or low number will win, and the high card of that pair wins. That winner then gets to use the effect on their winning card.

Players build up a tableau of cards, and aim to get the seven different owls to win the game. Otherwise, they try to force the unhappy cats onto the opponent. If a player gets five cats, they lose.
user summary

Publisher's summary:
In this lightweight two-player set collection game, you win by collecting Seven Lucky Owls before the opponent. On the other hand, you lose if five or more Unlucky Cats gather in your hand. Each card with a character also has a number on it. The players take
turns to choose whether a higher- or lower-number card will win.

Following that, they each play one of the two cards from their hand face-down, and then flip to reveal them simultaneously. Compare the numbers on the cards, and the winner can use the effect of the card they played.

Some cards have effects such as reversing the numbers and achieving a come-from-behind victory. Who would manage to outwit their opponent to force Unlucky Cats onto them or collect Seven Lucky Owls?

相手より先に7種類のふくろう「七福廊」を集めましょう！手軽に遊べる２人用セットコレクションゲーム。プレイヤーは相手より先に７種類のふくろう「七福廊」を集めると勝ちとなります。反対に、不幸の猫「黒闇天」を５枚以上集めてしまうと負けてしまいます。
それぞれのキャラクターが描かれたカードには数字も書かれています。毎回片方のプレイヤーが、数字の大きい方が勝つか小さい方が勝つかを選択。お互い２枚の手札から１枚を勝負札として裏向きで場に出します。伏せたカードを同時にオープンし、大小比べに勝ったプレイヤーは、カードに書かれている効果を使うことができます。
カードの中には大小カードを反転する効果や大逆転が狙える効果のついたものもあります。
読み合いを制して「黒闇天」カードをうまく相手に押し付け、「七福廊」を早く集めるのはどちらのプレイヤーでしょうか？

name: ChooChoo Stories
description:
Memorize the terms that are placed face down one by one and count them out loud in the correct order. According to the principle -I pack my suitcase- is played here! Whoever is caught making a mistake gets the card. When a 'player has accumulated three cards, the game ends. The winner is the player who has accumulated the fewest cards.

Another variant: The players take turns to add a picture card and complete the story. The game ends when no more cards can be placed.

name: Hip Hop 5
description:
A classic in the red glitter dress that characterizes all games in this series. The title promises "Your first checkers game", the board is in checkerboard pattern with shamrocks and empty squares, the pieces are Mickey Mouse for one player and Donald Duck for the other. Movement rules are similar to those of checkers, but the goal is to be the first to get your pieces to the other side, with your opponent's pieces and the neutral frogs getting in the way.

—user summary
categories: Abstract Strategy, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: ペンタキューブマッチ (Penta Cube Match)
description:
ペンタキューブマッチ (Penta cube match) is a 2 player abstract game from Japan. Players are trying to fill a narrow space with pentacubes against the clock.

A pentacube is made from five cubes joined in various different patterns. There are two sets of matching cubes, one set for each player. At the beginning of the game, all the pentacubes are mixed up in a bag, and each player draws three. They take turns placing two of them on the board in any position, and keep the third as their hand.

The board is a simple 6*7 grid and the pentacubes must not go outside of the grid. Nor can they go any higher than two cubes.

The remaining cubes are tipped out in a pile, and players cannot touch them. One player starts and must pick a pentacube to place by sight alone in ten seconds, counted down by the opponent (who is allowed to count fast!). Once they have chosen their piece, they take it from the pile, and either place it or the hand pentacube, so that it fits on the board and goes no higher than 2 cubes.

Players alternate this way until one player can no longer place legally, and they lose.

The designer points out that players suffer in the back end of the game from poor choices made at the opening. Planning ahead is crucial to survival.
user summary
mechanics: Action Timer, Single Loser Game, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: ペンギンセンス (Penguin Sense)
description:
ペンギンセンス (Penguin Sense) is a push your luck game from Japan. As Emperor Penguins, players swim out to see in search of food for their young. But they risk being attacked by predators such as seals or orcos.

Each player takes turns to take a food chip, worth 1-4, and then flip the Sea Card underneath the chip. Each card shows some aspect of life at sea, some are good fortune, some are bad luck.

Players can choose when to give up feeding and return to shore, but they cannot go out again. The game ends when either all the penguins have gone back, or when a second orca appears, which means any penguin still at sea loses all their food.

Of the penguins that got back home, the one with the most food value is the winner.

The game cards includes information, so the game is good for educating children (who can read Japanese).
user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending

name: お元気ですか？～紫陽花祭り～ (How are you? ～Hydrangea Festival~)
description:
'お元気ですか？～紫陽花祭り～ (Ogenkidesuka? ~Ajisai Matsuri~) (How are you? ～Hydrangea Festival) is a 2 player postcard game from Japan. "お元気ですか？" How Are You? is the name of the series of postcards being introduced. Hydrangea Festival is the first game and was produced in memory of the designer's grandfather. It is sold with 3 postcards, so you can mail a copy of the game to somebody you miss.

In the game, players are trying to have raindrops fall onto the petal of the Hydrangeas to change their colours. The raindrops are pink or blue (the player's colours), and the flowers are pink or blue or purple.

The flowers change colour in sequence: pink, purple, blue. So a blue raindrop on a pink flower turns it purple, and another then turns it blue. A blue drop onto a blue flower locks the colour in place. The same works in reverse for pink drops.

Players take turns placing flowers in the garden, and then raindrops in the clouds. As the drops fall, the flowers change colour until the clouds have passed. Players win by having more flowers in their colour at the end.
user summary

name: Splicing
description:
Players will roll dice, gather resource cards, form dynamic alliances, and create trading strategies to learn mRNA splicing - a complex biological process in a board game. The player who gets 10 Protein cards first wins the game!

Easy to play! No prior knowledge is needed.

In every living organism, DNA carries the genetic information. DNA is first transcribed into mRNA in order to decode the genetic information. Then, mRNA is translated into proteins. The genetic information is often interrupted by "junk" fragments (introns) in higher organisms, such as humans. Therefore, the initial transcribed mRNA contains both genetic fragments (exons) and "junk" fragments. Introns should be removed and exons should be joined in a process called mRNA splicing. ​The splicing mechanism was awarded the 1993 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Role Playing, Set Collection, Trading

name: Honour and Arms
description:
Honour and Arms is a fantasy adventure game played on a map of a small unnamed region. Each player controls a character; there are 16 characters supplied, differentiated by their values in six different traits, their special abilities, and their alignments.

On a turn a player rolls a die for their number of movement points and then moves from space to space on the map. In each new space a die is rolled to determine how many (if any) encounter cards need to be drawn. Encounters may be items which can be taken or may be beings which can be fought or bargained with, or in some cases taken on as minions. Fighting provide experience, either physical or psychic, and when a character has three experience of a type they must turn them in for increases in traits.

There are a number of fixed locations on the board with special rules in a separate adventure booklet, and in some cases special decks of encounter cards. There are also minor locations which have cards in the standard decks and are placed on the board once found.

There are rules for encumbrance, player vs. player combat, healing, etc. Players may band together as a group. Some activities are regulated by alignment, of which there are two kinds: good vs. evil and imperial vs. rebel. For example, good characters can't attack without provocation.

There are several ways to win the game, all dependent on alignment. For example, a good character can achieve a spiritual victory by entering the Nether Realm and defeating the Prince of Darkness, while a rebel character can achieve a political victory by finding the king in his keep and defeating him. Some ways require finding the five rings forming the Hand of Fate, but if a character wears all of them at once they may become bewitched by them, in which case they get special powers but then can only win by killing all the other characters. The rules suggest that for a shorter game a time limit is set and then if no one has achieved a victory condition, a scoring rubric is provided.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: 私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 (Pun University)
description:
私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 (Shiritsu goro gō wase daigaku) (Pun University) is a party game from Japan. 私立ゴロ合ワセ大学 translates as Private Goro Goiwase University. Players are trying to pass the university entrance exam, which requires making witty puns.

Players take turns to be the examiner and select a topic from two cards. Once declared, the players write puns on their whiteboards, and get a few seconds more after one player stops.

The puns are read out, and the players award points to the best.

Then the examiner asks questions. Players have to pass the exam questions using the puns read out.

After a few rounds, the player with the most points is the winner.

This game is the second in a series of 'Nappy' games by the publisher.
user summary

name: 12星座のガールズギターリフダービー (The 12 Zodiac Signs Girls Guitar Riff Derby)
description:
12星座のガールズギターリフダービー (The 12 Zodiac Signs Girls Guitar Riff Derby) is a card game from Japan. The publisher says "A music competition for primary school children, with no psychological warfare. Let's get into the rock swamp!

The game is a tournament between 8 high school girls chosen from the 12 signs of the Zodiac. You might think that this is a beauty contest or a story about a prince who wants to become a princess, but it's not. It's a battle of rock guitar riffs.

The game is short and minimalistic, so all but the finals are decided in a "rock-paper-scissors" kind of way, with lots of draws. Until the final, you may not reveal which girl you are favouring.

In the final, you will have to play the Do-Re-Mi... on the card as if it were a guitar riff battle. （The final is a guitar riff competition. (The author has arranged the music, but there is no stave, so you will have to make corrections and add any missing notes.)

The game is very light and quick to play. Recommended for primary schools children. You can also play "Horoscope Detective Michika" using the same 16 cards to guess your opponent's 12 signs of the zodiac.

心理戦とか無い(精神年齢)小学生向き音楽系勝ち抜き戦。ロック沼にはめよう

この「12星座のガールズギターリフダービー」も12星座から選ばれた８人の少女によるトーナメント戦です。
少女たちによる対戦なので美人コンテストや王子様のプリンセス目指す話でしょと思われるかもしれませんが違います。ロックのギターリフを競う戦いとなります。
短時間でゲームが終わるミニマムゲームのため決勝以外は「引き分け多めのジャンケン」のような方法で勝負が決まります。決勝までどの少女を推してるか伏せても構いません。
決勝ではカードに記しているドレミ…をギターリフ合戦を繰り広げるように競います。（作者が編曲していますが五線譜がないので補正したり足りない音があれば加えたりしなければなりません⁈ヒントはその少女がリスペクトしているミュージシャンです）。
とても軽くスカッとプレイするゲームです。精神年齢小学生におススメです。
［同じカード16枚使って、相手の12星座を当てる「星占い探偵ミチカ」もプレイできます］
publisher's summary
categories: Card Game, Deduction, Fantasy, Music, Party Game
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Singing

name: VICKE
description:
VICKE is an abstract game where each player has a ship, sailing the seas, looking for the two islands of their opponent's that are hiding treasure.

On a player's turn, they can choose from three basic actions (or pass), and have an additional action if they choose. The basic actions involve sailing their ship, creating a route, or checking for treasure. The additional action allows a player to move their ship along the route they have created.

Players alternate turns until a player has discovered both of their opponent's treasures; the discovering player wins.
publishers: Peanuts Design (ピーナツデザイン)

name: Doctor Quack: The Game of Pills and Ills
description:
"In a little village in Fairy Tale Land, there lived a friendly old doctor, who all his life wanted nothing more than to help people. Whenever a call came in, he grabbed his bag and rushed to the patient's bedside. Very often, however, he found that in his haste, he had brought the wrong cure. But did that stop him? No, he tried anyway, and, funny as it may seem, his patients would always get well."

Players each choose a color of playing piece, and place them on Doctor Quack's house in the center of the playing board, to start. Each player draws one Cure Card. Players spin to see who goes first.

In order to reach the different cases, players take turns spinning and moving their playing piece along a path of their choice. When they land on a case space, they can check to see if they have the matching Cure Card for that case. If they don't, they can either keep moving on subsequent turns to try to find and reach the matching case, or they can make their way back to Dr. Quack's house to pick up another cure. The other way to get an additional Cure Card is to spin a 6, 9, or 10 - then you can choose to take a card instead of moving that turn.

Once a player makes a cure match, they collect that case card, which indicates a number of points on it. When all cases have been cured, the player with the most total points wins.

name: Raus
description: Each player has to move his 4 meeples along the track to the spaces of his own color to win the game. The players take turns to throw die die and move a meeple accordingly. If a meeple gets on a space occupied by the meeple of another player, the latter is thrown out and has to start again. There are also spaces from where the meeples jump many spaces ahead like in Snakes and Ladders, so from space 32 to space 82 or from space 166 to 204. In the game for 6 players the blue corner spaces allow an extra move forward.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: El Turista
description:
El Turista is a game published by Botella Roja in conjunction with the municipality of Catamarca Capital, the game was born by an initiative for cultural activities where we have to reach the tourist spots of this province.

For this we will use our Kilometers cards to cover the necessary distance, but beware that other tourists can prevent us from reaching our destinations with cards of adversity. The first tourist to reach 20 victory points is the winner!

name: Constelaciones
description:
In Constelaciones, we have to get on our space rocket and navigate the universe to complete our mission to get the stars and form our constellation.

In a 20x20 grid, stars and comets will be randomly placed. Each player will have a mission to visit 3 numbered stars.

On the first turn, players will take 2 Movement cards, and in each following turn, just one Movement card (that define direction and distance) and select one from their hand for their movement. They will try to get to their stars and mark them as visited. They can also collect comets, and when 3 comets have been collected, they can exchange them by a Special card ,which have a power that can be used.

The first player to complete their constellation mission, visiting the 3 stars, wins.
mechanics: Hand Management, Movement Points, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Das Kali-Spiel der Heinzelmännchen von der Saat zur Ernte!
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. Artwork features gnomes/brownies and landing on those gnome spaces trigger events. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 75 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose coins. The theme of the game is using potash from seed to harvest.

Company rename to Salzdetfurth AG in 1937. Artwork style places this pre-1940.
mechanics: Action/Event, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Escape Team: Mission 6 – Cruise Ship
description: Mission 6: Oh no! The blackmailer has taken over a cruise ship! It is on collision course with the harbour - we must stop it!

name: Escape Team: Mission 7 – Prison
description: Mission 7: This time, the blackmailer has hacked into the local prison‘s computer system. He threatens to unlock all the cells in the high-security wing – that is something we must prevent at all cost!

name: Escape Team: Mission 8 – Bus
description: Mission 8: The blackmailer has taken control of a bus – and he is steadily accelerating it! Hurry up and end this madness – the people in the bus are counting on you!

name: Escape Team: Mission 9 – Bank
description: Mission 9: This time, he managed to hack the computer system of the national bank – the money of our nation is at stake. Let‘s hope this ends well.

name: Swordmaster Ys Sugoroku
description:
Ys Sugoroku was originally published in 月刊コミックコンプ　published on May 20th, 1991. It is obviously based on the Ys video game series, but in this case derives all of its art from the late 80s/early 90s manga by Hagoromo Shō.

To play the game, you roll the dice and move your token. The first to defeat the boss at the end of the board wins.

Certain tiles along the way to the end have special directions that must be followed should you land there.

Only the board and rules were provided. User must provide dice and tokens.

name: IQ ringas: Nr. 3
description:
Card game IQ Ring: No. 3 is an educational question-and-answer game. The game consists of a set of 90 cards with questions, 14 special cards to track the score, 4 player figures, 6 surprise cards and an answer book. Each question card contains 3 questions of different difficulty. The first question is worth 1 point, the second 2 points and the third 3 points.
The game progresses in a clockwise direction. First, the question and surprise cards are shuffled into one deck. The player on the left then draws the card. If it is a question card - the player chooses one of the 3 questions and tries to answer it. If the answer is correct, the player goes as far as the question was worth. If incorrect, stay standing or go back if indicated on a special card. If the surprise card is pulled out, what is written on it is executed. The winner is the one who first scores 14 points.
This game can be expanded with IQ Ring: No. 1 and IQ Ring: No. 2 cards.

Kortelių žaidimas "IQ ringas: Nr. 3" – tai lavinamasis edukacinis klausimų ir atsakymų žaidimas. Žaidimą sudaro 90 kortelių rinkinys su klausimais, 14 specialiųjų kortelių skirtų rezultatui sekti, 4 žaidėjų figūrėlės, 6 netikėtumo kortelės ir atsakymų knygelė. Kiekvienoje klausimų kortelėje yra po 3 skirtingo sudėtingumo klausimus. Pirmas klausimas vertas 1 taško, antras – 2, trečias – 3 taškų.
Žaidimo eiga vyksta laikrodžio rodyklės kryptimi. Pirmiausia yra sumaišomos klausimų ir netikėtumo kortelės į vieną kaladę. Tuomet kairėje esantis žaidėjas traukia kortelę. Jei tai klausimų kortelė - žaidžiantysis pasirenka vieną iš 3 klausimų ir bando į jį atsakyti. Jei atsakymas teisingas, žaidėjas paeina tiek, kiek vertas buvo klausimas. Jei neteisingas, lieka stovėti vietoje arba eina atgal jei taip yra nurodyta specialioje kortelėje. Jei yra ištraukiama netikėtumo kortelė, vykdoma tai, kas joje parašyta. Laimi tas, kuris greičiausiai surenka 14 taškų.
Šį žaidimą galima praplėsti su "IQ ringas: Nr. 1" ir "IQ ringas: Nr. 2" kortomis.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: クリスタルと商人 (Crystals and Merchants)
description:
A storytelling based game wherein an adventurer attempts to sell items to a merchant.

The adventurer comes up with a backstory for the item, then the merchant must add onto it while attempting to bargain the price down.

If a player fails to come up with something to add onto the story or notices a contradiction in the opponent's story, the game is over and the prevailing side wins.

name: Player of the Game Tennis
description:
Player of the Game Tennis is much like our other games in the Player of the Game lineup. It plays rapidly, but offers enough detail and action to give you the story of the match.

In Player of the Game Tennis, each player is individually rated for their service game both first serves and second serves; their complete ability when receiving (again how they handle the opponent's first serve or second serve); ability to hit game winners or game losers in some cases. Other factors, like a player's fitness, whether he is a favorite, ability to handle adversity, major and minor injuries are all included. Did we mention that all of the factors above are broken down by playing surface? All aspects of a tennis match are covered.

Player of the Game is easy to learn and easy to understand. You'll be playing in no time. Each match will unfold in front of your eyes at a brisk pace. A full match in Player of the Game tennis take no longer than 10 minutes. Most matches will be completed in 5 minutes!

The base game includes a fictional Men's Tour and a fictional Women's Tour with complete schedules, prize money, a points system, and even tournament brackets. Everything needed to play is included in the base game.

If you want to add real players, you can purchase any of our season year books.

If your favorite player isn't rated (which isn't likely), we give you a method to put them in the game!

The Printed game features all players on die-cut cards printed in vivid color.

Step on the court today, it is all Aces with Player of the Game Tennis!

—description from the designer

name: Mascara
description:
Who's behind the mask? A mystery game for 2 players. Choose whether you want to be the detective or join the criminal Red Circle.

The Hideaway
The Masked Man chooses where to hide on the game board and covertly writes down the corresponding letter on the sheet of paper.

This is the Masked Man’s hideaway. The Detective mustn't see this letter.

The Investigation
The Detective begins his search for the Masked Man by taking a coin from the Coin Reserve Zone and placing it on a free corner of the game board.

The Masked Man treats this coin move as an enquiry.
He answers yes if he is hiding in any of the squares adjacent to where the coin has been placed. Only squares directly touching the coin square count (not diagonal squares).

He answers no if the coin has been placed beyond those squares OR if the Detective has placed the coin directly on his hideaway.

The Detective moves the coin to a free square adjacent to the current square - including diagonally - and proceeds to repeat his enquiry.

The Raid
After a total of three enquiries, it is time for The Detective to make a raid. The Detective says in which square he thinks the Masked Man is hiding.
The Masked Man then reveals the letter he wrote on the sheet - thereby identifying his hideout.

If the Detective is correct then he WINS the round and places the coin face down in
the square with the Masked Man’s hideout.
If the Detective is wrong then the Masked Man WINS the round and puts the coin in the Masked Coin Area.

The first player to win three coins wins the game.

The game is presented on a vinyl 7" gatefold sleeve including a record produced by Timothy J Fairplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Video Buzzer
description:
Trivia Buzzer game, with an LCD screen, in which luck and good judgement also matter!

It includes 2 modes of difficulty, one for children and one for the whole family.

In your turn, you move your pawn on the board, answering questions to gather points. On special squares, everyone can bet on whether the active player will answer correctly, to win some extra points. Race first your pawn to the finish line and be the player with the most points to win the game!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Victory Points, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Timefold
description:
Timefold is a trick taking card game played in teams of two. Each round, the players have to predict the exact number of tricks they will win.

Players know their own cards and those of their teammate.

A correct prediction or „bid“ earns points. The team with the most points at the end of eight rounds of play wins the game.

Each player also has a unique set of abilities, that can be used to temporarily change the rules of play.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Memory, Predictive Bid, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Einfach klasse in Mathematik-DUDEN 2010
description:
4 games for the first handling of numbers are offered in this collection for the pupils of the 1st and 2nd grade elementary school.

Card pairs trains memory and continuous counting, you uncover pairs of cards with the same value or the same number or the same number and write down the value of two pairs found in several scores, who has the highest sum at the end, wins.

Fast task rotation poses arithmetic tasks with the help of the rotating arrow, first number tiles are uncovered, with which then the task is to be solved, who achieves the highest sum from two of three results, wins.

Arithmetic Quiz requires solving arithmetic problems in two difficulty levels for first and second grade.

Shape Puzzles provides a first look at geometric shapes and how they interact for larger and other shapes by laying shapes analogous to Tangram. The laying puzzles give the new shape and the number of pieces given for it, while the corner puzzles give the pieces needed and the number of corners the new figure must have.

name: The Doomsday Project: Episode 3 – The Battle for the North
description:
This game combines with the Battle for Germany game and the Battle for the Balkans game to cover the entire European Front in a hypothetical World War Three in 1985.

The game will add additional rules, which can be retrofitted in the previous games, for naval warfare.

Norway, Sweden, and Finland will be covered showing the Warsaw Pact attack on these countries. Denmark's role will be expanded.

—description from the designer

name: Blanc-manger Coco: La Culture G
description: The seventh expansion for Blanc-manger Coco, 200 cultivation-themed cards, for grown-ups, bodybuilders, for everyone indeed.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Word Game

name: Bible "Trivia": Authorized Supplement
description: Authorized supplement to the original Bible "Trivia" game (1984), "the game where trivia is not trivial". Provides 2,100 new and challenging questions from the King James Version of the Bible, with some additional questions of Biblical significance.
categories: Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Religious, Trivia

name: Gärtner und Schnecke
description:
The gardener and the snail start at their houses near space 1. The players roll a die and move their pieces accordingly. The first to get to the cabbage (between the spaces 29) takes the cabbage and tries to get it into his house. If the other player gets on the same space as the one with the cabbage, he steals it . At space 13 the players may change tracks. The player who gets the cabbage into his own house wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wer jagt wen?
description:
The players (cat and mouse) take turns to place a tile showing their animal on the game board. If cats or mice are enclosed by the other, they get flipped over to change from mice to cats or vice versa. When all spaces are covered, the player whose animal has the majority wins the game.

—user summary

name: Galactic Battle Game
description:
A simple multiplayer game where you select pieces to move a spring loaded bar.

Selecting the right piece so that the bar does not move is key to victory and each piece has a different hidden point value.

The game is quite luck driven and plays in 5-10 minutes
Tagline "choose carefully or the enemy will strike"

name: Kobold-Kämpfe
description: The players start at the lowest opposite spaces of the climbing frame and take turns rolling the die and move their meeple (only on the red part of the climbing frame). If a player can't move the rolled number of spaces forward, because he is blocked by the opposite player, he has to move backwards. If a player is forced to move back to his starting space he has lost the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Tug of War

name: Sechs Schlösser im Schloss
description:
The players start at the lower right corner of the game board and have to reach the treasure chamber at the end of the track. They take turns to roll the die and move their pawn accordingly. If a player reaches the space in front of a door, he has to use the special die to roll the key he needs to open the door. If he rolls a ghost he may pass the door without the key. The first player to reach the door of the treasure chamber and rolls the needed key wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Äpfel pflücken
description:
At the beginning of the game all spaces on the tree are covered with an apple token. The players put their meeple on their starting space at the fruit basket und take turns to roll the die and move their meeple. If a meeple gets on a space with an apple, the player puts the apple inside his basket. If a meeple gets on a space on the tree with is already occupied by the opposite meeple, the later has to start anew from his starting space.

When all apples are plucked, the player with the most apples in his basket wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: Pisa Fondo
description:
A persecution game of cops against truck drivers.

You are a "red skin" in your "car", running on the asphalt, trying to be the first to go around the board.

In other words ... you are a driver (red skin) trying to be the first player to get a complete lap of the board to your starting point ... but you have to be careful ... two police cars (pale faces) and a helicopter (iron bird) are waiting to catch you speeding.

name: Rallye World
description:
Run your adventure against wind and breakdown.

Rallye World is a game for reckless motorists, in which 2-8 players can participate.

The atmospheric situation and the multiple breakdowns that can occur to you during the tour, will make you an intrepid driver.

In the face of adversity, you will always have the invaluable help of your assistance truck, in which the best mechanics will get your car ready.

Your decisions made at the right moment will make ingenuity defeat mechanics.

You will drive your "car" from the high peaks of Europe to the most inhospitable desert in the world, where solitude will be your only company.

You are facing a real challenge, a true five-star adventure in your living room.

For you who are determined, sagacious and intelligent this game is made. Dare yourself!

name: Sadie Cat: Cook Out
description:
Sadie Cat and Mao are out in the forest for the night and need to get some food in their stomachs. Sadie Cat sends Mao out to get some supplies, but he comes back with more than just ingredients. Now Sadie Cat is on the hook to feed a bunch of mouths and the sun is going down fast. How much food can she make in time?

What is Sadie Cat: Cook Out?

Sadie Cat: Cook Out is a dice rolling and matching game by Alexander Shen. Players roll numerous d6 and match them to the recipes that she knows. Each recipe takes a certain amount of time to cook and there is a limited amount of time left.

Do you like dice games? Do you like the puzzle-y bits of figuring out how to maximize your score? If you do, definitely give Sadie Cat: Cook Out a try!

—description form the designer

name: Monster Healer Solo IIDX
description:
In the past monster hunters were needed to control the outbreak of certain monsters in the area or ones that cause direct danger to our local communities, but these needs have decreased and have no longer been an issue for a very long time. Instead, there has been a recent increase of rogue monster hunters running around in the wildlands, slaying them for no reason other than for sport. It is my job to save these innocent monsters, bring them back to health, and reunite them with their packs. It requires luck. It requires traps constructed from what nature can provide to subdue the monsters for treatment. It’s a dangerous job, but it needs to be done.

Monster Healer Solo IIDX is a print-and-play dice game that has you doing your best to subdue a hurt monster so you can perform your doctorly duties to save it. Two monsters included in this version!

Basic Gameplay

You roll your trap dice and assign them to the traps required to stop the monster. When the monster takes its action, it may do damage to you (saving monsters is a tough business) or even shake off the traps.

Full Rules

Setup

Print out the Monster Healer Solo IIDX Demo game sheet.
Give yourself 5x 6-sided dice and place in the Unused Dice pool
Give yourself 3x Life Tokens
Give the monster 1x 6-sided die
Player goes first
Phases

Refresh Dice
Player Actions (2)
Monster Action
Refresh Dice

Move all dice from the Used Dice pool to the Unused Dice pool.

Player Action

Player chooses to perform any two of these actions (player may choose to do the same action twice):

Roll Any Unused Dice
Player may reroll any number of dice from the Unused Dice in their dice pool.
Remove Trap (1)
Player removes a single Trap die from the monster and adds it to the Used Dice pool.
Assign Trap (1)
Player assigns a single Trap die from the Unused Dice pool and adds it to an open matching Trap space on the monster.
Use a Player Power
Player selects all required dice from the Unused Dice pool to use a power. Place these dice into the Used Dice pool.
Monster Action

Roll 1d6 for the monster.
Perform the action associated with the result on the monster card.
Game End

The game ends as soon as the player has lost all of their Life Tokens or if all the Trap spaces on the monster card are filled.

—description from the designer

name: Skulls and Pumpkins
description:
It’s that spooky time of year again where skulls and pumpkins are around every corner! Do you have what it takes to to be crowned Halloween Royalty?

Winning the Game

First player to win 5 rounds will be crowned Halloween Royalty! In the case where a player is unable to win 5 rounds, the player with the most rounds won will be crowned Defacto Halloween Royalty! If the game is still a tie, then it's a tie and both players turn into candy corn.

How to Play

Each player chooses one card and places it face down in front of them.
Each player reveals the card at the same time.
The player with the winning card wins the round.
Discard the played cards in their own respective discard piles face up, one for each player.

The Winning Card

If the cards share the same suit (i.e. skull vs skull or pumpkin vs pumpkin), the highest card wins.
If the cards are of different suits, the lowest card wins.
If the cards are the same, the round is a draw. Discard these cards.

—description from the designer

name: Pet shop
description:
In the Pet Shop you have your own pet store, where you have to buy and sell animals and food. Decorate the store, by placing the animals you have for sale on your player board, and have customers visit. ​Who first earns enough money to buy the white, coveted cockatoo and earns $ 1,000.00?

Players buy animals and food, and each round a customer for each player is drawn from a deck of cards, the customer will buy a specific animal or set of animals. If the player have those for sale, they will earn money. After each round players get to restock with the money they earn. Eventually earning enough money to buy the Cockatoo - and be ready for the final sale when the right customer wants to buy, and thus winning the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Tramvaj 1910
description:
The family board game Tram 1910 entertainingly presents the operation of a tram line in a small town. Your task will be to pass all the stations, get promotion cards and become the stationmaster before your opponent.

The game starts with the player who rolled the highest number of points in the shootout. He rolls the dice and advances his piece by the die roll number of points, except that he rolls on die number 6, see DICE ROLLING - special rolls at the end of the rules.

A player leaves the DEPO station in two in two arbitrary directions until the final stations in one direction - 11 Nadrazi; in the other direction - 1 Bielska Street.

The game is won by the player who completes both challenges first - namely, checking off the following tasks in sequence all 11 tram stops and collects 6 bonus cards (M). This will the stationmaster. However, the remaining players can not have to finish the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Le jeu de l'oie de Cornebidouille
description:
"If you don't eat your soup, I'll eat your blankie!"
Be careful, Cornebidouille is determined to swallow you raw!
We will have to travel the board as quickly as possible and thwart the traps set by Cornebidouille. Can you perform the mimes and the challenges launched by the famous witch?

name: Promises, Promises
description: A bitter tribute to the perceived injustice of the James Bay Treaty #9, move across local landmarks answering trivia to collect three red, yellow and blue tokens to win this indigenous game.
publishers: Ojibwe and Cree Cultural Centre of Timmins

name: Hul'qumi'num Treaty Group Game
description: Moving from village to village in British Columbia, players engage in both trivia and negotiation to try and secure a treaty with both provincial and federal branches of government.

name: Raju
description:
The Dragon God of the Eclipse, Raju, has cultivated and collected Arkonite gems for billions of years, giving it its ancient energy and power. Anyone who dares to challenge him to remove the gems ends up wishing they hadn't tried.

But, now, a group of Heroes are ready to enter and appropriate his priceless treasure. So much so that, blinded by greed, all champions will do whatever it takes to get the best cut. Get the highest number of victory points with the Arkonites collected and stored in the coffers of your kingdom. Each color of Arkonite has a different value. The player with the highest score wins the game.

During each round of Raju, two Arkonites are drawn from Raju's cave (from his cloth bag) and the die is rolled to see if the night and day champion cards are empowered or if, on the contrary, there is an eclipse and all champions develop your skills during this round.

Each opponent plays a Master card (secretly or not, depending on the previous roll of the die) in their own play area. Whoever has the highest card number wins the round and takes the Raju treasure drawn at the beginning of the round.

This mechanic is repeated over 9 rounds where, depending on how you have played your cards taking into account what you think others are going to play, you will or will not be the winner.

Depending on the game mode, up to 3 games can be chained together without revealing the loot achieved. Which makes it very interesting due to the great variety of Arkonites included in the game and of different value.

—description from the publisher

name: 共鳴する六芒星の輪舞曲 (Resonating Hexagram Rondo)
description:
共鳴する六芒星の輪舞曲 (Kyomesuru Rokuboseino Rondo) (Resonating Hexagram Rondo) is a game from Japan. Players hold their own rondel and use it and their cards to battle with magic. The game has 10 magical characters; each is unique and fun with different attributes and activation abilities. Even if a character dies, they can still win the game through Resurrection.

The publisher says:
Hold the hexagram tiles directly in your hands and chant spells! A magical battle for your heart!
Which of the six different spellbook cards will you use? You make an agonizing choice and raise your hexagram. You chant your spell in high spirits...!

The game has an unusual butting system: if your moves are read by other players, your attacks will be less effective and your opponent will gain Magic Points. It's not enough to be good at the game to win, you have to be able to play the tense game.

The magic battles are fast and thrilling, and can be settled in 20-30 minutes. But it's not the end of the world if you die - there is a resurrection element. You never know who will emerge victorious.

With multiple tactical cards, 10 different characters, 6 different attributes, 3 types of abnormalities, and the rare "Divine Awakening" ability, there's plenty to do! Let's go back to your childhood and enjoy the battle!

六芒星タイルを直接手に持ち呪文を詠唱！厨二心をくすぐる魔法バトル！
６種類の魔法書カードのどれを使用するか。悩ましい選択をし、あなたは六芒星を掲げる。
あなたは呪文を高らかに詠唱した…！

他のプレイヤーに動きが読まれてしまうと攻撃の効果が弱まったり、相手にMPを獲得されたりするという変則的なバッティングシステムを導入。
ゲームにうまいだけでは勝てない、ヒリヒリとした駆け引きの応酬。

20～30分でスピーディーにスリリングに決着をつける魔法バトル。
でもよくありがちな”死んだら終わり”ではなく、復活要素もあり。最後まで誰が勝利を手にするかわからない。

複数の戦術カードやバラエティに富んだ10種類のキャラクター、6種類の属性、3種類の状態異常にレアなメリット能力「神気覚醒」など、やり込み度も十分！
童心に返ってガチンコバトルを楽しもう♪
publisher's summary

name: ホメタリーディスラレタリー (Hometarī Disuraretarī)
description:
ホメタリーディスラレタリー (Hometarī Disuraretarī) is a word party game from Japan. Players talk about things in either complimentary or insulting fashion. The players are trying to create new ways of describing something to either promote or denigrate the item, and develop their own vocabulary as they go.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Naturafarm
description:
Each player has a farm that they must manage by offering their animals the best conditions of life. The meadow must be large enough for the animals to freely frolic in the open air, and food and straw for litter must be provided, including making up for unexpected events. Fully satisfied animals will earn points, and in time they are harvested for meat. Players may invite each other to the restaurant, and if a player's meat is served they will benefit further. Whoever manages their farm in the most respectful way for animals comes closest to victory...

—description from the publisher (translated)

name: Brilliant or BS?: Brilliant and Black Expansion Pack
description:
Flex on your friends or finesse your way to victory with this expansion pack that celebrates Black culture. Mix these questions into your copy of Brilliant or BS? First Edition to level up your game night.

Contents: 54 trivia questions to add to your deck.

name: Brilliant Or BS?: NSFW Expansion Pack
description:
Put the kids and grandparents to bed before breaking out this expansion pack. Things are about to get spicy! Mix these questions into your copy of Brilliant or BS? First Edition for some R-rated fun.

Contents: 54 trivia questions to add to your deck.

name: Brilliant or BS?: Fresh BS Expansion Pack #1
description:
Get excited! This expansion pack has more of the family-friendly trivia you love. Mix these questions into your copy of Brilliant or BS? First Edition to keep the BS going.

Contents: 54 trivia questions to add to your deck.

name: 私勇者だけど、美味しいとこだけかっさらいたい (Watashi yusha dakedo oishii tokodake kassaraitai)
description:
私勇者だけど、美味しいとこだけかっさらいたい(Watashi yusha dakedo oishii tokodake kassaraitai) (Despite of being a hero, I wanna just enjoy the sweetest reward lazily.) is a game from Japan. The game is intended to play with the idea that not all heroes are heroic. The designer's blurb is 勇者だからってまじめにまおう倒しにいくと思ってますか？ (Yūshadakara tte majime ni maou taoshi ni iku to omottemasu ka?) (Are you expecting me to defeat the demon lord just because I’m a hero?) or (Do you seriously think you are going to defeat the Devil King just because you are brave?), emphasising the counter-play tone of the game.

Players are trying to reach a central castle and defeat the Demon King (Maou 魔王 is a generic fantasy term for the/a devil king or demon lord). They can be aided in their quest by Jewel Fairies. There are six player characters drawn from who have different weapons, but each character also has some trouble. The winner is not the player who reaches Maou first, but second, and helps defeat Maou.

As the players progress along the path, they play mini-games which serve as training for the main game. Each player is trying to move themselves forward, but keep moving other players forward too, so that they get to arrive second after another player.

The game has various decks of adventure stories, so there is variety as you play it over again.
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Las Carabelas de Colón
description:
An old Argentinian Game of Goose style game, according to where a player falls, moves forward or backward, pulls back, etc. until reaching the final position of the track. It is based and tells the story of the Columbus' journey to America.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Sankt Martin Laternenspiel
description: The game consists of 14 lantern cards, 9 event and solution cards each, and 4 luck cards. The lantern cards and solution cards are distributed to all players with their backs facing up. A face-down pile is formed from the event cards and luck cards. One card is drawn from this pile at a time. Whoever draws a lucky card may turn over a lantern card, which now shows the lantern light. If an event card is drawn, you need the matching solution card to reveal a lantern. You point to one of the face-down solution cards, this is temporarily turned over. In the case of 2 events (wind and rain), even a lantern that is already lit is extinguished if you do not find the matching solution card. If the players manage to light all the lanterns, they win the game, otherwise they lose together.

name: El Linyera
description:
1940's Argentinian game.

Players will roll the dice, acquiring and paying jobs to others. The player who cannot afford the payments is out of the game. The winner is the one who has eliminated his opponents.

—user summary
mechanics: Income, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Clave
description:
Each player will receive a 6x5 square grid with CLAVE on the top row, a 0 on the center, and numbers on the other cells. Each turn, a CLAVE die a two d6 dice are rolled, and players can mark the combination of letter and sum of both d6 dice. If CLAVE is rolled on the letter die, players can choose the letter. First player to fill a row, a column or diagonal with 5 pieces, wins.

—user summary

name: La Cuadrera
description: An Argentinian horse racing game.

name: ¡Pum... Gool!
description:
¡Pum... Gool! is an old Argentinian football game, where two teams (players) will throw their dice alternatively (one with even numbers and the other with odd numbers) and move the ball in the grid between the different soccer player and field positions (goal, sides, end line).

The game is played to a agreed time in two halves. At the end of play time, the player with most goals wins.

—user summary

name: Juego de Policía y Ladrón
description:
1940's Argentinian game.

In Police and Thief you have your thief character and you move him to the banks / post office to rob. Then you must return to your lair before you are captured by the player who is driving the policemen.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: 30秒でナンパしな！ (30byou de nanpa shina!)
description:
30秒でナンパしな！ (30byou de nanpa shina!) is an adult themed part game from Japan. Players must use three words from the deck as part of an instant pick-up line. Come up with the best line to win each round.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: One Night Queen
description:
One Night Queen is an adult-themed card game from Japan. Players are women looking to pick up attractive men on the bar scene. They bid to get the best dates using their 'pride'. Players failing to get their man lose pride, and the date goes to the woman playing the best role.

The deck features a variety of men rated 1-5 hearts or a diamond, each with text in Japanese. The publisher says it is "anomalous poker betting with lady's pride".
user summary

name: Flota Mercante
description:
1940's Argentinian game.

Each player must navigate from Buenos Aires to Las Palmas, choosing the route: Orient to India, or Occident to England and North America, going back by the Pacific.

Each turn, players will throw the dice and advance as many squares as dice points. When a port is reached, a Knowledge card is drawn with some effects (earn money). When a red spot is reached, an Event card is drawn, and its effects take place. Black spots mark the entry to a port, and to reach them a exact roll is required.

When all players return to Buenos Aires, money is awarded according to the arrival order, and the player with most money wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Farándula
description: Old Argentinian game.

name: Guess猥談 (Guess Dirty Talk)
description:
Guess猥談 (Guess Waidan) (Guess Dirty Talk) is an adult-themed party game from Japan. Players recount true tales or fantasies based upon the themes on the cards. Points are scored if the listeners can guess the theme based on the tale, and for telling the best stories. The game is intended to be played while drinking, to swap dirty stories for amusement.
user summary
categories: Card Game, Humor, Party Game, Word Game

name: Have at You!
description:
Have at You! is a quick-playing card game about hand-to-hand combat during the 16th to 18th Centuries, as inspired by films such as the Errol Flynn classics of the 1940s as well as the more recent Pirates of the Carribean series. Each player takes the role of fighters who can get their hands on any weapons available to defeat the enemy. Each fighter has a fixed number of physical damage points that, once expended, result in his or her death.

In the base set, combat takes place aboard a ship, with the kind of weaponry available that one might expect: Daggers, Cutlasses, Belaying Pins, Pikes, Pistols, Grappling Hooks, and the occasional Bottle of Rum. Future expansions will explore other locations, such as Taverns and Encampments.

Play follows a basic rock-paper-scissors mechanic of taking actions when available and trying to avoid their cancellation through the opponent's play of reaction cards. But be careful! Every action causes fatigue, with nastier weapons causing more of it. As fighters get tired, fatigue turns to physical damage, so a player must balance the health of their own fighter while trying to take down the enemy.

There are several ways to play the game. At the most basic is a "duel" where a player wins once his or her opponent goes down. "Brawls" can also be played, where the death of an opponent "spawns" a new enemy, so victory is dependent upon the number of fighters eliminated on both sides. This base set also supports up to four players, so teams can fight against each other, while assisting teammates.

The base set includes over 140 "mini-cards" that can be self-printed along with the other tracks necessary to play. There is also an option to have the mini-cards professionally published at a reasonable cost. All of the components were designed to fit within a "video tape box."

NOTE: The "Card(s)" option does not include the rules and charts needed for play. If you want the cards and the rest of the game, make sure to select the PDF+Card(s) option.

Come test your mettle on the high seas with Have at You!

-description from designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Pike and Shot, Pirates
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simulation

name: Mask Village Poker
description:
You are the Mayor of your village. You want it to grow and attract more villagers. Fortunately, there are many applicants to join the village. That’s fine!
But, as well as people, there are animals, and supernatural creatures and all sorts applying. Foxes, Spirits, Werewolves, oh lots of strangeness!
No problem! Do your best to expand your village.

The players draw one card, and choose one of the follows.
1. You take it for the scoring.
2. You pass it to the left player.

In the round, the players plays until 3 card for you, 3 card for the left player.

Then, it's the next phase "Action phase".
Some cards have the ability for action with the number.
The number is called, and the player with the card play the action.

After all action cards are played, scoring.
The players total the cards in the front.

In the first and second round, the players take the point cards along the scoring.
In the third round, the players total the scoring and the point cards.

The highest player is the winner.

name: Things... Schitt's Creek: Bébé Game
description:
Everyone’s favorite game meets everyone’s favorite show! In this hilarious game, you read a topic card and then write down your response. It can be anything that comes to mind—there’s no right or wrong answer! Then all the responses are read aloud, and you have to figure out who said what! You won’t believe the THINGS… the people you know will come up with! With the Schitt’s Creek Edition, explore your thoughts about the show and it’s hilarious characters and see what THINGS… you’ll say!

Note: This is a smaller version of Things... Schitt's Creek which contains only 70 cards, compared to 188 cards and additional components found in the later version.
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Paddy McGinty's Goat
description:
Paddy McGinty's Goat is an Australian game based on a 1917 war-time comic song of the same name. Performed by the American duo The Two Bobs (Bob Alden and Bob Adams). It tells the story of an aggressive goat that enters the village of Killaloe in Ireland. The original score also has the goat defeating the German army and the Kaiser

A simple roll and move game where players use a small wooden marble to move along a path by the roll of he dice. The playing board is slightly elevated at one end to create a slope. The path mostly contains a series small holes for the marble to sit, but every so often on the path is a much larger hole where if a player lands directly on the large hole by the dice roll then the wooden marble falls through and rolls down the slope to the start and the player must begin again.

A player may "Butt" an opponent forward if he directly lands on that player. First player to reach Paddy McGinty's Goat's right eye is deemed the winner.

name: Schalten: Aber Schlau – Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel
description:
Schalten - Aber Schlau: Das Große Energieeffizienzspiel is a trivia game about energy usage put out by a German energy supplier to help folks learn about their energy efficiency.

—user summary

name: Full House: Mini-expansion fans/e-mail (Limited edition)
description:
20 new guests inspired by fans of Château Lafortune
20 new emails inspired by ideas from Château Lafortune fans. Emails that add some strategy!

Definitely the extension of the audience and the perfect complement to your game!

20 nouveaux invités inspiré de fans du Château Lafortune
20 nouveaux courriels inspiré des idées des fans de Château Lafortune. Des courriels qui ajoute quelques stratégie!

Définitivement l'extension du public et le complément parfait de votre jeu!

name: アウランド (OWLAND)
description:
アウランド (OWLAND) is a push your luck game from Japan. The cards are double-headed, that is, you play the top or bottom face of the card depending on it being night or day.

The publisher says:
Owland is a world with many forests of owls. Each player is an owl, who lives in a different forest. One day, this
Owland is troubled by crow, the owls' natural enemy. Try to defend your forest, even at the cost of having other forests taken over by the crow...!

You are immediately eliminated if you draw the Crow card from the deck. Try to avoid it by effectively using Day-Night tokens and the cards with effects that vary between day and night.

The last surviving player wins in this Russian roulette style card game. Enjoy the accelerating manoeuvring and thrills!

ふくろうの森がいっぱいの世界『ＯＷＬＡＮＤ』
プレイヤーは別々の森に住むふくろう。ある日やってきた天敵のカラスにふくろうたちは大騒ぎ！！　カラスから自分の森を守り抜け！　たとえ他の森がカラスに乗っ取られようとも…
山札から「カラスカード」を引き取ったら脱落。昼夜チップや、昼と夜で効果の変わるカードを上手く使って、カラスカードを回避しよう。最後まで１人残ったプレイヤーが勝利するロシアンルーレット系カードゲームです。
段々と加速する駆け引きとドキドキを味わえます！！
publisher's summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Sushi Scramble
description:
GRAB THE SUSHI! In this fun children's game, players use chopsticks to grab pieces of sushi that match the menu card before the chef knocks them off the belt. Get them all before the chef gives you the CHOP!

—description from the publisher

name: Puff Ball
description:
PUFF, RACE, WIN. In Puff Ball, players will have to take the ball from cup to cup and through a series of obstacles to the end of the track. But there's a twist - you can only do so by puffing the ball.

—description from the publisher

name: 世界恐蝗 (The World's Fear of Locusts)
description:
世界恐蝗 (The World's Fear of Locusts) is a co-operative game from Japan for three players only. Players are working to stop locust swarms across the world by researching grasshoppers, and by attack swarms of locusts spreading on the wind.

Each player takes on a role in the game, entomologist (Studying insects), a control expect, and a supply expert. The players win by completing their research and eliminating the locust swarms. Even under harsh conditions, players can work out a successful solution.

The game board shows various sections of land, and a spinner decides the wind direction, controlling how the locusts spread. The game includes 3D grasshoppers and locusts.
user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: ゴープラム 踊る彫刻 (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture)
description:
ゴープラム 踊る彫刻 (Gopuram Dancing Sculpture) is a game from Japan in which players are constructing a Gopuram. This is an entrance tower at a Hindu temple in Southern India. The tower is covered in elaborate, colourful statues of dancing Hindu gods. The players are the sculptors, seeking inspiration as they construct their own Gopuram.

The game has a set of cards of dancers used to form a circle. Players move glass stones around this circle in the style of a Mancala game. As they move the stones around, they build up on an animal for each player.

When the player has got enough stones on their animal, they move them on and draw sculpture cards. These show four carved figures in different colours. Players add the cards they draw to the one card they started with at the centre of their tower. In doing so, players want to complete a tower of 4,3 and then 2 cards, but with sets of coloured statues lining up in groups.

When a player completes a tower, they take a bonus card of Vishnu to top out their tower. The other players get a chance to finish their towers, and scores are calculated from groups of figures and bonus points.

The most points wins the game for the best sculpture.
user summary
publishers: Chonmage Game (ちょんまげ工務店)

name: Town Hall: A Card Game
description:
The game starts with players designing the Town by choosing from the 12 available districts, ranging from forest to the central business district. Changing the set up of the Town means that the game has more variability over time as districts advantage different candidates. Players are also assigned purple 'values' cards, which they share with the players next to them. This means you have things in common but, in a 4 player game, have nothing in common with the person sitting across from you! Values are important: your candidates perform better if they have the same values and your projects give you more legacy points if they also align with your values.

Once the Town is established and the districts chosen, players select cards (their candidates and inventory) and begin building up their arsenal for the upcoming elections. Be sure to select good candidates! They come with one or more Persuasive (P), Strategic (S) or Ruthless (R) skills which determines the number and type of actions they can make as candidates and later on as councillors.

Each district is up for election and players spend resources trying to ensure their candidate comes out as the winner. Players adopt the persona of their candidate and give a short 'campaign speech' to the table, outlining why they deserve your vote. The player with the "best speech" wins additional support which increases their odds of being elected. Support is also increased by the candidate's popularity in that district and any other cards you burn to give you a competitive edge. Be careful: the more you burn now, the less you can do once you're in Town Hall! Each candidate elected is worth legacy points, which decide the game.

Winning candidates become councillors who can complete project in their term of office if they have the necessary skills (P, S or R). Complete a project and get more legacy points. Diversity is key: players are rewarded bonus points for a complete PSR set of 3. At the end of 3 rounds the player with the highest number of legacy points is the winner! For experienced players, there is the option to include an add-on mode where the Mayor of the day tries to persuade players to support their proposal.

-description from publisher

name: Meine Tierarztpraxis
description:
We are in a veterinary practice. The players are supposed to collect 6 different animal cards by playing the matching treatment cards. On their turn, players may place up to 2 matching treatment cards from their hand on an animal. Once the treatment is completed (between 2 and 4 treatment cards are needed), you get the animal card. If no player succeeds in collecting all 6 different animals, the player with the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Domino-Click
description:
Principle like Dominoes. About half of the one- or two-color clickets are distributed equally to the players, the rest goes into a pot. the youngest player starts and puts a clicket on the table. Similar to dominoes, the next player must try to connect with a clicket of the same color. If he does not have the same color or if the clickets repel each other (because a magnetic south pole has hit a magnetic south pole or vice versa), the player must take an extra clicket from the pot and it is the next player's turn. The first player to run out of crickets to put on wins the game.

—user summary

name: Huskespil
description:
Memory Game. The equipment consists of: a circular wooden board with an outer ring of 16 holes, and an inner ring of 8 holes; 24 wooden pegs, with their root painted in one of six colours; a six-sided die with each face showing one of the same six colours.
The pegs are randomly placed in the holes in the board, so that the coloured tips are invisiible, and the board randomly rotated to negate any memory of their placement.
The starting player rolls the die, and then draws a peg. If its colour matches that shown on the die, the peg is retained, the player scores a point, and has another turn (roll, draw). This continues until the peg colour does not match the die roll, in which case the peg is replaced in the same position on the board, and play passes to the next player. Once all pegs have been drawn from the board and matched, the player with the most points is the winner.

name: Santiago de Compostela
description:
Waking up one day, you are filled with the overflowing passion to be as the travelers of ancient biblical times, and decide to travel to the holy land of Spain, the city of Santiago de Compostela. You thus begin your travels from your hometown of Paris to Santiago and finally return home the way whence you came.

The game is begun by shuffling the number cards (the companion cards) and laying them out between Paris and Santiago. When your turn comes, advance your pilgrim card as much as you like and earn a travel companion card. There is no restriction on the distance you can travel towards the card you desire, but there is no turning back once you advance your pilgrim.

How do you turn your journey into the best pilgrimage? By collecting travel companions (number cards)! You must choose number cards very carefully. In order to score the most by the cards you collect, you must collect as many of the same cards as possible, or collect various kind of cards. For example, the number 1 card allows you to score with just one card, but you must collect a large amount of number 9 cards (and/or a variety of cards) in order to score with them! In this game, you win by scoring more points than other pilgrims in a total of two rounds: a journey from Paris to Santiago and another one from Santiago to Paris.

“Maybe the real treasure was the friends we made along the way”.

name: Horseshoes & Hand Grenades Card Game
description:
An explosive card game unlike any other for friend and foe alike. Rule game night by obliterating the competition with unique card types. Set the charges or pull the pin early and let the sparks fly because only one player can call themselves the victor in this all out brawl of Horseshoes & Hand Grenades!

- Obliterate the competition with Hand Grenade cards.
- Shield yourself from the opposition with Horseshoe cards.
- Defy the actions of others with Short Fuse cards.

Play as a team or fight alone, the choice is yours. All that matters is that you are the last one standing.

Begin by choosing who goes first, preferably the least liked of your friends, who smells the worst, has the loudest burp or is the mostly to die first (in the game, don't be so morbid). The chosen player with then shuffle the deck and deal every player 5 cards and 5 Heart Tokens. The player to the left of the dealer will then begin the game with the first play action as the Active Player.

Once a player loses all 5 Heart Tokens, they are out. So, make sure to maintain your defenses since any defenses that are down, leave your Heart Tokens completely exposed.

On the Active Players turn, they can play 1 Hand Grenade card to attack with and 1 Horseshoe card to build up their defenses. No more than 3 Horseshoe cards can be in play for each player. After they have completed their two actions, they must draw a card to end their turn so that the Active Player status transfers to the next player on the left.

On the Inactive Players turn, they can play Short Fuse cards in response to any action performed by the Active Player or other Inactive Players, shifting the tides to favor themselves or others. But, they must be careful, since the Active Player can play Short Fuses in response to others.

In the end, only one shall remain. You may refer to yourself as the victor, but everyone else may refer to you as a frag-faced-fuck. So, pull the pin, count to 3 and have some explosive fun with Horseshoes & Hand Grenades.
categories: Bluffing, Humor, Negotiation, Party Game, Real-time
mechanics: Bribery, Hand Management, Hidden Roles, Player Elimination, Team-Based Game

name: Shaktis
description:
Game Type: Strategic Board Game
Players: 2
Playtime: 60-90 minutes
Theme: Strategy, Philosophy, Nature
Objective: Cultivate thematic gardens with strategic Seedstone placement, utilising Yaksis' abilities and the Botanical Codex.

'Shaktis: Mind the Plot' is a unique board game that blends strategy, nature, and philosophy within a mystical forest setting. Players embark on a journey to create thematic gardens by strategically placing Seedstones, leveraging the abilities of guardian Yaksis. This game emphasizes a balance between chance and choice, encouraging players to engage in philosophical debates and explore botanical wonders. With its innovative "Ripple Rule," the game ensures every decision impacts the evolving narrative, offering a rich, thematic experience that challenges the mind and soul.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Ancient, Dice, Educational, Exploration, Mythology

name: Thorngate Dungeon
description:
A Single Sheet Print and Play Eurogame. Simple to pick up play with plenty of strategy, depth and decision space.

Thorngate Tower has been taken over by all manner of unworldy creatures. Your task is to initially clear out the dungeon area. Whilst slaying foes from 4 different realms to gain the favour of Thorngates guild owners you must also try to rescue as much treasure as you can along the way in order to prove that you are worthy of entering the remainder of the Tower.

Thorngate Dungeon is played over a series of 16 Rounds where in each you will be taking actions based on the rolls of 4 dice. Everything is contained on a single sheet of A4 paper and all that is needed from you is a pencil per player and 4 dice for the whole group.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Food Who?
description:
This is a game for 2 players with each their own game board filled with 24 types of food. The opponent has to guess the food to win.

The game dynamics are similar to Guess Who?, the mystery face game where you flip over a collection of faces with different color hair, eye color, hair, hats, glasses etc. to deduce who the secret person is that your opponent has chosen. In Food Who? you flip over the hooked tiles with pizza, pies, meats, snacks, vegetables, etc. as you narrow your choices by asking characteristic questions.

name: Hexa Ruins
description:
ヘクサ・ルインス (Hexa Ruins) is a roll & write game from Japan. Players are exploring a jungle land for treasures and ruins. Key to the game is the date and time you play. At the start of the game, write these down on your sheet, and the numbers create your starting equipment and coins.

As the game progresses, you roll a red and a blue die and make your moves across the hex map of the landscape. The die rolls apply to your equipment and coins, and you choose how you move. The map shows water, plains, mountains and treasure sites. In the top corner is the fabled Hexa Ruins. The game ends when a player reaches here, or after 30 turns.

Players calculate their scores based on their exploration and the most points wins.

The publisher has already released new maps for PnP purchase online.
user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Paper-and-Pencil, Real-Time, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: BABEL: 0
description:
An expansion set that adds a new way to play "BABEL".

Each player bids off the right to build the Tower of Babel and raises the tower while earning points. At the end of the game, the player with the most points wins. The winning bidder does not necessarily build the tower. The tower will be built by the person with the highest total score at the time of winning the auction. If they fail to build it, they will lose immediately. The player with the second highest score at that time will be the winner.

name: Jikkuri Millet: Masterpiece Box Vol. 2 “Winter Masterpiece”
description: Expansion that includes 16 pieces of art with the theme of winter, special large scoring rose, and 6 new cards. Requires the base game to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Jikkuri Millet: Masterpiece Box Vol 1
description:
Expansion that includes 20 pieces of art, special large scoring rose, and 6 new cards.
Requires the base game to play.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: ヘクサ・ルインス 〜クロコダイルとドレイクの島〜 (Hexa Ruins: The Island of Crocodiles and Drakes -)
description:
ヘクサ・ルインス 〜クロコダイルとドレイクの島〜 (Hexa Ruins - The Island of Crocodiles and Drakes -) is a Print & Play expansion to Hexa Ruins. It has two new maps for Hexa Ruins, one with Crocodiles, one with Drakes. The expansion is available as a download purchased from the publisher's online store.
user summary
categories: Adventure, Civilization, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Print & Play, Real-time
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Network and Route Building, Real-Time, Resource to Move, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: CryptoSpaceGame
description:
CRYPTOSPACEGAME lets you control an intrepid team of crypto currency miners who want to reach the world of their dreams within a year of in-game time. Can you make those dreams come true? Follow the crypto currency exchange rates, devise a clever strategy for money transfer, and multiply your riches. Win the top spot in the race to a life of luxury!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a peaceful game, and you will not have to attack your partners. However, you will have to obtain more crypto currency than others and get the most expensive dreams before anyone else does. Think hard, and with a little luck, you may win!

CRYPTOSPACEGAME is a game about the world of cryptocurrency, but you need no background knowledge or preparation to play it.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Dice Rolling, Events, Income, Increase Value of Unchosen Resources, Investment, Trading

name: Spuds 'N Goblins
description:
A fast-paced, goblin-themed potato-gathering card game. Players play from three decks: Goblins, potatoes, and events. Players draw a goblin and a potato card on their turns, and may play add a goblin card to the field.
