Use your goblin's powers during your (or your opponent's!) turn to snag potato cards or do battle with enemy goblins. The player who gathers the most potatoes before winter hits wins! The game ends when all potatoes are gone. Will you thrive or starve?

—description from the back of the box (edited)

name: アニマルコレクティング (Animal Collecting)
description:
アニマルコレクティング (Animal Collecting) is a card game from Japan. The deck allows two games to be played: Hide & Seek, and Rebellion.

The players are zoo keepers and must sort the zoo out. For the game Hide & Seek, they swap cards in the style of Old Maid and try to complete sets of animals. Or they can guess the missing animal, a card drawn face-down to the table at the start of the game. However, there is also a black cat card, which a player may pass as an alternate to the requested card.

In the game Rebellion, one player is unhappy with the zoo's policies and is disrupting the zoo by hidden different animals in different places. In a one vs many game, the other three players must deduce where the animals are hidden.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Set Collection

name: Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Booster Set #2
description:
Star Trek: The Next Generation Collectible Dice Game – Borg Sphere Starter.
Contains:
2xd12 Weapon Beam dice (front/starboard & front port)
8xd12 Weapon Beam dice (2 each front/starboard, front/port, aft/starboard, & aft/port)

Each booster set contains 10 new dice to expand your ship and rulebook with rules for multiplayer battles and explaining new dice effects.

name: バナナはおやつに入りますか？(Do Bananas Count As A Snack?)
description:
バナナはおやつに入りますか？ (Banana wa o yatsu ni hairimasu ka?) is a card game from Japan, in which players must face a philosophical dilemma that has tormented humanity since the dawn of time. Do bananas count as a snack food?

In this game, the players are elemnetary school children, buying snacks to take on their school trip. They have some money and a variety of snacks choices in the shop. As well the usual chocolate bars, sweets and corn snacks, there are bananas. They must use their money wisely, and buy good value snacks, and not have too much change left over.

If a player buys some bananas, will they count as positive or negative points at the end of the game? It depends on the other children. If several children buy bananas, they count as 2 pts. But in not enough buy bananas, they count as -1 pt. Players must balance their need to spend, against the risk of elementary school childrens' opinions on bananas as snack food.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ひつじのあくま (Hitsuji no Akuma)
description:
ひつじのあくま (Hitsuji no Akuma) is a card game from Japan. The title translates as Devil Sheep, meaning Baphomet. The game box also says "How many Baphomet Do You Need?".

In the game, players are supplying various Baphomet to meet the needs of their customers. each player gets a secret character, a customer who wants a certain number of Baphomet.
They need to provide the correct amount of Baphomet demanded to get the best score. Too many or too few, they score less or zero.

With only 5 hand cards, players must trade Baphomet without disclosing the total they really need.

On a turn, a player either places a card as part of their supply, or plays a card using the effects on the card. When placing a card, it can go face up, showing some Baphomet, or face down to be revealed at the game end.

When a card is played for its affect, this might apply to the player or to another, and moves Baphomet cards around.

There are several special action cards too, which reverse fortunes, but players could lose all their Baphomet.

When the deck is exhausted, the game ends and players turn up their cards and calculate a final score.

The publisher says that the game is more chaotic with 5 players, and more thoughtful with 2 players.

The game is listed as for age 12+, but reviewers say it is easy to play, and should really be age 8+.
user summary
publishers: Red I Games (レッド・アイ・ゲームズ)

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Earthfang Relic Die
description: This all-new melee weapon was forged after the mighty axe "Earthfang' from Esfah lore. With SAIs like Bash, Counter, Fly, Sneak Attack, and Smite, this relic comes with great power, but must be wielded with caution...
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Dragon Dice (Fourth Edition): Dragonslayer Die
description:
The Dragonslayer is a 4-health unit that is a melee machine. They are also part of the Eldarim species. A Dragonslayer can kill any color of dragon if it rolls its SFR Logo during a dragon attack. Dragonslayers can cast any color of magic (not just the colors at the current terrain). Dragonslayers can carry magical items (including medallions) of any color.

These are the champions of the Eldarim species. See the Acolytes of the Eldarim kicker for more information.
categories: Collectible Components, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy

name: Caricatoon
description: Choose wisely the celebrity whose name you will make guess among your cards according to the challenge imposed. Attention! You only have 45 seconds to succeed! Meet the biggest stars of the world and of our country. Actors, comedians, politicians, athletes and even mystery personalities... Mime, draw, question and imitate! Laughter and fun are guaranteed.

name: アニマリーナ (Animarina)
description:
アニマリーナ (Animarina) is a tile placement game from Japan.

Players are explorers in a wild land in Africa, looking for a lost family member. They encounter various animals who offer to help, in return for being the most favoured animal in the land.

Players draw cards in their and place them across spaces on the game board, linking up with arrows on the card edges. The player's goal is to create the largest area in their own colour. By using the animals special abilities, they can gain and secure more land.

Some animals are stronger in certain habitats, such as the gorilla in the forest. Some animals gain strength from being linked in a herd.

A player can place their animal over another if their animal has a higher number. So a #4 dog can cover a #3 dog, and extend the territory.

When the game ends, the player covering the most spaces is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Square Grid, Tile Placement
publishers: Game Creation Association ZAM (ゲーム創作結社ザム)

name: Greater or Lesser Aquarium (大なり小なり水族館)
description:
Build an Aquarium together while trying to satisfy the demands of the fishes

Players work together to build a 5x5 Aquarium grid while trying to ensure that the mathematical equations hold true on all connecting sides of the tile
Each animal tile states a number along with the < or > symbol on each side
Players take turns placing a tile from their hand trying to successfully build the 25 tile aquarium

name: Nook: Le Racoon et les Ouassous
description:
Nook and his friends enjoy fishing for crayfish under the Caribbean sun. Only Rainbo, the Lorikeet, disapproves of these frenzied fishing parties and will try to stop them.

Each player has cards representing a team of raccoon dogs with different strenghs, some lobsters and a parrot. Every turn, you select one card, hidden face. By bluffing the others and a little bit of luck, the player will have to select the correct one, to catch the lobsters of the other players (only the biggest raccoon of the trick wins) without being disturb by a parrot.

name: Oui!: Le grand jeu de l'amour et du hasard
description:
(Name meaning : "Yes ! The game and chance", inspired by a book of Marivaux)

This game is a quiz of 1340 questions about love. Movies, History, Literature, Songs... everything will be explored, and by any means : drawing, quiz, mimes, memory games...

The board consists of a heartshape track with spaces in three different colors, corresponding to different difficulties. Players roll a dice and move along the track. When a player stops on a color, he gets a question of the appropriate difficulty. A correct answer allows the player to roll again.

Once a player reach the middle of the board, he win the game.

—user summary

name: Don't Mix It!
description:
The Recyclables Sorting Game.

It's sorting time at the recycling center, and each player has their own sorting board to separate the glass, metal, paper, and plastic.

In Don't Mix it!, players place tiles depicting various different recyclable material. Each round, players thoughtfully place their tiles so that their bin walls connect with only one kind of recyclable material inside. At the end of the game, bins can be any shape or size, but players will not earn points for bins that contain mixed recyclables. Players count up all their validly placed tiles and the player with the most points wins.

name: Rosetta: The Lost Language – Stars and Street Promo Pack
description: This Print & Play promo pack contains 2 new locations and 10 new inscriptions for Rosetta: The Lost Language.
categories: Ancient, Card Game, Deduction, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play, Puzzle

name: スリーウォンバッツ (Three Wombats)
description:
スリーウォンバッツ (Three Wombats) is a card game from Japan for three players only.

Players are wombats, trying to eat well. Each player has three cards showing their wombats hands reaching out. A deck of food cards is shuffle dup, and one dealt face-up. Players choose their wombat card to play simultaneously.

The result is worked out similar to rock-paper-scissors. Depending on the different combinations, players will get more or less food.

The player's goal is to eat the right amount over five rounds to win. Getting too much food or little makes the wombat ill.
user summary

name: Apéro 90's
description:
How much do you remember about Ricky Martin, Pablo Escobar or the Addams Family ? It's time to check that with this card based Trivia about the 90s.

140 cards for 3 themes (Movies and medias, society, music), earning 1 to 3 points, according to difficulty.
The person with the most points once all rounds have finished is declared the winner.

name: A.E.G.I.S Wildmoves: Roll n' Fight
description:
The characters of AEGIS face off in head-to-head melee battles of bluffing and prediction! Both players are armed with the same set of cards, but roll dice to determine their power and which of their Wild Move special attacks they have access to. The fight moves back and forth on the battlefield as blows are landed, granting advantage to those in the right position!

Features:
Fast, strategic battles in 10 minutes and no setup!
Options for 2 and 4-player battles!
10 unique characters from all corners of Sigaea!
4 unique stages, each with their own opportunities and hazards!
10 beautiful AEGIS d6 dice!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Tug of War, Variable Player Powers

name: Rampage at the Rockport Tower
description:
A giant gorilla has been terrorizing the city of Rockport since Monday. All attempts to subdue the monster has failed. Named "Coco" by the locals, Coco will climb up the Rockport International to evade his attackers. As he climbs up the tower, military planes release a torrent of gunfire to attempt to stop Coco's rampage. Using a traditional deck of card, you will assume the role of Coco. Two columns of cards will create your tower. Starting from the bottom of the tower, you will manipulate cards to create an ascending order of cards all the way to the top of the tower. Using memory, planning and a little bit of luck, if you make it to the top of the tower, you win!

But watch out! The higher up you go, the more likely that military planes will successfully hit you. If you are hit three times, before making it to the top of the tower, you lose!

Once you are comfortable with the game, you can increase the difficulty with the Night Rampage variant. This requires a great deal of memorization. There is also an Extended variant with the addition of a two card spire on top of the building. This will challenge you with a thinner draw deck and a more intense plane attack.

Can you safely guide Coco to the top of the tower?

name: Knowtable
description:
Knowtable is a unique card game that is 100 percent about connection between its players. Players get to share their stories and show off what they have noticed about the other players in the game. Players learn about one another and learn what other people have noticed about them. It is the rare kind of game where no one is sad when they “lose” because the process of the game is so fun and affirming.

I developed Knowtable over many years with my daughters. I am a single mother who values my connection with my daughters above all else. We invented this game and we played it often because it always made us laugh and feel closer to one another.

It is best for 3-8 players ages 10 and up, although it can be modified for younger players. The premise is that a “category card” is pulled by a judge and the players have ten seconds to think of something that falls within that category that will *most appeal* to the judge. At 10 seconds the judge counts down, “3-2-1” and the guessers shout out their guess. For example, the category is “car.” The guessers might respond: “a mercedes,” “the 1976 Rabbit that you got on your 16th birthday,” “a bike because cars are bad for the planet.” Anything goes so long as it will appeal to the judge.

This alone sponsors conversation. Players like to explain their answer and the judge likes to explain why he or she picks the answer that most appeals to him or her. The winning guesser gets the point and becomes the next judge. In the case of a tie where more than one player asserts the same “winning” guess, “break cards” are pulled. The break cards contain descriptions such as “biggest hands,” “youngest,” “shortest”, “most recently ate a piece of fruit,” etc. The player that best fits the description wins the tie break, gets a point and becomes the next judge.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Educational, Humor, Party Game

name: Xmas Socks
description:
Who will be the first to find the Xmas sock on the dice?
Shuffle the cards with the colourful Xmas socks thoroughly and spread them out on the table with the sock-side facing upwards so that everyone can see them clearly.
Each player will then take turns to throw all three dice, which will determine the colour, pattern and picture of the sock to be found.
Now you need to be fast! The player who finds the right sock first picks the card up using their suction pad and has won that card. The first player to collect 5 cards wins the game!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Memory
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Matching, Memory, Race, Speed Matching

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 23
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 23 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Nexus NXS1-B/C
Star Python
Fujin RJN-301-F
Raijin RJN-101-A/B/C/X/301-B
Lancelot LNC25-09
Rifleman IIC 1/2/9/10
Guillotine GLT-7M
Nova Cat T/E/F/G/H/M
Grand Crusader GRN-D-01/01-X/02/02-B
Star Crusader Prime/A/B
Katana CRK-5006-1


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Recognition Guide – IlClan Volume 24
description:
The march of technology across BattleTech’s eras is relentless—but some BattleMech designs never die. Each installment of this PDF-only series not only includes a brand new BattleMech or OmniMech, but also details Classic ’Mech designs from both the Inner Sphere and the Clans, now fully rebuilt with Dark Age technology (3085 and beyond).

Volume 24 Includes Rules and Record Sheets for:


Elemental III Battle Armor
Skinwalker (Ryoken III) Prime/A/B/C/D/E/F
Grand Dragon DRG-12K
Flashman FLS-10E
Stalker STK-9F
Alpha Wolf Prime/A/B/C
Annihilator ANH-5W
Atlas AS7-K-DC/S3/S3-DC/S4
Atlas AS8-K/KE/S
Atlas C/C2/C3
Atlas II AS7-DK-H


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 7
description:
Arm yourself with technical readouts, playable scenarios, an in-depth look at the weaponization of gift giving in the Draconis Combine, a glimpse into Clan Sea Fox’s customer service, an article on the importance of battlefield salvage, and more—all from elite BattleTech authors and recruits who have earned their stripes.

Contains rules for:


Chaos Campaign Scenario: The Christmas Eve Coup (Total Warfare)
The Abominable Icemonster (Mechwarrior: Destiny)
One Last Favor, Old Friend: A MechWarrior: Destiny Mission Briefing
Combat Shotguns: For Close Encounters (A Time of War)


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Infinity Casino
description:
In this betting game, players are allowed to write any number on their blank dry erase chips. However, if you have the highest number out of all the players, you cannot win the bet; and if you bet the lowest number, you will be fined. If you are in the middle when the number is rolled, you will win your bet.

The winner of the game is the player with the most moeny at the end.

name: Barkeeper's Order Trick
description: Play a series of simultaneous tricks to buy spirits for your bar. The inner trick sets the range allowed by the outer trick. The winner of the outer trick takes the cards and arranges them by type. Whoever has the most types of spirits at the end of the hand has stocked their bar the best and wins the game.

name: Travelus: Evacuate
description:
At the beginning, animals are peacefully roaming around their nine sanctuaries. Now, a disaster threatens to destroy eight of them. The animals have a limited time to evacuate before each sanctuary is destroyed. Destinarc is the only safe place and they must evacuate there to escape the danger and help save other animals - their own kind or all kinds.

You can play this game in two modes: competitive and co-operative. In competitive mode, players play for themselves and the winner is the player who saves the most animals of one type. In co-operative mode, everyone works together and wins when all animals are safely evacuated.

On your turn, you roll a die and move one of the animals the same number of spaces or to an unoccupied stone with the same number. Every two turns or so, a Warning card is pulled to show which board will disappear. You must move the animals off that board quickly before the board is removed along with everything on it. Be careful! The board you just landed on may go next! Or there may be no escape route left!

In those dire situations, there is always hope when the animals work together to save one another.

-description from publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Map Reduction, Modular Board, Negotiation, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Set-up

name: Travelus: Describe
description:
As a travel journalist, you explore, study, and write about different places and cultures. You get to travel around the Continents and to describe the world with your own unique style. From covering travel destinations and accommodations to celebrations and festivals, your adventures always start and end with words.

Your goal is to score the highest points for a collection of words.

On your turn, you roll a die and move the same number of spaces to make your way to different destinations and collect letters from Source and Interview cards to form words. But your words don't count unless you submit them to an Editorial Office for publication and unused letters take points away.

Stories are everywhere and you are always on the go: Meeting a source at the park, networking at the hotel, sharing leads with a colleague, all while juggling other life commitments. Your assignments can be exciting and you are often left to your own devices to deal with challenges wherever you are.

Combining your ability to navigate unfamiliar places with your aptitude to express, will you be the most prolific Journalist?
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Travelus: Expose
description:
You are the Head of the Intelligence Agency in your country and you send astute Spies around the globe to gather intel. Their missions are scattered throughout the Continents where rivals may be. They are required to get specific assets at certain locations. With the stakes at their absolute highest and time pressing on, Spies must decide their best move in every turn.

Spies aim to complete many missions within the time limit. The winner is the player who completes the most missions.

At the beginning of the game, you are given a deadline and Resource cards to get you moving towards your destinations as set out in your secret Mission card.

On your way, you collect and exchange Resource and Intel cards. Restrictions are in place and you risk being interrogated or exposed at every turn. Should you negotiate to form alliances to keep your Spies a bit safer, or should you take every chance you get to push the rivals away?

With constant shifting power and priority, can you achieve your missions in time?

-description from publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Area Movement, Contracts, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Race, Resource to Move, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Travelus: Launch
description:
You are the lead engineer of the space program in your territory whose mission is to be the leader in space technology. All territories are competing to build the next rocket that has the biggest launch mass to transport both people and large building materials to Mars.

A rocket requires 6 modules that must be placed in the correct sequence. You must acquire these modules from different territories within the interterritorial network and be the first to assemble your rocket to launch.

To build your rocket, you must acquire 6 unique Modules before your opponents. You must assemble the Modules in a particular order.

Starting with an isolated Territory, each turn you take one of the two actions: 1. Join or leave the interterritorial network or 2. Pick up a Speed card to help get you the Modules you need.

If you stay isolated, you won't be able to get anything from other Territories. But joining the network gives others access to everything of yours.

What and when will you do?
mechanics: Area Movement, Connections, Contracts, Grid Movement, Map Addition, Map Deformation, Pick-up and Deliver, Race, Resource to Move, Variable Set-up

name: Travelus: Top
description:
A potentially hazardous asteroid is about to hit the planet. We have the laser to destroy the asteroid, but it must be shot from the peak of Destinarc which is not accessible by helicopter or plane.

A team of mountain climbers must reach Destinarc before time runs out. They must travel through treacherous and rough terrains separated by deep crevasses. Each climber is responsible for securing 1 ladder and leaving 1 supply pack behind to aid their survival on the way back.

All of your Climbers, each with a laser part, must reach Destinarc within a limited number of moves.

Every Climber starts with 8 attached playing pieces and ends with 4.

On each turn, after turning over a Trekking card and as the team leader, the active player consults with other players, decides which Climber is in the best position to move, to secure a ladder, or to leave the supplies, then acts accordingly.

You must work together to plan and apply your approaches and moves. It’s always farther, taller, and harder than it looks.

Can your team save the planet?
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Negotiation, Resource to Move, Variable Set-up

name: Travelus: Shape
description:
Many years ago an artist traveled the world and paid for her travels by creating a piece of art for everyone who helped her. It has been discovered that there are 64 pieces still exist somewhere on the planet. You, as one of many passionate art collectors, are on a treasure hunt to build your collection through competitive and relentless acquisition, bidding, and trading.

Your goal is to complete your collection of 8 Article cards of 1 shape or 8 unique shapes. Your collection also counts when you have 4 or more cards of 1 shape or different shapes. Each piece of art must have a Frame. The game ends when one player gets their collection appraised. The winner is the player whose collection has the highest value.

On your turn, you choose from 2 options that let you hunt art pieces from different sources. Acquiring, bidding, and trading are a key part of this highly competitive and intimidating process. You will need lots of money and maybe insurance too! Building your dream art collection is certainly possible but a difficult task that is not for the faint of heart.

Do you have what it takes?
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Interrupts, Lose a Turn, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Race, Set Collection, Trading, Variable Set-up

name: Invocación Fronteras: El Encuentro
description:
Initiation into the arcane arts takes place in the great tower of Rothra, amid libraries and archmages who guard apprentices as they experience the dangerous paths of mana. From time to time, one or another decides to test the ancient artifacts and thereby discover the power of the portals. Before being called summoners, they practice their mastery in combat, learning little by little about the infinite possibilities of each being that they will be able to call; these are the encounters that grow mages into future summoners.

1 vs 1 mode expansion for Invocación Fronteras.

Includes 2 promo cards:

Akari (41 - Air): Match your Reserve Mana to the player with the lowest Reserve Mana (minimum 1).
Azael (60 - Air/Earth/Water/Fire): Your Power is equal to the lowest Power at this time, multiplied by 3.



Medium difficulty for new and old summoners.

In this game mode the summoners prepare a deck each. Then they fight normally but the cards they use are the ones they set aside for themselves. It is a practical way to learn the cards and they generate a dynamic reminiscent of TCG or CCG games.

Although 1 vs 1 is recommended, it is just as functional for more players.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Real-time
mechanics: Deck Construction, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Win The Night
description:
Win The Night allows you to live out the glorious debauchery of nightlife without having to change out of your sweat pants or get off the couch.

Grab up to eight of your friends for a metaphorical race home from a wild night out. One by one you'll take turns rolling the die and letting the cards choose your fate. You might stumble into a dance battle or have to recall a forgotten memory. Either way, all bets are off and only one player will Win The Night.
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Race, Role Playing

name: Delve: Feast and Famine
description:
An expansion for Delve: A Solo Game of Digging Too Deep.

F&F adds several new mechanics to the core game:

a new hunger mechanic that requires you to feed your troops or else lose them to starvation
expanded Inn room that allows for recruiting exotic troops
new production rooms that farm food
new processing rooms that turn raw food into enhance other rooms or troops
new units like butchers, farmers, and bread golems
cave goats! mythic beasts that can bolster your units with milk and cheese, but eventually turn on their masters with ancient powers
categories: Book, City Building, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fantasy, Farming, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Area Movement, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: William Shakespeare the Parlor Game
description:
A game using Cards Against Humanity mechanics.

A laugh-out-loud mash-up party game for everyone, whether you love Shakespeare’s works, or loathe them. Dealt from a deck of 400 answer cards, complete modern musings such as, “Just tell the judge to ….” with phrases pulled directly from the Bard himself. Your sense of humor paired with Shakespeare’s quick wit will prove (with refreshing hilarity) just how winsome his words remain in the twenty-first century. For fans of William Shakespeare and classic literature, and for fans of anything but.

name: Dr. Seuss 3 Games in ONE!
description:
A collection of three Dr. Seuss games:

The Cat in the Hat Game
Dr. Seuss's ABC Game
One Fish Two Fish Red Fish Blue Fish Card Game

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 6
description: Choose your plan of attack with technical readouts, after-action reports, a deep dive into plasma technology, a treatise on covert-ops poisons, and a look at Free Worlds League politics, along with playable scenarios and more—all loaded into your autocannon by both BattleTech veterans and new voices from the Inner Sphere.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Look Out Below!
description:
A new scenario for Battle for Greyport.

The Scenario comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

This scenario comes in two flavours of difficulty so both introductory and seasoned players should find a good time.

Look Out Below! (For new players)
- Use the "Torglesnarf Returns" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- Encounter 1: Each player's monster group starts with a Kite Bomber whose threat counts toward that player's total. Location monsters are set up normally.
- Encounter 2: After setup, each player adds a Gnome Gunner to their hand and a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Enounter 3:Use the Dragon's Fist instead of The Blackened Kraken. If the Dragon's Fist is destroyed, Captain Blake becomes active and loses his armor for the rest of the game. After setup, each player adds a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Recommended rest healing: 2

Look Out Below! (Advanced players)
- Use the "Torglesnarf Returns" scenario from the game, with the following changes:
- Encounter 1: Each player's monster group starts with a Kite Bomber whose threat counts toward that player's total. Location monsters are set up normally.
- Encounter 2: After setup, each player adds a Gnome Gunner to the top of their deck and a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Enounter 3:Use the Viceroy Lapentius and the Dragon's Fist instead of Cpatain Blake and The Blackened Kraken. After setup, each player adds a Kite Bomber to their monster group.
- Recommended rest healing: 1
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Monypoli Køreprøven
description:
In 1947 before LEGO had produced it's first plastic brick, they published this game about traffic safety, a theme you would see continued in many of their later products.

If was created in cooperation with Justitsministeriets udvalg for størrer Færdselssikkerhed (The Ministry of Justice's Committee for Greater Road Safety), and was based on the official traffic laws in Denmark at the time.

The game included metal cars, wooden tokens, a wooden die and cup, cards, a traffic sign poster in a box, and a separate gameboard.

All players start at one end of the track, and roll dice to move forwards, observing all traffic rules, and answering the meaning of the traffic-sign they end on, or answering the questions if ending on a ?-space. Failing to answer correct means you lose points. Running out of points means you fail your driving test, and have to start over with less points. Failing a second time and you are out of the game.

In order to win the game you have to avoid failing your driving test twice, reach the STOP space and have the most points.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Course à l'Oseille
description:
You are a new gardener in Oseilleville. With your cards, your mission is to plant vegetables and grow them with water, sun and time. But be careful, you are not alone and your neighbors could slow you with diseases and disasters.
Try to be the best gardener by respecting the harvest season, taking care of your garden or stealing others...

name: Bushido: Shinyuki
description:
Shinyuki is fearsome in word, act, visage and deed. A combat-centric member of the infamous Bleeding Moon, he excells in death, stealth and being prepared to deal with any situation. Being able to react fluidly counts massively when on missions, which makes this Shadows Crow the terrifying foe he is. His weapon of choice is the Kama: a short, sickle-like weapon that can slice and punch through the stoutest of armour. He loves it so much that he fights with one in each hand, and when in motion, they are a wall of slicing steel. He hides his identity behind a fearsome mask that stupefies his enemies for a second or two when they see it. They often realise - correctly - that this will be the last thing they see on this earth, and the hesitation is all he needs to strike first.

Shinyuki is a combat model that will excel at putting Damage and Bleed Markers on your enemy models. The Slice Ki Feat is expensive, but the damage can be worth it as it often turns a hit into a kill with a whopping Bleed 3 Marker. The ability to get Melee Boost 2 can help if locked in a protracted combat as you can get that higher Melee Pool every turn. The best use of this model may be to finish off a wounded enemy and use the Escape Ki Feat to reposition for Camouflage and Distance from the enemy. This moderate rice cost melee toolbox opens a lot of options for Bleeding Moon players.

Blister contains one miniature, 30mm base and full colour profile card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Mister X
description: In the territory of Yugoslavia, there is MISTER X, whom the detectives are looking for, and in case they find hope, they win, otherwise MISTER X wins. The players first agree on who will be MISTER X, and the others detectives.
mechanics: Hidden Movement, Point to Point Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Team-Based Game

name: Cyber Odyssey: Route 666
description:
Explore the Toxic lands around New Eden, and find new skillfull Agents, vehicules or equipments. But, also, face new adversaries and take part in the events going on around these abandoned places.

Includes 5 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 5 new henchmen, their miniatures and cards. 1 new district board. A new double sided tactical board. 26 new equipment tokens. 15 loot, 12 event and 3 support cards.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Cyber Odyssey: Law and Order
description:
Police forces trying to see what your Organization is doing! Police officers and special forces join the game as henchman.

Includes 2 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 10 new henchmen, their miniatures and cards. 20 Police mission cards and 4 order tokens. 62 new cards that includes 48 Bounty Hunter, 5 evasion, 5 android and 4 support. And 16 new equipment tokens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Cyber Odyssey: In Real Life
description:
Expand your Organization in two different ways. Acquire buildings and build your own city network. And add connections to your social network to get more influence over NEW EDEN!

Includes 2 new agents, their miniatures and cards. 4 hideout boards and 20 tokens. 4 network boards and tokens. 48 contact tokens.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Village
description:
The Village is a 2-4 player cooperative board game that sees players work together to build a new village while trying to overcome a host of potential threats ranging from plagues, famine to even wars.

The game requires players to work together to overcome a,series of potentially devastating events to see if they can build a village large enough to become its own town. During their turn, players can draw or play cards and must select and resolve and event card. Play continues until either a Town hall card is played, or all players lose their 3 lives (3 events).

The game balances elements of strategy and luck as players decide to best build their city to survive the different upcoming challenges that many come their way.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, City Building, Print & Play
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Income

name: Cyber Odyssey: Alone Against the Machine
description:
Play alone against other Organizations and also police forces that will not necessarily protect and serve you...
They might have a whole different agenda.

Also, beware, because one of your Agents may be a traitor!

Includes Ladder board and tokens. 172 cards, including behavior, tactical, features, strategy and henchmen. And various tokens to use with solo.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Παιγνίδι Ερωτήσεων: Ταξιδεύοντας στην Ε.Ο.Κ.
description:
This is a light family game that consists of two smaller games.

The first one is a game of questions, like the trivial pursuit. You roll the die, you move on the board and you answer to a question of the color that you landed on.

The second game is a roll and move game. You start from Thessaloniki, Greece and and travel through Europe with Bruxelles being the final destination. The first one reaches Bruxelles, wins. Every stop of the way, you have to follow a specific rule. The title is Travelling in the EE but in the years 1958 – 1993 it was a greek acronym that translates as European Economic Area (E.O.K.)

—user summary

name: ナンバース (NumVS)
description:
ナンバース (NumVS) is a quick trick taking card game from Japan for two players.

The deck has a set of cards for both players, numbered 3,5,7,10 and an Overwork card. And there is a set of 5 Skills cards. Each player takes their hand cards, and the skill cards are shuffled and dealt two to each player. The fifth Skill card is discarded unseen.

Each round, a player chooses one of their Skill cards face-down, and then both players choose a number card face-down. The cards are turned up and the highest number wins. However, the Skill cards affect the outcome. So players have to be careful in their choices. They know which cards have already been played, and can use their combination of Skill and numbers to win the rounds.

The player that wins the round takes the number card of the other player as their score. At the end, the players add up all the cards won, and the highest total wins.
user summary

name: Pentacular Word Circus
description:
"Ladies and Gentlement...this is NOT your average word game!"

In this cooperative and chaotic real-time spelling game, players take on asymmetric roles of circus acrobats, magicians, and other performers, all working together to wow the audience with their amazing Feats (5-letter word challenges).


Manage a hand of Letter cards.
Play cards into any of 3 Rings.
Earn Applause when you spell a word.
Spend Applause to unlock unique circus performer abilities.


Score as many 5-letter words and Feats as you can before the musical timer ends. To win, score 55 points over three 5-minute rounds.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Music, Racing, Word Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Real-Time, Spelling, Variable Player Powers

name: The Llama Game
description:
Players/teams attempt to build a llama herd through buying, breeding, selling, and running commercial pack trips. The first player/team to accumulate $300,000 in net assets wins the game.

Board is a typical Monopoly board set up with events on each space.
mechanics: Events, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Interplanetary
description:
Interplanetary, a board game invented by Art Widner, was shown for the first time to The Stranger Club in late 1942 and first played at Boskone III. It included elements of Auto Race and Monopoly and added complications such as planets moving in their orbits. The game took an enormous amount of time to play: 8 or 12 hours or even more.

According to Widner: The reason it took so long is that it was a combination of a standard ‘race’ game and Monopoly. One had to get to a planet and bring back a cargo in order to finance a trip to the next distant planet where a still more valuable cargo would be obtained, etc., out to Pluto, which harbored ‘Immortality Dust,’ the game winner. The novel aspect was that the planets moved, making it difficult to land on one, plus such hazards as the ‘negasphere’ (from E. E. Smith epics -- now known as a black hole) and pirates, to say nothing of falling into the sun, getting hit with space junk, etc.

Years later, Bill Evans, Bob Pavlat, C. Stewart Metchette, and Ted White changed the rules enough to make it possible to play the game in an evening. It still didn't catch on.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Pick-up and Deliver, Race

name: Spirit Stackin' Apples
description:
Spirit Stackin' Apples kids game transports kids to the world of DreamWorks Spirit Untamed where, just like Lucky, they can feed the beloved horses apple treats!

Two to four players take turns balancing the treats on Spirit's nose. Then, they push the button on his hoof the number of times shown on the treat. If Spirit opens his mouth and eats, that player keeps the apples. The player with the most apples at the end of the game wins! Pick the special 'yummy apple' and the player can choose to either stack it and press the hoof one time or keep the apple for their score pile.

Spirit Stackin' Apples is a fun way to pass the time and makes a great gift for kids 5 years old and up who love horses and sweet, silly fun.

-description from the publisher's website

name: Enemies of Rome: The Early Republic
description:
Exclusive Kickstarter add on two player game containing a mounted map of the "Early Republic" Ittalian peninsula, 10 "Early Republic" cards exclusive to this game and a color single sided instruction sheet of exclusive rules. Rules, cards and wooden markers from base-game necessary for play.

Game contains:

1 mounted game board
1 cover sheet/Instruction sheet
1 package of 10 game exclusive cards
1 ziplock bag

NOTE: Game requires components from base game to play.

name: Mad for Footy: The Australian Rules Football Board Game
description:
Mad for Footy is the Australian Rules Football Board Game that’s incredibly addictive!

Kicking big bags of goals, making turnovers at critical times and sharing memorable moments with siblings, parents, family members and friends, is what makes this game GREAT!

The aim is to score as many points as you can against your opponent, in four quarters of Australian Rules Football. Players use the dice code on the board to help move around the football field and kick goals for your team using as specially designed football counter!

name: ジャム職人さん (Jam Maker)
description:
You are a jam maker. Let's craft a nice jam! This game includes adorable components like little jam jars and plastic rings that represent ingredients.

The play area contains seven recipe cards, a bag holding the ingredients, and jam jars to be crafted. At the beginning of each round, the player who will go last chooses where to place fresh jam ingredients. The hand-made draw bag includes a mix of eight different ingredients, and different combinations are needed to make different jams.

On their turn, a player moves their meeple to an unoccupied recipe card. Once there, they can take two actions of these three actions: take all ingredients from the card, exchange unwanted ingredients for an ingredient you want, or make the jam on the occupied recipe card. Players can take the same action twice if possible.

After a recipe card is used, it flips over to reveal a more complicated version of the jam, requiring additional ingredients and scoring more points.

Once someone makes 3 jars (4 jars for 2 people), players finish the round and the game ends.
mechanics: I Cut, You Choose, Set Collection, Turn Order: Progressive, Worker Placement

name: Refugee: Searching for Hope
description:
The Refugee Searching for Hope, is a solo/cooperative game where players must work together to gather resources, build structures to create a safe path and guide the refugee to a safe place, meanwhile avoiding the "Shadow of War" that destroys and consumes everything in their way. The Refugee must reach the safe spot at any cost, even at the player's life.

On your turn you have 4 Action Points that can be spend in multiple and/pr a single action, these actions are:
-Advance on the pathway to discover the land, represented by cards of Resources/Hazards over tiles that create the pathway. But beware you cannot come back.
-Recover Resources, taking 1 Card from the pathway tiles. Be careful not to take too many resources or you will attract the attention of the militia. Look out for the “Hope Cards” this are the most valuable resources but also the most fragile and scarce.
-Guiding People, by moving a group or individual from a tile to an adjacent one by using the Resource necessary to overcome the Hazard. This is the only way to move the Refugee.
-Build a Structure, Structure provides benefits to the players and protection to the Refugee; you must build them to win special actions. This will help you and your fellow travellers.

The danger lurks! After you finish your turn, the pathway is filled with new card representing potential Resources and Hazards, but, if you reveal a “Shadow of War” Card the Shadow of War is going to move towards you, eliminating any “Hope” revealed and destroy everything in their way.

Players will win the game if they built a Campsite in the last tile of the pathway and guide successfully the Refugee to it.

But players will lose the game if any and/or multiple conditions are met:
-The Trial Deck runs out and there aren’t enough cards to refill the pathway, players run out of time and resources!
-The “Shadow of War” consumes the Refugee, you fail had fail your mission.
-All the players have been gravely injured and took out of the pathway, it was too much risk to continue, and you abandoned the refugee.

-description from designer
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Push Your Luck, Race, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: UNO: Disney Fairies
description:
Disney Fairies customized UNO is the pixie-dust filled version of the classic game that combines the magic of Disney Fairies with the fun of UNO! Customized Disney Fairies cards plus the exclusive Flitterific card!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 1-48TACTIC: Race for Gasoline
description:
A mission pack expansion for 1-48TACTIC, set in 1944, during the Ardennes offensive. A small group of German Volksgrenadier fight it off with US Airborne for the control of a fuel dump.
Requires at least 1 starter pack per faction and the basic rulebook, works better with a couple of extra additional figures.

Includes:

a booklets with all the rules;
a unique metal figures of a German soldier running with a jerrycan and a 25mm round plastic base;
three resin fuel dump models (each 80x40mm)
one jerrycan sticks (6 jerrycans);
ten numbered fold and cut-out dummy


markers with corresponding tokens;

three fold and cut-out fuel markers.


Requires items from the base game to play.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Flying Fox Farms
description:
Central California in the 1920's is Mecca to two major industries: farming and aeronautics. In this fertile valley, there is a thriving community of clever and daring foxes who have combined these two skills. The game's charming art-style featuring anthropomorphic foxes and other native critters is sure to delight.

During the flight phase, pilot your biplane miniature through the skies using flight cards. Be careful not to stall out! Spend seeds as you pass through the clouds and push them to form rain clouds - which generate rain water.

During the farming phase, sow seeds on your field, water them to grow produce for your roadside stand. Pay attention to the market to get the highest price.

During the market phase, Use your profits to purchase more seed, expand your farm, and purchase useful tools. Or expand your hanger, and tinker and upgrade your biplane to make it faster and more maneuverable.

The player who is the most successful farmer after three years and the big valley festival (scoring uses a variety of methods including money, objectives, and "neighborliness"), wins the game!
categories: Animals, Aviation / Flight, Dice, Economic, Farming, Miniatures
mechanics: Hand Management, Market, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: The Game of Denver, Pennsylvania
description: A Monopoly-like game released as a fund raiser and promotional item. There are no hotels/houses, just bonuses for collecting groups, and a unique "lottery" system called Lotso for gambling your money. The board is like a directory of businesses local to the small town of Denver, Pennsylvania, including addresses and phone numbers. As in Monopoly, you play until all but one player are bankrupt.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Income, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement, Trading

name: One week ‘till Christmas
description:
The card placement area control board game with Santa's Elves.
It‘s One week ‘till Christmas, you are manager of one team of Elves. Each turn you place one elf on empty space on board (or attack taken one). The stronger elf takes the place at working table. As they need to create as many gifts as they can, the more elves you have on board, the more gift they will create. Player who creates most of the gifts wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Territory Building

name: Stacking Frogs
description:
Ion Award Finalist 2023



In Stacking Frogs, you are the owner of your very own frog circus! Collect colorful frogs by drafting them over three short acts and build up your circus to be the best in the world.

Each act, your hand size will decrease, building tension throughout the game. Your stage can only be 3x3 stacks and each stack can only have 3 cards, but once you place the third card on a stack, it cannot be altered for the rest of the game. But building stacks, while encouraged, is also risky. If you don't fill all 9 spaces of your stage, you'll lose points for each unfilled space.

Most frogs score points at the end of the game but some frogs' abilities trigger immediately such as the pink frog that helps you recruit extra frogs or the green frog that allows you move frogs between stages. These two frogs are powerful and help you ruin your opponent's plans.

For more addictive replayability, dual frogs are thrown into the mix to give more variety and open up entertaining combos such as a yellow frog being worth up to 15 points or adding extra points to each blue frog. With each game lasting around 15 minutes, Stacking Frogs is an entertaining, simple and strategic drafting game for all ages. If you play it once, you'll definitely want to play it again!

—description from the designer

name: The Galaxia Initiative
description:
Take control of a budding galactic empire in the 22nd Century during The Galaxia Initiative, a program where civilizations are encouraged to expand and make their mark on the universe. Colonize planets, work on The Station, construct moons, build alliances and fight important battles while scavenging the scrapyards of the cosmos.


Swap 2 dice on the dynamic, ever changing Galaxy Board.
Create a line of 3 or more rocket dice of the same color or number and recruit them. Use them to colonize planets, build moons, work on The Station or visit the Scrapyard.


Trigger battles with the other empires by meeting collective or singular goals! Find alliances & take advantage of battle only bonuses for unexpected victory.

Your Player Aid is your empire and how you choose to build The Station, acquire attack and scavenge is up to you with variable empire abilities!

The game ends when six battles have been triggered and resolved, ten planets have been conquered by 1 player or a player has worked The Station 15 times. Highest score wins!

—description from the designer
categories: Civilization, Economic, Exploration, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Tug of War, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Kandersteg
description: Once a sleepy Lyran backwater noted primarily for its interesting local dialect and minor industrial exports, Kandersteg found itself much closer to the front lines during the first Clan Invasion of the 3050s. Now, a century later, Kandersteg is thrust into the spotlight in the wake of the Clans' move to conquer Terra, where it finds itself in the center of a budding Tamar liberation movement and home to a fast-growing Hiring Hall as mercenaries from around the Inner Sphere prepare to take the fight to the enemy.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Imagician: Extension 1
description:
The great grimoire of the imagination contains mysterious magic formulas. But you still have to be able to decipher them because you are only an apprentice magician. Will you be able to understand what is taking shape before your eyes?

Follow the formula and guess what you are making appear!
Imagicien is based on the principle of mystery drawing: connect dots to discover what is being drawn.
Discover 64 new cards to renew the game experience.

Requires Imagicien the basic game.

name: Gasolin Verkehrs-Erziehungsspiel
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 115 wins the game. On some spaces events or traffic signs hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published between 1953 and 1956.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Like And Subscribe
description:
Congratulations! You've been hired by CUT to help grow the channel! This means we'll need you to source the best thumbnails and combine them with the funniest keywords and headlines to make sure you get people liking and subscribing your work! You'd better bring your A-game, there's rumors that robots will soon be replacing all of our jobs!

Like and Subscribe! is a party game where players take turns being the judge who submits a thumbnail to the crowd then selecting a winner from the other players' submitted titles.

Each round, the judge player will draw two Thumbnail cards, then choose one of them for players to submit a headline for. All other players will make a headline for the selected Thumbnail by combining a caption and keyword card from their hand. Once all players have submitted their headline, the judge reveals the submissions and selects the winning combination!

The winning player is awarded the Thumbnail card as a point, play continues until all players have judged twice! The player with the most points, wins.

name: Zara
description:
Zara is a game of chance first played in the Middle Ages.

It was most commonly played with three dice, although there were regional variations. Each player would throw the dice, calling out a number at the same time. If the number he called was not the sum of the dice, he would pay a number of coins equal to the number he called; if the number he called was the sum of the dice, he would collect a number of coins equal to the number called.

Zara is mentioned by Dante in the Divine Comedy, Purgatory, VI canto.

The set consists of 3 handmade wooden dice, bag and booklet with rules and anecdotes, including Dante's step. The game can also be played with a dice tower.

name: Fortifications of Moroni: 8 Player Expansion Pack
description: This expansion will allow two more players to added your existing Shipwreck Island game board allowing up to 8 players at once. Expansion includes 2 Pawns, 60 Wall Segment Pieces, 4 Fire markers, 10 Reinforcement Cards, 36 new Wall Segment Cards introducing 2 additional colors, and 2 Game Play Instruction cards. It also includes a larger 6 panel board and 22 new Fortification Plan cards for the 22 new cities. This game requires you have the original edition as well as the 5-6 player expansion pack.

name: Alle Vögel sind schon da!
description:
Players are given four bird figures to roll over a circuit and bring them to a birdhouse over certain target squares. The four-sided birdhouse has only three entrances and is turned each time a 6 is rolled. On some squares, opposing pieces may be hit and sent back to their starting square. The first player to place his four birds in the birdhouse wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Monopoly: Holden 70th Anniversary Edition
description:
Tour the 70th Anniversary Holden Monopoly for the hottest properties: classic Holden vehicles, Assembly Plants and the Lang Lang Proving Ground are all up for grabs. Invest in Service Centres and Dealerships, and then watch the rent come pouring in! Make deals with other players and look out for bargains at auction, there are many ways to get what you want. Stay sharp – because there is only room at the top for one. For everyone else, there’s bankruptcy. Trade your way to success – you can own it all!

—description from the publisher

name: Totenstadt: Vier Pfoten Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Explore the dog school, fight mutants and zombie dogs or find a friend for life!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Erkundet die Hundeschule, bekämpft Mutanten und Zombie Hunde oder findet einen Freund fürs Leben!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Totenstadt: Hausverbot Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Explore the night clubs of the Totenstadt, fight with bouncers and find out what gold is hidden in the safe!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Erkundet die Nachtclubs der Totenstadt, schlagt euch mit Türstehern rum und findet raus was sich goldenes im Tresor versteckt!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Totenstadt: Frischfleisch Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Defend yourselves against Eddie and his cannibals.
Save your victims from being slaughtered as a main course and grab a fancy meat cleaver!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Verteidigt euch gegen Eddie uns seine Kannibalen.
Rettet ihre Opfer davor als Hauptspeise auf der Schlachtbank zu laden und schnappt euch ein schickes Fleicherbeil!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Totenstadt: Zeit des Horters Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

It's Christmas in the Totenstadt and the Hoarder is on the way!
Take care of your equipment and prevent thieving elves from getting their hands on it.
Then there is Robert the reindeer ...

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the publisher (translated)

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Es ist Weihnachten in der Totenstadt und der Horter ist unterwegs!
Passt auf eure Ausrüstung auf und verhindert das diebische Elfen sie in ihre Hände bekommen.
Dann ist da noch Robert das Renntier ...

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Heckonomics
description:
The objective of players is to gain as much money as possible by the end of the game. During the game players roll the dice and choose where to travel to within the limitations of their roll. After landing they can take an applicable action. This mostly involves investment in companies or political actions. Players are able to influence the population of the city in order to gain votes. This allows them to make political decisions that can impact the financial situation in the game.

—description from the designer

name: Pog Surf'n Toss Game
description: Toss your Pogs onto a teetering “seasaw,” while keeping them from sliding off. Use strategy to bounce off or slide under the central Pogman. Get rid of all your milkcaps first to win.

name: Lauf und kauf Persil 59
description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start in front of their respective tracks. The first to reach space 17 wins the game. On the numbered intersections of both tracks events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport – Kite Bomber
description:
A new monster card for Battle for Greyport.

The promo card comes from The Red Dragon Inn: Battle for Greyport: Store Event Kits – Season 2

Damage: Black die
Title: Kite Bomber
Hit Points: 6
Text Box: If you defeat Kite Bomber with Snipe damage, deal (black die) damage to a pirate ship or location monster
Threat: 1
Faction: Pirates
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: 5MAL5
description:
In this game inspired by a television format, players must attempt to guess 5 letter words similar to word mastermind. If the guesser manages to guess the word within 5 rounds, he may draw 2 chips, which he places on his bingo board. The guessing right changes to the opponent if the player fails to think of a guess word within a certain time, fails to find the correct word after 5 rounds or draws a red ball while drawing the chips. The first player to complete a bingo row wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Schnauferl-Rennen im Revier
description:
The players take turns to roll and move their cars. They start at "Start". The first to reach "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as "Das große Weinachts-Würfelspiel der WAZ" in the Christmas 1965 edition of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die WAZ Flaschenpost
description:
The players take turns to roll and move their bottles. They start at space 1 (Rheinhausen). The first to reach "Ziel" (Zeeland) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The Game was publishes in the Christmas 1963 issue of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ)"

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: それやっぱボクの！ (Sore Yappa Bokuno!)
description:
それやっぱボクの！ (Sore Yappa Bokuno!) is a card game from Japan. Players are babies, squabbling over who gets the toys and baby bottles.

Each player has cards marked I Want! or I Don't Want!. Object cards are dealt up and players place their cards face-down on these. When the cards are turned up, the player with a lone I Want! collects the card. But if more than one has placed I Want! on an object, nobody gets it.

Players are trying to build up sets and score points to win the game.
user summary

name: Revier-Spiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start in Essen. The first to return to Essen wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published in the April 1985 issue of the "Westdeutsche Allgemeine Zeitung (WAZ).

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Track Movement

name: Totenstadt: Angriff der Killer-Kürbisse Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

The Totenstadt is criss-crossed by a network of pumpkin tendrils, pumpkin fields clog the streets and a crazy professor is about to create a huge monster pumpkin!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the city of the dead basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters!

—description from the designer

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Die Totenstadt wird wird von einem Netz von Kürbisranken durchzogen, Kürbisfelder verstopfen die Straßen und ein verrückter Professor will einen gewaltigen Monster Kürbis erschaffen!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!

—description from the designer (German)
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies

name: What Cause The Big Whoopsie?
description:
A catastrophic event known as 'The Big Whoopsie' has wiped out most of the humans across the planet. "Oh heck!" I hear you say.

All that is left to do for the survivors is to pin the blame on someone... obviously.

As a head of one of these organisations, you must piece together the remnants of the world and discover if it was a Nuclear no no, a WOAH! Winter, a nasty Nature or if it was Aliens!... Ahhhh!

...and find out once and for all, what caused the Big Whoopsie.

What Caused The Big Whoopsie is a 2-4 player game involving drafting, secret objectives, secret bidding and tile matching with transparent plastic cards, all around the glorious apocalypse!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, City Building, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Victory Points, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Auction

name: Silvis
description:
The Silvis Woods are home to many small Critter vying to survive, and the constant threat of the expanding presence of the Predators of the Lobus and Vulporo families brings greater threats.

Take an ever growing family of Critters and explore the diverse Silvis Woods all the while avoiding Predators and attempting to save as many of your family as you can from the evil Dens and deliver to the great Usates. Usates can only truly rescue one family, and they must have enough Sustenance to be saved. Which unique family will make it?

In Silvis up to 4 Players will be racing against one another, and the distinctive Predator threat by laying new Forest tiles, playing Cards that can completely alter the state of the board and can cause some ruthless combinations.

All whilst trying to balance how many Critters to keep in the Woods, each one you save nets you a point, but each one you keep gives you more action points each turn. A game of cute Critters and idyllic forest backdrops with a very large dose of player interaction for those evil enough.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Movement, Map Addition, Pieces as Map, Race, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Tile Placement

name: Hy-Yah!
description:
Hy-Yah! is a card based physical duel where each card may have two different attacks, for tens of thousands of possible outcomes. Draft different decks to simulate fatigue and strategise on how to bluff and beat your opponent into submission.

A simple and quick 2 player rock-paper-scissors style card game that fits into a tin, where after drafting each deck at the start of the game players take their hands and simultaneously reveal a two sided cards. These cards range from jabs and uppercuts, to flying kicks and meditation, each one being a counter for another type of ability.

Choosing not only which card, but which side of the card to play is the key to whittling down your opponents health and winning the most rounds.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Totenstadt: Meister der Illusion Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

The cult of blood rages in the Totenstadt. As if zombies and mutants weren't enough, you now also have to deal with blood horrors, suicides and insane blood rituals!

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters.
-------------------------------------------------------------------
Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Der Kult des Blutes wüttet in der Totenstadt.
Als würden Zombies und Mutanten nicht schon genug sein bekommt ihr es jetzt auch nocht mit Blutschrecken, Selbstmördern und irren Blutritualen zu tun!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Totenstadt: Infizierter Glaube Booster
description:
This booster expands Totenstadt by 21 new cards!

Father Harry calls for church service in the Totenstadt. Disciples and acolytes prepare for baptism, and a priest needs your help to save his flock from Father Harry and his evil minions.

The cards can simply be mixed up with the Totenstadt basic box and the missions can be expanded with new possibilities and encounters


Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!Pater Harry ruft zum Gottesdienst in der Totenstadt.
Jünger und Messdiener bereiten sich auf die Taufe vor und ein Pater braucht eure Hilfe um seine Schäfchen zu retten.

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land
description:
Quiz Kids in Ice Cream Land is an educational and entertaining family game. It encourages children's desire to improve their mental ability. The aim is to help children develop their skills in logic and recall. Most children will easily handle 50% of the questions, within their age level. However, since the game is won by the roll of the dice, all players have an equal chance of winning. The player who gets to the end of the track first, wins.

Players roll the dice to determine the number of spaces they will move on the board if they answer their question correctly; the questions are colour-coded into three levels of difficulty according to age.

Includes a plush die, five plush playing pieces, and a cloth game board (all washable) as well as a set of question cards.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Urlaubsspiel
description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home in the upper left corner of the game sheet. The first to reach the travel agency in the center of the game sheet wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Die ARAG in Europa
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach the ARAG building in Düsseldorf wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Game board may be paper or very light, foldable, card stock.

It's the ARAG-Zentrale from the 1960s (Architect: Paul Schneider-Esleben)
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Das große HÖRZU-Verkehrsspiel
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at home at the lower left corner of the game map. The first to reach the finish at the upper left corner wins the game. On the paces with traffic signs traffic situations hinder or benefit the players.

Originally publised in HÖR ZU magazine.
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Das lustige Würfelspiel: Hol' das Brot vom Bäcker
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". The first to reach space 17, the bakery, wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Likely a 1970s or 1980s publication.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Bärenmarke Almenspiel
description: Typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Das fröhliche Ferienspiel
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at "Start". On some spaces events cause the players to gain or lose points. Sometimes event cards are drawn. Some of the rules of the game are integrated in the game board. The player with the most points wins the game.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Vom Korn zum Brotgenuss
description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space "Start". The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Multi
description:
Multi is a simple family card game with the aim of teaching children multiplication.

The game has a number of cards with numbers from 1 to 12 which are factors and more cards with numbers up to 144 which are results. During the game, players have a combination of these in their hand.

On your turn, you may play a result card if there are two factor cards on the table which make up the correct result for your result card and collect all the cards to your score pile. If you can't do this, you have to play a new factor card to the table. After playing, a player's hand is refilled.

The game ends when the draw deck is exhausted. The payer with the most sets, wins.

There is no publication year stated but the packaging suggests 1940s or 1950s.

name: Bärenstark
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The trip takes place in East Germany and the game was created by the German Communist Party.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 100 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The rules of the game are integrated in the game board.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Solo / Solitaire Game, Track Movement

name: Die Gewürzlandreise
description: A typical roll and move type promotional board game. The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 76 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mixed Pickles
description:
A dexterity party game from the late 19th century comprising sets of wonderful, polished wooden misshapes (the pickles) and a rack's-worth of pointed, wooden handled 'lifting spikes'(!).

Each player receives set of the pickle pieces and two spikes; starting with the Turnip piece, they try and lift the piece into the 'jar' - if they stand up OR drop the piece their turn is over. The first player to drop the turnip in chooses the next piece, all others set their turnips aside for end game penalty scoring.

The rules mention an extra rule for 'Tittups' - pieces that don't seem to exist in any edition this reporter has seen (and I've seen three different editions, one of which removes all mention of Tittups altogether).

Different editions presented in cylindrical, square and octagonal bottles have been confirmed.

—user summary

name: The BMX Race Game
description:
A simple roll & move race game with a few opportunities for delay by other players and obstacles on the board. Includes a folding board, dice and 4 standard bicyclist pieces.

—user summary

name: Reit-Turnier
description:
Players roll their show jumper over a start-finish course. Along the way, they can encounter squares with events that either set them back or let them advance further. The player who reaches the finish line first wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Necromunda: Underhive – Outcasts Gang Tactics Cards
description:
This set contains 26 cards for use in Necromunda games.

18 Outcast Gang Cards
8 Blank Fighter Cards

Requires Necromunda Rulebook and Book of the Outcast to use.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Science Fiction

name: Verliebte Jagd
description:
