A game for 2 teenagers in love. One takes the role of the hunter, the other the role of the little bird. After one round, the game is played again with swapped roles.
Both players move their figures by throwing the dice over a start-finish course. At the beginning of the game, the little bird has ducats, which must be paid out to the hunter every now and then. If the ducats run out, the bird must draw and fulfil task cards. These tasks are suitable for impressing shy teenagers from the 1970s. Example: "Dance with me." Whoever has the largest sum of ducats and task cards after both rounds wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pōpoki
description:
OVERVIEW: You are a feral cat trying to leave the abandoned Royal Gardens subdivision on the Big Island of Hawai’i. You will try to make your way over a recent flow field of smooth, glassy pāhoehoe lava without hurting yourself. If you can make it to Highway 130, then maybe you’ll get picked up and taken to a shelter in the nearby town of Pahoa.

DETAILS: You roll dice to determine the journey the cat will take across lava. Along the way, you draft abilities by playing "akamai" cards. These allow you to change the path of your journeys, to avoid losing life points or whiskers. After six rounds, your score (whiskers multiplied by life points) reflects how well you survived the overall journey.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action Drafting, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Lunar Warrior Luna
description:
Switch up your gameplay with Luna! This Spellslinger is just as ecstatic to share her powers as she is to switch cards. Keep your opponent guessing with all new card effects—including "Word Wall," which gets stronger the more words your opponent has in their spell's text box—and super protective spells to keep you well in the game!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

name: Spellslingers Velocity Expansion: Prodigal Sorcerer Kyugen
description:
Kyugen is back with a vengeance! Arm your deck with 16 new spells, and a new Kyugen character card with an ability that rewards you for playing Legendary and Signature spells! Kyugen has several tools at his disposal to dispatch threats with superior counters, blocking, and card draw, keeping you several steps above any opponent!

Velocity Expansions have unique frames, allowing you to shuffle them into and out of any other Spellslingers deck quickly and without issue!

This Velocity Expansion includes 18 new cards! x1 character card x1 lore card x16 spell cards (4 of each type).

name: すみっコぐらし おさんぽカードゲーム (Sumikko Gurashi Card Game)
description:
A game consist of 54 Cards (Can be used as standard poker card).
Most cards show a road on or pavement on it. Join the roads and pavement, first to play all the cards win.
A special placement rule for 8 sets of 3-cards combinations and 4 sets of 2-cards combinations.
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Set Collection

name: Dessert Party
description:
Designed in Hong Kong.
Players are pâtissiers, gathering fruits in the market to make tasteful pastries.
The best pâtissier make the highest value and number of pastries.
Strive to be the Best!

Simple Rules:

Move along the ring-shaped street with shops and supplies yourself with fruit's materials.
Using 5 identical fruit's material to upgrade to processed fruit. You may have to "borrow" your fellow pâtissiers to aid one's upgrade.
Produce one of the two requested dessert with your processed fruits. These dessert will act to your points and also give you special abilities to aid your gather/upgrade process.


Be the first to hit the point target and become the best pâtissiers.

There is a point target for different player count.
publishers: (Self-Published), Board Game Walker 桌遊行者

name: Happy Hats Beginning Reading Game
description:
Players journey through the alphabet in this board game, creating 3-letter words along the way and collecting Hat tokens as rewards for successfully creating words."

Each player starts the game with 5 word ending cards. They spin the spinner and move to a spcace, ahich has a letter that use to begin a word. If the can spell a word with one or more cards, using the first letter from the board, they get a hat token.

The game is over when all players reach The End. The player who collected the most Hat Tokens during the game is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Spelling, Track Movement

name: The Teams Courtyard (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
When the construction of that courtyard was completed, everyone realized that they were part of the same community. Something bigger than the mere sum of their individualities. Something that reunited them with an unprecedented force regardless of their origins, their beliefs, or their social stratum... at that moment they stopped competing and started helping each other, sharing the infrastructures and resources that this new and beautiful city was offering them.
This commemorative tile was created by Carcassonne.cat for the first online team world championship of Carcassonne on the Boardgamearena platform (WTCOC 2020).

• RULES FOR TILE PLACEMENT:
This tile is mixed with the rest of the tiles in the game. The player who draws it can place it following the standard rules of the game. Note that the tile has the city on all 4 sides and these are joined at the corners (it's not a dividing tile, it's quite the opposite).
The city that contains The Teams Courtyard tile will not take into account the regular system of who has the most meeples to designate who wins the points for that city (completed or not). You only need to have at least 1 meeple in order to get points from that city. The player who plays The Teams Courtyard tile will be able to place an additional farmer in the yard if he wishes to.

name: The Roads of Europe (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
This mini expansion has been designed by Carcassonne.cat to celebrate the first European (Online) Team Championship. In doing so, we have encapsulated elements of the global Covid-19 pandemic such as the recommendation to use a protective mask to minimize the spread of the virus, and the need for self-isolation among those who may have been in contact with it.
Thus, the meeple with stars between the two roads depicted on the tile symbolizes the geographical context of the championship and the exceptional situation in Europe, and throughout the rest of the world.

Setup

The Roads of Europe tile should be mixed in with the other tiles as usual

How to use the tile

Following the basic rules for laying tiles, proceed as normal according to the following cases.

In 2-player games, promote a more competitive use

When a player draws this tile and places it such that it extends a road (or roads), any meeple(s) occupying these roads must immediately be removed from them without scoring. These meeples have been in contact with the virus and must go home to self-isolate! The active player must then place each removed meeple into separate incomplete and unoccupied cities of his choice, somewhere on the landscape. Meeples may not be moved into any city that is already occupied.
If there are not enough unoccupied cities available to accommodate all removed meeples separately, the active player chooses which meeples to place and which to return to their owner. After all removed meeples have either been moved to cities or returned to their owners, the active player is granted a bonus turn and must draw a new tile and place it according to the usual rules.
If the tile is placed on an unclaimed road (i.e. one without a meeple), it may not be claimed by the active player and no bonus turn is given.
The road may be extended on subsequent turns, but may not be claimed until such time that it is completed. The player that completes the road may choose to claim and score it, as per the usual rules, as long as they have at least one meeple in their supply.

With 3 or more players, promote a more playful and fun use -

The rules for games with more than two players follow the same rules as outlined above for games with two players, but with one exception: when the road is closed, all players who have not closed the road will lose as many points as there are tiles on the road.

Special cases


While meeples may never be placed as thieves on any of the road segments on the special tile, the fields are safe from the virus and may be claimed according to the usual rules by a meeple as a farmer.



There may be a situation where the placement of the special tile automatically closes a road. In that case, if there are meeples on it, they would return to their owners and the player who placed the tile would not be able to claim the road and the other players would not lose points either.



In the case of playing with expansions, all the tiles with special effects would disappear as part of the road expansion before closing. In any case, the tokens could still be used as normal tokens. Example: The mini tunnel expansion contributes to the expansion of the road without adding any special effects, but the princess and the dragon or inns and cathedrals contain symbols that are canceled when they are part of the road.

name: Flying Colors: Beat to Quarters, Vol II
description:
Beat to Quarters, Vol II (Serpents of the Seas) is an official expansion to Serpents of the Seas by GMT Games, LLC and requires a copy of that game to play.

One of the most common criticisms of the Flying Colors system is the clutter of status markers on the map and that they may detract from game play. This concern can be minimized somewhat by using status sheets and a handy pencil to keep track of things on paper. This, however, adds a separate record-keeping aspect that the design of the game goes out of its way to avoid.

Beat to Quarters provides the ultimate way by which to keep track of the status of individual ships through the use of individual tracking cards that are kept conveniently near the map and that are laid out to conveniently hold a variety of status markers such as Broadsides Fired, Sail State, Rigging Damage, and Hull Damage. The cards are designed to be printed at a standard 3.5 by 2.5 inch size so that they can be slipped into card protectors for extended usage.

Individual tracking cards are included for all 255 individually named ships included with Serpents of the Seas. But that’s not all!

As a bonus, Beat to Quarters also includes the print-and-play components for an entirely new way to play Serpents of the Seas. Drawing from games such as Naval War, Modern Naval Battles, and (in particular) Enemy in Sight, Beat to Quarters can be played with just the ship tracking cards, a special set of markers and 8.5 x 11 inch tracking board, and the status markers from Serpents of the Seas. The ship cards are organized into squadrons that maneuver and fire against the opposing fleet within a relatively small playing area. With Beat to Quarters, you can play the huge battles without the space requirements for several game maps.

NOTE: This volume of Beat to Quarters only includes marker sheets for the British, French, and American fleets. There are insufficient Spanish, Venetian, and East India Company ships to form a fleet, but these ships can be included in the fleets of the other nationalities as desired or added to the cards from the first volume of Beat to Quarters.

With Beat to Quarters, you can either enhance or completely change your enjoyment of Serpents of the Seas!
Card play modifications to Flying Colors.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, American Revolutionary War, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Napoleonic, Nautical, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Treasures of Olympus
description:
The Olympian gods are up to their usual mischief, again! In this Greek mythological game, you'll assume the hidden identity of an Olympian god. Zeus has granted you the ability to wield his Thunderbolts in a Tournament of the gods. You’ll capture mythological creatures as you build an army to command in an epic contest for fame, fortune and most of all, bragging rights in Mt. Olympus. In this mystically veiled bidding and battling game, the god that scores the most points wins.

This is a fun, fast paced action game that is played in three distinct phases, the capture, command and scoring phases. As part of the game, there is a hidden god role card that each player has assumed. Only the gods know when you'll reveal your god identity and how your divine power will be used to enhance your play and stifle others.

In the capture phase, using a bidding style mechanic, you’ll use your limited supply of Thunderbolt tokens to capture mythological creatures from around the table. Gathering information is a key element of this phase because each player will only be allowed to see the creature’s strengths on other players stands. Their own creature card will be on a stand facing away from them and therefore unknown. So, if you surrender, you’ll need to take the lowest strength creature you can see.

After the capture phase, each player will then command their army of mythological creatures one at a time to battle for treasures! This phase is an epic competition for various treasures (gold, armor, valor, temples and worshippers) that only interest the gods. Treasure cards have different point values that range between 1 - 10 and various symbols that are part of your set collections and end game scoring. But be aware that worshippers, the 9 and 10 point value treasure cards, don't have any symbols while the golden Apple, the 1 and 2 point value treasure cards, have a wild symbol that can be used in any one of your set collections.

After all the battling and treasure collecting is done, it’s time to move into the scoring phase and tally up your scores. Unused thunderbolts, treasure cards, set collections (combination of creatures and treasure cards) and any god card bonuses all count towards your grand total. The player, or Olympian god with the most points wins and gets bragging rights in Olympus... for now.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Mythology
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Hidden Roles, Selection Order Bid, Set Collection

name: Nur noch 4 Plätze!
description:
The players form two teams and take turns to roll and move. Each team controls four pawns. They start at home at space 1 and have to reach the train station at space 35. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The first team to get four pawns to the train station wins the game.

The game was published just after WWII. It came in an envelope and the meeples consisted of small aluminium cylinders, perhaps leftovers from other productions.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Mission: Bathroom Run
description:
You’re snuggled up warm and drowsy in your bed when it strikes: the need to use the bathroom. If you try to just clench down and ignore it, you could ruin your comfy cozy bed and have to wake up your parents. So you decide to navigate your way past spooky shadows and scary noises to relieve your need so you can get back to bed and finally fall to sleep.

Mission: Bathroom Run is a game for 2 or more players. The only thing required is 1 six-sided die per player and 1 deck of playing cards for every 2 players. Draw a card, roll a die, and see if you make it to the bathroom!

—description from the designer

name: Miau-Mäh-Muh!
description:
On each of 36 cards are 2 to 6 different animals. The cards are laid out face down. The player whose turn it is rolls the dice and tries to uncover a card with the animal on it. If the player succeeds, he may collect the cards that have been revealed so far, or continue rolling the dice and reveal another card. If the player does not succeed, all revealed cards must be turned over again and it is the next player's turn. The player who collects the most cards wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Push Your Luck

name: Funkstille
description:
The players set up their satellite dishes between the two planets with the spikes pointing at the double lines on their respective spaces. Then the players take turns rolling a die and rotating one of their dishes according to he result of the roll.
The first player to get to align the spikes in a straight line between the planets wins the game.

—user summary

name: Name Dropping
description:
Name Dropping is the frustratingly fun movie card game. Challenge your friends and family to hours of fast paced fun as you listen to clues to guess the titles of Hollywood's biggest films. Comes with over 300 movie trivia cards, featuring blockbusters, indie films, superhero movies, cult classics, musicals, and much more.

Each Name Dropping card comes with 6 clues, ranked hardest to easiest, that relate to a particular movie, clues include actors/actresses, a quote, and a fun trivia fact, to help you figure out the movie name. Each card also comes with a clue genre, which gives you a snapshot description of the movie, to help guide your guessing.

One team-mate reads the clues, while the rest try to guess the answer as quickly as possible. If the team guesses correctly, they keep the card and add points.

name: Großes Mäuserennen durchs Labyrinth
description: The Players start at the upper right and the lower left corner of the maze und take turns to move their mouse one space per turn. The first player to reach the center of the maze wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Square Grid

name: The Towers of the Black Prince (fan expansion for Carcassonne)
description:
Édouard Plantagenêt, better known as the Black Prince (1330-1376), was the eldest son of Edward III of England and Philippa of Hainaut. The origin of his nickname is uncertain. Some associate it with the colour of his armour; others refer to his reputation for brutality on the battlefield.

The Black Prince's "ride" in 1355 was a devastating raid. In Carcassonne, the upper town (city) remains untouched, but the lower town disappears in flames. In Narbonne, the suburbs, devoid of defences, were destroyed. Retracing his steps, Édouard took the Chemin de Gascogne, set fire to Miremont, destroyed Carbonne, Gimont and returned to his Bordeaux lands without difficulty.

Here, the Black Prince's army is represented by a wooden black tower figure (a black chess rook). The black tower will move around the playing area like the dragon (see Expansion 3 - The Princess & the Dragon), destroying any towers it encounters. It will capture all the followers placed on them.

Towers cannot capture any follower placed on the same tile as the black tower. The black tower cannot be removed from the game even by the dragon.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Incohearent: Fresh Phrases Expansion Pack
description: Our addicting guess-the-gibberish game just had a baby, and it’s the Incohearent Fresh Phrases Expansion pack. With 180 new gibberish cards to be added to the Incohearent Core game, hilarious game nights are guaranteed. A rotating judge holds a card up so that only they can see the answer, but everyone else sees the Incohearent phrase. Everyone else reads the front of the card aloud. Whoever decodes the phrase first wins the card.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Spray-Spiel
description:
There are 4 large and 12 small cards, that allow 3 different kinds of play:

- Each player gets a large card. The small cards lie bottom up on the table. The players take turns turning up a card. If the card belongs to the player's large card, he keeps it. Otherwise the card is returned to the table. The first player to get all 3 small cards belonging to his large card wins the game.

- Trump game: A player calls a trump card, f.i. "living room". Now the other players add a fitting card. The last player who is able to do this, collects the played cards and call a new trump card. The player who collects the most card wins the game. This game is played only with the small cards.

- Terzett game: All small cards are dialed among the players, who take turns to draw cards from one another to collect trios. Each player gets a large card to act as a wild card. The player with the most trios wins.

The pictures on the cards illustrate the correct use of aerosol sprays.

name: デコニファ (Deconifer)
description:
デコニファ (Deconifer) is a co-operative dexterity game of stacking from Japan. The playing area is a large wooden board showing a fir tree with ribbons, which stands propped up at an angle (much like a stepladder). Players take turns placing toys and gifts on the tree, starting from the bottom and working up.

There are some horizontal lines across sections of the tree. If a gift is placed so that it crosses a line, decorative balls and ribbons can also be hung on the tree. The game ends when a placed object falls from the tree.

At the end of the game, players can work out a score and see how well they did in decorating the tree. If they are careful, they will complete decorating the tree with a Santa and a golden star at the top.

The designer has specialised in highly ornate games made using woodburning techniques. The game features a large number of intricately designed, hand-made pieces, brightly coloured to produce a highly attractive design. As a result, only a few copies are made, and sell for a high price (approx $400).
user summary

name: Anabid!: Bid, Spell, and Steal
description:
In Anabid!, players compete to outspell, outbid and outwit their opponents to achieve the highest score.

After the custom 6- and 8-sided lettered dice are rolled, the first player states a word length and bids how many words that long they think they can spell. Each subsequent bid must increase the number of words or the word length.

Each player has a scant few seconds to make a bid and each bid is an opportunity to drive the next player to unwisely overbid -- a core strategy. The top bidder has a minute to fulfil his bid.

Words with greater lengths garner higher scores. To counter Aunt Edna's dictionary memorization, however, the game includes a clever mechanism that enables a would-be thief to steal the bid score! After each player has rolled three times (with the middle round in reverse order), the player with the highest score wins!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Spelling

name: Smeghead and the Dares
description:
Are You Ready to Dare: Smeghead card game is here to transform every moment of boredom into an entertaining party game that you won’t get tired of! This game is the ideal combination of skill and luck, where the only purpose is to have fun while testing your courage with silly or brave challenges.

Endless Hours of Fun: You don’t need to be a mastermind to play this party game for kids, as the only requirement is to be open to challenges and tons of fun. Our game is based on silly, hilarious, or bold dares, perfect to break the monotony and share endless moments of fun and laughter with your friends.

For All the Family: If you are older than 14 and have a good sense of humor and passion for life, this card game is perfect for you! Gather your family, friends, or colleagues outside work and embark on an unforgettable experience full of tension, laughter, competition, and see if you are up to the challenge.

Party Ice Breaker: Whether you plan to meet with your friends on a night out or want to change the atmosphere in your house, the Smeghead adult card games are definitely the right choice. They are perfect for birthday parties, anniversaries, family reunions, trips, holidays, or other events.

Easy to Play: The Smeghead family card game contains 4 types of cards and an easy-to-read guide, which makes this game extremely easy to play. Daring, uneasy, and super fun, this game will get you hooked from the first hand, dragging you into endless rounds of fun and dares.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Single Loser Game

name: Wörterlegen-Lotto
description:
First, 15 picture cards are distributed according to the lotto rules (3 picture cards per tray). Then letter cards for the 4-letter words are called out. Since the letters are needed several times, speed is also important here in order to be the first to fill the board. Whoever manages to do this wins the game.

—user summary

name: Afrika macht Schule
description:
A cooperative game about the rural school situation in Africa. 36 cards are laid out face down in a 6x6 grid.
Players roll the dice and move one of 3 pieces across the grid, but may not jump over gaps. The card you leave is revealed.
On 5 cards there are obstacles to learning (e.g. lack of school fees), which have to be removed immediately after uncovering in order to win the game. To remove a learning obstacle, an already uncovered photo pair must be removed from the grid. 4 turtle cards (recognizable on the back) help when it gets tough on the playing field. 1 monkey card causes trouble and all cards are unrevealed.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Square Grid

name: Rhino 5
description:
Rhino 5 is a cooperative card-based crisis management board game for 2-4 players.

Players form the crew of an old mining spacecraft, caught in a deadly meteor storm after an immense catastrophe that has engulfed the solar system. Play cards and use special skills, as you work together to repair damage to your ship. All while simultaneously trying to avoid incoming meteors, which will continue hitting the ship until you reach and complete a hidden objective.

Play isolated scenarios, or take part in a solar-system spanning campaign to save the people of Earth and discover what caused the catastrophe in the first place.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Pass Order, Worker Placement

name: Totenstadt: Kälteeinbruch Booster
description:
This booster adds 21 new cards to Totenstadt!

It's getting cold in the Totenstadt.
The zombies don't care about the cold, the mercenaries do.
So wrap up in warm clothes, light fire barrels, keep your balance on the slippery roads and free snowbound survivors.

But beware!
In every snow hill, a zombie can be waiting for your helping hand!

The cards can be easily mixed with the Totenstadt basic box and expand the missions with new possibilities and encounters!

Dieser Booster erweitert Totenstadt um 21 neue Karten!

Es wird kalt in der Totenstadt.
Den Zombies macht die Kälte nichts aus den Söldnern schon.
Daher hüllt euch in wärmende Kleidung, zündet Feuertonnen an, haltet das gleichgewicht auf den glatten Straßen und befreit eingeschneite Überlebende.

Aber vorsicht!
In jedem Schneehügel kann ein Zombie auf eure helfende Hand warten!

Die Karten können einfach mit der Totenstadt Basisbox vermischt werden und die Missionen mit neuen Möglichkeiten und Begegnungen erweitern!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Fighting, Horror, Zombies
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chipmunk Chompers
description:
In the Chipmunk Choppers game, kids learn letters, matching, spelling and pattern recognition while having fun. The object of the game is to pick nuts off the tree to find the right letters or colors to match the pattern on the card. But it's not simply finger picking-players use a cool chomper mechanism to collect the nuts.

Be the first player to earn the most cards by gathering the correct acorns to spell words or complete patterns.

There are 3 ways to play Chipmunk Chompers™ game: Match & Spell, Complete the Pattern and Acorn Chomp.

Match & Spell - First player to complete 3 cards wins!
Complete the Pattern - The first player to complete 5 cards wins!
Acorn Chomp - The player with the most acorns wins!
mechanics: Matching, Pattern Recognition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Angry Birds Lunar Launcher and Planet Base Playset
description:
Angry Birds Lunar Launcher and Planet Base play set. Based on the best-selling phone app game, Angry Birds, kids can now play their favourite app game in real life! This set offers two different ways to play - you can mount the planet base on the wall (using the included 3M Command strip technology) or place it on a table. The gravity-defying blocks and pigs and a handheld launcher allow kids to build, launch and destroy like never before! Includes: handheld launcher, planet base station, mounting bracket, 3 popular Angry Birds, 3 pigs, 10 blocks and bonus pieces and 2 x 3M Command strips. Suitable for ages 5+.

Object: To score points by knocking down pigs, blocks and bonus pieces to score the most points.Level 1• Decide who will build the castle on the planet base and who will launch birds to try and knock it down!• Build a castle on the Planet Base. You may design your castle any way you want, but you must use ALL the blocks, pigs and bonus pieces.• Launch the birds at the castle. You get three tries, one for each bird.When launching a bird, hold the launcher in one hand, and then put your finger in the launcher ring to pull it back. Then let go and watch it fly!

Any pig you knock off is worth 2 points, and any bonus piece you knock off is worth one point. NOTE: if the pig or bonus piece is still attached to a block when you knock it off, it still counts.• Add up your points, then switch roles so that the player who launched the birds now builds the castle, and the person who built the castle will now launch the birds.• After both players have had a chance to score points, compare the results. The player with the highest score wins the round.• If there is a tie score, the round doesn’t count and you must play it over.• First player to win 2 rounds is the winner!Level 2• Level 2 is exactly the same game play as Level 1 but the scoring is different. It’s a little more complicated but there’s also a chance for more points!• Just like in Level 1, you have 3 chances (1 for each bird) to knock things off. But in Level 2, you also get points for knocking off blocks! Also, EVERYTHING is worth more points.• Pigs are worth 75 points, Long Blocks are worth 50 points, Short Blocks are worth 25 points and Bonus Pieces are worth 10 points. • Just like in Level 1, compare points to determine the winner of each round. If there is a tie score, the round doesn’t count and you must play it over.• First player to win 2 rounds is the winner!

name: Summon Guardians
description:
Summon Guardians is a 2-4 player war strategy board game. It combines the spirit of fantasy and adventure with strategic castle warfare. Players join an epic, centuries-old war for the realm of Quadrenna. Here, four Kingdoms battle over a centrally located territory known as the Wastelands. The main Battlefield of this war is the intersection of these Kingdoms, where each struggles to prevent the other from achieving victory.

Through their Queens, the four Kingdoms summon Guardians from throughout time and around the galaxy in an attempt to gain control of the Wastelands. The Kingdoms’ main tools for winning the war are their two Guardians, each of which has unique strengths and weaknesses. Although the Guardians’ attitudes about being summoned vary, they all loyally serve their Kingdoms and find high honor in their duty.

Each turn consists of 3 phases, in this order: Move, Card, and Action. The Move and Action phases are optional, but the Card phase is required. Both Guardians act during each phase; you can choose the order in which your Guardians act.

A Kingdom achieves victory when it obtains ownership of the Wastelands. This is achieved one of three ways: kill all enemy Guardians, kill all enemy Kings, or take ownership of the Red Jewel Platform in the center by sacrificing 5 Red Jewels to it after your Kingdom is fully Upgraded.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Line of Sight, Player Elimination

name: Colony X
description:
In Colony X, you play the role of a space foreman working for a billion dollar corporation. Your mission? Establish a sustainable colony on a distant planet.

Colony X is a 2-4 player game featuring area control and colony building. Each turn players land one of their ships on a nearby planet to collect two resources from an ever-changing pool of resources or use one of their ships to visit an architect to construct a new building for their colony. But be warned, after construction future buildings will cost less for your opponents.

The game takes place over four rounds. At the end of each round, the player with the most ships on a planet gains its influence token which is needed to complete work orders and increase the value of certain buildings.

At the end of the final round, the player with the most Victory Points tallied from their buildings, influence, and completed work orders is the winner.
categories: Card Game, City Building, Space Exploration
mechanics: Action Points, Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: The Silk Route
description:
The world is getting more and more connected. As an owner of a distribution company, it is up to you to make your company grow and deliver goods all over the world.

The Silk Route is a flip and write game where players have a distribution company. Deliver the appropriate goods to different cities and squares inside these cities, by drawing posts of your own. Right after, draw a poliomino in your company panel to represent the experience you got with each transaction.

Eventually, squares will have all their necessities covered. It's the moment to see how your goods increase their value! Use these values to score more points than any other player and have the most prestigious company by the end of the game!

—description from the designer

name: Wer ist zuerst in der Schule?
description:
Each player moves his figure towards the school by rolling the dice (values 1 to 5). On green fields you may roll the dice again, on red fields you have to sit out. If you roll the teacher symbol with the dice, you move the teacher one space further. All players who reach the school before the teacher win the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wann war's
description:
The game contains 105 question cards asking for the year of a certain event. Each player makes a guess and names a year. Whoever comes closest to the correct answer receives the card as a prize. The player who has collected the most cards after a predetermined number of questions wins the game.

—user summary

name: Rainbow
description:
Rainbow: The Kaleidoscopic Flip and Colour Adventure!

Players use the colour and shape cards to fill in their grid in order to collect points and bonuses. Complete as many squares as you can or colour all of the rainbow, unicorn or unicorn shoes!

—description from the designer

name: The Ghosts of Rocca
description:
The Ghosts of Rocca is a worker-placement game for 2-5 players, ages 8 and up. As a player, you control two necromancer characters, moving them around a haunted castle in an effort to soothe the castle’s restless ghosts by bringing them the enchanted charms they crave. But beware! If you enter a room occupied by a rival necromancer, you are bound by honor to duel — and if you lose, your rival may take a charm from you!

In addition to worker-placement, the game features resource-management, area control and optional combat. Movement is accomplished by a combination of cards and custom dice. Come heed the call to honor and adventure!

—description from the publisher

name: The Knights of King Frea
description:
King Frea - King of Weirdland - has decided to give one of his sons/daughters in marriage to the bravest knight in the kingdom.
Each player will assume the role of a knight and will compete with each other to get the Royal Consideration needed to ask the prince/princess in marriage.

The knights will have to manage their Energy, change the rules of the game with the right Spells, collect Gold and Reputation and complete the Challenges that fate will put on their path.
If the knight will be lucky enough, he will even have the honor of meeting the prince/princess in a Blind date, but only those who will be able to overcome the different challenges, adapting to the situation brought forth by the events, will receive the prince/princess’ hand!

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Matching, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Trick-taking

name: Theatrix
description:
A Gigantik charades game for kids! It's a play of words!

The curtain is going up on Theatrix!

Theatrix is a game of charades developed by educators with children in mind. Theatrix gives your children the ability to use their imagination to act out what is on their card. Each card is divided into 4 categories: things we do, everyday things, things we use to move on and characters & creatures. When selecting a card, the child can use either the 400 words or the easily recognizable full-color illustrations, without the use of reading.

The Gigantic floor gameboard creates a fun atmosphere for playing Theatrix, allowing the child the freedom and space to "play" out their turn.

Theatrix is the game that allows parents to sit back and enjoy the show! (Popcorn not included.)

—description from the back of the box

name: Brain Quest: After School Sports
description:
The Players, the Games & All the Stats. 800 Questions & Answers

Was Shaq, Magic, or Sir Charles once known as the NBA's "Round Mound of Rebound"? What is baseball's Mendoza line? After School Sports is a Brain Quest for outside the classroom, a feast of players, stats and famous moments. Baseball's M&M Boys. A "Tomato Can" and the Munchkin of Munich. Plus relay races and auto races, the balk and the "Fosbury Flop." It's not just sports--it's part of our culture.

Contains two decks. Can be used with the Brain Quest game.

name: Brain Quest: After School Weird Stuff
description:
Strange, Gross and Unbelievable-But-True- Facts .800 Questions & Answers

Where is your sweet tooth? What part of its own body does the common toad swallow several times a year? After School Weird Stuff is a Brain Quest for outside the classroom, a feast of oddities, curiosities and the unbelievable-but-true. Why you can't catch cold in Siberia. The 69 1/2-year hiccup attack. Plus pogonologists and piranhas, mummies and shrunken heads. Because it's not just weird stuff--it's part of our knowledge.

Contains two decks. Can be used with the Brain Quest game.

name: 相席 (Sharing a Table)
description:
Sharing a Table is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a six to eight-player trick-taking game using two standard decks of cards and one joker. Players will also need two tables.

In an eight-player game, 13 cards are dealt to each player, and the remaining card is flipped face up. The suit of the revealed card will set the specific scoring of the hand at each table; the scorings will be related, such as -2 points for each trick taken at one table, and -1 point for each taken at the other table.

The first 4 tricks are played to determine which players from the 8 will move to the second table to play; the results of these tricks do not otherwise bear on the scoring. Each table then plays out the remaining 9 tricks, and the players score.

The player with the most points after a number of rounds wins.

name: Socrates and the Just City
description:
The game takes place over 4 Years (cycles of play) in the City of Athens 400 BC. 12 dice are rolled in each round of play. Players take sets of dice to position citizens. When all Citizens have been placed, players resolve the various spaces they occupy. Each Citizen brings an empowerment so that players can earn gold, defend the city, remove decay and gain culture. These empowerments are enhanced year on year. Socrates himself is a 'wild card' Citizen who is 'Immortalised' in the fourth and final year. The ultimate aim is to have the most culture and thereby win the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Align Me
description: Align Me is a party game for role players. Give clues based on the mundane category and have other players guess your secret alignment! Players take turns giving clues and guessing the correct alignment. Each correct guess gains you 1 point. Each clue you give that was guessed correctly gains you 1 point. The first player(s) to 10 points wins!

name: Disney Things That Go
description:
23 learning games to introduce kids to things that go. Games start with things that go on wheels and then introduce water transportation and air travel.

The games range from domino-like picture cards, to 3-dimensional vehicles, to card games based on vehicle types.

name: Basketball Card Game
description:
This is a card game from the 1950-60s. Players set a line-up and draw cards one at a time. Each card shows a result based on the player in the respective line-up slot. Normal basketball rules apply.

Part of line of card games by Built-Rite that included baseball and football.

name: Blind Adventure
description:
Players try to navigate through a circuitous path while blindfolded. Players can play as a team or individually. The goal is to complete the path from start to finish in the fastest time which includes penalties for going off the path.

When playing individually, the player studies the map, then puts blindfold on and uses a wipeable crayon to mark their path on the wipeable board. They can stop at any point and take a peek to see how they are doing, but this incurs penalty time.

When playing as a team, a navigator gives directions to the blindfolded player.

name: Drive & Survive
description:
Family game that aims to help improve driving habits. Players drive along one of four routes on the board encountering various obstacles and requirements along the way. The players deal with driving school, accidents, and insurance to deal with random events that occur along the route.

Players earn money along the route. The player with the most money when all players have reached their destination wins.

—user summary

name: Save 'N' Spend
description:
Players use a spinner to move along a path from start to finish. Along the way, the players follow instructions on the board or draw cards which they must follow. They will sometimes have to spend money or other times they may collect and save money. Some cards may send the player on a detour and slow them up.

The players try to get to the finish line with the most money, but also quickly as each player who finishes also collects money from all the remaining players.

—user summary

name: Pro-Baseball Game
description: Japanese baseball card game. Each game package contains cards representing the players on a Japanese baseball team. The package also includes a paper representation of a baseball field and rules for play.

name: Color Life
description:
Theme
Color Life is a meta-monopoly family board game. The player will take on the role of little-ü. In the trip he/she will buy some colorful lands, select the abilities and earn money to win the game.

Gameplay
On player's turn, the player rolls one dice and moves that number of spaces around the board. If the player lands on an as-yet-unowned property, he/she has the opportunity to buy it. The land is not exclusive so that all players can buy the same land as if he/she does not own it. The player can use ability card or item card to move instead of rolling a dice.
If a player owns all 3 lands within a color group, he/she may then build building and enable its functionality. Then all players can benefit from that function once they own that land.
There are other lands on the board which can't be bought, they provide other functions such as drawing a random event card, guess other player dice rolling, buy an item card, get new ability cards and earn salary.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Income, Ownership, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Rondel, Set Collection

name: Becher-Spiel
description:
Below each cup, a token is placed. Each child then lifts three cups in order to find at least 2 tokens which are the same. If that's the case, the child gets the same tokens and the cups are put back on the table.
The child with the most tokens wins.

—user summary

name: Die verrückten Experimente der Microminds
description:
Help! The mad MICROMINDS crashed with their spaceship and only you can save them!

Look with your smartphone into the funny world of the Microminds und help them to repair their damaged spaceship. Alot of exiting and informative tasks await you. With varied playful experiments you and the Microminds repair the spaceship part for part. Do you find the best combination for an exiting rocket drive?

A new interactive gaming system from Ravensburger with complex smartphone app and high-quality gaming materials.

—description from the publisher

name: Raketofix
description:
The children blow a little rocket from one planet to the other planet. On every planet, they have to solve different tasks which involve some gymnastics, puzzle games or quizzes.
The kid who solves the most tasks wins at the end.

—user summary

name: Das Ringelspiel
description:
Every player is a visitor on a fairground and tries to drive all the four different wagons of the merry-go-round. But the funny clown tries his best to distract the players and changes the places of the wagons!
The child who first manages to drive all wagons wins.

—user summary

name: Spacy-Racing/Auto-Rennen
description:
Two racing games in a single box

Car-racing:
Objective: Be the first ending the car race by passing target space the 3rd time (or more if agreed by the players)
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.
On each field only 2 cars are allowed to stay.

Space-racing:
Racing with the Alien "Spacy" through the space in a round course starting from the earth to moon and mars and back.
Objective: Be the first ending the space race by passing field 70.
- moving by turns -
roll the die, move your meeple & and follow instructions for some fields.

—user summary

name: Rauf & Runter
description:
A tactical dice game where each player tries to run as fast as possible. At the same time, each one needs to stop at least seven times, but the more you stop, the more points you'll score. What a dilemma...

The winner is the player with the most stops.

—user summary

name: Arche Noah
description: This is a funny jump & run game for children. The child who is the first one in putting all his animals and Noah in the ark wins the game.

name: Wer hat mein Häuschen?
description:
The players try to catch the dogs to put them in their corresponding dog kennels.
Each play gets the same amount of dog kennels. All dog cards are put in the middle of the table. The starting player roles the dice three times. If the dice shows at least 2 times the same colour, the player can put one dog in the kennel of this colour.
The player who is the first one in putting the dogs of the correct colours in his dog kennels wins.

—user summary

name: Fix und Foxi picknick Memo-Lotto
description:
Fix and Foxi make a picnic.
Each player has a board which shows a picnic blanket.
Each picnic blanket has the same 9 elements (picnic theme) printed on it.

Objective:
Complete your picnic as first, but don't pick the mice.
On players turn he selects one memory tile and turns it open.
If it's an element he still needs (not covered by an equal tile or a mouse tile) he takes and places it. Otherwise he turns it on the back side at the old position.
If the player finds a mouse he can choose if he place it on 1 free field on his blanket or if he puts it back.
The game ends, when 1 player has placed 1 tile on each of the 9 fields on his blanket.
Every player removes all mice and 1 good tile for each mouse tile from his blanket. For every remaining tile he gets 1 point. The player who ends the game gets 2 additional points. The player with the highest amount of points wins.

—user summary

name: Boss in der Bank
description:
The player are employees in a bank who want to become CEO. Therefore, each player needs to answer questions and if he knows the right answer, he moves up the corporate ladder.
The fastest and most skilled player will become CEO and win the game.

—user summary

name: Wortspiel
description:
This is a collection of word games where children can easily learn the different senses of various word pairs.
It contains 48 tokens which form 24 pairs.

Puzzle game for 2-6 children
One half of the pairs is put face up on the table, whereas the other half is put face down. Then one of hidden tokens is put face up as well and the children have to find the corresponding partner. The fastest child gets the pair. In the end, the child with the most pairs wins.

Memory game for 2-6 children
All tokens are put face down on the table and the children try to find pairs according to the actual memory rules. The one with the most pairs wins.

Homonym game for 4-6 children
2 kids secretly take one word pair and both of them explain their word to the other children. The child who is the first one to guess the word wins.

—user summary

name: Rekorde Quiz
description:
A simple quiz card game with 107 cards. Each card covers a specific topic about world records in sports, culture etc. with 4 questions. The answers are on the backside of the cards. Players try to answer the questions and score points.

—user summary

name: Erzähl mir was!: Wiener Spielschule
description:
This game encourage children to remember and explain easy stories. It contains 50 tokens with images of some terms, such as apple, bike, street. These tokens are put face down on the 8 fields of the game board.
In the first round, the starting player turns the tokens of one field face up and tells a fairy tale inclduing all the terms of the tokens on his field. He puts the tokens face down again and the next player starts to tell a story about the next field.
In the second round, the children have to remember the terms. Therefore, a field is selected randomly and the player mentions all the terms of this field. For every correct one, he gets the token.
The child with the most tokens wins.

—user summary

name: Die Simpsons: Drunter und Drüber in Springfield
description:
Each player is one of 8 "The Simpsons" characters.
There are 5 Springfield locations (Kwik-E-Market, School, Moe's bar, nuclear power plant, TV channel). On each location the player can gat a typical thing (e.g. beer at Moe's), a new order card or fullfill an order card he has on his hand.
The player who fullfills 3 order cards first, wins the game.
On players turn he can choose 1 of 4 moving possibilities (monorail, car, skate board, feet). There are differences in cost, speed and precision.
2 additional rules: moving by feet allows to move the barrier (drunken Barnie), which blocks the monorail and the street (for all except skate board).
On each order card there is a "being mean" possibility. This can be done for free if you fullfill the order. The victim can be choosen. It can also be executed by giving back one order card and an additional thing.

name: Tier Legespiel
description:
The cards with half funny pictures of animals are shuffled and dealt evenly to the players. The players now play cards in turn. If the next player can complete an animal, he may take the cards. If not, then he must place another card in front of him.
Whoever has collected the most complete animals at the end wins.

—user summary

name: Chapter V: Serpents of the Sand
description:
Chapter V invites you to investigate an archaeological excavation site in the desert. Starting with a battered journal and some cryptic notations, you find four dig sites across which 12 scales of a great beast are scattered.

You must follow the archaeologist's eleven-day research mission to locate the resting place of a fallen star.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter VI: Milton Manor
description:
Chapter VI brings you to the stately Milton Manor. From a mysterious note slid under your hotel room door, you know to examine the portraits, blueprints, and books you find in the house.

You must locate and unlock the vault in the manor to complete the investigation and recover the shard before your adversaries get there first.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter VII: Access Denied
description:
As you are chased in a speeding van, you must use everything you've learnt as a Guardian to access the Mysterious Companies files.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter VIII: Thornhill Forest
description:
We believe that a former Guardian is living in isolation in the ancient forest of Thornhill. Before we lost contact with him, he left two things for us: a utility knife and a tin with a compass and some polaroids. We are entrusting you with these items, knowing that you have the tools to find him.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter IX: The End of the Line
description:
You board a train with one of our allies. Make sure that you have the run of the vehicle; however, you may need to keep things on track with your quick thinking and decoding skills.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter X: What Lies Beneath
description:
You enter the sewer system underneath the looming tower. Will you be able to navigate the winding tunnels with what you have on you?

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter XI: Floor Sixty-Four
description:
You arrive at the tower of Starfall Corporation. You find a note with a simple message 'Floor Sixty-Four' - the Restricted Research Department. There must be some clues left behind that points to the last artifacts. It's time to start exploring Floor Sixty-Four!

Will you be able to locate the last artifacts?

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Chapter XII: Project Nexus
description:
This is the finale of Season One. We have been sworn to secrecy, we will reveal nothing.

---
Audience
Recommended for 12+; younger players may require guidance from an adult. Designed to be played either solo or collaboratively, and takes an average of 60-90 minutes to solve, though players can work through them at their own pace.

Difficulty
Each Chapter of The CCC is supported by a dedicated digital hint library, allowing you to choose how many additional clues you receive. From subtle nudges all the way to complete solutions for each puzzle, it's up to you to choose your level of difficulty.

—description from the publisher

name: Necromunda: Underhive – A Swig Of Wild Snake Tactics Card
description:
Card was available in issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

Play this gang tactic when activating a friendly fighter.

Place the thin end of the Flame template in contact with the active friendly fighter. All fighters touched by the Flame template (both friend and foe) gain the Intoxicated condition and the Doused in Alcohol condition. Playing this card counts as the chosen fighter's activation.

Intoxicated fighters are marked with an Intoxicated token and suffer a -1 penalty to BS and WS checks for the remainder of the battle. For the remainder of the battle, fighters Doused In Alcohol are automatically set on fire the first time they are hit by a weapon with the Blaze trait.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Miniatures, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Adeptus Titanicus: The Horus Heresy – Ordnance Delivery Promo Card
description:
Card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

As two battlegroups clash, low-orbit aircraft brave the blizzard conditions to unleash blind bombing runs upon the two sides.

If all players agree, the card can be added to an existing Open Engine War deck or used on its own. At the start of each Strategy phase, the First Player rolls a D10. Until the end of the round, the long range characteristic of all weapons is reduced by a number of inches equal to the number rolled (to a minimum of the weapon's short range). In addition, each player, starting with the player who is not the First Player, may place a 5" Blast marker anywhere on the battlefield and Scatter it D10 inches. Any model at least partially under the template suffers D3 S7 Hits, as if hit by a weapon with the Ordnance trait.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: Kegel Knirpse
description:
It's a bowling for kids.
Additional the kids should use the mages for building pyramids with them to train their mechanical abilities.

—user summary

name: Legend of the Galactic Heroes: Side Stories 2
description:
Science fiction wargame set in the universe of the Legend of the Galactic Heroes. This set covering battle of Starzone Vanfleet and 6th siege of Iserlhon.

Two scenarios are contained in the game, and the fictional space battle that each was drawn in the story is reproduced. These are being called a fleet battle, but when either is said, it is close to the land battle of Napoleonic age.

Each player control one or more star fleets.
Each fleet is commanded by one admiral, and organized by 6 to 14 ships units.

Each turn, a fleet are activated in the unintentional order by chit-pull system, and it resolves a movement and a combat.
An average admiral has only one or two chits. But the heroes of the story has four or more chits, and it is activated many times during one turn.
A battle is resolved with adjacent hex on the Odds CRT.

The winner determined by the number which made a fleet collapse. A fleet collapses when a fixed unit is eliminate or admiral's mental agitation.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Curmudgeon: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A 10 card promo pack. Includes:
1 new Curmudgeon Card
3 new Insult Cards
6 new Life Cards

name: Cloud Control: Dice Tower 2021 Promo Pack
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

A five card pack of word cards that can be mixed in with the other words cards in the base game.

Includes: Deck Builder, Flip the Table, Convention, Game Night, and Dice Tower.

name: Panzer Strider
description:
Miniatures agnostic skirmish game of mech on mech combat.

This is a game of mech combat in a science fantasy setting of battle and ambition. Of pirates and those of royal blood.

Any faction can fight any other faction it is assumed that the pirates will fight pirates when their ambitions do not align. And the noble's family’s will fight in petty conflicts for similar reasons.

You can design your own mechs and carrier then send them off to war. You need something to represent your forces. Model kits or LEGO are what I recommend. You will also need two sets of polyhedral dice and some paper for your character sheets. Last but not least: you will need a flat surface to play on. I also would recommend some books to use as terrain.

The game is won when you destroy or demobilize the opposing player's carrier or they do the same to yours.

In the future, I hope to introduce solo play and a campaign but for now let’s get to the game.

—description from the designer
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Variable Phase Order

name: COAL&GUNS! US ships 1885 - 1905
description:
This volume contains “ship cards” for the rule set "COAL&GUNS!". In order to play with them you need the basic rulebook.

-description from publisher's website
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Nautical, Wargame

name: Eco Neighborhood
description:
In Eco Neighborhood the most important thing is building a clean environment, so moving through the streets you will have the opportunity to use different means of transport and find out their pros and cons, but be careful, you can get stuck in a traffic jam! On your way to the finish line, every time you step on the Eco Fact field you will find out new and interesting information about renewable energy sources, and why it’s important to wisely spend the electrical energy! Eco Neighborhood will show you where to move to find out the importance of protecting our environment and how you can contribute in protection of the Planet.

On the way to the finish line you will find out new things and challenges. Some of the fields will move you forward, but some will move you back. Also you will have the opportunity to invest you hard earned points in order to save energy through energy efficient light bulbs, energy efficient windows, solar panels and isolation for your home. The road to your goal is field with lots of interaction and fun.

Eco Neighborhood was created as a didactic material as part of the project “Education on energy”. The project was realized by Eco Logic, and was supported by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC).

name: Smile & Play
description: The board game is intended for pupils from 5th to 9th grade, and it comprises of a platform with 11 examples of everyday locations toward which the children/teams have to go. On the way to the location, they resolve exercises and tasks for improving of the English language skills, through cards with activities, questions, fun facts – given by the mentor/teacher/parent that has the role of Game Guide/Maser.

name: Porno Charades
description:
Act out funny porno titles like ‘Womb Raider’ or ‘Prodzilla’ for your team mates to guess.

No talking allowed, only gestures – the ruder the better!
categories: Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Word Game

name: Variations on a Theme: Supplementary Rules for Monopoly
description:
A collection of Monopoly variants, intended (except for the last) to be used separately:


The Investment Fund allows players to invest their money. The principal can never be taken out but every time a player passes GO they receive 10% interest. This can radically change the nature of the game, among other things speeding it up significantly.



The Auction Game requires all properties to be auctioned when landed on for the first time. This tends to slow the game down and reduces reliance on luck somewhat.



Building Past Hotels allows further property development. This makes the cheaper monopolies more interesting. A set of extended property cards is provided which show the additional costs and rents.



Ruffles and Flourishes, a set of small tweaks which can be used together or separately. One is a new set of "wahoo" cards which can all be kept until a player wants to use them; a set is provided.

name: Modern Royalty
description:
Modern Royalty is a trick-taking game for exactly six players using a standard 52-card deck plus two jokers.

In each hand the deck is dealt out and the players then bid; bids can be 1-36 in a suit or 1-25 in "anarchy."

If the winning bid is in a suit, that suit is trump and cards are ranked normally, except that aces are special and jokers are the lowest members of the trump suit. Play is fairly standard (must follow suit, not required to trump) except that the aces in the non-trump suits are assassins which kill trump cards, and the trump ace is a guard which stops one assassin.

If the winning bid is in anarchy, there is no trump suit and cards are ranked ace high to ten low, with the face cards being equal below the ten; the jokers form their own "pariah" suit. If a pariah is led to a trick no one wins it.

Scoring depends on whether the play was in a suit or in anarchy, and if in a suit each player's score depends in part on what is taken by three of the other five players. The player who won the bid must always achieve their bid in points or be penalized; if the bid was in a suit then other players who last bid that suit must also do this.

Play is to 626 points.

There is an optional rule for an extra "knife" bid which basically means that the knifing player(s) work deliberately against the winning bidder.

name: Solitaire 34
description:
Solitaire 34 is played with a standard 52-card deck. It assigns court cards a value of 10 points and all other cards their face values. This gives the deck a total of 340 points; the goal of the game is to divide the deck into 10 stacks of 34 points each.

At the start of the game the player deals a row of three cards and a row of four cards. They then find any subset of those seven cards that total exactly 34, set them aside, and deal cards to fill the empty slots.

If there is no way to make 34, the player chooses one of the two rows of cards to set aside and deals a new row. They can bring the set-aside row back in later by completely emptying the row of matching size. Several rows can be set aside at any given time.

name: Eagles
description:
Eagles is a Diplomacy variant which is set in an alternate history Roman Empire; the game starts in Spring 118 CE shortly after the assassination of Hadrian. The game can accommodate 2-12 players but is recommended for 4-6.

Each player starts in one of a group of given supply centers and has two more from a different group as allies; which ones each player gets is determined randomly.

The basic rules are modified in three ways:


Reinforcements are handled differently.



Many spaces on the board are held by barbarians. A force entering one of these must roll a die and may be destroyed or repelled.



Naval movement and combat is very different, with multiple fleets being able to coexist in the same space, die-rolling, etc.
mechanics: Area Movement, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Home Run Derby
description:
Home Run Derby is a simple baseball game. Each player creates a nine-member team either by rolling on a table or by choosing a real team's current starting lineup; in each case only the batting averages matter.

When a baseball player comes up to bat two dice are rolled to determine if they get a hit, sacrifice, walk, or are out. If they get a hit a roll is made on a second table to determine the outcome. Bases can be stolen, which is also resolved via dice roll.

The defending player's only decision is whether to issue an intentional walk.

name: Тактическое Лото (Tactical Lotto)
description:
Тактическое Лото ("Tactical Lotto"), published in Moscow (Soviet Union) 1929.

Though the game is titled as Lotto game, it is typical roll and move game about war and military tactics with separate game board with 96 stops (16 cards of 6 stops each) and additional cards with questions about each stop. The first player, who cross whole route first, wins a game.

—user summary

name: The Clever Knight
description:
A strategy game for 2 players.
Try to create a sequence of 4 tiles of your color inside the inner quadrangle of the board. Tiles advance in the
familiar chess steps and may be placed on top of each other. The game has simple rules and guarantees hours of fun.
A game for developing a thinking strategy and the ability to plan moves.

—description from the publisher

name: No Na Me
description:
No Na Me is an abstract strategy game for 2 players.
Play as a ring caster, in the attempt to reach the center of the board first. On your turn choose one of four available actions:

move your player piece one space orthogonally.
take control of a minion with the top most ring on your player piece.
move a minion one space orthogonally.
pick a ring that is orthogonally adjacent to you.


Use your limited resources to manipulate the game and outwit your opponent in this slow pace ballet of deception and strategy.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Resource to Move, Sudden Death Ending

name: Durch Kampf zum Sieg
description:
Whole title: "Durch Kampf zum Sieg, Original-Hakenkreuz-Gesellschaftsspiel“ (eng. "Through struggle to victory, Original swastika parlor game") made by Verlag August Haug, Berlin.

Game rules similar to game "Mensch ärgere dich nicht!", which is German version of Pachisi. Each player has a set of pawns that start in his or her corner of the board (this game is unique because the game boards layout is similar to swastika). The goal is to move the pawns around the board to the "home" section. Movement is controlled by dice. All players move around the same board, so they may capture each others pawns. Captured pawns are returned to their player's corner and must start their journey over. The winner is the first player to move all pawns "home".
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: A... B... C... D... SPEEDY
description:
Play the classic, very popular and addictive game, but with a literal twist!
Get rid of the cards by putting down cards with identical first or last letters.
Do you think it’s easy?!
Try doing it while competing rapidly…
ABCD SPEEDY is an entertaining, fast-paced game to learn the English language by practicing reading, quick letter identification, and increasing your vocabulary at the same time.

—description from the designer

name: Space Time
description:
In Space Time, you role play as a scavenger among the stars, flying your trusty rocket all around the universe, in an attempt to earn income, by completing tasks, finding items, and using tools at your disposal to gain an advantage.

However, watch out for "Space Pirates." They can take everything in your cargo hold, and set you back, big time."

Over the course of three rounds; players draft from a grid of 15 cards choosing to take a low, medium, or high risk card. Flipping the card over will reveal if you have gained an item with income (victory points), a tool which will give you a optional action, an event which will give you an instant effect, or an attack card which will cause you to loose items.
categories: Card Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction

name: Les Jeux Olympiques
description: The Olympic Games is a card game similar to belote. By winning tricks, you progress on different tracks which represent events (high jump, 100 meters, long jump, marathon...).

name: Aeronautica Imperialis: Wings of Vengeance – Emperor's Blessing Card
description:
Card found in Issue 470 of the magazine White Dwarf.

Marauder 'Ace' Payload: A single Marauder Bomber or Marauder Destroyer may purchase this ace for +4 points. Once per game, when firing its Bomb Bay weapon, the aircraft may add 4 to the FPR characteristic.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Variable Player Powers

name: Trash-TV: Promis, Pannen, Peinlichkeiten
description:
"I’m only in this for the money“, „I don’t have photograph for you today“ and dramatic slo-mo of tearstruck faces – you know what that‘s about: Common phrases and events from reality TV (or lovingly called „Trash-TV“).

Created by Trash-TV expert @anredo this game serves as a companion for most reality tv shows, where you play along to find out who can get rid of the most cards. Whenever a quote or event happens on the show or at home in your living room, that you just happen to have on one of your cards, you may get rid of that card.
Examples include "someone uses a sob story about a bad relationship with one of their family members" or "someone adjust the volume on your device at home".

The player who manages to get rid of all their cards first wins. If at the end of the show no one managed to lose all their cards, the player with the fewest cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Mythic Mayhem: Forge of Heroes
description:
Mythic Mayhem: Forge of Heroes is the core game release from the Mythic Mayhem saga. A battle card game with heroes like Rangar the Barbarian and Kieran Darkheart the Wizard, among others. There are 87 unique cards with a total of 250 playing cards within the deck, perfectly balanced for play for 2+! Some cards are rarer to have in your hand than others, so play them wisely!

This card game has one sole purpose, to play! We took all the elements of the most popular trading card games and made it simple and affordable for anyone to start playing. You do not need to know complicated deck building systems or spend hundreds of dollars on trying to get the best cards. Perfect for playing with friends or family, anyone can learn quickly. All the cards needed to play the game are within the game box!

Mythic Mayhem challenges and changes the definition of trading card gaming. Recently, there has been a disconnect between collectors and players and this game brings everyone together. With exceptional art, holographic legendary cards, and smooth game mechanics we hope to reach as many players as possible!

There are Heroes, spells, attacks, defense cards, and more! This is a game of skill, strategy, and chance. We are dedicated to the creation of a smooth, entertaining, and intriguing game that can be played round after round with various outcomes!

Setup

1. Shuffle the cards; Place all cards face down, instant cards and battle cards in separate decks
2. Each player starts with 20 life points
3. Each player draws 8 cards from the battle deck
4. Each player rolls the die. The highest roll starts; turns go in clockwise order

Details

1. One card can be played per turn, unless otherwise stated on specific card
2. Cannot heal for more than starting life points, unless otherwise stated on specific card
3. A card can be played toward any opponent, unless otherwise stated on specific card
4. Cards are played face up in front of the player until the card mechanics have played out; then discard card to the graveyard
5. Defense cards can be played anytime to defend against damage if the defense card is a reaction; otherwise, it is played for turn; A defense
reaction does not count for turn
6. One defense card can be active per player
7. If defending, any remaining damage not defended is taken
8. Instant cards must be played at time of pulling; instant card effects and damage cannot be blocked
9. A player cannot draw an instant card two turns in a row
10. Instant cards have a separate playing deck and graveyard than all other cards
11. If a player uses all 8 cards in their hand; add 2 life points and redraw 8 cards
12. If there are no available cards in the battle deck or instant deck, shuffle all of the graveyard cards, and place face down to continue the
game

Let's Play!

For turn, choose one of the following options

1. Play a damage, defense, or spell card
OR
2. Draw and play an instant card
OR
3. Discard 1 card from your hand to the graveyard and draw two cards from the battle deck for your hand

To Win

Deplete all opponents' life points
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Forbidden Brews
description: You drop the final ingredient into your bubbling cauldron, and see the colors shift as your brew is complete. This potion could make you a pretty penny, even more so since the King outlawed them. You hear a knock at your door, increasing in tempo—the King’s Guard!
