In this press-your-luck deck builder, players attempt to brew powerful potions while avoiding the King’s Guard in order to collect the most fame and become the greatest witch in all the land! Potion Commotion will be released after Towering Purrfection, so keep an eye out in the future for more news about this dangerously magical deck builder.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Market, Push Your Luck

name: フラグのいけにえ (Flag no Ikenie)
description:
フラグのいけにえ (Flag no Ikenie) is a bluffing and deduction game from Japan.

The game title refers to a character in a movie who is marked for death (flag sacrifice). Like the cop on the last day before retirement, or the young woman hearing a noise in the cellar. You know they are going to get it, you just don't know how.

In the game, these characters are hidden as Prey cards, and players are the villains in horror movies, hunting them. Player hunt by put numbered cards against the Prey cards to reveal them. Cards are played in sequence, and if the total is 6, the player may check the card to see if it is their own target. At 10, the card is revealed to all.

Each hunter has a special ability that helps them catch their targets. But the prey characters also have special skills to resist the hunter and slip away.

The first player to catch two of their targets is the winner.
user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Deduction, Horror, Humor
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Cursus Honorum
description:
In Cursus Honorum you lead your patrician family on a path to power, by occupying all offices in the progression of importance.

Roll your dice and move one of your family members according the number rolled. If it is on the right position, it can stop family members of your opponents.

If you are the first to get one of your family members to "Imperator", the game ends and you win.

—user summary

Published on History Kids, italian edition, issue #9.

name: Quiznight: Mädelsabend – RUBBELN, RÄTSELN, RATEN
description:
You are just quiztastic and looking for a varied program for your hen party or want to spice up the next girls' night a bit? Then get this quiz game for a unique experience.

Exciting questions on funny categories await you here to put your knowledge to the test and challenge the other girls. Scratch the questions, win the mini-games, and get your brain in gear. Who knows more, who's faster - who comes out the winner? Categories include: Literature, Celebrities, Art, Nutrition & Sport, World of Fashion, Surprise.

Playable as a single player or in a team - for 2 to 20 players with creative decoration and recipe ideas, invitation cards and Spotify playlist for an unforgettable evening.

Players win by answering more questions correctly and solving more puzzles than their adversaries!

-description by the publisher

name: Quiznight: Familienabend – RUBBELN, RÄTSELN, RATEN
description:
You are sure of victory in the quiz and your next family evening should be a special experience!

With this unique quiz night you can quiz your knowledge, because the quiz game puts young and old to the test. Scratch the questions free and challenge yourself in a variety of categories. The exciting mini-games will really get your brain working! Which team knows more, who is faster - who comes out the winner? Categories include: Animals, Fairy tales, Superheroes, Food & Drink, The World, Surprise.

Playable as single players or in teams - for 2 to 20 players with creative decoration and recipe ideas, invitation cards and Spotify playlist for an unforgettable evening.

Players win by answering more questions correctly and solving more puzzles than their adversaries!

-description by the publisher

name: Quiznight: Partytime – RUBBELN, RÄTSELN, RATEN
description:
Use your insider quizzing skills, scratch the questions free and put your knowledge to the test in creative and nerdy categories.

Exciting mini-games, fast-paced quick question rounds and exciting guessing questions await you. Who knows more, who is faster - who comes out the winner? Categories include: Movies & Series, Stars & Starlets, Computer Games & Comics, Spirits, History, Surprise.

Playable as a single player or in a team - for 2 to 20 players with creative decoration and recipe ideas, invitation cards and Spotify playlist for an unforgettable evening.

Players win by answering more questions correctly and solving more puzzles than their adversaries!

-description by the publisher

name: OAKO
description:
OAKO is a 2 player strategy card game where players take, reveal, switch and place cards in order to take the highest number of points from the opponent.

The cards are inspired by nature and the illustrations are by elm of elm island.

The first edition is self published and limited to 100 copies.

name: Infantry Attacks: Fall of Empires – Imperial & Royal Panzers
description:
In 1911, Lt. Gunther Burstyn, an engineer officer of the Imperial Austrian Landwehr who rejected umlauts, presented plans for a Motorgeschütz, in effect a small tank. His vehicle included caterpillar tracks and a revolving turret with a 37mm gun, and looked very modern for its time. The War Ministry declined to accept it, but we’re not limited by such thinking.

Imperial & Royal Panzers is a variant for Infantry Attacks: Fall of Empires, with the Burstyn Motorgeschütz and some other early attempts at armored vehicles like the Austro-Daimler armored car. But most of all, it gives you Austro-Hungarian tanks. In 1914.

It comes with 24 new die-cut, silky-smooth playing pieces. You also get a set of scenarios to turn these proto-panzers loose against the Russians (who do have those 76.2mm field guns, so this it’s no walkover).

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I

name: Sriracha Dice
description:
Sriracha Dice! Flaming Fun for Everyone! Spice up game night with this quick-playing party game for the whole family.

It comes with 5 standard red six-sided dice. You’ll also need: Score pad, pen and a Smartphone timer

Three hot rounds make up a game:
The First Round: Hot Ones has you rolling as many ones as you can in 30 seconds.

The Second Round: Pair-A-Dice gives you one hot minute to roll two pair of the highest value you can.

The third and final round: Flamin' Fast Fives has you roll five of a kind in the fastest time.

If you total the most after all three rounds, holy smokes! You win!
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking

name: Agrisha
description:
Agrisha is a resource-drafting worker-placement game about expanding one's influence in a bustling fantasy port town for 2-4 players (best with 3).

Players take turns gaining influence with various factions, purchasing buildings or hiring special characters, or using special abilities from previous acquisitions.

The game takes around 2 hours to play with experienced players. The basic game actions are simple to learn, but the variety of options can make the turns of new players take some extra time.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Hoops!: Basketball League
description:
Hoops! Basketball League is a dynasty building card game where 2-5 new team owners compete to win the inaugural and coveted Hoops! Championship Trophy.

Owners will spend their weeks preparing for their upcoming games by bolstering their roster, improving their stadiums, Raising funds, getting in some last minute training, or seeking to sabotage their rivals.

Games will occur at the end of each week where owners will roll die to discover just how well their players performed against their foes. Calculate the scores and determine a winner. The first franchise with seven wins will be declared champion!

name: Spacer: The Space Game
description:
Spacer is a new and exciting game with a futuristic perspective. Players accumulate wealth buying, selling, and/or trading space companies related to their Galactic Charter. For future opportunity, play Spacer!
—description from the publisher

Spacer is played on a square board with an octagonal track. Players taking turns round-robin style. Each player takes a roll-and-move action, with results primarily depending upon which board space they land upon. Players expend in-game resources to acquire properties.
—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Slither Stone
description:
Slither Stone is a free print-and-play game for 2 players. All you need is a printout and a pen.

Players have two snakes which move every turn, but only one can be controlled at a time while the other continues in the same direction as last turn.

The goal is to juggle controlling both snakes without running into barriers which are randomly scattered on the paper or placed by your opponent.

Each game board printed from the website is unique.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Paper-and-Pencil, Pattern Movement
publishers: (Web published), Critical Pawn, Wirtualne Wydawnictwo MARK6

name: Soldier Kings: Sultan and Shah
description:
During and after the Napoleonic period, Ottoman Turkish armies fought the French, Russians, British, Persians, Wahhabis, Greeks, Serbs and Egyptians. The decaying empire retained enormous military strength, and despite repeated defeats both maintained its independence and enacted a series of military, economic and political reforms aimed at restoring the empire’s power.

Sultan and Shah is an expansion book for Soldier Emperor, focused on the Ottoman Empire as well as its satellite Egypt and rival Persia. Just as these so-called gunpowder empires formed a bridge between east and west, so does Sultan and Shah, which connects Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires into one large game stretching from Scotland to Scindia.

Sultan and Shah includes a full-sized (22x28 inches) map of Persia and Central Asia connecting the two games, plus a dozen new high-quality playing cards, 25 new huge playing pieces representing armies and fleets and 24 simply large ones that serve as leaders and markers. The book includes historical background, game analysis, additional scenarios and variants for Soldier Emperor and Indian Empires, and the rules, cards and pieces needed to link the two games together.

—description from the publisher

name: Soldier Emperor: Asian Empires Land War in Asia, 1759-1825
description:
War ravaged the globe during the late 18th and early 19th centuries. Europe saw the French Revolution and then the Napoleonic Wars, while India underwent the struggles of powerful local dynasties against both one another and European invaders.

In South-East Asia, the kingdoms of Burma, Siam and Viet-Nam fought one another, the British and the Chinese Qing Empire. Meanwhile China’s Qinglong Emperor mounted his Ten Great Campaigns to expand Chinese rule to the west, south-west and south against the Dzunghar Empire, Burma, Nepal and Viet-Nam.

Soldier Emperor: Asian Empires is a complete game in the Soldier Emperor game system, based on these wars for Asia with over a dozen scenarios featuring two to four players (Burma, Siam, Nepal, Viet-Nam, Dzunghar, Qing – not all of them appear in every scenario). It uses the same rules set as Soldier Emperor and Soldier Emperor: Indian Empires, modified for the new theater. If you know how to play one of those, you already know how to play Asian Empires.

—description from the publisher

name: Schlacht (シュラハ)
description:
シュラハ (Schlacht) is a two player strategy game from Japan, which pits two small armies against each other, akin to Chess.

The game board is a mix of land and sea hexes. Both players have a set of 12 pieces; spears, archers, shields, cavalry, longship, infantry, and a castle to protect. The players take turns rolling a die numbered 1-3, and move their pieces accordingly. The first to capture their opponents castle is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up
publishers: Board Game Production Committee (ボドゲ製作委員会)

name: Galactic Poker
description:
Although the rules do not explicitly reference Battlestar Galactica, this set of 55 custom hexagonal cards bears elements showing that the game was inspired by the seventies TV show, including two cards that display Cylon helmets and an Ovion "Death Card." In keeping with the theme, there are rules regarding gameplay when the ship you are stationed on is at yellow or red alert status. Cheating is explicitly authorized in the rules, but with penalties for being caught. There are no face cards in the game. The cards of the four suits are ranked in value from 2 to 13 plus a Pyramid card. The three special cards with Cylon or Ovion markings round out the deck.

Galactic Poker comes with rules for four different games:

"Pyramid" - the name of a card game the characters played on the seventies TV series, Battlestar Galactica;

"Red Eye" - perhaps just a generic reference to Cylons, but Red-Eye is also the name of a specific Cylon character featured in a 1978 episode of the TV series;

"Draw" - in reference to a fast-draw western showdown with blaster pistols; and

"Galactic Strip" - which is exactly what the name implies - a game where you wager articles of clothing rather than money - and where the Death Card causes you to lose all of your attire, except for your blaster and holster!

Other Implementations of Pyramid

This implementation of Pyramid is different from that reflected in the game Triad (the name given to the card game in the newer version of the TV series) and appears to be an independently designed game rather than a variant of Triad. In addition, the cards shown in the BGG entry currently described (without attribution) as the "Official Version" of Pyramid appear to use the same artwork as this set, but that deck has 56 cards, with four Cylons and no Death Card.

—user summary

There are thousands of forms of Poker through out (sic) the galaxy. They differ only in details & all basically follow the same elementary principles. The following rules are not the only games of Poker that can be played with these cards. They are a galactic deck which can be used for most any card game.

May the Lords smile upon you with great fortune!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Set Collection

name: Gribouillis Party
description:
A drawing game for kids with a few funny constraints, like drawing a dinosaur with a pen stuck in its toes.

Every turn, a team rolls the dice and advances the corresponding number of squares. depending on the type of case, you can win a"pencils" token by successfully completing challenges. The first team with 10 "pencils" wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Line Drawing, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: The Dealer
description:
Who can try to keep a poker face during a thumb war against a Cavalier? The first to have no more cards in his personal deck win the game.

All players start with their own same deck of cards. They then draw 3 cards from it which constitutes their starting hand. In turn, each player plays a card from his or her hand by placing it on the mat in the frame corresponding to one of the 5 families of the game (Spades, Clubs, Jokers, Hearts, Diamonds).

Each card causes an effect when it played. Spades and Clubs allow you to put cards from your deck on top of an opponent’s deck. Joker allow you to do special effects. Hearts and Diamonds allow you to draw cards while emptying your deck. As the rounds progress, 5 piles of cards are formed on the mat. The top visible cards of these piles form a combination. As soon as someone notices it, an additional effect is applied.

The game ends when one player has no cards left. That player wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Bluffing, Card Game, Party Game
mechanics: Advantage Token, Events, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: The Game of Kriss Kringle's Visits
description:
Typical spin and move game including cards.
Each player chooses one of 4 corners of the board for his "home". The player who spun lowest spins again, and moves Kriss Kringle toward his home the number of spaces spun (each olly leaf is a space). The next player spins, and moves Kriss Kringle toward his home; and so on round and round. When the player gets Kriss Kringle either to stop at, or pass over, his home space, he takes a card from the top of the pile in the centre. The game proceeds till all the cards are used up. When all the cards are exhausted, the player who has most GIFTS wins the game.
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Alchemy!: Platinum Founder's Edition
description:
Alchemy! is a card game that turns players into competing apprentice alchemists trying to impress their master by being the first to complete a set of potions in a laboratory space they all share.

This limited-edition upgraded Kickstarter release combined the Alchemy! base game's Kickstarter edition with the Alchemy!: Famous Alchemists, Amazing Potions, & Remarkable Places expansion, plus a set of 250 card sleeves and 4 extra tuckboxes, all in a box with a limited-run slipcover (optionally signed by the game's creators).

name: Monopoly: Die Geissens
description: Another edition of the classic Monopoly game themed with characters and places from 'Die Geissens', self-made millionairs. It includes a variant to replace the "doubles roll again" rule with
categories: Dice, Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: グレート・サマナー (Great Summoner)
description:
グレート・サマナー (Great Summoner) is a 2 player strategy game from Japan. Players are wizards battling with their wits for their lands. The game box has a full title of グレート・サマナー 〜二人の偉大なる召喚術士〜 (Great Summoner ~Two Great Summoners~).

Each player has the role of a novice Summoner, and is trying to create magic circles in the opponents landscape, in order to summon a monster. If the defender can reach the circle and suppress it, the monster cannot arrive. But if it gets through, the land is damaged.

However, the game has many more elements beyond this fighting. As players are battling, they also must take a key hidden by a guard, and use it to rescue a servant. This gives clues to decide the mystery of the deadly death that can be used only once during the battle, and summon the phantom beast to aim for the opponent's capture.

This is handled in the game by various cards, giving 'keys and keyholes', six unique followers, four different tactical types, tactics that make use of the terrain, and 'mysteries and secrets'. The elements of strategy, identity concealment, and luck are combined in a game system that requires you deduce your opponent's hand whilst concealing yours.
user summary

The publisher says:
Create magic circles and summon phantoms to conquer your opponent's area! Psychological battles where players read each other and cheat each other as the board changes rapidly!

Great Summoner" is a two-player board game that features a non-stop psychological battle between players.

Players take on the role of novice summoners in a battle for the fate of their country.

The player can summon phantoms by creating magic circles in the opponent's territory.

However, the opponent can move to the square where the magic circle has been created to remove the magic circle and prevent the summoning of the beast.

It is important to read each other's cards and create magic circles in squares that your opponent cannot reach in order to summon monsters!

In addition, you can also collect keys hidden by the guards, special skill cards for your followers, and special skill cards to summon powerful monsters.

The player who can summon the most monsters wins the game.

魔法陣を生成し幻獣を召喚して相手エリアの制圧を目指せ！目まぐるしく変化する盤面に応じた読み合い騙し合いが白熱する心理バトル

『グレート・サマナー　～二人の偉大なる召喚術士～』は読み合い騙し合いのノンストップ心理バトルが展開される正体隠匿系・二人用ボードゲームです。

プレイヤーは駆け出しの召喚術士となって国の命運をかけた戦いに挑みます。

自プレイヤーは、相手の陣地内に魔法陣を生成することで、そこに幻獣を召喚することができます。

ただし、相手プレイヤーは、魔法陣が生成したマスまで移動することで、魔法陣をかき消し、幻獣の召喚を阻止することができます。

手札を読み合いながら、相手が届かないマスに上手く魔法陣を生成し、幻獣を召喚させましょう！

さらに、衛兵が隠し持った鍵の回収や、特殊スキルを持った従者カード、強力な幻獣を召喚できる奥義カードなどが、ゲームをさらに白熱させます。

より多く幻獣の召喚に成功したプレイヤーの勝利となります。
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Deduction, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Soldier Kings: Austrian Succession
description:
With the death of her father, Emperor Charles VI, in October 1740 23-year-old Maria Theresa inherited not an empire or even a country, but a collection of far-flung territories stretching from the Atlantic coast to Italy to Transylvania. The Habsburg inheritance seemed almost intentionally designed to encourage predators, with its richest territories widely separated from the “core lands” and bordering her hungriest neighbors.

For the next eight years, almost all of Europe would be engaged in war as Maria Theresa fought to retain her crowns and exert her family’s right to rule the Holy Roman Empire. France, Spain, Prussia and Sweden all lined up against her, while Britain and Russia only provided sporadic help. Despite a tiny army, weak finances and utter lack of competent generals, Maria Theresa somehow kept her empire intact.

Austrian Succession is an expansion book for Soldier Kings: Pragmatic Sanction, adding even more historical background to this unique conflict plus game variants plus scenarios for two additional wars: the 1733-1735 War of the Polish Succession and the 1735-1739 Austro-Russo-Turkish War. You get 76 new die-cut and silky-smooth playing pieces plus 16 additional tiles.

—description from the publisher
categories: Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame

name: True Party Destiny
description: A collectible trading card strategy game featuring art of and by community artists. Gameplay involves playing cards to a grid, flipping one or more other cards based on adjacency and relative strength, and following special instructions on the cards, vaguely similar to Equinox and the TCG mini-games from various JRPG console games. Like Othello and Equinox, the goal is to have more cards face up in your color after all cards are played.

name: Ridley's Games Room: Brain Freeze Quiz
description: The fast-paced word guessing game for all ages! Get your teammates to work out the secret word, but there's a catch - you can't say any of the words listed on the card. See which team can guess the most in this brain-freezing quiz set from Games Room. Perfect for gaming fun with friends and family, it includes 140 question cards. Presented in a stylish geometric print box. Full instructions included.

name: Castaway
description:
A cooperative island survival game originally described and published as part of the webcomic Leftover Soup. Players navigate on and around the island searching for useful items and resolving dangerous events. Roll to move, items and events drawn from a common deck. Goal is to find the specific items to spell "HELP" on the beach and attract a rescue.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Events, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bucky Lasek's Ramps & Rails
description:
Ramps and Rails game play is a mix between a fun chutes and ladders race and an educational tool, which helps children better understand the relationship between numbers and spaces.

Teaches spatial reasoning and math skills.

name: Les Souris gloutonnes
description:
"Qui rapportera le plus de fromage ?"
"Wie zal de meeste kaasblokjes binnenhalen?"
"Who will bring back the largest number of cheese-dice?"

—description from the front of the box

Similar to Hungry Hungry Hippos, 2 players control mice using magnets under the board to bring cheese to their corner as fast as possible. Whoever has the most cheese when all cheese dice have been collected wins.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Nambarz
description:
Nambarz is a game of mental arithmetic and strategy for adults and children, age 7 and up. Played by anywhere from 2 to 12 players at once, either as individuals or in teams, it is an educational game which promotes the practice of mental arithmetic, as well as strategic thinking, while having fun.

It does not require complex math exercises. The idea is to perform combinations of mathematical operations (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division) using numbers from 1 to 10. The goal of the game is that a player be the first to discard all of his or her cards. The sooner a player finishes, the better his or her ranking and the more points received.

There are two possible means of getting rid of cards : either by finding a card that matches the card which is face up in the card pile (that is, sharing the same face number or picture), or by doing mental math (which is not limited to a certain number of cards or number of mathematical operations). The latter allows a player to eliminate several cards at once.

The game’s challenge is to find mathematical combinations that allow the elimination of a maximum number of cards at one time. It must be kept in mind that strategy is required, both in the choice of cards and in the order of the mathematical operations performed, in order to create an advantage in the next round or for a teammate’s next play.

Four types of wildcards are included to make game strategy even more challenging and exciting. The variations that are built into the game allow players to advance gradually from beginners to seasoned players, depending on the number of wildcards that are used.

name: Diplomat Chess
description:
Diplomat chess is a chess variant that is played on a completely circular board with 43 spaces, including a large red circle space in the middle which is considered adjacent to every cell it is surrounded by.

The game has the same pieces and piece movement as standard Chess with a few changes:
1. There is no Queen
2. There are only 1 of each of these pieces: Rook, Knight, and Bishop
3. There are 4 pawns instead of 8
4. Adds a piece called a Diplomat which instead of capturing can suborn enemy pieces, making them changes sides rather than capturing.
5. Pawns become more powerful because instead of changing direction to capture in 2 directions (diagonal right or left). They can capture in 3 directions (diagonal left/right or diagonal down). Pawns still need to move forward, but "forward movement" is defined as movement that moves the Pawn closer to the opposite side. So for that reason, the Pawns movement expands and it becomes a more powerful piece.

Diplomat Chess is different from Circular Chess because the board has a complete circle with 43 spaces, adds the Diplomat Piece, removes the Queen, and expands the movements of many pieces in the game.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Card Game
description:
A multiplayer card game based on Rock Paper Scissors gestures.

Each player is dealt 5 cards and play goes from left of the dealer around. Each player can either match the face card (ex. red scissors) with the same card (ex. blue scissors) of a different color or play a dominant card of same or different color (ex. rock would be played to crush scissors). Most specialty cards only require you to match the top discard pile color, while the change color card requires the top discard card to be a different color. It's a variety of playing same color, different color, dominate card and Rock, Paper, Scissors Battles.

When a battle card is played, you set down your cards and choose a player to battle against(traditional Rock Paper Scissors style). Play until a winner is determined. Loser takes up to three cards depending on how many battles were used to determine a winner of the battle.

The player wins a hand by being the first to discard off of their cards.

The game is made up of hands. You score points for each hand (10 points for going out, plus one point for each card left in the opponents hands) Game play is to 20 multiplied by the number of players, except in two person games, it is simply the best of three.

Use two decks for 5+ players
mechanics: Matching, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Quadlevel 3D Chess
description:
A version of three-dimensional chess with 4-half boards stacked on top of one another. A 4x8x4 playing field. Requires two sets of chess pieces, that even means two kings and two queens. Each 3D row has alternating colors. It is ideal to play facing each other along the long span of the board. The game is intended to naturally extend the 2D-Chess game into 3D.

The game was inspired by the 3D chess and checker boards depicted on Star Trek. A 18-page booklet was published in 1970 entitled "The Complete Rules of Three Dimensional Chess".

All aspects of 2D-Chess are retained and extended into 3D, even some things you would not expect like "Castling" and "En Passant". However, there is one rule that remains ever unpopular and may seem counterintuitive. 'The Change in Distance Rule' (CID) It states that all diagonal or L-Shaped moves must advance or retreat to or from the opponent. Yes, players do find it naturally intuitive to move on side-diagonals. But with the rule in place: The Rook nearly stays above the Knight in Piece-Power. Bishops & Knights cannot just move around on their Back-Rank. This eliminates Extra Diagonal 3D King running room and expect a similar game length to regular chess.

Two-Kings?: The rules were simplified by Robert Jr. It was very unpopular to have to checkmate both kings. Therefore, a King-fork, and/or either King being Checkmated wins.

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Kerensky's Vision
description:
Once known as Qualip, during the first Star League the unfortunate world became a cautionary tale of botched terraforming and human ignorance as entire continents became locked in ecological warfare even before Combine nukes fell in the Succession Wars. When the Clans invaded, ilKhan Ulric Kerensky saw in abandoned Qualip a chance to implement Nicholas Kerensky's vision for the Inner Sphere and the Clans, and the rechristened Kerensky's Vision became that chance. Setting Clan science to restore a paradise world lost to war created a planet unique in the occupation zone. On Kerensky's Vision, Clan and Inner Sphere merchants compete, while others smuggle, spy, and even steal in the packed enclaves of the capital. Here, anything can be bought, for a price.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The 40th Birthday Game
description:
The 40th Birthday Game is a light-hearted trivia game that adds a healthy dollop of fun to any 40th birthday.

Created solely for this landmark occasion, the special edition game has a traditional question-and-answer format. The professionally written and absorbing questions are designed to intrigue, surprise and amuse. All the questions are on the theme of forty, making it wholly suitable for the big occasion.

Players form two teams which take turns to answer questions.
Correct answers win cards, and the first team to win 7 cards wins.

If a team answers a question correctly, they can choose to "stick" (which ends their turn) or "play on". If they play on and get the next question incorrect, they lose all cards they've won on the current turn (i.e. the penalty for not sticking). Ending your turn with a "stick" means you keep your cards, and will not be able to lose them on a future turn.

name: Sixty Seconds Tabletop Game
description:
You have just one minute to talk on a given subject - don't let anyone else interrupt. All Wafflers are welcome!

A host is needed as a timekeeper who will also settle disputes.

The host picks a card at random and reads out the topic on the card. The first player has to speak for as long as he can (up to a maximum of one minute) on that subject. Other players listen and can challenge for: Hesitation, Deviation or Repetition.

If a player challenges correctly he can then take over the role of speaker. Whoever is speaking at the end of one minute earns two points. Whoever has most points at the end, when everyone has had an equal number of chances to be first speaker, is the overall winner.

name: Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa
description:
Pisa 1230. A very demanding client has arrived in the quiet Berlinghiere art workshop: Mr. Fibonacci, the famous mathematician! He wants to make a gift to the Cathedral, a work worthy of being exhibited. An excellent art that is in harmony with the mathematical sciences! Mr. Fibonacci spares no expense and commissions the work to Master Berlingo and Master Bonaventura, but on the condition that the Golden Ratio are sequence of numbers are respected ...

But the two artists fail to be precise and respect the rules that their client imposes. They work day and night on their canvases, in the hope that Mr. Fibonacci will be satisfied. But every time, because of his perfidious nature, the work is discarded because it is not very precise. A really busy challenge; but Mr. Fibonacci is a severe judge! Who will succeed in the enterprise.

Mr. Fibonacci and the Great Art Commission of Pisa is a dice drafting, roll and write game, where two artists (players) are competing to complete artwork for the fastidious client. The one catch? The artwork must be in accordance with the golden ratio. Whichever player completes their three paintings first, wins the game.

name: The 52nd State
description:
The game is simple; it's politics. You are a lawmaker in this brand new state. Make laws and convince the other players to pass your laws. It doesn't matter how you feel about the law, just make sure it passes.

On each player’s turn, they’ll propose a law by combining an “Issue” card and a “Law” card. The group can vote on this combination as-is, or another player (or several players) can propose an “Exception” card to be combined with these two cards.

As a group you all vote for the best combination and whether it includes an Exception, or if it’s the original two card combination on its own. When a new law is passed, the proposing player keeps their “Issue” card as a win token, and if an Exception was passed with the law, the player that played the Exception card keeps their “Exception” card as a win token as well. The “Law” card is put back to the bottom of the deck to be reused if needed.

The “Law” and “Exception” cards each count as a single point. At the end of the game, whoever has the most points wins.

name: Attack The Dungeon!
description:
Attack The Dungeon! is a Playing Card based RPG. To get started you need 1 Deck Of Cards and a Pair Of Dice. Separate the deck into aces, face cards, 2-6, and 7-10. Then here's where you get to choose your class from the 4 aces:
Spades = Thief
Diamonds = Mage
Hearts = Warrier
Clubs = Horder

The Dungeon is split into 3 Sections : Cards going up to 6 are beginner & mid level dungeons. Cards 7 - 10 are the higher level dungeons. Place a Jack and your hero on the table and roll for damage. The winner is the player who is alive at the end.

name: Save Your Bacon!
description:
Save your bacon in this cute but brutal breakfast game! Buy characters and action cards from a limited shared shop. Fight and steal from other players to get the characters you want. This fast paced game continues until a player assembles the ultimate breakfast or only one player still has the greatest breakfast food of all: bacon!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Force Commitment, Kill Steal, Ownership, Player Elimination

name: eMEMO America
description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players. Match the photos from locations around the US and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

name: eMEMO  München
description:
EMemo is a tile matching game for 1-2 players. Match the photos from locations around Munich and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

In the two player versions, players compete to be the first to match a set of tiles. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

name: Infiltrés
description:
Infiltrés is a party game that plays on memory and bluff. With 110 cards, 5 games are available for 1 to 12 players in 5 minute rounds.

The cards are divided into Role cards and Cargo cards. Role cards give a hidden identity that defines the player's goals according to his team. Cargo cards are the game cards that will allow him to achieve this goal.

The 5 games represent the steps of the journey of the Coal Conveyors:

Loading: 2 to 5 players
Each player place a Cargo card in one of the 9 wagons, then the players cover them until they no longer have cards in hand. The team that has the majority on top of the wagon wins.

Travel: 1 to 2 players
The convoy must pass through the 3 steps Mine, Wagon and Customs before arriving. Along the way, the Conveyor tries to fill up with a maximum of Coal, while the Traitor tries to get Werewolves into the Coal. The points are counted individually at the arrival of the convoy.

Halt: 3 to 6 players
Players exchange cards with the convoy stopped in the center. Each one tries to fill his hand or the convoy with his favorite Cargo cards, unless the Striders come to modify the balance.

Customs: 3 to 12 joueurs
Each player is responsible for a load (4 or 5 Cargo cards), each in turn takes the role of the customs officer. The customs officer must allow in a load proposed by another player. The Conveyors are trying to take 5 Coals in a row, while the Traitors win if 2 Werewolves go through customs.

Raid: 2 to 4 players
Traitors seek Striders, while Striders search for Werewolves. All cards are present in the center, face down, the first team that indicates the position of the 3 opponents wins.

description from publisher.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hidden Roles, Memory, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Leo Lausemaus Klatsch-Memo
description:
A memory variant. 54 cards (27 pairs) are placed randomly on the table, face-down. Players take turns flipping over one tile and leaving it open. When a pair shows, all players try to put their hands on the two tiles. Whoever is first on any of the tiles gets it. The player with most tiles at the end of the game is the winner.

—user summary

name: Companies
description:
Companies is carefully designed with fun rules and tactics which allow for multiple playing styles. Inspired by strategy games like Chess and War Games, Companies has elements of exploration, resource gathering, construction, and destruction.

The rules are short and simple. However, the game can become more complex as it goes, providing a unique experience while playing. Companies is packed with dozens of cards ranging from characters to technologies to planetary events. The cards have special abilities, which, with a little luck, can turn the tide against your opponents.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Economic, Environmental, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination

name: The 5th Key
description:
The 5th Key is a medieval turn-based strategy game where the goal is to obtain five or more keys and gain control on the central island. During the game you can use special cards which will give you strategic advantages and are designed to make the game fun and balanced.

After each round the control of the Castle port changes from one player to the next in clockwise order. A player can use the Explorer Spirit card to obtain the control of the port for the next 2 rounds,. The first player to obtain 5 keys and gain control on the castle port on his turn wins the game.

Battles are the only way to obtain keys. Every player starts with 3 keys and the remaining 2 keys need to be obtained from the neighbour players, the battle mechanics are based on a simple formula: dice points multiplied by the attack points plus the number of soldiers, during the match you can send a maximum of 20 soldiers for a battle and by default the number of attack points is 1, but it can be increased with the Brave Destiny Card. You can only launch an attack at your turn after collecting your village resources, If you win the battle you can claim 1 key and 5 coins if available. The loosing party will loose the number of soldiers sent to the battle unless he has hospitals to treat his soldiers.

After each battle the losing party will be allowed to draw a special card, the card needs to be displayed at any time to others, some cards are valid only once and need to be returned to the card pool, other cards are held permanently by the player. Only the defender can claim the special card and only the attacker can claim the key and the coins.
mechanics: Set Collection, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Der kleine Sprechdachs
description:
NOTE: not to be confused with Der kleine Sprechdachs, designed by Reiner Knizia[/boardgamedesigner].

The game is about describing these titular friends instead of making up and remembering stories as in the Knizia game.

name: Secret Agenda
description:
Magic has become unbalanced, creating disharmony among the citizens of the realm, and prompting an investigation by the order of Zoological Zealots. They have ruled that casting communities in your area were illegally gerrymandered and new ley lines must be cast immediately. As an adept and member of the magic community, you have been summoned to join the sacred council recasting the lines. This is your opportunity to alter the lines to benefit your own secret agenda. Rezone the new communities to your liking, but be careful! The other communities have their secret agendas as well. You'll have to outmaneuver the rest of the sacred council to benefit your community.

The sacred council is now called to order.

This is a family friendly game for players 12 and up. Bring this game home or easily take it with you to a party or game night. These premium custom components will look great in your hand and in play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Alliances, Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Map Addition, Map Deformation, Modular Board, Ownership, Pieces as Map, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Tile Placement

name: おとぎあつめ (Otogiatsume)
description:
The Black Hood has scattered all of the fairy tale characters! It's your job to gather them back together.

In this simple but engaging game, players try to complete sets of characters from famous stories, including Little Red Riding Hood, Alice in Wonderland, Urashima and the Kingdom Beneath the Sea, and Journey to the West.

Each player begins with a hand of four cards, and there is a face-down deck with two face-up cards on each side. On their turn, a player must discard a card to one of the face-up piles. They then draw from either the face-down deck or the other face-up pile.

The goal is to complete one of the four-character story sets or two of the two-character story sets. The first to complete such a set wins. To add to the fun, each character is only on one card but may appear in multiple stories, and the Black Hood card acts as a wild. Advanced rules, where you must play until winning twice in a row, are also available.

name: M.A.D. Bots
description:
Inspired by modern, real world, robot combat, M.A.D.Bots takes the idea of pitting two custom built robots against one another in a contest of speed, force, and luck.

Using cards, players choose their drive system, weapon system, and level of defense to create their robot. Then they roll to enhance the natural levels of those parts. Taking as many turns as it takes, each turn a combination of the strategy of your build and the luck of the dice to move faster, attack harder, and destroy your opponent.
mechanics: Action/Event, Advantage Token, Command Cards, Dice Rolling, Movement Points, Open Drafting, Simulation

name: Impel City
description:
Find out about the possibilities of the Impel Group. Meet ImpelCity, a city where the services and products of the Impel Group help to live comfortably and safely every day. It is a city that is not on the map, but you can easily find it in Impel's comprehensive business offer.

On their turn, a player picks a card then he/she choose section for resources and performs certain actions.

The game ends when the last card is chosen. The player with the most points wins.

name: Mécréants
description:
A standard medieval and fantasy miniature fighting game for 2 players.
The goal is to defeat the army of your opponent (by killing all his/her miniatures) using dice rolls and miniatures' stats
You use 1d10, a measuring tape, miniatures, each miniature must be attached to a square base.
Each miniature is costing a number of points based on what it represents, what it is wearing and its weapons.
Both players agree on an army budget.
A game is divided in turn, a turn is divided : 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack, 1st movement and combat, 2nd movement and combar, combats resolution, 1st player range attack, 2nd player range attack

name: Mécréants: Extension numéro 1
description:
This expansion adds:

rules clarifications
new obstacles (ditches, frieze horses, trap doors, etc.)
new environments (quick-sand, volcanoes, etc.)
new creatures (dragons, hydras and chimeras)
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Medieval, Miniatures

name: Room 25: Hypercube
description:
You are stuck in a maze like Prison. Escape this horrifying by trying to find Room 25, the rumored exit from this nightmare. But among your fellow inmates, may be Guardians, destined to entertain the sick game going on and end your sentence in the most gruesome way possible. You must escape this Maze.

Room 25 Hypercube is the latest installment of the Room 25 Game Series and will allow you to enter a New Dimension with the HYPERCUBE!

On their turn, players will plan their action to interract and move through the different rooms making up the maze like prison they are in. To win, they will have to escape alive by finding the Room 25 and its key at which point the game ends.

The Hypercube adds a new dimension to the game, now split into 3 levels.
categories: Horror, Maze, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action Queue, Betting and Bluffing, Cooperative Game, Memory, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game, Traitor Game, Variable Player Powers

name: Von Danzig nach Warschau
description:
German war propaganda game to promote Stricker bicycles: A journey through Poland on the trail of the German army.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 in Danzig and have to reach Warschau at space 40. If a player gets on a red space, he wins a point. The player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

Each red space represents a city or town which was taken by the "Deutsche Wehrmacht" in September of 1939. The text below the game board notes the dates of German victories and sometimes the number of Polish prisoners of war.
categories: Children's Game, Travel, World War II
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Cat Detective
description:
Cat Detective is a cooperative deduction game for 2 to 5 players.

In the game, players are children who are blamed for a shattered vase. The goal is to find out the cat broke the vase, where is the other half, how, and when, plus the accomplice cat. In their turn, players will collect cards from others to create sets and eliminate possible crime elements. When a number of sets are created, the game ends, and players will write their conclusions on the report.

If the four main crime elements are discovered, players win the game. If fails, they will be grounded for at least two weeks.

The game is paw. Are you ready to solve the meow-stery?
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Paper-and-Pencil, Set Collection

name: Culann's Hound
description:
Before chess, there were the ancient Tafl games of the Nordic & Celtic people. Rooted in the same idea of military strategy, but with a less complicated rule set.

Due to the less than stellar documentation of these games, there's a number of ways to setup the board, and approach your strategy, but the basics are always the same. Two teams, a king and his guards, and twice as many attackers, on a checkered board, take turns moving their pawns across the board, surrounding one another to remove them from the board. If the king escapes to the edge of the board, the guards win, if the king is captured, the attackers win.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Single Loser Game, Square Grid, Static Capture, Variable Set-up

name: Remedial Chaos Theory
description:
Old school game play, with a new school twist. Roll the die, leave your home 'timeline portal' and work your way around the board collecting tokens from each of the others. When you get them all, take them to the 'prime timeline portal' and win the game.

Sounds easy right? Well, with a non-linear board, figuring out your best move with each roll gets a bit more complicated. And once you're in a portal, you need the luck of the die to get back out.

Still too easy? Play it as the 'darkest timeline' and any other players can steal your tokens at any time, sending you back home to start over. Fun thing is, you can do the same to them.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Fantasy, Party Game, Science Fiction
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Baby Ninjas
description: Baby Ninjas is a card game of “Hot POOtato.” Players start with a mystery envelope holding either a clean or a dirty baby ninja token. Action cards are used to figure out which baby ninjas are where, move or swap babies around, and make sure someone else who is not you gets stuck with diaper doody at the end of the round.

name: Behind the Five Seals
description:
The Mysterious Tower of Magic was left without a master. Now the wizards of the Great Five will have to choose a new master.

The Shaman of the North, the Witch of the East, the Sorcerer of the South, the Seer of the West and the Sorcerer of Outland will leave their regalia and books, amulets and artifacts in the main hall of the Tower. They will go to meet the trials, armed only with their talents, will, knowledge, and with the help of faithful familiars - magical animals. Descending into the dungeons of the tower, players find themselves in the very center of the labyrinth. All possible routes diverge from it, and the most distant rooms contain spell scrolls, only all passages are protected by magical seals of the four elements.

The search takes place in rounds, at the beginning of each of which the players, in turn, take three different-colored dice from the general supply and roll them. Sinces the mage can easily move from one point of the dungeons to another, if there is no obstacle in his way, it is very important not to give rivals a chance to steal the scroll from under your nose. To do this, you need to skillfully occupy strategically important passages with the chips of your mage and familiar. The collected scrolls not only bring victory points, but also allow you to manipulate dice, seal tokens lying on the playing field, and even the enemy.

The game end when a rounds ends with the number of scrolls with a strength of 6 is checked (at least 3 for 2-3 players or at least 4 for 4-5 players).

The winner is the player with the most victory points (the sum of all his scrolls and bonus points for spells).

There was room for five circles of magic in the box, and only two of them (one basic and one additional set of scrolls) are used in each batch. Each circle of magic has its own specialization, so their choice affects the nature of what is happening in the dungeons of the tower. This allows you to diversify the game and provides high replayability.

name: The Game of Jack and the Beanstalk
description:
A dual race game. the giant must race up a staircase, reaching step 40, before Jack reaches the bottom leaf of the beanstalk (#20).

Each player moves by rolling dice. Jack rolls one die. The giant, being bigger, rolls 2 dice.

Rules pasted on inside of box cover.

name: Syncron
description:
Syncron is a quick card game for 4 to 10 players. In Syncron, all players play their cards simultaneously, aiming to move their meeples forward in order to win the race. But in Syncron, a wide variety of skills can be used to win the game, apart from just intelligence. You’ll need empathy, intuition, prescience, negotiation skills and even mind-reading powers.

—description from the designer

name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Hitos
description:
8-card Milestones expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval.


We have terrains to fight, we have weather that condition our battles. And now we have milestones. With Hitos, at the moment of achieving these milestones, you will have a benefit that will last you the rest of the battle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Print & Play

name: Cabbage Patch Kids: Touching Tunes
description:
Everybody knows the Cabbage Patch Kids! Ever since they were discovered by a little boy named Xavier, they've been making friends wherever they go. Touching Tunes unique electronic game board is filled with musical fun--all at the touch of a finger.

There are 6 fun-filled Cabbage Patch Kids games in all. Some specially designed for the younger player, others for the more advanced. And each one invites players to use elementary skills such as counting, matching, and memory.

1. Side-By-Side - In this game, it takes two cards to make a Cabbage Patch Kid complete. Match the most cards side-by-side and you're the winner!

2. Look Alikes - Here, there are lots of Cabbage Patch Kids! Be the player to match the most cards by the number of 'Kids or the colours of their outfits.

3. Family Five - You'll have an entire family when you collect all 5 Cabbage Patch Kids--each one with a different hair colour.

4. Make-A-Face Race - Be the first player to win all the right cards that make a friendly Cabbage Patch Kids' face complete and you're the winner.

5. The More, The Merrier - In this game, just like in the Cabbage Patch, 'Kids are growing from cabbages. Be the player to "pick" the most 'Kids from the Patch and you're the winner.

6. Heads Up! - Blonde hair, brown hair, black hair, red hair - even no hair at all! They're all here. And it's up to you to win the most pairs of Cabbage Patch Kids by matching their hair colours.

name: Five Deadly Venoms
description:
Five Deadly Venoms is a 3-player 18-card game that plays in 15-25 minutes. Each round, one player will face off against the other 2, attempting to earn coins by winning precisely the number of hands that they bid. The first player to win 7 coins, wins the game.

The name and theme come from a classic (1978) martial arts movie by the same name. It featured 5 evenly-matched deadly assassins whose techniques were based on venomous creatures. No one assassin could beat another but by teaming up, two might beat one.

The special features of the game are:

Every hand pits one player against the other two.
The deck is comprised of one wild card (the Student), and 17 cards split among 5 suits with a carefully-crafted uneven distribution of card values among the suits.
Hands are resolved by comparing the two cards played by the lone player against two cards played (one each) by the other two players.


The game is presented as a free print-and-play. The rules reference a bid token, but it is optional. The bid token is a disc with a numeral "3" on one side and a "4" on the other. It indicates who bid and how many hands they bid. The rules also mention 21 tokens/coins. These are used for tracking the score. Use any tokens you prefer or keep track of the score with paper and pencil.

I recommend keeping a copy of the card distribution (the last page of the rulebook) out in front of players. It helps players keep track of the unconventional distribution of the cards among the suits.

I really hope you enjoy the game. It's small and quick, but it has some depth in the play. If you're familiar with Euchre, it's a bit like a 3-player version in which one player always goes alone.

It's a nice filler for when you're waiting for other players to arrive.

name: Nordpolsflygningen
description:
Nordpolsflygningen (The North Pole flight).
Typical roll/spin and move board game for 2 players made in Sweden with playing pieces very similar to board games made at the same time in Germany.

Each player starts from different side of the board and should cross separate routes of 45 stops. The first player, who reach 45, wins a game.

Probable date is 1926 based on Amundsen's flight to the North Pole.
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wisdom's Tales: Candy Island
description:
In Wisdom's Tales, players take the role of one of the Master Wisdom apprentices on a mission to find King's Marshmallow castle and retrieve the Crown.

During the first half of the game, you and your team have to explore the Island by flipping tiles and resolving unpredicted events. Tiles, such as Caramel lake or Bombomb valley, will present some difficulties on your journey and will demand a bit of luck (dice) on your part. Stay close to your team, or wander in another direction, the objective is to locate the Castle and grab the Crown.

The second half starts at the moment a player grabs the crown. Now, you and your team will have to escape the Island, tracing back from your current location to the initial tile. But be aware: You're not only having to go back through all the difficult paths, but Chocolate guards will be on your track to take the Crown!

To successfully finish your mission, all players must get back to the start tile with the crown on one of the player's backpacks.

Will your team be successful on this quest, or will it succumb to those tricky, but weirdly delicious, candies?
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Exploration, Fantasy, Humor
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: Froschlaune
description:
Froschlaune is a game collection about feelings, only in German language. Included are 10 games 3 years and up. The cards show 24 frogs ... in different moods.

Included are among games in which you talk, learn and discuss upon feelings: A memogame, 2 moving games, a gesture game, a guessing game.

A fun game collection with cooperative and competitive games.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Bushido: Risen Sun – Loyal Kyudoka
description:
Kyudo, the art of archery, has long been the pastime of the Samurai and those that perfect it become known as Kyudoka. It is extremely rare and frowned upon for anyone other than Samurai to take up a bow for whatever reason. However, the Shiho, with little access to black powder, have made the bow a formidable part of their arsenal. Shiho Shota, a master of Kyudo, has been training loyal Shiho Ashigaru to use this weapon to devastating effect. They can fire several volleys and disappear into the underbrush before an enemy force can even sound a call-to-arms. Shiho Hiroto, never one for rules or archaic tradition was ecstatic to learn that he had some of the finest archers in Jwar who were not Samurai but loyal Ashigaru instead. Shiho Hiroto is a champion of the people and not the power that forces them into submission.
They may only be Ashigaru, but they have a pool of three ranged and access to the Lightweight trait, making them some of the best missile troops in Bushido. For 14 Rice, they have outstanding Range - and Strength - and can keep their distance to stay safe. With the Eagle Feather Arrow as a choice, it gives them that chance to let loose that one vital shot that must do damage at all costs.

Blister contains two miniatures, 30mm bases and a full colour profile card.

—description from the publisher
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein
description:
Whole title: "Soldaten-Leben heißt allzeit lustig sein. Ein heiteres Würfel-Spiel für Front und Heimat" ("Soldier's life means always having fun. A cheerful dice game for front and home").
Typical roll and move game. The first player, who reach 75 square, wins the game.
This game was produced in World War II-era and was designed for Wehrmacht soldiers. They could play on the front or at home (like the title said).

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wallop!
description:
Crash! Bang! Wallop! In this exciting game of strategy and luck. The leader which is chosing by who looks the strongest will shout WALLOP! the leader gets first dibs on action cards and every round a new leader is passed in clockwise order. Once the round starts all rounds only last for 30 seconds. This game is played simultaneously so there are no turns or turn order.

First all players roll 2 D6 dice then picks 1 of the rolls to keep and draws an action card based on the number shown on the die.
Action cards can be used at any time unless a card says otherwise.
Always leave 1 action card face up of each number out in the playing area.
Action cards help you deal damage block damage heal you and some may even have special effects no other card ability can do.

At the end of a turn all cards you havn't used get discarded. Each player starts with 30 health and
players keep taking turns until 1 survivor is left alive.

name: Napoleonic Kalinatactic
description:
A brief (two pages) set of Napoleonic miniatures rules published in Panzerfaust #56.

Normal units are battalions of 24 figures, split into six stands of four each (for changing formations). No scale or preferred figure size is given, though considering the era 12 or 9mm figures are likely.

The main element of the rules was the use of written movement orders, so that all movement could be done simultaneously.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Purgatorio
description:
After leaving Hell, L. enters Purgatory and finds it being consumed by shadows. Using the energy of her soul, she tries to fight off the darkness, but it may just be enough to shine the path and escape. You will take on the role of L. to save her from being consumed...lost...forgotten...

Purgatorio is a beautiful solo game inspired by Dante's journey in the Divine Comedy. In this game, you will manage L.'s soul's energy and try to light the forest up. Her energy is greatly limited, so you must figure out a way to recycle it as much as you need. The darkness will come, and it will reduce her energy to zero, so be quick...but clever.

During a turn, you will use up to two Energy cards and resolve the effect depending on the combination and placement of those cards; these effects are revealing and/or moving through Purgatory tiles, storing and restoring Energy (cards), and dealing with the Shadows (cards). Your objective is to reveal 18 tiles before you lose all your energy or lose 8 tiles to the shadows. The Shadow cards will be cycling in and out of your deck depleting your cards and the tiles.

If you want to help playtest the game, you can find it here: https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=29654...
And here is a questionary you can fill up: https://forms.gle/5nruRtZSvkMyP5ps5
I'll be updating the game accordingly :)
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Fino a prova contraria: omicidio color zaffiro
description:
This game was attached to the ioGioco #21 magazine.

You are late. Damn if you're late! The Judge will not take it well. But it's not your fault, really! Your colleague, Turk, the one following the case, had a kind of nervous breakdown and left the office suddenly. Now you are here running up the courthouse stairs, dodging the crowds and desperately scrolling through the papers of the first hearing. Because there has already been a first hearing but you haven't read all the papers yet ... and you have to face a murder trial!

Fino a Prova Contraria is a new cooperative game system that can also be played solo.
As a lawyer, the game will see you face a sequence of accusations: in each of them the Attorney will try to prove the guilt of your client. The focal point of each intervention will be highlighted in bold: to it, you will have to respond with a Defense among those available to you, or using evidence or testimony that contradicts the statements of the Prosecutor.
As you try to draft a defense, you will discover more and more details that will allow you to investigate the murder that took place.
The title of this first chapter is Omicidio color zaffiro.

name: Top Dogs
description:
Tricks win the treats in this barking good strategy card game Top Dogs from Ridley's Games. Are you the prized pooch that will win the most treats?

You and your fellow hounds have two rounds to win after starting off with nine trick cards for nine chances to win the most treats and be the ultimutt Top Dog.

Each trick and treat card has a points value, and players must choose which trick cards to play to score the most highly prized treats. Can playing fetch win the treat of a good head scratch? Or can a balancing act land some tasty sausages? Sniff out the 'Top Dog' card which will trump all the other tricks! Will you be top dog or sent to the doghouse?

Pawfect for friends and family fun, Top Dogs includes 95 game cards and instructions. Ages 6+. 2 to 5 players. Average 15 minute gameplay. Printed on FSC paper and with vegetable inks.

Fancy some feline fun? Try our other game in the series, Fat Cats!

—description from the publisher

name: Rome, LLC.: From Heraclius to Manzikert
description:
Rome, LLC. is a game of the Eastern Byzantine Empire and Western Frankish Empire from the unification of the Frankish Kingdom by King Chlothar II in 613 CE. to the disastrous defeat of Emperor Romanos IV to the Seljuk Turks at Manzikert in 1071 CE, which precipitated the Crusades.
Heraclius overthrew the Emperor Phocas in 610 CE, but his prolonged war with Persia weakened the Byzantine Empire, which almost collapsed to the might of Islam and the invading Avars, Bulgars, and Slavs. The Empire survived thanks to the Theodosian Walls of Constantinople, the secret of Greek Fire, and capable leaders such as John Kurkuas, John Tzimiskes, and Basil the Bulgar-Killer, who reconquered territory lost to the barbarians.

King Chlothar II united the Frankish Kingdom in 613 CE, but his inept successors were replaced by the warlord Charles Martell, who repelled the Islamic Invasion at Tours in 732 CE. His grandson Charlemagne invaded Germany, Spain, and Italy and in 800 CE was crowned Emperor by Pope Leo III, reviving the Western Roman Empire. Like its predecessor the Frankish Empire slowly fell apart, divided by civil war, and devastated by Norse and Magyar raiders. The last Carolingian ruler died in 987 CE and the empire split into warring kingdoms.

Two players may play Rome, LLC. one controlling the Eastern Byzantine Empire and the other the Western Frankish Empire. The Byzantines have the larger, wealthier, empire, but their enemies are more dangerous. The weaker economy of the Franks makes them more dependent on allies and marcher lords to guard the frontier and must expand their kingdom into an empire. Each plays their own game side-by-side, with their own statesmen and units, co-operating against invading Arabs, Avars, Bulgars, Magyars, Moors, Norse, Rus, Saxons, Seljuks, and Slavs. The game may be played solitaire, with the player either controlling one empire, or both at the same time.

Each empire has its own statesmen who are made emperors, kings, governors, or rebels. They are rated for their military, administration, religion, and intrigue abilities, and each has a special ability. St Boniface reformed the Frankish Church and the evangelist of Germany, so is a Western Statesman with 1 Military ability, 4 Administration ability, 5 Religious ability, 2 Intrigue ability, and the Convert special ability.

The map has provinces grouped into commands with their own governors, who collects taxes, quells insurgents, fights wars, but may assassinate their emperor or rebel and start a civil war. Emperors counters are used to change commands and rules and determine which statesmen of the new dynasty will become emperor, regardless of their abilities (or lack thereof).
Cavalry, Guards, Auxilia, Forts, and Fleets are used to fight wars and garrison provinces, with some provinces held by allies or marcher lords to protect the frontier from barbarians. Enemy leaders and wars move from province to province until defeated, encouraging revolts, and shrink the empires. Fighting a war may result in a triumph, which removes the war, increases prestige, reduces unrest, generates gold, and annexes provinces, but may also lead to a disaster or bloody stalemate.

Victory is determined by winning Prestige, which is earned by imperial administration, annexing provinces, defeating wars, and financing prestige projects. The loss of both Constantinople and Rome to the barbarians results in defeat, but bankruptcy and unrest can also drive an empire to destruction.

Rome, LLC. uses the system from Rome, Inc. (ATO 53). Each turn represents 5-10 years, with 10 turns in each scenario. The five scenarios start in 610 CE, 711 CE, 814 CE, 888 CE, and 973 CE which may be combined into campaign games. Players may continue the scenarios from Rome, Inc. and Rome, IInc. into Rome, LLC. allowing them to play 17 consecutive scenarios covering 1500 years of history.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Events, Point to Point Movement, Simulation, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Rainbow Blvd.
description:
Build rainbows to make the city of Hopewell Springs beautiful while creating 3D masterpieces in Rainbow Blvd! In Rainbow Blvd. players are animal architects, tasked with completing city plans and private contracts with the goal of gaining the most prestige to become the next head architect at the rainbow factory.

Rainbow Blvd. is played over a series of days (rounds). Each day begins with players acquiring city plan cards that will reward them for building specific rainbow segments and arcs around the city. However, take on too many city plans, and there is a risk of losing prestige for uncompleted work.

While the rainbow factory pays well, there are always opportunities for private contracts to help. The 6 local color companies that produce the materials used by the rainbow factory want their hues to be used whenever possible. Each is willing to offer more prestige to whomever completes their various goals.

The player who manages to collect the most prestige points before spring is the winner and new head architect at the rainbow factory! Rainbow Blvd. utilizes several fun mechanics including action selection, hand management, a time track, set collections, and more, resulting in a wonderfully beautiful experience around any game table!
categories: Animals, Card Game, City Building, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing
mechanics: Action/Event, Commodity Speculation, Contracts, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Claim Action, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Angry Birds Don't See Red
description:
Come up with the right words, find your way through the maze, spot the differences and land the die right to score high! Each task is a fun challenge, but who will win?

During their turn players pick a card from a shared deck. Each card is a mini game using the game components. The winner of each card takes the card as a victory point. Once any player has 5 cards they win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game
mechanics: Action Timer, Dice Rolling, Flicking, Real-Time

name: Lasca & Caos
description:
Argentinian compilation of Laska and Chaos.


World Chess Champion Emanuel Lasker developed Laska (a.k.a. Lasca), a variant of the Checkers Family, in 1911. The game board and play resembles that of Checkers, but captured pieces remain on the board and can possibly be freed later in the game.

Each player starts the game on the 7x7 board with eleven soldiers. On a turn, a player moves one soldier diagonally forward one space. If a capture is available, then the player must make that capture, trapping the captured piece underneath the capturing one; if the newly captured piece had previously had one or more pieces underneath it, then those pieces are now free to move in future turns. If a soldier reaches the opponent's back row, it's flipped and promoted to an officer, which can move diagonally in all directions. The game continues until either a player can't move or a player has no pieces remaining on the board. In both cases, this player loses the game.


In Chaos, The object of the game is to move your six playing pieces from one side of the board to the opposite side. The game is played by either two or four players. The catch is that the pieces all look identical; they are identified by a colored ring on their underside only.

On your turn, you move a piece forward, sideways or diagonally, possibly jumping over a single piece (a series of jumps is possible if the right gaps are present, as in Checkers). When a piece reaches the far side, it is turned over to reveal its true owner. If yours, it stays there; if not, it reverts to its indistinguishable side and its true owner must move it on his next turn. During play, you can also challenge the ownership of a piece being moved. The incorrect player forfeits his turn.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Memory, Secret Unit Deployment

name: Frases de Mente
description:
An Argentinian trivia game about famous quotes.

More than 1,300 famous, funny or curious phrases present you with as many challenges: try to remember or guess who said them and, if you succeed, advance on the board in a wild race with the other players.

On each turn, a roll of the dice will tell you which question to answer. There are always several options to choose from and where your memory fails, your wits or luck can pull you through. Those who get it right advance on the board, and the first to complete two laps wins.

Those old television ads, the slogans (and the whores) of politicians, the reflections of writers and philosophers, the most quoted sayings, the statements of actors, stars, kings and rockers are material for fun and memory in a fascinating game, ideal for meetings between friends or family. Also included is a variant to read and play individually.

name: 東方采霊弾 紅魔館 (Tohosaireidan Komakan)
description:
東方采霊弾 紅魔館 (Tohosaireidan Komakan) is an expansion to 東方采霊弾 (Tohosaireidan), which introduces new characters and weapons/equipment that help the characters fight more.

Publisher says:
Fill the battlefield with a barrage!
This is the first expansion of Tōhō's Dairei Bullets!

Three players from the Red House, Patchouli, Misuzu, and Sakuya, have joined the battle!

The barrage of card battles will become even more intense and vivid!

A new equipment system has been added for the three new characters!

What is the equipment system?

By equipping special cards to your characters or specific cards, you can strengthen their attacks and improve their basic performance.

To play this expansion, you need to have the basic set of "Touhou Shireidan".

Characters included
The following three characters are included in the first expansion.
For more information about the cards and rules, please visit the dedicated website.

Sakuya Jurokuyo
Beni Misuzu
Patchouli Norledge

戦場を弾幕で埋め尽くせ！
東方采霊弾拡張第一弾！

紅魔館から「パチュリー」「美鈴」「咲夜」の3人が参戦

弾幕カードバトルは更に激しく鮮やかに！

新たな3人のキャラクターには専用の装備システムも追加！

装備システムとは

装備専用カードをキャラクターや特定のカードに装備させる事で、攻撃を強化したり基本性能をアップさせたりすることができます。

※この拡張を遊ぶには基本セットとなる『東方采霊弾』が必要です。

収録キャラクター
拡張第一弾に収録されているキャラクターは以下の3人になります。
詳しいカードの内容、ルールは専用サイトで確認できます。

十六夜 咲夜
紅 美鈴
パチュリー・ノーレッジ
publisher's summary
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: 雪華 (Sekka)
description:
雪華 (Sekka) is a card game from Japan. Players try to match the snowflakes on their own hand cards with those on cards played by the other players. Get 6 snowflakes matched to win.

The publisher says:
A simple but profound card game where the fewer cards and information you have, the faster the game progresses and the harder it is to win.

You have 5 cards in your hand and the first player to get 6 snowflake cards wins!

Look at your cards and your opponent's cards and match them to get the snowflake cards!
If you get the snowflake card, you will get good luck.

Each game is short and easy to play over and over again!
But if you're not careful, you might get a big upset!

少ない手札と情報で早いゲーム展開ゲームが進めば進むほど勝つのが難しくなるルールシンプルだけど奥深い絵合わせカードゲーム

手札は5枚、誰よりも早く6種類の雪の結晶カードを獲得できた人の勝ち！

自分の手札と相手の捨札を見て、役を揃えて雪の結晶カードを獲得しよう
雪うさぎのカードは揃えると幸運が訪れるかも？

1回のゲームも短く、気軽に何度も遊べるゲームです
でも、気を抜いてると大逆転されてしまうかも？

name: Военно-морская игра
description:
"Военно-морская игра" (eng. "Naval game") is a pre-revolution Russian board game similar to Chess, 1907 made in Saint Petersburg.
From the carine government in 1908 this game won a bronze medal.

Each player controls 10 playing pieces - different warships.
Game play: At the beginning, the game figures are placed in specific squares on the game board (always the same as specified in the instructions). As in Chess, the different figures/ships moves on the game board in different ways and are removed when the square is occupied by another player.

The object of the game is to capture the opponent's Admiral ship (like a king).

name: Intrighi e Missive
description:
This game was attached in ioGioco Magazine 23

Europe between the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries is that of the great absolutist monarchies where politics, diplomacy and war are decided in the gilded lounges ... or between the sheets of the alcoves.
Myriads of small states fragment the continent, becoming pawns in a complicated game between the Powers of Austria, France, England and Spain.
Their ambassadors have much of the adventurer: partly bankers and partly spies, they are skilled double agents who know how to juggle the intrigues of the Court.

Intrighi e Missive ("Intrigue and Missive") is a strategic game of conquest and war, where battles are won also thanks to the missions of our emissaries in the courts of the adversaries. Each of them will bring a secret message (white or black) which, once revealed, will trigger special actions capable of changing the balance between the powers.
mechanics: Area Movement, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Contracts, Negotiation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: STOP by ZERO
description:
