STOP by ZERO is a push your luck card game from Japan. Players draw cards from a deck. The cards show numbers with either + or x for addition or multiplication. As players accumulate cards, they increase the player's score. But if they draw a x0 card, their score is now zero.
user summary

name: Operation Nordwind 1945: The Last German Offensive in the West
description:
Operation Nordwind 1945 is an introductory level, card-assisted game depicting Germany’s last offensive in the west from December 31, 1944 – January 20, 1945. The game concentrates on the fighting that took place in the mountainous, heavily-forested terrain of the Alsace region of France. Historically, the German offensive failed in its attempt to secure the Saverne Gap – needed to unleash its Panzers in order to cut off the U.S. Seventh Army and perhaps gain a political settlement to the war in the west.

- From the Publisher
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Point to Point Movement, Simulation

name: Contraseña
description: An Argentinian 1990's logical deduction word game.

name: Tango de Mente
description:
An Argentinian 1990's card game about tango.


This is a very original and entertaining board game. The box (black) contains the rules (red) in Spanish and English and the cards (blue box). Illustrated by Hermenegildo Sábat, it is a purely porteño game made up of characters such as the Chanta, the Curda, the Muñeca Brava, the Viejita, and Carlos Gardel, among others.

—description from Museo del Libro "Gardel y su Tiempo"


Play a tango!

From the stories that tango lyrics tell, Tango de Mente was born, a new deck and a pastime to practice with friends.

Sitting the players at the table, the cards come and go. When playing Curda, the values are reversed and a lower number wins over a higher number. Where the Chanta appears, the best card does not win, but the one that follows in value. Muñeca Brava beats any man, even Carlos Gardel. In turn, Cafishio beats any woman, even the Viejita. When Garufa appears, there is a party and the one who wins the trick has to give it away. Misteriosa Mascarita is a card with gender to define, will it be male, will it be papusa?

The game is learned quickly and its rules barely occupies the first four pages of the book. The rest of the volume links pieces of tangos, memorable lyrics that act as background music for the game, breathing life into it and giving thickness to each card.

—description from the book back cover


¡Juéguese un tango!

A partir de las historias que cuentan las letras de tango nació Tango de Mente, una nueva baraja y un pasatiempo para practicar entre amigos.

Sentados los jugadores a la mesa, las cartas van y vienen. Cuando se juega Curda, los valores se invierten y un número menor pasa a ganarle a uno mayor. Donde aparece el Chanta no gana la mejor carta, sino la que le sigue en valor. Muñeca Brava le gana a cualquier hombre, incluso a Carlos Gardel. A su vez, Cafishio le gana a cualquier mujer, incluso a la Viejita. Cuando aparece Garufa, hay fiesta y el que gana la baza tiene que regalarla. Misteriosa mascarita es una carta con sexo a definir, ¿será varón, será papusa?

El juego se aprende rápido y su reglamento ocupa apenas las cuatro páginas iniciales del libro. El resto del volumen liga retazos de tangos, letras memorables que hacen de música de fondo para la partida, soplándole vida y dándole espesor a cada naipe.

—Spanish description

name: わたしがシンデレラ！ (Watashi Ga Cinderella)
description:
わたしがシンデレラ！ (Watashi Ga Cinderella) is a tile placement game from Japan. Players are Cinderella's, trying to gather their things and get to the palace first. A Cinderella needs her coach, glass slippers and ballgown. These sit in different places in the forest, and Cinderella must walk around the forest and collect them.

Players take turns to lay down tiles showing paths in the forest. Pathways must connect, and on some cards are the three treasures. At the top is the Palace, and the path leads there. Players place tiles and move their piece around, until they have crossed the three treasures and head for the Palace. The first to get there complete wins.
user summary
mechanics: Network and Route Building, Race, Set Collection, Tile Placement

name: Die Olchis: Müffel-Knüffel
description:
This game is a Yahtzee variant for kids.

The dice contain icons instead of numbers, and special dice combinations need to be played.

The game is designed with the "Olchis", a green family of creatures designed by Erhard Dietl.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: Fri-Ho-Di Würfel-Spiel
description:
A typical roll and move type promotional board game. Published to celebrate 50 years of Homann Margarine.

The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game board shows the production process of "Homann Margarine".
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Pin 2 Win!
description:
Pin 2 Win! combines Bible trivia with 7 life skill categories (camping, health & fitness, recreation, world missions, arts & crafts, Bible facts, nature).

Players roll the dice to move around the track. They must answer a questions in the subject of the space they land on, collecting merits tokens and pins.

The first player get to the collect seven merit tokens and a pin wins the game!
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ship of the Line
description:
As admiral of the fleet, you command your 3 captains in battle on the high seas. Though the wind may be against you at times, you can still use it to your advantage. Try to find the vulnerable spots to destroy or capture the enemy! Outmaneuver your opponent using naval tactics governed by the wind.

This game is based on the British and French battleships that fought each other during the Napoleanic Wars, and uses the sailing concepts, strategies and idioms of that period.

The 3D ships consist of a hull, 3 masts with 3 sails on each, 10 guns, and a wheel/rudder. As the ship takes hits, parts are removed from the ship. Each player has 3 ships and tries to cripple, capture or destroy his opponent.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal

name: Euromoney
description:
For several years you have been experimenting with nanotechnological materials, in particular with graphene, you manage to discover an efficient way to produce it, you get the capital to start a business and you choose to focus on the European Union markets... but you are not the only one! The next few years will be key to position itself.

In a first phase, the participants will choose the countries in which they will initially invest and decide on their headquarters.

They will only be able to stay in a country, which manages to position itself better in the market, after checking the return on the initial investment (which is determined with a minigame of skill and fortune, the CT or coin toss).

Then the actions phase begins, where each player can perform one action per round, such as reinvesting in an already dominated market, conquering a free market, or attacking a market dominated by another player (all will be defined with the CT).

The final score is determined at the end of the fifth round, the participants will receive points according to the initial investment, the countries they dominate, according to the final value and their sizes, in addition to the bonus for maintaining the main venue or those that may have been obtained by a launch in the Kanchis sector (seven).


Desde hace varios años estás experimentando con materiales nanotecnológicos, en particular con el grafeno, lográs descubrir una forma eficiente de producirlo, consigues el capital para lanzarte a emprender y eliges concentrarte en los mercados de la Unión Europea... pero no eres el único! Los próximos años serán clave para posicionarse.

En una primera fase, los participantes elegirán los países en los que invertirán inicialmente y decidirán cuál es su sede central.

Sólo podrán quedarse en un país, quien logre posicionarse mejor en el mercado, luego de comprobar el rendimiento de la inversión inicial (que se determina con un minijuego de habilidad y fortuna, el LM o lanzamiento de monedas).

Luego comienza la fase de acciones, en donde cada jugador podrá realizar una acción por ronda, como reinvertir en un mercado ya dominado, conquistar a un mercado libre, o atacar a un mercado dominado por otro jugador (todas se definirán con el LM).

El puntaje final se determina al finalizar la quinta ronda, los participantes recibirán puntos según la inversión inicial, los países que dominen, de acuerdo al valor final y los tamaños del mismo, además del bonus por mantener la sede principal o de los que pudieran haber sido obtenidos por algún lanzamiento en el sector Kanchis (siete).

name: Veredicto
description:
Veredicto is a fun board game, created in Argentina, where you have to defend cases and convince other players that what you say is true, in order to win!

It's time to give your “Verdict”!!! All participants must use their ingenuity, strategy and audacity to defend a statement, whether it is true or false, and persuade the other players with arguments to win, within the dramatization of a trial where the participants will play the roles of lawyers and jury.

Players must advance and add positions to win round after round each case as lawyers or by getting their verdicts right as a jury, until someone manages to win the game.

The game is innovative and contains a large dose of entertainment because the players learn from each case and have fun watching the lawyers argue in each case. In turn, the participants test their knowledge, in a unique dynamic where everyone plays all the time.

How to play?

The plot of the game is novel and captivating. Players take on the role of lawyers and - indicated by a card - must argue for the truth or falsity of a statement, trying to convince the other players (the "jury") to lean towards their defense.

It's a game for 3 to 6 players or teams where you'll be a lawyer and you'll have to defend unusual cases and convince the rest that your argument is true in order to beat your opponent. The objective of the game is to win as many cases as possible to move up in your career before the rest do. Each lawyer must defend a position regarding an affirmation, convincing the rest that what he says is correct.

name: eMEMO Europe
description:
EMemo is a memory game. Match the photos from locations around Europe and learn fascinating facts at the same time. Plus Bonus CD-ROM with extra content.

Challenging memory fun. The player with the most tiles at the end of the game, wins.

—user summary

name: Questo
description:
Your goal in Questo is to score as many words as possible, but the letters are presented in random order, so good luck fitting them all together.

Each player has a 6x6 game board and a set of letters. A set of red letters are placed in the center of play available to all. One player shuffles the deck of 36 cards, then reveals the top card. If the card shows a letter, everyone takes this letter from their set and places it somewhere on their grid, either face up as the letter or face down as a block (similar to a black space in a crossword puzzle). If the card shows "FREE" — a designation on the J, Q, X, and Z — then you can instead choose a red letter from the center area to add to your grid.

After all 36 cards have been revealed, score any words that you have created when you read your grid left to right and top to bottom, with each letter in each word being worth 1 point. Letters that are not part of a word are worth 0 points, and if every combination of letters on your grid forms a word, then you have created a "perfect square" and score 12 bonus points.

The rules suggest playing multiple games until someone passes 500 points. Questo can also be played as a solo game, with a player trying for the best score possible, with 52+ being quite difficult.

name: Ascent: Give rise to an Empire
description:
It is time to conquer a new frontier. As global overseer you have ambitious plans for your expansion into the galaxy, but space is large and there are many contenders to deal with. From the peaceful Alliance to the insect-like Swarm or the warrior race Kthuani. Do you have what it takes to emerge victorious from the galactic power struggle?

Ascent is a solitaire, 4x, sci-fi, roll and write game in which you must explore your local sector, discover and lay claim to new systems and their resources, defeat your enemies in battle and trade with your allies (or destroy them too).

The game is played over a series of turns divided into 6 phases. During each turn you’ll gather resources, explore space and colonize star systems, construct new structures to progress your colonies, improve your armada and advance your political agenda.

Win the game by efficiently managing your commodities and time in order to pursue one of the 3 different, species-specific, winning conditions (Goals).

Once you complete any one of your goals the game ends and, optionally, you can determine your final score.

Will you be remembered as an all-powerful leader? A grand merchant? A warmonger? A political genius? Or something entirely different?

—description from the designer
categories: Exploration, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Set-up

name: Usurpers
description:
The King is a formidable ruler, whose strength and cunning have not been matched in a generation. But he is away on a diplomatic visit to another realm... now is your chance to seize the throne!

Take control of his legion troops and he will be ill equipped to stand against you.

Master the dark arts and summon a demon and he dare not oppose you.

Infiltrate his court and turn his own advisors against him and he will be powerless to stand in your way.

But, if he returns before you accomplish one of those things, kiss your ambitions good-bye.

Will you have the best reputation among the guilds when the king returns?

Apotheosis is a worker placement game where each of your workers have a type and a level. Many of the worker spaces care about one, the other, or both of those attributes. Blocking is a big dynamic in worker placement games, and in this one you are allowed to use a space as long as your worker is at least tied for the highest level there when you place it. This means there's not as much blocking at the beginning of the game, but as players level their workers up, blocking (and therefor placement tension) becomes more and more of a thing.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Race, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Keeping Up With The Joneses
description:
One-up your neighbors in 6 different aspects of life, while trying to keep up with the Joneses up the street, who really seem to have everything together!

In this rondel game, each space on the rondel has a track representing a life aspect you can compete in: Job, Home, Kids, Cars, Charity, and Social. When you land on a space, you advance that track. Occasionally, an aspect will score in a majority fashion (farthest up the track gets 1st reward, etc), but if you are too far behind the Jones marker, then you don't gain any status!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Rondel

name: Game of Trumps
description:
Game of Trumps is a trick-taking card game for four players. It is played in partnerships, but what sets this game apart is that players do not know who their partners are at the beginning of the round! The partnerships are revealed over the course of the round through cardplay.

The deck consists of four suits: Circles, Squares, Triangles, and Trumps. The Trump suit has cards numbered 1 to 14, while the other three suits are numbers 1 to 6.

There is no bidding, and play proceeds like most trick-taking games, with one player leading a suit and other players following if they can. Certain cards are worth points if they are taken as part of a trick.

The player or players that have the top two trump cards are on one team, and the rest of the players are on the other. This is not revealed before the round, but through normal card play.

At the end of the round, each player scores points based on how their team did during the round. The first player to 10 points wins!

name: Ice Barrier
description:
You are a small troop of 20 people who reached a sheltered valley a good 12,000 years ago. As winter approaches, you disagree on how to proceed: some of you want to risk it and move south across the ice barrier, another prefers to stay and wait, and the third thinks it best to go straight back to the old home. One evening you will come together to make a decision.

You lead one of the three groups and want to enforce your opinion with your 6 people. To do this, you take turns placing character cards between you and one of the other two groups so that one half of the card faces towards you and the other half faces the rival group. One half of the card has a numerical value that shows how convincing the person is in the discussion. With the other half, you use the person's special ability. So you always have to decide which side you want to benefit from and which side you might concede to another camp.

With these special abilities you can swap cards, turn them, or even knock other tribe members unconscious. This also allows you to influence the row of cards between the other two, because otherwise you can only place cards to the left or right of you, but not opposite.

When all the cards are played, see which of you won this primitive debate. To do this, you add up the numbers that are facing you to the left and right. Your rivals claim the other halves of the cards for themselves. The one who could collect the most points after three rounds has prevailed over the others and decides the further fate of the troop.

Additionally needed: 2 chips to mark the people protected by the warrior.

name: Kommissar Rex und seine Freunde!
description:
A Quizgame featuring the famous TV-Dog REX, regarding everything from the TV series and dogs in general.

The areas of knowledge are series, lineage, training, husbandry, behavior and breeding.
categories: Animals, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Lobster Roll
description:
The Penobscot Bay off the coast of Maine produces a yearly bounty of saltwater fish, shellfish, and lobsters. This solitaire roll-and-write game lets players become commercial fishers, seeking the largest and best catches of these valuable seafoods. It’s a risky endeavor, requiring proper timing, thoughtful management of your resources, and a bit of old-fashioned good luck.

Choose your location, roll your dice, and see what you've caught. If you succeed, sell your catch strategically to earn top dollar. If you don't succeed, use your failures wisely, to improve your operation for next season.

This is a solitaire, print-and-play, roll-and-write design. The game comes with rulebook, map sheet, and record sheet. The only other bits required are three dice: one each in green, red, and blue.

The game takes about 45 minutes (15 minutes for each of three rounds), and is appropriate for ages 10 and up.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Chess more than a game!
description:
4 levels - 8 categories - 32 important places of chess - 512 questions: Test your knowledge concerning the history, the rules, the board and its pieces and much more around on the most popular board games in the world!

The game board shows a map of Europe with 32 places that are significant to the history of chess. Each place is displayed with a playing field containing one of eight category symbols. The starting point is Madrid, the location of the first European chess tournament in 1575. The goal is to get to Tromsö, the venue of the 2014 Chess Olympiade.

The cards are divided into eight categories: Peculiarities – Openings – Mate in 1 – Rules – Game Board & Figures – Chess Lexicon – Timeless Beauty – Quiz. Every category is positioned on the board game with its own symbol and colour. On each question card, you will find questions for four different difficulty levels: Pawn –> Knight –> Rook –> Queen. The questions are ordered from easiest to most difficult, so there is an opportunity for everyone to be involved.

name: ダイスマンカラ：拡張 (Dice_Mancala: Expansion)
description:
ダイスマンカラ：拡張 (Dice_Mancala: Expansion) is an expansion to a dice game from Japan. The expansion has two extra variants for the base game. These can be combined.

The expansion 旬の宝石 (Seasonal Jewels) is a module that gets additional points in the set collection as you collect the same colors. With simple rules, it is recommended to used as soon as you learn the base game.

The expansion 悩みの種 (Troublesome) adds an additional dice to get in the way when you're in the mancala phase. Players with this will lose their turn privilege and will roll the dice from the beginning. At the end of the turn, place the Troublesome dice on the board again. Make good use of it and increase the number of times you roll the dice.
publisher's summary
mechanics: Contracts, Dice Rolling, Mancala, Modular Board, Variable Set-up
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: Wabbeln
description: Every player tries to throw his coins as near as possible to the wall. The one whose coin is the nearest wins.

name: TropeQuest
description:
TropeQuest pokes fun at everyone's favorite sci-fi and fantasy stereotypes and puts them literally into the hands of the players, who attempt to turn a pile of genre fiction cliches into a workable narrative. It's a creative, collaborative game with a lighthearted competitive element that uses cards and a board to make it fun and easy for players to improvise an original story. Best of all, it generates a unique tale each and every time it's played.

The board provides the story arc, a plot map that packs as many cliched scenarios and overwrought plot twists as possible into fifteen squares. The deck brings the setting... a library of genre tropes and oblique pop culture references to tickle the imaginations of geeks and laypersons alike. Players and encouraged to mix, match, and try out new combinations.

After a deck of tropes and a plot board are chosen, players are each dealt a hand of cards and take turns being the Narrator. The Narrator reads the prompt on the next available square and chooses a card from a pool of trope cards submitted by adjacent players (plus one random from the deck) to finish the prompt. While this may yield some hilarious results, the Narrator's work has not yet begun! Next, the Narrator "sells" the scene by elaborating, tying up loose ends, spicing it up a bit. Afterwards, the players redraw cards, the player whose card was picked draws an extra one, and the next player becomes the Narrator. Rinse and repeat until all fifteen squares have been played and the story has reached its thrilling climax.

So, the story is over. What was the point of it all? Well, in a way, the goal of the game is to laugh, have fun, and tell a quirky story together. However, in another, more mathematical and literal way, the goal of the game is to win by having more cards than anyone else at the end of the game. But winning also comes with great responsibility! After the gloating is over, the winner then chooses their favorite scene in the story Narrated by another player. That player then becomes the Chosen One, Master of Tropes and The Uber-Winner of that round of TropeQuest.
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Humor, Party Game, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Acting, Cooperative Game, Player Judge, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling

name: La mansión de Drácula
description:
La mansión de Drácula ("Dracula's Manor") is solitaire card game where you enter Dracula's lair to find your kidnapped relatives, as long as you also try to kill the King of Vampire before it's midnight.

In every turn, the player reveals a card until he finds a room card. An Event or Relative card can also be drawn, in which case it will be activated in the next room. The player has a limited time to find among the cards their relatives. The goal of the game is to find them and/or kill Dracula before he awakes. The game ends if the player leaves the Manor, rescue their relatives or kill Dracula (win), or is killed by Dracula's minions or Dracula himself.

This fast paced card game is inspired in the modern solitaire RPG's questzines but its roots are in the 80's videogames.
mechanics: Events, Map Addition, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Electric Whiskers – Expansion 1
description: First expansion for the 2016 big-hex reissue of the classic Advanced Tobruk wargame, including two pages of additional rules (Battlefield Walkaround), eight scenarios from June to December 1940, some additional Italian and British vehicle counters (ATS North Africa Expansion AFVs 2016_1940), a couple of pages of terrain overlays (wire, encampment and depots) and another two pages of vehicle cards.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: My Brand
description:
The personal branding game, MY BRAND, is developed based on the 5-personality type of 'CEO Brand Big 5'. This theory is based on the "Brand Personality Big 5", developed by Professor Jennifer Aaker of Standford University.

Players become brand managers, and through three consecutive games that they will play, they will help others and themselves to learn about their current brands and the brands that they are to persue.

Game 1
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Pick a card from the hand and introduce themselves using the brand card.
Players vote two players who presented the best.
Take the card and make your personal 'Brand Archive' pile.

Game 2
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Pick two card from the hand and open them on the table.
Then players tell stories about the strengths they have.
The other players offer each narrator a card from their hands.
The narrator takes two cards among them.
Send those two cards along with two other cards you previously places on the table to your 'Brand Archive'.

Game 3
Each player is dealt with 8 brand cards.
Players take turn become a presenter. The presenter opens a Question card.
Question cards have questions like:
'What is the cover of your autobiography that you've published 20 years later like?'
'What is the feed you are uploading, 5 years later, as a social media influencer like?
All players place a card face-down. The presenter gather the cards from the other players and add more card from the deck to make a total of 7 Brand cards. Shuffle them and open those cards in a single line.
Players secretly select two cards they think most accurately represent the presenter related to the question.
Then place tokens on those two cards. If more than two players selected the same cards, those players each gain points as many as the number of tokens on it.
Sent three cards which have the most vote along with your own card to your 'Brand Archive.'

Players gain points as they play each game, they get points from the vote they get and the cards selected by other players, etc. Whoever has the highest score after three games becomes the best brand manager and wins the game.

After the game, you can examine and draw your brand in graph at the back of your sheet.
It will visually tell you your current brand and the brand to pursue.

name: Sea Battle Agrisha
description:
Sea Battle Agrisha is a 2-player drafting and worker placement game using similar mechanics as Agrisha. Players draw resource dice from a bag, roll them, draft them, and then take actions, such as placing or removing Sway, to secure control of the ships involved in the fight.

Unlike Agrisha, the players in Sea Battle Agrisha have asymmetrical starting positions. Both players have a Captain and First Mate who have unique special abilities. Additionally, both players control a flagship, which are also not identical.

There are 2 pages to print, and you will need a number of dice and tokens (beads, cubes, or whatnot) to play.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Open Drafting, Worker Placement

name: Fantastic Pop Trivia: Questions from Every Decade
description:
Pop Trivia game comes with all you need for a trivia challenge of epic proportions! Simply slip off the lid, pull out a card, roll the die and off you go!

Featuring questions from the last six decades, Pop Trivia covers every aspect of popular culture from flares to feng shui, Beatlemania to breakdancing...as well as questions on the music we all enjoy too!

Pop Trivia is the ideal game for those who remember the good old days...with a smile!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Card Game, Dice, Party Game, Trivia

name: Civilisations
description:
Civilisations is a card game about building competing ancient civilisations over three Ages
Each Age has a different deck of cards. At the start of the game the first Age is divided into a number of hands equal to the number of players plus an extra hand which is set aside.
The set aside hand means that the card mix if different for each game, creating a strong replay value.
Each player then chooses a card from their hand and these cards are played simultaneously, paid for with Gold from your civilisations treasury.
Most cards have Military and/or Culture values and all cards have a special effect. When the card is played the special effect is resolved. These effects do things like enhancing other cards already in play, scoring extra points for certain cards, making certain types of cards cheaper to buy, removing or stealing cards from opponents and a host of other things to.
Some special effects are triggered by circumstances and if not triggered when played will wait until a later turn when their trigger condition is met.
Cards which target other players usually target a random card and/or a random player to prevent players ganging up one someone and ruining their fun.
After playing a card, hands are passed round the table clockwise, giving you new options and choices to make.
Once each player has played 6 cards the Age ends and the player with the card with the highest single Military score gains a Colonisation culture bonus and then players may choose to declare War on each other. Winning a war gets you a small amount of gold but, more importantly, destroys a random card from your opponent.
At the end of the third Age Culture scores are added up to find out who won.
The game was written with the following in mind:

A game should take 1-2 hours (my attention span now is about 2 hours.. age is great :)
The game can be played on a card or kitchen table
Set-up and take down time for a game is less than 5 minutes
You don't need to refer to the rulebook in play, everything you need to know is on the cards (e.g. card abilities are clearly explained in plain english)
There is a degree of randomness which stops players ganging up on other players
The game allows direct (war and espionage) and indirect competition (choosing cards which you know your opponent would like)
No one gets "knocked out" or falls so far behind as not to be able to win. Games are nearly always very close.
Every decision is interesting and important, you will nearly always want to play more than one of the cards in your hand and have to choose which very carefully
Choosing cards which interact with each other in positive ways is critical to victory, but the swapping of hands requires some careful forethought on what cards to play and when and also allows you to mess with your opponents by playing cards they want!
Each game is unique and you have to adapt to the cards you are given


The core game focuses on the region around the Mediterranean sea and Carthage, the Celts, Greece, Rome, Persia and Egypt as playable civilisations.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Coopolis
description:
Coopolis, the game of cooperatives is the result of our exploration of dynamic and innovative educational resources and has been declared by the Legislature of the Autonomous City of Buenos Aires of Interest in matters of Cooperativism and Education, for its contributions to the dissemination of the values ​​of cooperation, solidarity and collective work (Declaration no. 148-2014 / File 1043-D-2014).

Coopolis is a creative and dynamic educational game designed to introduce the growing cooperative economy. In Coopolis, players must work together to found and run a democratic company. To develop as individuals and to strive for the success of their cooperative, they must make decisions, while putting their teamwork skills to the test through familiar and entertaining games such as "mimic it", "taboo" and "draw it". Yes you can". This is an exciting game of skill and solidarity, where everyone wins or everyone loses. By playing Coopolis, we learn about the unique benefits, challenges, and how the co-op world works.

—description from the publisher

name: Warmis: Mujeres en Lucha
description:
This game that has the purpose of making visible and spreading the leading role that Latin American women have had in the construction of a different world, in the struggle to defend the rights of the oppressed peoples and classes.

Transforming in each of its steps the history of the entire continent, breaking barriers, in no hurry to lose calm until patriarchy and capitalism fall.

It is three games in one, or three modes to play with the same cards.

The first mode "Allies", each player must summon Allies to add more voices and defeat the Patriarchy.

The deck of cards is taken and they will be revealed one at a time.

On their turn, each player can choose to take refuge with their Allies, or stay in the streets to gather more voices, but be careful, since the same deck can leave Violence cards, which will stop us in the fight for freedom.

Violence cards include, Repression, Disappearance, Indifference, Capitalism, and Patriarchy. If one of these cards appears, we will be at risk, but we can continue fighting, if a second card appears, we will lose all the Allies that we had gathered that round.

The second mode "United" is a very dynamic game in real time, where we will try to collect all the cards of the same fighter as quickly as possible, to get all the characteristics of each one, and to put an end to the disinformation of their stories. .

We will have 7 different cards in our hands, and we will have to exchange cards with other players, with the only limitation that all the cards delivered must be from the same Fighter. The player who manages to collect the 7 cards of the same Fighter first, will be the winner.

Finally, the third modality "Abya Yala", is a cooperative game where we will try to reconstruct the story. For which we will have to put together a timeline ordering from smallest to largest the year in which the women who have fought to defend the rights of our peoples throughout the continent were born.

But with a twist, since we will play with our cards upside down, so that we can only see the back of our cards, but we can see all the cards in hand of our partners.

In turn, we will have to give clues to the other players about the cards in their hand, and thus be able, together, to put together the correct time lines.

A lot of memory, a lot of commitment, in a beautifully illustrated game, with great quality components, which will help us become aware and build knowledge for the construction of a different, fairer and more inclusive society.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Cooperative Game, Deduction, Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Lark: A Game of Challenge & Chance
description:
-Abundance Through Play-

Lark is a party game for venturesome people. Players challenge each other to get out of their comfort zones in fun and affirming ways using challenge prompt cards and the roll of a 12-sided die.

How to play: Players all draw four cards. One Player (the Dealer) chooses a prompt from her cards or makes up her own for one or more Players and assigns the odds of it happening using the 12-sided die. If Players consent to the challenge and odds, the Dealer rolls the die and the play either commences or not. Regardless of the outcome, the Player who accepted the challenge becomes the new Dealer. Discard and draw a new card when you've played both prompts on your card. Play Wild Cards when it suits you. Incorporate as many variations and inspirations as you like. Be adventurous. Be good to each other. Dealers can prompt one or every play with every turn, including themselves.

On winning and losing: Traditionally, the gameplay is not competitive. However, for those who like the added tension, players can win by collecting points for consenting to a proposal IF and ONLY IF they are not then required to perform the feat based on the role of the die. The first player to 15 points wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Real-Time

name: Lark: Happy Hour Expansion Pack
description:
An expansion pack for Lark: a game of challenge & chance that will elevate your next social night of drinks and carousing.

This expansion pack blends seamlessly into the Lark main game and adds 64 prompts & 5 more wild cards that work best when you and your friends are sharing a drink or a social night on the town.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Command Cards, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Negotiation, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Real-Time

name: En la Punta de la Lengua!: Versión Difícil
description:
A game where laughter and creativity come from the tip of your tongue.

Teams are assembled and the game begins. When it is your turn, you have to give clues so that your classmates guess the secret word (the one that is underlined), but without saying any of the words that appear on the card (or their family of words). WATCH OUT! That the opposing team will be monitoring you.
categories: Card Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: BattleTech: Spotlight On Hellion Keshik
description:
Death From Above. No words better describe Hellion Keshik, the bodyguard Trinary for Clan Goliath Scorpion's saKhan. Few formations conjure terror amongst their enemies more than this assemblage of warriors. Forged from tattered remnants of two Clans, one absorbed and the other abjured, Hellion Keshik welded their disparate philosophies into one. As the tip of the spear for Hellion Galaxy, the Keshik does more than protect the saKhan. These warriors train endlessly and fight savagely like no others in the Scorpion Touman. The Keshik has never tasted defeat, because victory is so sweet.

Spotlight On: Hellion Keshik includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Caminando
description:
Questions related to daily life, trades, domestic tasks, popular knowledge, ancestral knowledge... all this and much more will accompany us on this path of fun and learning.

Caminando is a quiz game, with varied dynamics where other types of knowledge and skills are rewarded that are not associated (like most quiz games) with academic knowledge. Questions referring to daily life where the knowledge "that plays" is that which we have acquired at work, from grandmothers, on the street, in domestic chores, in the neighbourhood. Caminando proposes us to play from other ways of asking about many kinds of knowledge. Because here all knowledge is valid.

name: リトル2キングダム (Little II Kingdom)
description:
リトル2キングダム (Little II Kingdom) is a 2 player card game from Japan. Players build up a tableau of cards and send units across to fight the opponent and capture their castle.

The designer likens the strategy to Shogi, in that a player must be careful which units are deployed and how they attack with a longer view to win.

Each player has a deck of cards and lays out a castle at the back of their tableau, and a forest at the front of the tableau. There is an empty row between the two cards, and two empty spaces either side (so the tableau is 5 wide by 3 deep).

Each player draws cards and plays them to their tableau. Buildings go to the back row and generate military units. These can advance and attack in different patterns. So one unit might advance like a pawn, another like a knight in Chess. A player wins by successfully attacking the opponents castle.
user summary
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Adiviná Qué Tengo...
description: The object of the game is to get your teammates to guess as many words/images as you have on your cards. To achieve this you have to say everything that comes to mind in relation to that word without naming it. Each card is guessed is a point for the team.

name: Fröhliche Rheinfahrt
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start with their Steamship at space 1 in Ludwigshafen. The first player to reach space 55 (Köln) wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Gordon-Bennett-Rennen
description:
The race starts on the small red dot at the gasometer in the lower left corner of the game board. The players take turns to roll and move one space. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The die shows the colors red (upward), black (downward), blue (left or right), green (left half:diagonal up/right half: diagonal down), white (choice move).

The player to reach the furthest red dot at the lower edge of the game board wins the game. If a balloon sets down on a space without a red dot it may begin again at the starting space. The game ends when 3 players have reached a red dot.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Advanced Tobruk 2016: Expansion 3 – Tobruk Perimeter
description: Second expansion for the 2016 large-hex reissue of the Advanced Tobruk wargame. As in the case of the first one, the zip bag includes a 2-page Battlefield Walkthough (with the exact same additional rules as Expansion 1), 8 scenarios dated from March 31 through April 14 1941 (the "Enter Rommel" period of the North African Campaign), a small countersheet with German and British AFVs (ATS North Africa Expansion AFVs 2016_1941), two pages with additional AFV cards, and another couple pages with terrain overlays (hills and trench lines).

name: Escape From Camelot
description:
Four smaller quests await in this legendary adventure. You have been invited to a grand tournament in the legendary Camelot to compete against Sir Lancelot. When you arrive, however, you discover that the kingdom is in chaos. King Arthur has gone missing and the mythical “round table” has been broken into 4 pieces. It is up to you to take on 4 quests to reassemble the table and to restore Camelot to glory. Can you pull the sword from the stone, vanquish a dragon, match wits with Merlin, or battle your way to victory? Encounter characters like Merlin, Guinevere, Mordred, Lancelot, and Morgan Le Fay as you attempt to figure out what is real and what is legend. Be careful though…. with every passing minute, the darkness around Camelot grows.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape on the High Seas
description:
A great treasure has been taken by some of the most infamous pirates to ever sail the Caribbean, Calico Jack and Anne Bonny. The pair have recently fled the safety of Nassau and are on a spree attacking ships big and small, including other pirate ships. Among their recent takes is an object you need… a time machine, hidden within a chest of gold. It is up to you to infiltrate the crew, gain their trust, and escape with the treasure before they grow wise of your plan. The only issue is that Anne Bonny is not an easy pirate to deceive. Wicked and clever, she sees through your rouse and is ready to make you pay for your deception.

Three separate, shorter games await you in this massive adventure. Each game increases in difficulty, with the first being a nice introduction to escape games and the last being a challenging battle to claim your riches. Use cannons to sink other ships, climb to the highest mast, explore the bowels of the ship, and even sword fight your way to victory!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Moon
description:
After 21 missions through time, you have earned yourself a nice vacation. The boss has booked you onboard the spaceship “Apollo 135” in the year 2050 on an all-expense paid trip to the moon! As the spaceship soars out of the atmosphere, it becomes quite clear that not everything has gone according to plan. After a rough landing on the lunar surface, you realize it is up to you to repair the ship before it is too late. With an artificial intelligence system malfunctioning, you have little help making sense of the massive spaceship, but odd clues appear to be have been left on the lunar surface itself. Can you crack the code, repair the ship, and return to Earth or will you be lost in space?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: The Games of Olympus
description:
The 2020 Olympic games may have been postponed, but this summer you can compete against the gods! In this adventure we have several smaller escapes to complete, so you can play the game in smaller spurts than a traditional hour long setting. We are sending you back to Ancient Greece where a false prophet is spoiling future events and changing history in her wake. The only way to stop her prophecies is to compete in the fabled “Games of Olympus.” Each challenge will pit you against the Greek gods, goddesses, monsters, and heroes as you attempt to come out on top. Do you dare enter the maze of the Minotaur, soar into the sky on Apollo’s chariot, face-off against Medusa, or think you can resist the urge to open Pandora’s Box? Win each of the challenges to take on the prophet and restore history to its rightful path. Can you earn the favor of the gods?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Circus Heist
description:
Time for the Greatest Heist on Earth! You have a strange mission this time. An extinct animal, known as the Tasmanian Tiger, has been found back in a depression-era circus. It will soon disappear into history, so this is your chance to travel back and steal the creature, thus saving the species. To do so, you will need to pull off a heist of EPIC proportions! Sneak through the circus train, explore the sideshows, avoid the meddling clowns, and try to find a way to plot out the perfect heist. You see… the only way to get the tiger will be to steal it from right under the Ringmaster’s nose and in front of a whole tent of paying customers. Are you able to save the tiger in time… or will you just turn into its next lunch?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape Alcatraz
description:
Two 45 minute escape adventures await you in our holiday box! Our agency is in crisis! The Clockmaker, head of EMIT, has been framed and locked up in the world famous prison known as Alcatraz. The place is said to be the most secure prison on Earth, with many escape attempts proving to be failures. That is where you come in… You have 2 missions to complete. First, find a way to escape your jail cell before the guards notice you are missing. Clues are hidden everywhere, along with the tools you will need to get out. The second mission asks you to do the impossible: Rescue the boss and find a way to escape the island itself. The search light is always watching for you and the bay is known to hold Great White sharks… yet this escape attempt is your only option to save our agency and perhaps the entire world.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Mothman
description:
In this eerie, yet family friendly, escape adventure, we are sending you back in time to the quiet town of Point Pleasant, West Virginia. At first glance, it seems like the least likely place in the world for something sinister to happen. However, in 1966-1967 the small town was rocked by the appearance of a mysterious creature…one known as the Mothman. With large wings, glowing red eyes, and the aura of danger hovering around it, the creature roamed the woods and the skies. We are sending you back to 1967 to investigate claims of a Mothman sighting where your name was brought up by the creature. An abandoned cabin holds the secrets you need, where the radio crackles with incomprehensible codes and strange men in black suits stalk the streets waiting for your arrival. You only have an hour to explore the cabin, piece together the evidence, and escape before you end up disappearing into the night.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: Quest for the Lost City
description:
This is no ordinary treasure hunt. This is not the city of gold… this is something much bigger than that. The Incan Empire was one of the most mysterious civilizations the world has ever known and it holds one of the largest secrets. The lost city of Patiti was said to be a massive city filled with gold, jewels, and priceless treasures. Tucked away in the lush jungles of Peru, the city has claimed the lives of many explorers who have tried to find the path, but they never held the secret you do. A mysterious package has been delivered to us from the Vatican filled with maps and tools used by Spanish conquistadors. It appears the lost city had been found before… and with the maps in your possession, you have the chance to find it again. In this combination treasure hunt and escape room, you must unravel the path, decode the secrets, and survive the quest, with danger lurking only steps behind.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the World's Fair Killer
description:
Two 45 Minute Escape Adventures await in this box! Your mission takes you back to the 1893 World’s Fair in Chicago, where you will have a choice to make. One Escape Adventure is a Family Friendly exploration through the fair which introduced the Ferris Wheel, Cracker Jacks, and many other iconic inventions as you search out a misplaced object in time. Will you be able to discover all of the secrets of the World’s Fair? The other Escape Adventure, however, takes a darker turn. HH Holmes, America’s first Serial Killer, set up a hotel near the World’s Fair and rigged its rooms with a variety of traps to ensnare his victims. Step into his hotel and dare to avoid the traps and escape in time. Will you escape or become his next victim? Both games are included in this next adventure to play separately or together!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Sheboygan-opoly
description:
Monopoly with a unique Sheboygan twist. Don't eat too many onion rings at the Charcoal Inn!

Each game is a walk around a specific town and the board spaces are the buildings, local businesses and traditions that are special to that town.

Follows traditional Monopoly rules.
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Truth or Drink: On the Turps (Aussie Edition)
description:
A whole carton of refreshing Aussie truth! Over 300 ripper new questions, for those with a hard-earned thirst for knowledge.

Think you know your mates? Drink again. By the end of the night, we’ll all be better friends after sharing the things we never thought we’d say out loud. Heaps of crisp, fresh questions. Aussie as.

Every turn, a judge draws a question card and selects two people to either answer or drink. Players win the round by giving a satisfying answer and being awarded the question card.

name: Triads
description:
The Oryius titans of war dropped into the atmosphere of Bengall II. Planetary orbital fire screeched in vain as the Oryius forces were dropping short of their range. Thunderous echoes reverberate as the giant mechanized robots, or “mecha”, hit the ground. Although wise to avoid dropping directly into the city, the forces of Bengal II were now alerted to their presence. Forces were moving to intercept.

Triads uses counters and traditional wargaming gameplay to simulate robotic combat of the future. Players choose a team of three triads of mechanized robots. Each member of a triad can work independently but gain their greatest strength working as a team.

The objective is to destroy your opponents robot forces.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Boise is Brighter
description: it was a vintage Monopoly clone with properties showing the businesses and buildings of Boise, Id.
mechanics: Income, Negotiation, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Junior Achievement Company of Defiance, Ohio

name: Omni TCG
description:
Within Omni, a realm of constant flux, there stands massive Relics of unknown origins. These Monoliths, the Gate Crystals, are the source of all existence in Omni. From them, Souls manifest and engage in battle for complete omnipotence. Enhance your Souls with Quirks which provide unique abilities and allow them to ascend into Entities of considerable power. Change the tides of battle with Events that become reality through the magic of these Crystals. Be wary! When one of these great Monoliths shatters and falls upon itself, the gate of creation closes with it. Wage war against other crystal wielders; use your mighty Gate Crystals and their adaptable creations to claim Omni for your own!

Game starts with players selecting a Soul from their Existence deck ("Monster" pool) to begin the battle, placing one crystal on their board, and drawing three cards from their Standard deck (Event and Quirk deck). During a player's turn, they can improve their Souls by equipping Quirks and eventually Ascending them into Entities, by meeting the required EvoVal points for the Entity chosen (determined by Quirks' cumulative EvoVals). Players may also play "Stabilizers" or "Destabilizers" (Omni's equivalent to "Spells and Traps") that will have an immediate impact on the gameplay. There are no "Deck Outs" in Omni - simply reshuffle the Standard deck and continue play. Once all of a player's Crystals or Souls are destroyed, they have lost the game. They may also surrender at any point.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Player Elimination

name: Escape: Rock N Roll Spy
description:
Your next mission takes you back in time to Benny’s Diner, the most hopping malt shop in the 1950’s. At first, this mission may look like a breeze. There are poodle skirts, a juke box, and the fanciest cars you have ever seen. However, this diner holds a secret, which only the wisest can uncover. Benny, the owner and a local celebrity, has known connections to the Soviet Union and we think it just might be possible that he may be none other than a Russian spy! You have an hour to sneak into the diner, discover the secrets, and figure out what Benny knows before he returns. Good luck!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Titanic
description:
In our most dangerous mission yet, you will be asked to board the infamous Titanic in a daring rescue attempt. The ship is already beginning to angle into the water, but your team has been tasked to head deep into the bowels of the ship to save an agent and to recover a cursed object which may have brought about the disaster. Split up to explore the elegance of the first class staterooms or take your chances in the already flooded 3rd class bunks as you gather objects to complete the mission. Remember, however…. there were not enough life boats on board and time is rushing away. Can you escape the unsinkable ship?

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Silver Screen
description:
The worst fears of your boss have come true. Someone has discovered time travelers and has made a movie about your adventures... a movie soon to be released to the world as a blockbuster. This simply will not do...so your team has one simple mission. Stop the movie from being released at all costs. Sneak into the movie studio in old Hollywood and sabotage the production without being discovered. Hurry, the filming resumes soon! Do you have what it takes to bring production to a halt? Lights, Camera, Action...

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: Outlaw
description:
After causing a massive change to history, you need to prove your worth to your boss at the time traveling agency. The easiest way to regain his trust is to hunt down a time traveling object lost back in the Old West and return it to the present. The only issue is that a band of outlaws have already found the item and plan to defend it with their lives. It is up to you as to how you proceed. Partner with the law to hunt down the outlaws and put them to justice... or join the gang and steal the item from under their noses. Either way, it is up to you to recover the item... even if it comes to a shootout.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Stellar Evolution
description:
Stellar Evolution is a game of strategy set in a distant future where mankind makes its home among the stars. Choose a race and select your fleet from the varied units available to you before leading them into battle against another player. Destroy enemy forces and capture key strategic ships in order to become the ultimate victor.

The game takes place on a square grid. The game takes place over turns, meaning that one player moves all their ships and takes all their actions before announcing their turn is at an end and the next player begins their turn. The game ends if one player destroys all opposing forces or automatically after every player has had 10 turns.

—description from the publisher

name: Mein Körper: Das Quiz
description:
Why does our hair turn gray? How many chambers does the heart consist of? What causes tooth decay? Our body is a miracle! Mein Körper - Das Quiz (= my body, the quiz amazes and amuses, and lets young and old quizmasters prove how well they know the human body. The quiz game contains everything children want to know about our organs, bones, and cells, as well as the exciting processes of human life. There are also plenty of unbelievable facts and crazy stories.

Each player draws a card from each of the different categories. The youngest player starts and turns over one of the cards from their own little pile. If it is a solo card, the question may only be answered alone. If the answer is correct, the card may be kept. If it is a chance card, all players may guess the right answer. The player who comes up with the correct answer the fastest receives the card. The goal of the game is to be the first to play out all the cards from your own pile and collect more correctly answered cards than the other players.

name: Das Feel Good Spiel
description:
Das Feel Good Spiel is a card-based game that is all about expressing affection and appreciation for your loved ones by answering the questions on the cards. The game helps to create a conscious moment for compliments and nice words.

The small cards support players in finding the right expressions and give ideas for different topics they want to highlight with compliments. The game is not about winning or losing, but solely about positive vibes and the players' well-being. In the course of the game, the players compliment each other and express their mutual appreciation in a creative way. On 100 cards, there are numerous ideas for kind words, encouragement and compliments.


In each round, one person receives compliments from their fellow players.
One person draws a card with a compliment idea and reads it aloud.
The other players add their own personal compliment and write it on a piece of paper.
Afterwards, all compliments are read aloud.


The game can be played with in a variation where each player has to guess who wrote down what and receives one point per correct guess. Whoever has the most points wins.

name: Girl Talk: Sassy Sticks
description:
Girl Talk games are all about getting together with your friends and having fun. Sure, there's a way to win if you want to be competitive, but there's also room for plenty of LOL moments in each game so you can just sit back, chill out and have a great time with the girls.

Who’s got the best answer? Pick a stick with a question on it and roll the dice to “fill in” the missing word. Then, think up a good answer to the question based on the kind of answer the die asks for — whether it’s silly, weird, true or anything else!

The best answer gets a ring. The person who collects the most rings, wins!

name: Bible Brawl: End Times Expansion
description:
The End Times Expansion Pack adds 30 more cards to be used with your base game of Bible Brawl.

This expansion pack draws inspiration from stories and characters from the book of Daniel and Revelation. From a seven-headed red dragon to a minion of the Locust King Abbadon, you never know what you are going to pick up next.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting, Religious
mechanics: Action Points, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Take That

name: Little Drawington: Halloween
description:
Welcome to Little Drawington, a small sleepy village on a hill in the British countryside that prides itself on their beautiful gardens and friendly community. As the days get shorter and the leaves start to change, excitement rises in the village as they get to work on their autumn gardens for the Pumpkin Growing Contest. This year, the competition is extra fierce, there are strange rumours going around of unusual behaviour. It is the night before the grand jury comes by and you are not leaving anything to chance, calling upon dark forces from beyond to grow your pumpkin the biggest and even sabotaging your neighbours gardens.

Little Drawington: Halloween is a draw and draw game, where players draw cards with shapes they then get to draw on their own garden boards.

The game consists of 3 repeating phases and a final evaluation round The phases are: The Ghastly Growing Phase, the Creepy Carving Phase, and the Demonic Decoration Phase.

When the deck of root cards has run out, the sun rises and players add up their points. The player with the most points win. The garden boards look like little clipboards from the town council, so as players are creating their gardens they are also filling in what the garden looks like on a scoring form for the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Print & Play
mechanics: Connections, Line Drawing, Move Through Deck, Paper-and-Pencil, Square Grid, Take That

name: Dracula: Fangs & Pitchforks
description:
Dracula is a social deduction game. In Dracula all players are arguing for their life, convincing Dracula not to eat them while having a hidden agenda.

Welcome to Transylvania where the local Villagers have received the unwanted pleasure of joining Dracula for dinner.

One player will be the famous Count and the rest will be Villagers trying to convince Dracula that anyone else would make a better meal. Players will take turns using Excuse cards to craft their plea’s and take cues from Act cards to support their plea. But watch out, your fellow Villagers might stab you in the back using their Excuse cards to save their own skin!

The game ends, when all players have had their round as Dracula. All players count their Victory tokens. The player with the most Victory Points is the winner.

name: Herzblatt: Das Kartenspiel
description: In this card game, each player gets 3 cards in hand. The cards show boys or girls with different hair colors. On his turn, the player lays out a card in a grid and tries to make a set with it. Then a card is drawn. Sets consist of 3 girls and a boy or 3 boys and a girl and earn different points depending on whether the set was formed horizontally, vertically or diagonally. The player who has collected the most points wins the game.

name: Das Rennen
description:
In this car racing game, each player gets their own set of racing cards and a fuel card. The race card to be used for each game round can be chosen by a player from any number of drawn cards in his deck. However, if you draw a lot of cards to choose from, you will also use a lot of gasoline. Once the race card pile is used up, the fuel card is turned over once and the race card pile is refilled. The fuel card can only be reactivated during a pit stop. The selected cards per player are turned face up at the same time, and the race cars are drawn in order of highest card. It is possible to block tracks, slip on oil fields and of course you have to slow down in corners. Special cards allow special moves and can be used once per pit stop. The first to complete four laps wins the race.

—user summary

name: Drehwurm
description:
Excitement on the chicken run! The worms are crazy and turn around again and again. The chickens must try not to get dizzy!

Each player wants to get rid of his hand cards as quickly as possible and get as many victory points as possible. Worms are put down on turnable piles on the table whereas chickens are used to eat piles of worms in order to get victory points. The player with the most victory points out of several matches wins the game.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Memory, Push Your Luck, Sudden Death Ending

name: Escape: Inferno
description:
On August 24th, 1814, the White House, then known as the President’s Mansion, burned to the ground. The British invaded the United States capital and began their looting of the city, yet one key piece of American History was saved from destruction… the portrait of George Washington. Dolley Madison, the first lady at the time, historically stayed behind until the painting could be safely removed… yet in a new timeline, the painting was not able to be saved. We are sending you, agents, back in time to the burning of Washington. You have one hour to explore the mansion, save the painting, and escape the flames to restore history. But as you will soon discover, there is far more at stake here than a painting…

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Queen's Curse
description:
In this family friendly escape adventure, we are sending you back in time to the age of castles, jousts, thrones, and dungeons. Queen Elizabeth I rules England, but it seems a problem has happened back in time that only you can fix. The Queen has been poisoned. Her close advisor and noted alchemist, John Dee, is concocting a cure to her ailment, but it is up to you to take on the quest to save her. Search the castle, escape the dungeons, and compete in tournaments to gain the essential ingredients to save the Queen in time. Succeed and you will be in the Queen's favor for all of eternity. Fail and you might just find history crumbling around you.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.
