Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: The Heist of Bonnie and Clyde
description:
Revenge is sweet.... After being one step behind the sinister Mr. X for missions and missions, the tables have turned. Along with your fellow EMIT agents, you have targeted the location of Mr. X's secret plans....the vault of a small bank in the heart of the nation. You know that if you are to stop his future changes to history, you are going to have to get into that vault and get your hands on those plans. There is one tiny problem though... the bank in question is about to be robbed by a notorious duo.... Bonnie and Clyde. You need to follow the bank robbers to their hideout, find out what they know, and break into the vault of the bank before they catch up. In this cat and mouse game, nothing is sure.... including the ending. There are MULTIPLE endings to this game, leading to a few different ways to replay the game until you perform the perfect heist. Win and you will have all of the plans you need to be one step ahead of Mr. X. Lose and you might just end up next on Bonnie and Clyde's hitlist.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: Extinction
description:
Your time machine has malfunctioned, stranding you back in the prehistoric world....more specifically, the late Cretaceous period. It is a land of jungles and swamps and is one that is inhabited by creatures you never thought you would encounter...dinosaurs. While some dinosaurs are curious of your presence, a few see you as dinner. But the creatures aren't the only ones that draw your attention. Someone else appears to be back in time too...another time traveler. Search through his or her camp, examine the findings, and discover a way to return to the 21st century. Dawdle, however, and you might end up face to face with a prehistoric predator....or even worse.... in the path of the meteor which destroyed much of the life on Earth. The stakes have never been this high! Good luck!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Lost Colony
description:
The colony of Roanoke - 1590

In this spooky, but family friendly, escape adventure, we are sending you back to England’s first attempted permanent colony in the Americas….Roanoke. Expecting a colony full of settlers, you discover something much more eerie. Everyone has vanished… The tables are still set for dinner, the coals are still hot, but no one in the entire colony can be found. There is no sign of violence and any written accounts of the events appear to be locked up securely. The only cryptic clue as to what has gone on is the word: CROATOAN carved into the wood.

Even worse, you find that you are trapped here. The rest of the time traveling agents left you alone in the eerie stillness of a world where you might just disappear next. You have 1 hour to discover the mysteries of Roanoke, to identify a suspect associated with the disappearance, to find the missing gears of your pocket watch, and to repair the time machine. Will you escape or will you become the next part of the legend of the LOST COLONY?

name: Escape the Colosseum
description:
It appears that a major change has occurred to the timeline...one that has led to massive changes to the present. America has vanished from existence and Roman numerals are the only digits to be found. We've pinpointed the beginning of this change to history to be back in Ancient Rome, centered around the Colosseum. A futuristic object was offered as a prize for winning the games. When it was won, it gave the Romans technology far greater than they should have had....leading to the change to the timeline.

We are sending you back in time before the grand spectacle to sneak through the labyrinth of passages. You are to recover the items needed to enter the gladiator match, so you can recover the artifact before it winds up in the wrong hands. Be aware, however, that you are entering into a world where lions and gladiators lurk behind every corner... but your greatest enemy might be your very friends you are playing with...should you have to battle them for survival...

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Queen Anne's Revenge
description:
We've received word that one of our time traveling agents has been captured by Edward Teach... a man you probably know as Blackbeard. We are sending you back in time to the Blockade of Charles Town to recover the agent and escape before Blackbeard notices your presence. You have one hour to break out of the ship's hold, rescue the agent, sleuth out the identity of an object from the wrong time period on the ship, and escape the ship before you end up in Davy Jones's Locker.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape the Confederate Spymistress
description:
We've received word that Abraham Lincoln is about to be assassinated...4 years early. You have only an hour to save the President by breaking into the house of suspected Confederate spy, Rose O'Neal Greenhow. Sift through her belongings, discover her secrets, and crack her code to discover the details of the assassination in time.

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Escape: Whodunit?
description:
In this eerie, yet family-friendly, murder mystery, you have been invited to Burke Manor for the reading of your great-uncle’s will. You have never heard of him before and getting the call was quite the shock. It turns out that 7 others were also called to stay the night at the fancy mansion. The grounds are gorgeous and hide swimming pools, hiking trails, a hedge maze, and even riding stables, but they are nothing compared to the mansion itself. 30 rooms are connected by a series of hallways, dumbwaiters, staircases, and secret passages. Shortly after you all gather together, however, you discover this isn’t going to be a weekend getaway. One of your number wants the inheritance all to themself. One by one, the other guests are murdered… and it is up to you to solve each and every crime. Compete against your other detectives as you watch the number of suspects shrink. If you find a clue… do you share it with the others? Or do you keep it for yourself? Just be careful… as you may just be the next victim yourself!

About Escape the Crate escape room boxes:
Each box has over a dozen unique puzzles which all fit the theme. Every item in the box has a purpose and will help you escape in time. Clue are hidden everywhere and in this game you need to think inside the box. Each box is a complete story.

These missions can be challenging and it is very possible you won't escape before the time limit. You can always reset the game using our instructions or you can continue playing past the time limit to see the mission to completion.
Every challenge you will face will have a set of hints, which you can choose to reveal when your team needs them. If you are completely stumped, even after the hints, the solution is also provided.

Note: You will need a fully charged computer or mobile device to play this escape room.

name: Unlikely Heroes: Archaic Beginnings Expansion
description:
The Archaic Beginnings Expansion is a fun addition to the three core boxes: Vikings, Pharaohs, or Cowboys. In the Expansion box, you find Weather, Nightfall, and Epic that each in their way adds exiting mechanisms or extra adventuring quests to the mix.

Unlikely heroes must explore the map, encounter challenges, and ultimately save the day. Start the game by flipping the first map tile and exploring each corner of the map.

As more and more tiles are uncovered, your team will encounter puzzles, enemies, treasures, tools, weapons, and allies. Decipher the narrative and explore the map accordingly for victory.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Humor

name: Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre
description:
Shaar: Motley Lands Massacre board game is a progressive, interactive game, of which the game plot is determined according to the main scenario. Players will take on the role of legendary heroes with their own special set of animals, holy trees and they will choose their own path for traveling through the magical universe of Shaar.

At the start of the game, each player chooses a character, tree, and animal card. The player then chooses a path to take. They select a card (event, item, or road card) based on their current location and tour. Players roll dice to accomplish certain goals and events, as well as to determine who wins battles and duels, during gameplay. Finally, the game progresses along the road with the player's character growth, finishing in victory by fighting the endgame bosses.

The ultimate achievement in the game is to first destroy the enemy elements by reaching the campsites located at the end of the city routes to be determined and then to gain a victory by destroying endgame bosses. Besides the main mission, there are many sub-duties within the game. The sub-duties, which are shaped through the edicts and road cards individuated according to cities, directly affect the development of the player’s character and animal; also, it enables the player to reach a lot of opportunities.
categories: Adventure, Exploration, Fantasy, Fighting, Miniatures, Travel
mechanics: Action Queue, Action Retrieval, Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Storytelling, Trading

name: Bimini
description:
The players take turns placing a tile on the game board. New tiles must be placed side by side with tiles already placed, thereby only connecting areas of the same shade (light or dark blue).

The players get points awarded for each placed tile. When all tiles are placed or the remaining tiles can't be placed, the player with the most points wins the game.

name: Rot tabu
description:
The players place 6 tiles (1-6) white side up on the lower row of their tableau. Then the players take turns rolling the die. After each roll the player may take the white tile with the rolled number from the tableau of his right neighbor and places it red side up on the upper row of his own tableau if he has the complimentary white tile on his lower row. If not he places it white side up on his lower row. If a player already has both tiles, the new tile is placed white side up on his own white tile. Red tiles are safe and may never be taken.

If A player has at least 4 red tiles he may take white tiles from any player. If a player has only one white tile left, and has not the corresponding red tile he may place the tile red side up on his upper row without rolling a die.

The first player with 6 red tiles wins the game.

Rule printed inside box cover.

name: Game Of Pawns: Iron Cauldron
description:
Game of Pawns: Iron Cauldron gives you the opportunity to become king Izanoff and save the holy city of Argenost from King Horvat the Horrible. Lead a bunch of misfits from the infamous 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment against the powerful and dreaded Horvatian Army in the Battle of the Iron Cauldron.

In this two-player chess-like game, players can switch sides for the Second Battle of the Iron Cauldron for a purely unique battle experience. The invading Horvatian Army units can receive promotions while 2nd Infantry Izanoff Regiment can receive reinforcements from the city of Argenost. In the third and final battle, 2nd Infantry faces off against King Horvat's elite Wolf Guard Regiment in an epic game of pawns.

To win the game, you capture or trap your opponent's king or they are forced to surrender. The game ends with a draw if capturing the king becomes futile for either side.

Each player takes turns moving a unit towards the enemy based on their unit's movement/attack ability, to gain ground, capture enemy pieces, set traps, enforce area denial or perform counteroffensive operations.

Get Ready: War is Coming!

name: Das große Allgemeinwissen-Quiz
description:
If anyone knows about general knowledge, it's him: The TV-famous "know-it-all" Sebastian Klussmann presents 300 entertaining questions, divided into the ten official knowledge categories of the German Quiz Championships.
After participating in this quiz, you are guaranteed to be smarter!

name: Das große Deutsch-Quiz
description: Everything that makes the German language appealing is celebrated in this high-quality equipped quiz box! Lovers of language and literature can look forward to a variety of exciting questions and equally instructive and enlightening answers.

name: Write on Track
description:
In Write on Track, a new Train game, players will be connecting Cities, gaining influence, and increasing population all in a push to import and export goods. Each turn 2 six-sided dice are rolled and 1-100 players simultaneously complete actions using each of the dice. The player can mark Influence in an area of the map, which can gain them bonus abilities. The player can use the die value to fill in Population rings of a City to show its demand for Imported goods. The player can also use the value to connect two Cities in a matching region or to connect a City from that region to an adjacent City in another region.

Players will find plenty of ways to earn Stars in this Sandbox style game! Stars are used to trigger game end. Further, the game includes a 9 card expansion deck that allows for Campaign play as players open up new ways of earning Stars and the player who won a previous game starts with a bonus at the beginning of the next game, the losing players also receive a bonus to start the next game. Play a Campaign of 10 games and see who had the greatest total of Stars across the entire Campaign! The Campaign can also be played solo, can you get to 300 Stars?

—description from the designer
publishers: Lagniappe Games, Roll and Write Revolution

name: Måsen, Draken och Kastellet
description:
The knights do their best to climb to the top of the castle, while taking care of flying seagulls, dragons and the daring knights of their opponents. Everyone wants to escape from the castle's scary dungeon! Which strategy do you choose - to focus on fast climbing to the top of the castle, or do you have time to stop to stop the competing knights with sweeping tricks? The player with the first knight who reaches the top of the castle wins the game.

Players take turns playing cards to get their knights to the top.

name: Pocket Quiz: Stadt, Land, Quiz
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

This edition contains 150 surprising and curious questions about cities, countries, rivers, beaches, buildings, sights, national parks and other geographical facts. Amusement and amazement guaranteed!

The title translates to "city, country, quiz".

name: Lustige Reise
description:
The players take turns rolling a die and start their meeples at space 1. The first to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Published in the hardcover annual "Das Kränzchen" No. 26
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Fischers Fritz
description:
Tongue twisters are a real challenge - and quite funny for the listeners. The faster you speak these sentences, the greater the possibility of slurring your words.

How to play:

You pick a card and repeat the tongue twister three times.
Does it work without mistakes? You get to keep the card.
Does it not work? The next person tries to repeat the tongue twister three times.
The person who has collected the most cards wins.

name: Blood Coven
description:
Blood Coven is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are vampires competing to create a coven of vampies and a herd of victims to feed on. Blood coven features mechanics from the vampire game from Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and city(play area) are "villagers". Coins in a players hand or fatigue area are "victims" and coins on turn order slots on the player card are "vampires'.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (feed, action, refresh). Players use pieces from their hands (victims) to feed any hungry vampires on their player cards and take actions. If any hungry vampires are not fed, they die. The game ends when there are no villagers left in the village or supply area.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per victim in their possession. Vampires are worth 3vp for penny vampires, 4vp for nickel vampires, 5vp for dime vampires.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat or even cat and vampire against a god from Eldritch Cults.
mechanics: Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: WereKittens
description:
WereKittens is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are wereKittens competing to eat villagers and convert villagers into a powerful team of wereKittens. WereKittens features mechanics from the werecat game from Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (place victims, action, refresh)

phase 1 place victims: players place victims from their hand into their feed and/or scare areas if they want to feed them to cats this turn.

phase 2 Action: During this phase, each werecat takes its action in order.(each werecat has its own turn order/initiative number). players each begin with 1 werecat and create more as the game progresses. On its turn, a werecat may either, take a villager from the village as a victim or turn one of the villagers in the village into a werecat.

In this game, penny werecats have the most strength but are expensive to make and are not worth many points. dime werecats are weak, but are cheap to make and worth a lot of points. nickels are in the middle.

The game ends when there are no villagers left in the village or supply area.

The player with the most victory points wins. werecats are worth 2vp for penny werecats, 3vp for nickel werecats, 4vp for dime werecats.
victims are worth 2 vp for the victim type you have the most of, 1vp for the type you have second most of, and 0 for the type you have least of.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat, or even cat and vampire against a god from Eldritch Cults.
Components: (12 cards, 1 rulesheet)

The player with the most victory points wins. .

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat or 2 vampires against a god from Eldritch Cults.

name: Eldritch Cults
description:
Eldritch Cults is a microgame for 2-3 players, in which players are weird and Lovecraftian gods who are competing to lure villagers into their cults. this game features mechanics from the cult game Cults & Covens.

This is a microgame that uses pocket change as pieces. 10 pennies, 6 nickels. and 6 dimes. Coins in supply and the city (play area) are "villagers". Coins that are tails up or in the fatigue area are cultists, heads-up coins are priests.

Each round is divided into 3 phases (place cultists, action, fatigue).
In phase 1, players place cultists on temples to enable actions.

in phase 2, temples can take actions. Temples, on their turn can either turn a villager into a cultist or a priest.

in phase 3, players take back any cultists that were fatigued on the previous turn, then move any cultists they used this turn into the fatigue area.

Game ends when there are no coins left in the supply area or village.

The player with the most victory points wins. Players receive 1vp per cultist in their possession. Priests are worth 4vp for penny priests, 5vp for nickel priests, 6vp for dime priests.

Blood Coven, WereKittens, and Eldritch Cults are 3 completely different microgames in the world of Cults & Covens. Each game can be played by itself or the games can be mixed so that players can play vampire against cat, or 2 vampires, or 2 cats, or a mix of vampires and cats against a god from Eldritch Cults.

name: Crystal Taking
description:
Crystal Taking is a trick-taking game. Players take turns playing cards to tricks in hopes of winning or losing tricks.

The game uses 56 minor arcana card, and 22 major. Minor arcana cards can be played right-side up to predict a victory or upside-down to predict defeat. The major arcana cards determine the rules for the round. There are typically three rule cards in play. You can pay VPs to put a new one from your hand into play (they each have 2 orientations also); the rules work as a conveyor, so when you add a new one, the oldest is removed.

After a certain number of rounds the game ends, leaving the player with the most points as the winner.

name: Spiralchain: Foreverot
description:
SpiralChain: Foreverot is a fully cooperative board game based on the SpiralChain novels by Jeremiah L. Schwennen. Between one and eight players work together to defeat the Foreverot before it can unleash untold suffering upon the Spiral of Worlds. The players win or lose as one--there are no victory points to tally or secret agendas to work towards.

Each player will have a Role Card that gives them special abilities to aid in their efforts, and each world has a limited number of enigmatic guardian dragons that might be employed to help fend off Warlords and Obliviates.

Players will travel from world to world gathering resources and making occasional forays into Nur to discard Rot Tokens until all eight of those tokens have been discarded and the heroes emerge victorious. But things are never quite that easy, are they? Gathering resources is made more difficult by the presence of maniacal Warlords that seek to destroy key locations on each world and malevolent Obliviates--scouts for the Foreverot--that block the heroes' efforts wherever they can. The same resources that are used to stop the Rot must also be used to vanquish Warlords and Obliviates, making for tough choices in each and every round of play. And the clock is always against you.

At the end of each round of play, the current First Player will roll a die in a grim responsibility we call the Foreverot Roll. This die will determine whether or not the Rot advances in its own schemes, wreaking havoc across the game. If those schemes advance too far--if all of the Foreverot Cards on Nur are played--the Rot will win. But even if the die roll is kind and a new Foreverot Card is not played, damage will be visited upon worlds and Warlords will continue in their inexorable march, bringing ruin to whatever lies in their path.

In about an hour, the fate of the 8 worlds can be decided... but in the quest to forge the Spiralchain, almost anything can happen!
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Solo / Solitaire Game, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers

name: Julii
description:
Julii is a game where you navigate the political intrigues of republican Rome as the head of one of four prominent families, the Julii, the Cornelii, the Sempronii and the Claudii.

These families are made up of senators, statesmen, and other members of Rome’s elite governing class who share the same gentes, that is claim descent from a common ancestor, and the same ambition: to rule the Roman Republic.

The objective of the game is to gain political supremacy over rival families. Ultimately, the family with the most social status, wealth, popularity, and provincial control is declared the winner. To gain supremacy you must ensure that statesmen affiliated with your family wage successful military campaigns, govern prosperous provinces, control key industries, and implement effective political reforms.

Julii is a 2-4 player game that starts in 264 BC at the outbreak of the 1st Punic War and ends with the turmoil and civil wars of the late 1st Century BC. A full game is played over 10 turns, with each turn representing approximately 20-25 years. Several scenarios are included introducing shorter game duration and modified winning conditions.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Akademia Superbohaterów
description:
This game (which could be translated to "Superhero Academy") is about Polish scientist that made a great impact in the history of science.

The game consist of 30 cards with a different scientist on each card. On a player's turn they draw a card from the pile and ask other players questions (which are actually clues) about the scientist (the questions are presented on the cards). The first player to guess which scientist the question(s) refer(s) to score 1-3 points depending on how many clue-questions they needed (more clues - less points).

The game ends when there are no cards in the pile and the player who scored the most points is the winner.

—user summary

Akademia Superbohaterów to fascynująca rozgyrwka, która pozwala odkryć znanych i nieznanych polskich bohaterów.

Gra karciana w formie quizu. Przeznaczona jest dla minimum dwóch graczy w wieku od 7 lat (gracze muszą umieć czytać). Jej celem jest zgromadzenie jak największej liczby punktów.

Punkty są przyznawane za wiedzę o największych polskich naukowacach, a także za refleks.

—description from the back of the box

name: Yortuk
description:
Based on the second Jabari book, it is a card game where you must capture monsters by making pairs.

Each turn the active player must draw a card from another player, in case of making a pair, he must play it, each monster has a power and a value. Resolves the power and passes the turn.

The game ends when a player begins their turn with no cards in hand, and each player will score the value of each monster in their play area minus the points of the pairs they have in hand.
whoever has the most points wins.

name: Brako
description:
Based on the novel "Dog Mystery", a group of puppies have to stop BRAKO, an android dog who wants to usurp the role of animal death.

A board is built with tiles (5x5 for 2-3 players, or 6x6 for 4-5 players) where the skeletons of animals killed by BRAKO will be hidden.

The pups have 2 actions to perform each turn, they must choose between moving by rolling 1d6, removing a stone from the terrain, digging in a clear terrain. Resolve an event card and end turn.

BRAKO moves when events dictate, if he manages to completely damage a pup and they don't have a bone to heal it, the cubs loses.

If the pups manage to unearth the animal skeletons (4 in a 2-3 player game and 8 in a 4-5 player game) they will stop BRAKO and win the game.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Events, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: La Rata Ricarda
description:
Based on the novel of the same name.
The Mice are trapped in the sewers under the serpentarium, and must escape by rescuing as many mice as possible, but among them there is a traitor, if the traitor leaves the first, he will close the exit trapping them.

Each turn the active player take a tile and place it as part of the sewer, can move up to 2 spaces and resolve an event card.

The tiles allow you to draw item cards or rescue mice.
the events will indicate when to remove the sewer covers, when the 4th is removing, the mice will be able to get out.

If the traitor mouse comes out first, he wins.
If at least 1 brave mouse manages to leave before, when the traitor mouse leaves, the rescued mice will be counted on each side and the one with the most will win.
mechanics: Events, Hidden Roles, Tile Placement, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Touring the Stars – Rocky
description:
Once a cool, but beautiful world, rich in natural resources, Rocky led a charmed existence as one of the first planets colonized by humankind. As a paradise settled by some of Terra's wealthiest citizens, its people wanted for little, and strife was rare for centuries. But like the Hegemony it belonged to, Rocky fell to the darkness of the Amaris years, and saw its killing blows come in the form of a rare battle between Houses Steiner and Davion at the dawn of the Succession Wars. Now little more than another ruined casualty of human avarice, Rocky is little remembered by the Inner Sphere at large"”save for the rumors of stolen treasures of the Star League, lost beneath its frozen wastes.

Touring the Stars volumes consist of a color cover depicting an orbital view of the subject planet, a short history section, a small number of RPG tracks tailored to the planet, a rules annex detailing optional rules for games and scenarios set on the planet, a color world map and a hexed Battleforce 2 map. Each volume averages between 15 and 19 pages in total.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Dukes of Hazzard
description:
A simple but fun board game,based on the famous TV series "The Dukes of Hazzard". It was released in Greece in the 80's by Toys Art company. It can be played from 2-4 players. Each player in his turn rolls the spinner to determine how much spaces will he moves on the board. There is a unique space upon the spinner, which has the rule "Get a card". In that point, you must follow what card says. The winner is the player who reaches first the finish line.

—user summary

name: Das große Jahreszeitenspiel
description:
With Lilly through the year, you play in teams and learn about events of the year. 109 season cards show events and in addition a simple and a difficult question, the back has the answers. For a game, 20 random cards are placed ready. The active player chooses an easy or difficult question, rolls the appropriate die and moves Lili forward. If one can answer the question, the card goes out of the game, otherwise it goes under the pile. If Lilly passes over the call sign field, a new year begins. If the prepared pile is used up before 10 years have passed, everyone wins together.

—user summary

name: Watershed Arizona
description:
Throughout what is now known as Arizona, ancient civilizations constructed epic cities, harnessed the powerful and unpredictable rivers to water crops and sustain their communities, and thrived for thousands of years. Eventually, the unpredictability of the seasons, the power of the floods, and the fragility of infrastructure contributed to the abandonment of cities--leaving only ruins to mark these impressive achievements.

Today, modern technology and sheer hubris have resulted in a new set of settlements that again attempt to thrive in one of the world’s harshest and driest climates. With the help of modern engineering marvels like the Hoover Dam and the Central Arizona Project canal, more than 7 million people call Arizona home and over 100,000 more residents move there each year. How long can this continue before, like other civilizations of old, nature asserts its dominance and returns the cities to dust?

Watershed: Arizona is a turn-based asymmetrical game played in rounds. Each round consists of the following:
1. Revealing climate conditions card which modifies the precipitation coming to the watersheds
2. Revealing and resolving policies that impact watershed conditions, city building and water infrastructure
3. Simultaneous city building using workers and card playing
4. Watershed stewardship and infrastructure building
5. Delivering water to thirsty cities

Players will advance through eras that unlock new abilities, workers and actions—allowing the continued growth and development of their ambitious cities. Victory points determine the winner and are accumulated through achieving objectives, passing policies, stewarding watersheds, building districts and improving quality-of-life in cities, and conserving water through smart development practices.
categories: City Building, Civilization, Economic, Environmental, Political, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Semi-Cooperative Game, Simulation, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Carnivorous
description:
The shop was said to be minute and yet terrifying all at once. The patrons were both thrilled and horrified by what was inside. The very idea of man-eating plants! Well here we are, you and your shopkeeper friends have embarked on a truly hair-raising experience this time. Armed with your cloned assistants, just break the glass when you need a new one! And a cavalcade of customers ready to buy the most exotic plants, only the plants look awfully hungry. Ah, maybe we should rope off that area so no one gets too close?

Your goal: Gain the most points by being the most clever greenthumb!

Players will be using worker placement to feed the plants in the shop or add new plants to the shop in the form of dominoes. Players will stacking dominoes to create new levels with each level scoring for the greatest number of a value, with lower floors being hidden as the players stack, will they know what’s down below and plant those matching flowers in their greenhouses?

This tricky game of playing dominoes for the value and also stacking them gives players an elevated gaming experience. There’s also a dice customer or two each round who might visit the shop. Hopefully you can keep the man eating plants from doing what they do best! Or you may want to feed your opponents’ cloned shop assistants to the plants, but be aware that they also get the bonus you earn for doing so, while losing an assistant of course.

The game ends when the last domino makes it to the shop. Players score their greenhouses as multipliers with each level, maximizing their scores as they go.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing

name: Jigsuw: Rainbow Hole
description:
When building traditional jigsaw puzzles, there are several tactics people use. One can look for pieces by their image or their shape.One can build the whole puzzle at the same time or concentrate on building a specific section of it. Organise the pieces before starting to build or dive right into it. Doing the border first, looking for a one of a kind piece and so on.

In Jigsuw, players need to master not only the different tactics to build a puzzle but also when to change from one to another. They start by setting down the large circular core of the puzzle flat on the table. From there, the players divide the rest of the pieces among themselves, then it’s off to the races. They compete to set down the pieces against the starting circle as fast as possible until the puzzle is complete.

What makes Jigsuw interactive is that players don’t just try to build the puzzle faster, but instead they need to try block their opponents. You block their pieces when you set down all surrounding ones before they get the chance to put theirs down. At this moment they cannot play it. The game continues until no one can lay down any pieces. Whoever ends the game with less pieces blocked wins the match.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Pattern Recognition, Race, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That

name: Lapidarius
description:
To become the most prestigious luxury jewelry store in the city of dwarfs, the most beautiful gems and the most important buyers are needed. Unfortunately some customers can be very demanding, and this can cause some stress to the hardworking employees. Perhaps buying some gifts for these workers at the end of the week might make them happier?

The game is divided in 4 rounds and each round has two phases. On the first phase, customer cards and gem cards are opened on the table and players secretly distribute their discount tokens on their boards. Then, each customer will buy a gem from the player who offered the best discount. Some customers cause the staff's mood to go down. Then, on the second phase, present cards are opened and each card is auctioned by players. The gifts can be used to improve the employees´ mood and avoid negative points at the end of the game.

After the fourth round all players get points acording to the clients attended, gems sold, the employees' mood and the money left. The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction: Turn Order Until Pass, Set Collection

name: Total Contamination
description:
A science outpost on an icy moon. The bio-filter A.I. has mysteriously crashed. One of you has been infected with an alien form that can assume your whole identity. Can the humans reboot the A.I. or make it to the launch vehicle before the hidden infection achieves Total Contamination.

In this game all players begin in human form but one of you is secretly an alien infection that has assumed the guise of one of the humans. During play, infected players may infect others. The uninfected humans struggle to expose and defeat the aliens. The aliens attempt to defeat and contaminate the humans. However if too many humans become contaminated, then the aliens will turn on each other.

The game board represents a small, domed science station on an icy world, with a launch vehicle ready for lift off outside.

At the start of the game there is only one infected card in play. As play progresses more such cards accumulate and infected characters may end up infecting others by sharing to them. Each turn players choose one or two actions (move, combat or a task). The location on the board will make certain tasks available, such as using the bio analysis drone from the drone hub. Other players whose characters are nearby can help, hinder or watch. Cards are played to show how things turn out. When the dust settles the active player also gets to share cards with someone who helped or hindered.

If a player is forced to reveal an infection card in their hand face up, then their character changes from human form (blue) to monster form (red). Monster form can perform fewer tasks but can easily attack and infect others.

The game ends when one of these conditions is met:

the AI is fully reprogrammed using uninfected cards, or with 2 or 3 infected cards giving an infection win
the launch vehicle lifts off. If any character on board is infected that becomes an infection win.
all players are in monster form, which produces an infection win.


If a human victory occurs, all uninfected humans win.

If an infection victory occurs only a limited number of infected players win, as the infection organisms are very competitive.
mechanics: Action/Event, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Hidden Roles, Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game, Traitor Game

name: Raon: 10th Anniversary
description:
To celebrate the 10th anniversary of the most popular Hangul boardgame Raon, Gemblo, inc. published Raon: 10th Anniversary.

It features deluxe components such as a velvet bag and golden color printed tiles. It has more tiles than the base game, so it can be played with up to five people. And the rule book includes total of twelve rules, from the first edition rules to the rules that are newly developed for this edition.

Examples of new rules included in 10th Anniversary edition:

Guess - Select a theme and each player makes a word related to the theme, then players figure out what words the other players made by guessing each consonant or vowel tile.

Connect - Players take turn making a word using their tiles. After the first player makes a word. The following players must use 1 syllable from ‘the previous word’ when they make a new word.

Recombine - This is the rules for Raon championship and any other tournaments.
mechanics: Action Timer, Hand Management, Real-Time, Tile Placement

name: Simply Foot
description:
Defend, defend and defend! Today you are facing the best team in the championship, you have been preparing for this event for long weeks by developing a tactic called The Mega Bus. You suffer but are well fielded in your half of the field, your players in the middle "Cut out" everything that passes and your defenders are well grouped in your area. As a last bastion, your goalkeeper resists, left, right, but begins to wear himself out... You have to hold on! It's up to you to achieve the perfect steering by making the most of your counterattacks?

Throughout the game, your objective will be to protect your goalkeeper's HP as much as possible from opposing attacks and penalties. For this you will play Defense, Middle, Recovery and Special cards. Attackers score goals when your goalkeeper has 0 PV left , but if you can resist attacks , you can counterattack by accumulating dice and score goals.

The game ends when the cards deck is empty and the winner is declared. You win by winning the match!!
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Move Through Deck

name: The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge
description:
A crate full of unique physical puzzles, and the story of a lost civilization. Solve the puzzles. Find the treasure. Escape the maze.

The Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will include hands-on physical puzzles, paper puzzles, mechanical puzzles, ciphers, folding puzzles, logic puzzles, illusions, riddles, and pattern games. We are designing each puzzle ourselves specifically for The Labyrinth, and are placing an emphasis on immersive puzzles with physical objects and unique solutions.

To complete the challenge, you must use clues to solve many smaller puzzles, which will lead to other clues in a larger interwoven narrative. Once you solve the smaller puzzles, you can combine the solutions in order to unlock and solve the overarching meta-puzzles.

Solving all of the puzzles in the Labyrinth Puzzle Challenge will provide at least 8-10 hours of puzzle-solving and clue-cracking for a group of 3-4 people. The challenge can be played individually or with a group, and the game includes a huge number of puzzles and associated content. We have designed puzzles that will be accessible to people who have never participated in a puzzle hunt or escape room, as well as puzzles that will challenge even the most experienced puzzle hunters and escape room addicts. Some puzzles will be easily and quickly solved, while others require a more in-depth examination. The complete Labyrinth challenge is designed to provide hours of entertainment and immersion into this unique experience, with a story that unfolds as the puzzles progress.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Love Letter to Lady Luck
description:
The King wants to stop the many love letters arriving in the castle. So he arranged for prospective suitors to temporarily come and meet all the ladies to earn their trust. The suitor with the most support from the ladies is permanently allowed inside the castle.

Love Letter to Lady Luck (LLLL) is the sequel to the widely acclaimed game, Love Letter. As it shares the same background world setting, the art and layout is the same as "Love Letter". However, it plays differently from the original.

You bid on cards which you either use as collaborator or score cards. The collaborator cards help you gain better cards or manipulate your own or your opponents' decks. But score cards help you win the game.

You can also play Goita with the same cards.

Released as part of Princess Wonder. It was not released in a separate retail edition.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deduction, Hidden Roles

name: Charlatan
description:
Somewhere on the French Riviera:

The town is brimming with wealthy, gullible targets. But too many Charlatans in the same area might ruin this Con Artist oasis. So! Since you all know each other; you’ve agreed to these terms:
Who ever gets away with the most money this summer, gets to have the place for themselves for good.

It’s going to take every trick in the book to pull this off. Every con, scheme and exit strategy you know, must be put to use, if you’re planning on having this oyster for yourself.

Charlatan is a 1-4 player asymmetric take-that/push your luck card game, where each player tries to get away with as much money as possible, while also trying to sabotage their rivals.

Each card is unique and gives the players the option of actually telling a funny story of how they win a Target's trust or getting away with millions, which can make it somewhat entertaining having your target stolen by another player.

Through a combination of different cards; Cons, Long Cons, Combo Cons, Schemes, Arrangements and Exits, you'll scam and swindle your way through to becoming the biggest Charlatan of them all!

—description from the designer

name: Cafe Rush
description:
A top speed, high energy, family-friendly card game that’s perfect for parties.

Don’t keep your customers waiting; serve the food they ordered as fast as you can!

In this fast & frantic card game, play table cards, then fill their orders by playing food cards onto them. The catch? Everyone can play on anyone's cards, and everyone plays at once!

Serve the most tables and play the most cards overall to score big points and get the "tip jar" bonus!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game, Real-time

name: Birthstone
description:
Birthstone is a competitive board game that takes place deep in the heart of the bustling Sulperra Market. In the game, players take on the role of artisan jewelers who bid against one another for precious gems, metals, and reagents in order to craft valuable artifacts for the wealthy elite.

Players take turns placing their apprentice tokens (workers) on various locations on the game board to take a variety of actions, including bidding, mining, and reagent procurement.

The game ends when the last of the commission cards is completed, and the player with the most victory points wins the game.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Dice Rolling, Loans, Turn Order: Claim Action, Worker Placement

name: Deviation
description:
Path building game that uses tile placement with color coordinated line segments to move totems, with the objective to move the opponent to a designated "kill spot".

—description from the designer

name: Riot Quest: Arena Miniatures Game
description:
The once-great Iron Kingdoms are now a pile of smoldering ruins, and there's treasure everywhere if you've got the gumption to fight for it! You'll need a crackerjack crew, gobs of gear, and lots of love for the chaos of battle if you're going to score the best leftover loot in the land — but it's every human, dwarf, elf, and goblin for themselves in this outrageous quest for bodacious booty!

Riot Quest is a fast-moving, highly unpredictable skirmish board game using hobby miniatures. First released in 2019 using hobby miniatures, Riot Quest has enjoyed three years of expansion and growth. The new board game edition will include 48 preassembled plastic miniatures and all the dice and accessories needed to play the game with up to four players.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion
description: The Riot Quest: Pe(s)ts Expansion features 24 miniatures, with six different pets in four colors. Pets are actually riot gear with corresponding minis that get placed on the board with your heroes, providing a bevy of wacky antics to drive your opponents crazy while helping you score more loot and bounties.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Chopping Block
description:
Chopping Block is a fast paced card game for junior- and mid-level executioners where you need to outbid your unscrupulous coworkers for the juiciest contracts in town. If you're lucky you'll even have time for a cup of your favorite hot beverage.
Probably coffee. Definitely coffee.

The game is a card game for 2-5 players with bidding mechanics and cut-throat player interaction to gain the most gold. You gain gold and influence by fulfilling contracts for executions of various nobles (and other unfortunates….). You can spend both Gold and Influence during the game to get benefits or sabotage your executioner colleagues' work. The player with the most gold at the end of the game wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deduction, Interrupts, Kill Steal, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Take That

name: Vanksford
description:
Hundred of years ago the world was dominated by six races: Humans, Dwarfs, Drakes, Beasts, Elves and Orcs. They control their own kingdoms briefly knowing the existence of the others. Until the big calamity falls in their kingdoms destroying their places and turning it uninhabitable. One traveler called Vanksford discovered a huge and prosperous land, not ruled by anyone, the rumor traveled all over the six destroyed kingdoms, and since then all the empires started a war for the lands of Vanksford.

Vanksford is a 2 to 6 player, based on strategy and luck none will be out of this board game, you could play it as teams or not, making it playable for all the family. Per turn every player will collect the materials based on the dice throw, move the troops and realize attacks against other players.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Civilization, Dice, Fantasy, Wargame
mechanics: Alliances, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Market, Modular Board, Player Elimination, Random Production, Team-Based Game, Trading, Zone of Control

name: Pluzzables: Destinations
description:
Pluzzables are “playable puzzles” - a collection of puzzles you play as games after assembly. Additionally, two web apps come with the game for simpler "match and claim" games. You do not have to put the puzzle together exactly in order to play Destinations. However, to play the online Pair Up game, all the pieces must be in their correct positions.

The Destinations edition is a puzzle of vintage travel posters. After assembly, the puzzle becomes a board game where players fly airplanes to various locations to collect lost luggage.

Players are given tickets that contain not only destinations, but a variety of actions that can influence movement of airplanes. On their turn, players roll dice, use a ticket, and either move, collect suitcases, or perform an action.

Once all luggage has been collected, the player with the most luggage points is the winner.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Service: Das Taktikspiel der Sparkassen
description:
Each player has his own track to move on. Movement is determined by two dice. The players decide to use the sum or difference of both dice to move their meeple forward or backward.

The players have 20 tokens each. If a meeple gets on a space with a "S" the player gets to place 1 or 2 tokens beside that space. On the spaces with a dot he has to place 1 or 2 tokens upside down beside the space.

Instead of rolling the dice a player may turn one arrow token on the track of another player to cause him to have to use the cedit track. Each player can be caused to use each of his two credit tracks only one time. On the credit track only forward movement is possible and the probability of having to place upside-down tokens is higher.

If a player has at least placed 12 tokens front-up, he may go to the "Ziel"-space. When all but one players have reached the "Ziel", the game ends. The player with the most front-up tokens after substracting the number of upside-down tokens wins the game.

This game was published between 1970 to 1983 based on text on the game board.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Final War: Arcane Expansion Set
description:
The Arcane Expansion Set weaves in the volatile tempers of the spell-casting Warlords; the powerful Wizard, the hypnotic Witch and the deadly Necromancer. With potent new abilities and devastating spells, get ready for these Warlords to change the game!

—description from the publisher

name: 9-Card Ultima
description:
Sosaria has become overrun by evil creatures and the land is in turmoil. The King has sent out an urgent request for the bravest adventurers to help purge this evil from his kingdom and save Sosaria. Those who are brave enough to take up the challenge will be richly rewarded with land, titles and riches. But for those who do decide to take up this gauntlet you must take heed for evil doesn’t just roam the land; it swims deep in the oceans and creeps deep underground within the three dungeons of Sosaria.

Victory Conditions:
You win the game once you complete three quests given by the King of Sosaria to rid the land from the evil that has rising from the darkest dungeons. You must search the land for three magical signposts. Each signpost marks the spot of a magical gem that holds a secret message. There are three signposts holding three gems: Blue, Green, and Red. These magical gems “when deciphered by the King” will give you access to their dungeons. The first quest will be to find the blue dungeon which will be guarded by Beholder. The second quest will be to find the green dungeon which is surrounded by water and guarded by a Minotaur. The last quest and the most difficult will be to find the red dungeon which is surrounded by mountains and guarded by a Balrog demon the most feared evil monster of all. Find the three signposts in order of blue, green and red to recover each gem. Travel back to the King after each signpost to decipher the message in the gem. The King will then tell you where to find the dungeons so you can defeat the monsters within to become the savior of Sosaria.
You lose the game if your health drops to zero or you fail to complete the three quests.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fantasy, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Paper-and-Pencil, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: ゼバオト (Zebaot)
description:
ゼバオト (Zebaot) is a card game from Japan, featuring cat angels. Players are collecting sets using cards in hand and an open draft.

Players draw and discard cards, forming sets and runs as in Rummy. Once each player has formed their hand, they score. Each two of a kind is 1 point, each three of a kind is 3 points, each four of a kind is 7 points, a six-card straight is 5 points and a six-card flush is 5 points.

The start player has a ring from King Solomon, and if they have the most points (or tied) they keep the ring and score 3 bonus points. Otherwise, the ring moves clockwise. The game ends when every player has had the ring, and the most points wins.

Players can draw from the deck, or from the pool, and hold or discard. When a player holds, they put their hand down until everyone is ready to score. Players cannot keep drawing , they are forced to hold finally.

The publisher says:
King Solomon once used many angels to build the temple with the power of the ring given by the archangel Michael. Use Solomon's Ring to create an army of angels stronger than any other player! A card game where cute cat angels fight!

かつてソロモン王は大天使ミカエルから授かった指輪の力により、多くの天使を使役して神殿を建築しました。
ソロモンの指輪を使って、他のプレイヤーより強い天使の軍団を作りましょう！
かわいいネコの天使たちが戦うカードゲームです！
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection

name: バトルオブジパング (Battle of Zipangu)
description:
バトルオブジパング (Battle of Zipangu) is a card game from Japan. In feudal Japan, warlords are trying to establish their own kingdoms. Players use either building cards to gain rice, or soldiers to gain buildings. The first to get to five rice is the winner.

Players are dealt three cards from two decks, a buildings deck and a soldiers deck. On their turn, a player can place down a building or a soldier, or discard. The goal is to form sets, so a run of numbers on a soldiers lets the player attack and steal a building, or defend against attack. A flush on buildings lets a player draw rice chits. Some buildings give special effects too. Players must balance their need to gain rice and also defend or attack with soldiers, making tactical decisions as the game progresses.

The publisher says:
Become a champion of the Warring States period! Build buildings or attack the enemy with your soldiers in this easy to play strategy card game!

Players take on the role of a feudal lord in the Warring States period and compete with their opponents to build a kingdom. You play the role of a feudal lord, competing with your opponents to build a kingdom. The first player to collect 5 rice bale chips is the winner.

The first player to collect 5 rice bale chips is the winner. Rice bale chips can be obtained by creating roles with 2-3 building cards. You can also make a role with 3 soldier cards and take the enemy's building cards. Some of the building cards have special effects that can be used to your advantage. In this game, you have to choose between building with your cards and attacking with your soldiers.

The game takes only 20 minutes to play and is an easy strategy card game to enjoy!

This game was distributed at the 2019 Autumn Gemma, and we plan to distribute a new version with improved rules and design at the 2020 Autumn Gemma.

戦国時代の覇者となれ！建物を建てるか、兵士で敵を攻撃するか、手軽に遊べる戦略カードゲーム！
プレイヤーは戦国時代の大名となり、対戦相手と国造りを競います。先に米俵チップを5枚集めたプレイヤーが勝者となります。

米俵チップは建物カード2-3枚で役を作ることで手に入れることができます。また、兵士カード3枚で役を作り、敵の建物カードを奪うこともできます。建物カードには特殊効果があるものもあり、戦況を有利にすることができます。
自分の手札と相手の状況を見ながら、建物カードで建設するか、兵士カードで攻撃をするか、駆け引きを楽しめるゲームです。

プレイ時間も20分程度で、手軽に楽しめる戦略カードゲームです！

2019秋のゲムマで頒布しましたが、2020秋のゲムマでルールとデザインを改良したものを頒布予定です。
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: セーノ (Seeno)
description:
セーノ (Seeno) is a two player card game from Japan. Using the theme and gameplay of rock, scissors, paper, the game has three characters, グー (Gū), チョキ (Choki), パーで (Pā de). Each player gets six cards, numbered 1 to 3, which count as hits to win draws. These three battle it out but also have special abilities on action cards. A quick game that children and adults can pick up easily.
user summary
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Variable Player Powers

name: PHONEY WAR
description:
PHONEY WAR is a WWII war game.
Play as West Allies, Germans or Soviets in the two modes of play:
2 Players: Prelude to War
3 Players: Race to Berlin
Both game modes use most of the same rules and components.

name: Opportunity Royal Oak
description:
Opportunity is the family fun game featuring real local businesses as its properties. During the course of play you will buy, sell and expand businesses for profit, and face some of the same problems business owners and managers face on a daily basis. Players should find Opportunity intriguing as they match their intuition, decision making skills and luck against that of their opponents.

—description from the box
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Income, Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Puzzle Frenzy
description:
What do a cat and a star have in common? How about cotton and a rock? Puzzle Frenzy challenges players to find the common follow-up word that ties the clues together:

star fish . . . cat fish

With another clue -- Halloween -- for cotton and rock you might figure it out:

cotton candy . . . rock candy . . . Halloween candy

Try to discover the connections between seemingly unrelated words as you build jigsaw picture clues. The first team to solve the master picture puzzle wins.

—description from the publisher

name: Burned
description:
Burned is a quick, aggressive, game of cat-and-mouse for two players. It pits The Agency, led by The Director, against a Burned Asset. The Agency must locate the Burned Asset with its team of Agents. The Asset must use its array of equipment to discover and eliminate The Director. First to die loses. Do you have what it takes to survive in the Neon City, or will you get…Burned.

Choose between playing as The Agency or the lone Burned Asset.

As the Agency you will build your team of Agents to hunt the Asset across the city. Guess where the Burned Asset will move next and intercept them all while protecting the identity of your Director. As the Burned Asset, you'll have to assemble a kit of weapons and tools to stay hidden while hunting for the Agency Director.

—description from the publisher

name: DiceCulus
description:
DiceCulus is a fun and useful game, suitable for all ages. Make your children's school studies easier, or make a one-of-a-kind party.

The rules are simple enough, so that everyone can easily grasp them, but challenging enough to keep you interested. The game develops not only logical thinking and combinability, but also communication skills and - most importantly - makes algebra FUN!

A great gift for adults and schoolkids, the game comes in a luxury packaging and with an engraved wooden dice cup.
—description from the publisher

HOW TO PLAY:

Each player gets an empty writing sheet where they fill their results after each round.
Game consists of 4 stages and each stage has several rounds. In each round the first player draws the top card of the deck and puts it face up on the table. The card will contain a mathematical equation that could be as simple as "b-ac=" and as complex as for example "3bc/a - df/e =".
Players then spread out the dice around the equation's variables in their sheets, roll the dice and calculate their results based on the dice values and how they put them in the equation.
Each round has a twist on the main game rules. In one of the rounds you are giving points to the other players, so your goal would then be to minimize the equation's result.

name: Да оцелееш като родител
description:
CONGRATULATIONS! YOU ARE NOW A PARENT!

This is where the fun begins. If you've been there before, you are in for an (un)pleasant return. If you're there now - you will be back to the daily terror instead of playing to relax. If you're about to do it - you may decide not to! Like we just said - congratulations!

—description from the publisher

How to play:
You step into the uncomfortable shoes of a parent whose sweet offspring brings him joy at the same time and seems to be trying to destroy him. All parents are different: there are businessmen and punks, politicians, managers, athletes, but they are all united by one thing - they try to survive without going crazy. Well, of course, and win. Each role has pros and cons, starts with different levels of health, sanity and money and has an individual special skill. There are two ways to win - you are either the last to be still alive or the first to get to 30 health and sanity.

MECHANICS
Before starting the game, do the following:
Give a random parent card to each player. Return the unused ones to the box.
Put cubes to indicate the current levels of sanity and health (initial values ​​are marked on the parent cards).
Shuffle all the playing cards and create a deck. Place it in the middle of the table.
Give 4 cards to each player, as well as the starting money marked on their parent card. Three cards are then removed from the pile of cards and the top one is turned over so that it is visible to everyone.
You are now ready to begin. Each action in the game is determined by the cards you play or are already in front of you.

FIRST ROUND: The last person to have become a parent takes the three cards without bidding anything, the other players take one card from the deck. If there is no parent between you, skip the first round and start directly from the second.

EVERY NEXT ROUND: You bid for the three cards visible on the market. With shouting, cunning, insults and everything. The one who bets the most wins. There are no restrictions on bidding - you can always intervene. The one who wins the bidding takes the three cards he has bid for. The others take one card from the top of the pile. The winner of the bidding starts first and can play as many cards as he wants - without restrictions. After him is the next player in clockwise direction. When everyone is done, it's time for the next round, which repeats the second round. And so on until a winner is announced in one of two ways:
Either the last survivor or the first who reaches 30 health and sanity.

name: Business Tycoon
description:
The board game starts off with each player creating an LLC and borrowing money from the bank.

The LLC start the process of purchasing assets and either making a profit or running into liabilities. Another LLC can even aggressively take over an asset owned by a rival LLC.

The LLC that can withstand making a profit after paying the bank back the loan plus interest is the WINNER.

Great family and friends game. A fun way to introduce the topic of entrepreneurship to anyone from age 8 to age 80!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Reise nach Paris
description:
The game about traveling by train from Berlin to Paris and return.

Objective: be the first reaching start/finish stop called Potsdam Gate (Potsdamer Thor).
Roll the die and move forward. If you land on one of the special spaces follow instructions.

The game board shows seventy one beautifully executed views (hand colored) of places along the Berlin-Paris route in 1850's (Paris without Eiffel tower at that moment).

—user summary

name: Rallye Interplanetaire
description:
Rallye Interplanetaire is a French promotional space game from the Fromageries Bel company producing the popular line of Laughing Cow Cheese products.

The game is a simple roll and move mechanism where players move cardboard rockets along a path in the cosmos. Certain spaces on the course can advance or delay the players journey to reach the moon. First to reach the moon is the winner.

The company put out a number of these promotional envelope games during the mid 1950s, with Rallye Interplanetaire being Number 7 in the series.

—user summary

name: Onimaru: Legendary Foes
description:
The spirit-caller Kappa, the shadowmancer Kagekemono, and Ryujin, King of the Dragons, joined by three others, have emerged from the Shadow Gate to threaten the land. These Oni, along with their Hordeling followers, are hellbent on terrorizing all in their path, and they will not be easily stopped.

With these Oni components added to the game, you and your allies must work together like never before to stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

Take the ultimate challenge against these Legendary Foes, or mix up others to create your own circle of Oni.

name: Onimaru: Heroes From Faraway Lands
description:
The fierce fighting prowess of Jung Hae Jin and the magical mystic arts of Ichiro Hashi have been heard of from across the waters. These capable companions travel from their respective lands to join the fight against the Onimaru, contributing their skills to the battle.

With these two new heroes added to the game, you are able to take advantage of their unique abilities, or even use their various components to increase the customization options of any hero build.

Choose or create your hero wisely, and you and your allies may stand a chance of defeating the Onimaru!

name: Disaster Master
description:
A game designed to promote preparedness for natural disasters in the developing world, it was initially distributed by UNESCO in Thailand and Indonesia, but a later version was created for Pakistan as well.

Financed by Japan, it includes high-quality pieces including custom dice, a spinner, reference book and test sheets, marketed as a fun boardgame for the entire family.

The winner is whomever is able to demonstrate the best emergency preparedness in each category of disaster.

name: Cuniculture
description:
Cuniculture is a competitive, card-based board game, designed to be medium-weight with little luck involved. Published through 'Bring Your Own Dice' and designed by Aaron Rebelo, this board game features over 50 rabbit species with an expanding market of items.

As a rabbit enthusiast expanding your hobby into the competitive world of rabbit ownership, you begin to understand the strengths and flaws of certain breeds and the unique traits of others. Using your knowledge of each breed, it becomes your duty to utilize the short season of the summer months (rounds) to earn as much gold before the season ends. Performing the following tasks will help you become successful or slow down your competitors:

Complete your personal goals to earn some quick points.
Collect rabbit droppings and selling it as fertilizer for some quick cash.
Enter your rabbit into the show to prove you have the best of the best.
Breed your rabbits and collect handfuls of wooden rabbit tokens to sell to future enthusiasts for long-term cash.
Bargain with your friends into lending you a hand or trading their finest rabbit.
Visit the market to gain a larger collection of rabbits or purchase items to increase your chances at victory.


The winner is determined by the highest point value after the 6 rounds are complete, typically ranges from 30-45 minutes a game.

With bargaining incorporated into the board game, you are playing or scheming even while someone else is completing their turn, ensuring your fun does not wait for others, making time seem to hop on by.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Bribery, End Game Bonuses, Market, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Turn Order: Pass Order, Victory Points as a Resource

name: This That & Everything: Canada
description:
This That & Everything: Canada is all "aboot" famous landmarks, iconic people, cultural influences and more. Players race to describe people, places and things related to Canada for their teammates to guess - in 30 seconds or less! The game includes 100 double-sided cards with six subjects per card, a score pad, pencil, and 30-second sand timer.

—description from the publisher

name: Chińczyk Rodzina Treflików: moja pierwsza gra
description: Chinese is the classic game for kids with the favorite characters from the Treflik Family cartoon! Help the Treffles arrange the balls by guiding them all to the center of the room. Watch out for other players who you are sure to meet along the way. Others are also in a hurry with their pawns, and meeting them will delay the order slightly. Roll the colored dice, move the balls and win! Have fun with the Treflik family. Thanks to the colorful dice, no counting skills are required.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Kalejdoskop 15 Trefliki
description:
Kaleidoscope 15 Games is a set of addictive games for the whole family, enriched with original pots that serve as pawns. Take part in an obstacle race, collect tokens, smash other people's pots and test your strength in a game of dice. The characters from the Treflik Family children's series are waiting for you!

—description from the publisher

name: Suited for Death
description:
Dapper Gentlemen's Shop is one of the most respected men's clothing stores in all of Valley Falls. Its reputation, however, has become tarnished after two recent murder victims were found dressed in Dapper Gentlemen's suits. As a result, its employees have gone from being viewed as respected tailors to being viewed as the prime suspects in these gruesome killings. Uncover what is actually going on behind the scenes at this esteemed haberdashery and find out who else might be Suited for Death!

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: The Gift
description:
As the holiday season approaches, the Valley Falls Police Department receives an early present: three dead bodies surrounded by toys and games. These “gifts” have been left by someone calling themselves The Tinkerer. Now, the killer has left a note at the Will Street Detective Agency claiming that more lives are on the line. Time is running out.

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided, visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find what's missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Till Death
description:
It's the perfect day for a wedding at the illustrious McKinley Event Center until the groom
turns up dead just hours before he is set to walk down the aisle. Given that the only attendees are friends and family of
the couple, this case is bound to get messy. As if weddings weren't drama-filled enough, now you have to catch a killer
in addition to dealing with all the madness of the event itself. This gives a whole new meaning to 'Till Death Do They
Part.' Can you uncover who murdered the groom and why?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: A Stolen Star
description:
A theft has occurred at the Valley Falls Mall. No stores were robbed. No products were
taken. Instead, the thief stole the heart of Christmas itself - the star from atop the mall’s giant Christmas tree. What at
first seems like a harmless prank becomes much more upon further investigation. Without the star, the Christmas Eve
light show cannot happen because the star is needed for all the other lights in the display to work. Not only will this lead
to some people losing their jobs, but it will also affect the light show fundraiser for the homeless of Valley Falls. Can you
find the star in time and help save Christmas?

As with all Deadbolt Mystery Society games, you step into the role of the detective. Examining the evidence provided,visiting different locations and using the password protected QR mechanic to uncover the truth.

Players win once they catch the killer, find whats missing or whatever else is needed to solve the case at hand.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Drunken Spirit
description:
Drunken Spirit is a party-drink game where you have to beat other drunken masters to be the last one standing!

Roll the dice to determine your actions and combine it with your drunken master spirit power to make your opponents drink their shots.

Their life is based on the shots elixr. When you run out of shots (drunk it all), you've been eliminated.
categories: Animals, Dice, Mature / Adult, Mythology, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: The 3 Little Pigs in the Wild West
description:
Your brothers have gotten themselves in a heap of trouble with the Sheriff Wolf. He’s seen fit to toss all of them in jail while you were trying to build up a farm. Guess you’ll have to bust them out. If the Wolf finds your brothers though, he’ll toss them straight back in the clink. Get creative with your moves to get your farm built before your opponents. Will the Wolf be fooled if 3 pigs stack up in a poncho and make the rounds completing tasks?

In 3 Pigs in a Poncho, players will move their dice around the action rondel completing the action matching their die value then re-rolling for their next turn. 3 Pigs is at its core a farming game. Players use actions to build their hideout which gives them bonuses from bricks, sticks, and straw. But building has to be done with care, straw can stack on anything, but sticks only stack on sticks and bricks and bricks only stack on bricks.

Players also have an opportunity to raise livestock, building them stables and if they have a pair and an empty stable, they can get baby Unicorns, Llamas, and Cows!
