Players also try to keep their fairy tale pals safe from the Big Bad Wolf Sheriff, Red Riding Hood, Billy goat gruff and Puss in Boots need your help!

Players will get to be strategic with their dice in that they can space the 3 pigs out on the rondel, but doing so makes them susceptible to being arrested by the Wolf who is also moving around the rondel. Or they can stack their piggies, less opportunity to get exactly the action they want, but less likely to be arrested also!

The game plays until a player has completed all 3 sections of their hideout. Then players score on their sheets. The game is a roll and write in that the players roll dice and mark their player sheet based on the actions they completed.

—description from the designer

name: Cafe Rush: Table for Two
description:
A two-player standalone expansion for Cafe Rush: a top speed, high energy, family-friendly card game that’s perfect for parties.

Don’t keep your customers waiting; serve the food they ordered as fast as you can!

In this fast & frantic card game, play table cards, then fill their orders by playing food cards onto them. The catch? Everyone can play on anyone's cards, and everyone plays at once!

Serve the most tables and play the most cards overall to score big points and get the "tip jar" bonus!
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Race, Real-Time, Score-and-Reset Game, Speed Matching

name: Kingdom Frenzy
description:
In a Kingdom ruled by a ruthless King, where peasants revolt, circus performers strike and lovers are left to die, can you fight for the throne and become the new ruler of this corrupted kingdom? Will you be able to escape the assassin while you secretly bring your coven together? Or will you fool around like the Jester and hinder the competition?

Kingdom Frenzy is a fun, slightly chaotic, hidden card party game for adults and teens. The average game time is about 20 minutes long and no two games will provide the same results.

The aim of this game is to have the highest scoring card at the end of the game.

Kingdom Frenzy is played using only a deck of cards. With 30 unique cards, including a King, Queen, Jester and many more, there are many ways to help you end with the highest card. Don't forget to watch out for that Assassin.

Kingdom Frenzy was printed by LudoCards, who print 'custom cards and games 100% made in Italy in ecological approach'

—description from the designer

name: Berliner Verkehr: Mit S + U-Bahn kreuz und quer
description:
Each player gets 2 trains, which are placed on the depot in the lower left corner of the game board. The players take turns to roll the die and move their trains. On the roll of a 6, a player may take one of his trains to the starting space of the same color and letter. When a train reaches the ring track, it proceedes clockwise along the ring. If a train reaches an occupied station, the first train is taken back to it's starting space. Whenever a train reaches a transfer station that leads inside the ring, he may use connected the "S-Bahn" track as a shortcut.

Game variant 1: The players only use the "S-Bahn" tracks. The first player to get his 2 trains around the ring and back to his starting space wins the game.

Game variant 2: The players may also use the subway tracks inside the ring as shortcuts.

Game variant 3, 4 and 5: The players have to reach alternate destinations to win.

Game variant 6: Players that have made their way at least through half the ring may use a shortcut even if they don't land on a transfer station.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture

name: No Cheese, No Coin
description:
No Cheese, No Coin: The card game for people who like Cheese & Money (who doesn’t?).

Do you like Money? Do you like Cheese?

If you answer yes to any of these questions, then this is the game for you!

No Cheese, No Coin is a quick easy to play card game designed for smaller groups of friends who are avid cheese and money enthusiasts. A simple design and dynamic gameplay makes the game fun and enjoyable for all players.

The objective of the game is very simple. Players need to collect coin cards from the deck. The player with the most coin cards within the time limit wins! However, the challenge is dealing with all the different cheese effects cards and the players that can either help or sabotage your chances.

Think smart, play cheesy and remember if you got no cheese then you can’t get no coin.

—description from the designer

name: Bird of the Year
description:
Each year in New Zealand there is a competition to vote for the most popular bird - this is to help raise awareness for some of the worlds most endangered wildlife, their habitats and threats they face. What if that competition wasn't about who got the most votes, but which bird was the best in a variety of challenges and scenarios?

Bird of the Year is a 9 card game that puts various New Zealand birds against each other to win the prestigious title of 'Bird of the Year'. Can your bird win and be crowned the champion for this year?

—description from the designer

name: Battle Shards
description:
Be the player with the most Shards (cards) in your Shard Pile (cards you won) to win! To win Shards, have the highest attack.

Your attack depends on the color of your solid block (red, yellow or blue), against the number that matches your opponent's square for that color (1, 2 or 3).

—description from the designer

name: Game of United States History
description:
Game of United States History is designed for play by 3-10 persons. It contains 56 cards in which seven historical divisions are included:

Commerce and Industry
Education and Religion
Finance
Invention
Territorial Expansion
Transportation
War


Each of these divisions treats two or more subjects/events/movements, with two cards giving specifics regarding the subject/event/movement. Of the two cards, the first treats the beginning or early phase of the movement; the second details the results of the event or the evolution of the movement. The two cards constitute a "pair". In matching the cards of a pair, the same illustrations occur on each card of the pair.

The instructions include directions for five different variations that may be played with this game.

—user summary

name: Chess Mage
description:
Chess Mage is a chess extension using a deck building mechanism to allow new moves and make chess more challenging.

Each player has a base deck and can get additional cards paying them with pieces they capture.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes: Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel
description:
Third Reich period time board game "Der Siegeslauf des Hakenkreuzes - Deutsches Gesellschaftsspiel" (eng. "The victory run of the swastika - German parlor game").
It is typical roll and move game. The first player, who cross the route with 120 stops first, wins the game.

The board game was approved by the political police in Bavaria in the spring of 1933, and according to historian André Postert it was a bestseller. However, since the game also addresses the failures of the party, a ban procedure was opened as part of the "anti-kitsch law".

name: Worst Enemy
description:
Worst Enemy is a (mostly) cooperative trick-taking card game with rotating hidden roles and one-vs-all mechanisms. It's designed for 2 to 4 players ages 12 and up, and lasts between 30 - 40 minutes.

The premise is that you all play as parts of a single mind, however, each round one of you will take the part of the Core Personality who shoulders the sole responsibility of scoring for the group. The other players take on the roles of negative personality traits each playing with a unique rule that confounds how the tricks play.

The game is a race against your bad tendencies as each round you lose advances a Worst Enemy token closer to the end of the score track. Can you work together to score enough tricks to reach the end, or will you prove that old adage once again, "Sometimes you are your own worst enemy"?
mechanics: Hidden Roles, Trick-taking, Variable Player Powers

name: Empatiza2
description:
It all starts with EMPATHY, which is the ability to perceive, share and understand what another may feel. In Empatiza2, the sequel to Empatizate, we are going to talk about gender parity, emotions, self-esteem, anxiety and stress, money management, commitment to the environment, among others. We will learn to say YES, NO and I DON'T KNOW. This game allows us to anticipate and solve interpersonal conflicts and achieve a greater emotional connection with people. When you say "Empathize", it is to put yourself in the place, defending the cause, for 1 minute in both cases in a mandatory way.

The “YES”, “NO” and “DON'T KNOW” are placed in the center of the table and 5 cards are dealt to each player.

Each player reads his cards and strategically chooses one to pass to the player on his right saying "empathize". This action must be done by everyone at the same time. The youngest begins to answer and from there to the right of him one by one during 1 round. If you meet the slogan, score points, if not. The answered letters are left on one side.

The game ends when all the cards in hand are answered. Cards are scored at the top. Whoever scores the most points wins.

name: The Dark Forest
description:
Scientists on your homeworld have discovered that the true nature of the universe is not unlike a Dark Forest, with solar systems connected by branches of a Cosmic Tree. Your people have started to travel to nearby stars, but even so, you have not found other advanced life. Obsessed with the search for your cosmic brothers and sisters, you set out exploring from your homeworld. To aid in exploration, your scientists have invented The Singularity Probe, a machine that can travel into space and speed up time, turning the millennia it would take to travel to the stars into hours. As a side effect of time speeding up however, life on nearby planets grows in leaps and bounds every time the Probe causes one of these leaps in time. Oversee and guide the development of life in the Universe, and discover whether we are alone in the Dark Forest.

In this action selection game, players will use Seekers to Sow the seeds of life on planets, Settle their own Watchers on a planet, and plan jumps to new solar systems that will occur during the next Leap in time. Watchers then will work to Suppress or Elevate the native life on a planet, tending them for a later Reaping, or perhaps helping them evolve to higher forms of life. Each new planet you discover will have unique properties, yielding a new worker placement spot that will alter the possible strategies in the game. The winner of the game is the first to find and make peace with an Ancient Civilization, if one exists, or to become the only advanced species in the universe if not.

name: Monsters & Minecarts
description:
Have you ever been out on a picnic when a sinkhole opens up and drops you into a scary old mine filled with strange and dangerous creatures?

Well, let me tell you what to do if you're ever in that situation!
You gather up all the picnic supplies you can find, leap into a minecart to try your best to escape from the monsters, avoid the cave-ins, and keep your distance from the mad scientist who's just as likely to help you as he is to turn you into one of his experiments.

The objective of the game is to place enough track cards in a row to escape the mine. The number of tracks you'll need will vary depending on the number of players but the gameplay remains the same. The monsters, the natural disasters and the mad scientist will all be working against you.

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Horror, Humor, Maze, Science Fiction
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Echec aux chevaliers
description:
Échec aux Chevaliers is the tranposition into a board game of the fights that took place in the Middle Ages between the Knights and the men-at-arms.

We play with two players, even if it is possible to play with four. The object of the game is to successfully capture the opponent's citadel and stay there for an entire turn without being captured.

Échec aux Chevaliers is a fairly rare game. It is indeed sought after by both board game enthusiasts and collectors of Mokarex figurines.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Pattern Movement, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: おそうじとねこ (Osouji to Neko)
description:
おそうじとねこ (Osouji to Neko) is a shedding game from Japan. Players are trying to clean up the cat's pawprints across the house. But the cat keeps being naughty.

Players are dealt a hand of cards, numbered from 1 to 12 in six colours. There are also some special action cards, including a joker. The start player (who most recently cleaned) lays out a card and players must play a card or combos that are better, or pass. Once everyone has passed, the last player to play leads the next round.

Cards must be played out in the style of [thing15878], in sets and runs, which can include the jokers. So a pair of 4s can be raised by a pair of 5s, or by three 8s. But three 3s won't do, nor a run of any kind. Likewise, if a run is lead, it can be raised by better runs, but not by sets.

As cards are played out, the cat marker is moved down, and when it hits zero, the players hands are scored. The player with the most points is covered in pawprints, and the fewest points wins.

The publisher says the game is easy enough for young players to enjoy.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Melding and Splaying, Set Collection

name: Go Make A  Hike
description:
Go Make a Hike is a competitive tile drafting and placement game for 2-4 players (with a solo mode) about building the perfect hiking path. Each round, players will draft either a Trail or Destination tile to add to their Trail System. Destinations require certain features along their trail: Water, Flowers, Wildlife, or Viewpoints.

As players work to build the perfect hike their trails will grow and spread across the table in an impressive display of nature's beauty!

Solo mode included.
mechanics: Connections, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: Polyhedral Perils
description:
In Polyhedral Perils you and any other number of players are heroes whose hobby is exploring dungeons, battling the monsters who dwell there, and bragging about your exploits. But who is the greatest hero? You decide to hold a competition to determine, once and for all, who the hero with the greatest prestige is.

All you need to play Polyhedral Perils is a set of seven polyhedral dice (D4, D6, D8, D10, D%, D12, and D20), something to keep score, and some competitors (or play solo - see below).

Taking turns, each hero will attempt to defeat the strongest monster they can. As monsters are defeated you'll earn Prestige. Head back to the village to brag about your exploits at any time to secure your Prestige, but if you are defeated you'll return dejected and forlorn and earn much less Prestige.

Polyhedral Perils Solo In the solo variant, you are trapped deep within the dungeon and must fight your way to escape. There is no Prestige, you are fighting for your life! You must defeat enough monsters to escape the dungeon before you perish.

Polyhedral Perils: The Champion's Journey
The Champion’s Journey is a way to play a campaign mode of Polyhedral Perils. This is a solo adventure that can be played in one or several sessions and will take about 30-40 minutes to complete. You’ll track your progress across multiple games with additional challenges and abilities as you progress through locations on the map of the Kingdom of Petitia. Each location must be defeated before you can move to the next location. Each location will have a new challenge that must be overcome, but doing so will give you a benefit that you can use in future challenges.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Polyhedral Predicaments: Dungeon Demise
description:
In Polyhedral Predicaments - Dungeon Demise you are a hero delving deep into a dungeon in search of treasures. You'll encounter a maze of rooms, each with a powerful enemy, weapons and tools that will help you on your journey, as well as coins and gems. Collect what you can, survive if you are able, and defeat the dungeon boss at the end to earn a trove of valuables!

Polyhedral Predicaments is a series within a series! These are small, 18-card games that share similar mechanics as you go on adventures and survive disasters.

name: Caught in the Act
description:
Hanki-Panki is going on. Sex is a natural part of life. But the question is Who? is doing What? to Whom? and Where?

This game is your chance to be an investigative reporter and uncover the naked truth. If you are the first plater to correctly catch a couple in the act - YOU WIN!!!

On your turn, roll the dice to determine how many spaces you can move. When you reach a room, ask another player to reveal one fact they know. Keep your notes and try to narrow down who did what, to whom, and where.
mechanics: Deduction, Roles with Asymmetric Information, Roll / Spin and Move

name: SuperMark Bygger Hus
description:
A card game for children and others, 5 years and up. You're trying to build a play house by drawing cards from the other players, but avoiding the "Ouch, my finger!" cards.

On your turn, you choose to either

a) draw a building card from another player's hand into your own hand. If you draw an "Ouch, my finger!" card, you discard that and your entire hand of building cards to the bottom of the draw pile.

b) play a subgame where you place one of your tool cards face down and say "Tool". All other players will now also place one of their tool cards face down, and then everybody reveals their chosen tool. The active player will draw a building card from the draw pile, if at least one other player has chosen a different tool. Each of the other players will draw a card, if they chose the same tool as the active player.

At the end of your turn you win by having all four different building cards in your hand. Otherwise play passes to the next player.

name: Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path
description:
Go Make A Hike: Off the Beaten Path includes three modules that can be added to the base game in any combination.

- Fire & Ice includes 10 new Destinatons with volcanic and snowy themes.
- Ordeals to Adventures adds immediate and ongoing effects that can change the flow of the game.
- Points of Interest adds new, yellow feature cubes that have unique scoring opportunities.

Requires Go Make A Hike to use this expansion.
categories: Adventure, Environmental, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration, Travel
mechanics: Connections, Open Drafting, Solo / Solitaire Game, Tile Placement

name: もやっと海図 (Moyatto Kaizu)
description:
もやっと海図 (Moyatto Kaizu) is an exploration game from Japan. The game title means something like 'hazy sea charts'. Players are building up a nautical chart from memory of their voyages, complete with sea monsters. But they aren't quite sure what goes where, and work together to remember what they saw.

In the game, players place tiles showing land and sea. As they place a tile, they can add player pieces, or a pawn worth 2 pieces. If a tile gets to four pieces, it is confident enough to stay. But if it has fewer than four, then some black balls are added to make it up to four.

When a continent is completed, it is scored. Players with the most pieces/pawns get the most points (counting all the pieces on the island), for having been most confident in their memory of the voyage. The next most gets the points of the majority pieces, and so on down. There are bonus points for places of interest on the land (buried treasure) and for adjacent sea monsters.

But the black balls are collected by the majority scorer, and count as negative at the end of the game, along with any player pieces remaining in hand.

The game ends when ten black balls have been used.

The game is a mix of co-operating, and bluffing to complete island with the most confidence.
user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Tile Placement

name: Ich hab mein Herz im Spiel verloren
description:
The players start with their pewter figures on the colored spaces in the corners of the game board and take turns to roll a die and move their figures. If a figure has completed a trek clockwise around the game board, it advances to the next inner circle. Some spaces benefit or hinder the players. In a game with two players, the first to reach the heart in the center of the game board is the winner.

If more are playing and one of the two players, who arrive at the heart first, has the heart as a playing figure, the two players are a couple and win the game together. If two other figures are first, the last two are the couple and the winners.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond)
description:
セブンクォーツ_ダイヤモンド (Seven QuartZ Diamond) is an expansion pack for セブンクォーツ (Seven QuartZ) that adds new magicians and skills, and lets three players duel.
user summary
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: DaG Eight Chess (ダグエイトチェス)
description:
ダグエイトチェス (DaG Eight Chess) is a two player abstract game from Japan, a mix of Chess and Stratego on a smaller 5*5 chequer board.

Players have a small Chess army that move across the board, but as face-down tokens. The pieces are one each of King, Queen, Rook, Knight and Bishop, and three Pawns. These pieces all move and attack as in normal Chess.

But if a player can deduce which piece is which, they can declare a piece's identity instead of moving. If correct, that piece is eliminated. A player wins by getting the eight army pieces, or by getting the King.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Grid Movement, Secret Unit Deployment, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Da Mafia (ダマフィア)
description:
Da Mafia (ダマフィア) is a crime game from Japan, with players concealing their gangster cards to control the city.

The game works as a worker placement game, but the workers are cards for the different gang members; Bosses, Members, Hitman, and Bodyguards. Each player is the head of their gang and places their initial four cards face-down around the city. When they are turned, they might control that section, and gain benefits such as recruiting more gangsters.

But before cards are turned up, players have a chance to guess who is concealed where in the city. If they are correct, the player outsmarts the opponent ands gains an advantage.

Each player has their own board for their gangster head, which shows their abilities, recruitment, and player levels and score. The other side is the same but with a special unique ability, meaning players can play a simpler or more complex game.

After five rounds, the player who has gained the most notoriety in the city wins the game.
user summary
mechanics: Deduction, Hidden Roles, Secret Unit Deployment, Worker Placement

name: Reise durch die Schweiz
description:
The players start at space 1 in Schaffhausen. The first to arrive in Lindau at space 50 wins the game. Movement is determined by the roll of a die. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Contains 6 metal player pieces. Published before 1928 based on publisher location on cover.

name: アドテール (Adtale)
description:
アドテール (Adtale) is a dice game from Japan in which players direct red and green slime against each other.

Each player rolls dice and chooses a suitable attack card to be used with that dice. They all send their red and greeen dice and cards out together, to form a mass of slime in the middle of the players' area. As the mass of slime builds up by accumulating more dice, the slime is forced around, until it finally impacts on a player.

By using the combination of player abilities, dice abilities and dice, players try to eliminate the opposition before they succumb to attacks themselves.
user summary
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers

name: Treasured Depths
description:
A deck building game where you utilize a 3x3 grid of cards as your "hand". Each turn you'll refill your grid then choose a row and column to activate. You'll collect the resources indicated and carry out textual abilities in your chosen order. Following that, you can acquire new cards to add into your deck, and/or use your accrued dive points to locate treasures at different depths. You're competing for the most fame (Victory points) by finding the best treasures by the end of the game.

I created this game because I really liked the grid system of Monumental, but literally nothing else about it. So, it's main inspirations are Monumental and Ascension. I intend to creat some art for it at some point.
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Square Grid

name: Chilli or Chunder: Hot Stuff
description:
Welcome to the 'Chilli or Chunder' Chilli Eating Contest!

The Hot Stuff expansion includes two new ways to play:

- First Timer (more challenging)
Having never eaten hot stuff chillies before but decided to give the contest a go none the less, this contestant shows determination of steel, but without the matching stomach.

- Professional (less challenging)
A hot stuff chilli eating machine, this contestant should eat up this contest.

—description from the designer
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: 魔王大戦ブットバクラッシュ (Satans War Buttoba Crash)
description:
魔王大戦ブットバクラッシュ (Satans War Buttoba Crash) is an action game from Japan. Players flick their monsters onto Satan's castle, trying to earn enough reward to gather three 'heroes'. The first player to recruit three heroes, such as Dracula, Succubus, Vorpal Bunny, or Hanako in the toilet, is the winner.

One player acts as Satan and defends a large castle, made from staggered boxes as a dias, with a throne at the top. The other players have a Demon King, one of eight such as Lucifer, Cthulhu, or Nurarihyon. Each Demon King starts with special abilities to help the player.

The game uses highly decorated plastic cards. The player takes their plastic Demon King card and inserts it vertical into a base card. This creates a flicking device. By holding the base down, and bending the card back, a player can flick their small foam creatures up onto the castle levels. Satan can defend the castle platform with its own cards, or use whatever toys or plushies a player has to hand.

As the game progresses, the attackers try to steal money from the castle, and use this to recruit 'heroes' to their side. These heroes bring more powers and abilities to the cause, and strengthen the attack in different ways. For example, the Vorpal Bunny increases the attack magnification to the throne by 100 times and exerts super high firepower, but Hanako in the toilet nullifies the attack on the throne. Getting Hanako-san from the toilet keeps the player with Vorpal Bunny in check. Players can choose to work together, and a player might even be better off attacking themselves. The game system is very open and fluid in the way the characters' abilities work.

The first player to gain three heroes to their side is the winner.
user summary
publishers: Kagami Kyosuke Works (架神恭介ワークス)

name: Fire for Light: Red Water Depths
description:
Red Water Depths is a campaign-driven expansion for Fire for Light that includes five new chapters. During each chapter, you set up a new scenario with new enemies and objectives. Most importantly, players are given choices that will change the outcome of their games and give them access to different rewards or shape future chapters differently.

Red Water Depths introduces the new Fire exposure, as well as new lava terrain, that will fundamentally change the environment. Inside you can also expect;


5 new chapters in a new small Storybook
new tokens
new Foes
new Item cards
new Trait cards
and so much more!


Red Water Depths introduces a whole new region inside a dark volcano where elves have claimed regency after slaying the dragon Arkunda! The Flame King is quickly extending his rule. The explorers must rally the people to defend themselves against an army of goblins and ogres before it's too late!

Make your choices and save the people in Red Water Depths!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Point to Point Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Fire for Light: Lichen's Landing
description:
Lichen's Landing is a campaign-driven expansion for Fire for Light that includes five new chapters. During each chapter, you set up a new scenario with new enemies and objectives. Most importantly, players are given choices that will change the outcome of their games and give them access to different rewards or shape future chapters differently.

Lichen's Landing introduces the new Toxic exposure, as well as a new Summary Page, that will fundamentally change the explorers. Inside you can also expect;


5 new chapters in a new small Storybook
new tokens
new Foes
new Item cards
new Trait cards
and so much more!


Lichen's Landing introduces a whole new region of strange jungle filled with mykonids and creatures who seem to be poisoning the water supply - but the different groups of mykonids are all blaming each other for this tragedy. Beneath the surface, someone is lying and the explorers need to figure out what's really going on.

Make your choices and save the jungle in Lichen's Landing!

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Book, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Summer's End
description:
The village of Summer's End is struggling to keep the villagers fed, and Malwinter is looming. You've been drafted to gather as much as you can to keep the coffers full - but you might have to use some of those materials to craft tools if you want to bring the most back.

In this competitive roll & write game inspired by Fire for Light you'll spend and roll your dice every turn to move around the map, collect different resources, fight off the creatures of the forest, and try and bring back more for the village than the other explorers!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Resource to Move

name: The Memories of Old Map
description:
A set of eight postcard wargames themed the end of the Qing Dynasty:
Sanyuanli anti British 1841
Fall of the Kingdom of Heaven 1864
Fall of the Black Banner: Taiwan 1895
Memories of Guangzhouwan 1898
On the other side of Hong Kong 1899
Outside the Forbidden City 1900
Trample on Heikoutai 1905
The Wuchang Uprising 1911

一套八款以清末为主题的明信片兵棋：
三元里抗英斗争（广州1841）
天京江宁 太平天国的覆灭（南京1864）
黑旗陨落 乙未战争（台湾1895）
回忆广州湾（湛江1898）
港岛对岸 划出新界（香港1899）
紫禁城外 八国联军（北京1900）
践踏黑沟台 日俄战争（辽阳1905）
断蛇七寸 武昌起义（武汉1911）
publishers: Kilovolt Design, The Later Han Games

name: 好漢日記 (Nice Guy Diary)
description:
A card game of "Water Margin", one of the Four Great Classical Novels of Chinese literature.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Water_Margin
Out of the story of the novel, this game expresses a big battle and a hot bond by 108 heroes.
108 cards
1 turn marker
3 round markers
2 dice
2 pages of rules
1 player's guide

name: 一子相伝 (Isshi Souden)
description:
This is a simulation game that reproduces the one-on-one battle in the manga "Fist of the North Star".
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fist_of_the_North_Star
Introducing a novel system such as the abolition of the map and the replacement of the attacking side by interception, to express the battle that "movement is understandable".
48 data cards
1 record sheet
4 pages of rules

name: ANIMAKER
description:
A multiplayer card game in which the player becomes the president of voice actor production and aims to make money by making full use of voice actors to create anime programs. While taking care to bring out the charm of the voice actors, it is easy to play because it uses very simple rules.
You can also build your own deck by adding voice actor cards and program cards.
128 voice actor cards
36 program cards
48 guarantee cards
234 markers
6 management sheets
2 pages of rules

name: S.T.A.R.S.
description:
This game reproduces the first work of the TV game "Resident Evil" with cards. Rather than having each player compete for victory or defeat, everyone works together to achieve their goals. If not achieved within the time limit, everyone will be defeated.
80 search cards
16 event cards
4 caracter sheets
1 distance display
72 counters
1 map
2 pages of rules

name: アイアンリーグ (Iron League)
description:
A card game that reproduces full 52 episodes of "Whirlwind! Iron Leaguer", a Sunrise TV anime broadcasted from April 1993 to March 1994.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shippū!_Iron_Leaguer
Each player can make leaguers use new big skills by raising the "heart value" of them.
48 leaguer cards
190 skill cards
1 play sheet
126 counters
4 pages of rules

name: 関ヶ原無双 (Sekigahara Warriors)
description:
Sekigahara Warriors is a simulation game that reproduces the "Battle of Sekigahara", the biggest battle in Japan's Sengoku period.
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Battle_of_Sekigahara
The map was cut from the foot of Mt. Momokubari in the east to Fuwa no Seki in the west, from Mt. Sasao in the north to Mt. Matsuo in the south. The victory condition includes the element of "betrayal" that is indispensable for the battle of Sekigahara, and players can enjoy purely clashes between units.
In order to create the atmosphere of the battle at that time, the battle logic is extremely deformed for a simulation game of this scale. In other words, the front side of the piece expresses the ability as a unit, but when it is damaged and becomes the back side, it expresses the ability of the individual military commander. In terms of wargames, the front side is the operational level and the back side is the tactical level. If the soldiers are lost due to damage, the military commander will fight directly.
There is also a twist on the victory conditions. The point is that "when the military commander retreats, Kobayakawa's heart shakes."

name: ソリティア関ヶ原の戦い (Solitaire Battle of Sekigahara)
description:
The player play the main Battle of Sekigahara as a commander of the Western Army. The Eastern Army is controlled by the game system and attacks / counterattacks according to the rules. This system is partly based on the system of VPG's The Barbarossa Campaign.
It is said that the Battle of Sekigahara was won by the betrayal of Kobayakawa Hideaki and others of the Western Army. Therefore, when making a game, the elements of the politicking for the army of Kobayakawa Hideaki and others are usually included. However, this was an element that was prone to system problems, such as complicating the game system and allowing players who know the historical facts of betrayal to take measures against betrayal in advance.
Therefore, this game focused on "the salvo of guns on Mt. Matsuo by the Ieyasu main corps" that triggered Kobayakawa Hideaki to finally implement the betrayal. The game defines that Ieyasu gets impatient and starts advancing = betrayal = defeat of the Western Army, and sets the victory condition that the Western Army is defeated if the victory or defeat is not decided "until the Ieyasu main corps starts advancing".
This is a fairly high hurdle for the Western Army, but it is a victory condition unique to solitaire that you can challenge as many times as you want without having to secure an opponent. Try to challenge the if of history.

name: Winds of Caribbean
description:
Winds of Caribbean is a naval battle-themed game of sailing ships during the Age of Discovery, based on the system of the masterpiece Wings of War: Dawn of War. Players control sailboats, shoot cannons, and sometimes come alongside to fight and aim for victory.
The big difference between Wings of War and Winds of Caribbean is that the former has the same direction of movement and attack, while the later has different directions of movement and attack. The theory of naval battles during the age of sail was to face the enemy on the side where the cannons were lined up, and this game also reproduced that. You can experience a different battle from the air battle, such as how to switch between movement and attack. In addition, the cannon reflects the performance of the time, it requires loading of bullets for each attack and the rapid fire does not work, and if the ship moves violently, the hit rate will drop or it will not be possible to load. It also includes the element that if a fire breaks out due to being hit, the fire must be extinguished. When ships collide with each other, side-to-side battle (aboldage) also occurs. Some ships are better at this, so pirate style is also possible.
The feature of the component is that the display such as loading of bullets and decrease of hit rate is set to "character + lines". It is also an expression that the commander's ability and command occupy a large weight in the naval battle at that time.
There are three types of ships: caravel, carrack, and small galleon.
mechanics: Action Queue, Movement Template, Programmed Movement, Simulation, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: リーダーズアイドル (Leader's Idol)
description:
Leader's Idol is a table game with character development elements. The number of players is 2-4. The player will be in the position of the public relations manager of the Leaders Company and will carry out PR activities for the company. This PR plan includes making subordinates public relations idols, and it is important for players how to make their idols active.

The outcome of the game is determined by the total number of PR points earned at the end of the game. PR points are listed for each public relations plan (project card) that is the center of the progress of the game, and these cards can be obtained by "auction". There are 24 types of projects, and the points and contents are different, but a "budget" is required to compete for these, and the speed at which these budgets can be recovered depends on the abilities of each idol. If you spend a lot of time collecting your budget, no matter how big a project you get, you may lose to another company that has more projects.

In addition, some projects may have synergistic effects with other projects, and some may affect subsequent activities. For example, the "manner training" card has 0 PR points, but it has the effect of improving the "social" ability. Therefore, planning is important for how to use the budget, and it is also necessary to consider when to incorporate training such as compensating for the weaknesses of the character / developing the strengths.

In addition, some projects may have synergistic effects with other projects, and some may affect subsequent activities. For example, the "manner training" card has 0 PR points, but it has the effect of improving the "social" ability. Therefore, planning is important for how to use the budget, and it is also necessary to consider when to incorporate training such as compensating for the weaknesses of the character / developing the strengths.

For that reason, it is a game that you can enjoy the public relations simulation side, where the rules are simple but planning is important.

name: Cat Collection Card Game
description:
Cat Collection Card Game is a table game that can be played from the lower grades of elementary school. You can play from 2 to 4 people at once.

The game includes cards that represent cats and items. Players use item cards to compete for how to bring cats to their place.
There are cats such as stray cat, boss cat, tortoiseshell cat, celebrity cat, etc. and some of them have different favorite items as well as abilities. Each cat has a score, and the player who collects a certain number of points wins the game. There is a difference in the score between a cat that can be caught by one mouse and a celebrity cat with a pedigree, and there are also compatibility between cats, so it is important to think about how to collect them.

Items are replenished from the deck, but some are easy to get and some are not, and some items have special effects, so planning is important. However, happenings such as stray cats and crows may appear, so it does not go exactly as planned. The rules are simple in a game like picture matching, but there are also elements of
replay.

Play time is about 15 minutes. Planning is important when playing with two people, and reading the flow of the place and a little luck is important when playing with four people.

This game has no relations with a mobile cat collecting game "Neko Atsume".

name: Coral Sea Decisive Battle Card Game
description:
Coral Sea Decisive Battle Card Game is a two-player card game with the motif of the first aircraft carrier-to-aircraft carrier confrontation that took place in 1942 during the Pacific War. Players will fight in the position of commander of the Japanese task force centered on the aircraft carriers Zuikaku and Shokaku, or the commander of the US task force centered on the aircraft carriers Lexington and Yorktown.

Battles between aircraft carriers include elements such as searching for enemy locations, air defense plans, and the formation and rotation of attack units. While covering these elements, I tried to reproduce the air and naval battle at that time with a system that was as simple as possible like a card game. The game also includes the presence of friendly forces, geographical advantages, and technical differences such as radar.
Especially the search for enemy is the heart of this game. By repeating the search for enemy, the location of the enemy will gradually be narrowed down, but it is the same for the opponent. It's better to find the enemy early, but you also have to think about defense. You will feel the excitement because you do not know the movement of the opponent.
categories: Card Game, Wargame, World War II

name: Senryaku-Daimyo
description:
Senryaku-Daimyo is a board game for 3 to 4 players who aims to prosper in their own country by taking the position of a daimyo during the Sengoku period.

When you think of a game during the Sengoku period, you might think of a battle for territory without humanity and justice, but this "Senryaku-Daimyo" includes not only "battle" but also territorial management elements such as commerce and industrial development. You can enjoy the trade-in that suits your style.

The starting line at the start of the game is the same for all players. The number of territories, economic power, and human assets are the same. From there, players will continue to prosper their country while acquiring cards for their policies and territories. You may focus on industrial development such as "hydraulic control" and "land survey", or you may focus on commercial promotion such as "free trade" and "money casting". Of course, you may expand your territory and make your country bigger by the battle unique to the Sengoku period. Ultimately, who enriched the country the most is determined by the total number of victory points on those cards, so it's completely up to you what direction you're aiming for.

Of course, among the routes mentioned above, the expansion of the territory has a great deal of economic gain, which greatly contributes to victory. However, the act of relying on force is not unrelated to the interference of other countries. In addition, events such as storms and floods and riots occur suddenly, so territorial management does not go as planned. Sometimes it will be necessary to make bold use of human resources during the Sengoku period.

Is it possible to outsmart the speculation of other countries and build the richest country in Japan?

name: キャッツバトル (Cats Battle)
description:
This is a card game for 2 to 4 players who compete for fish cards using the cat cards in their hand.

The flow of the game is as simple as choosing one of the cat cards in your hand for your turn. However, cat cards have various effects, such as drawing cards from the deck, forcing other players to exchange cards, and pressing unwanted cards. Occasionally, there will be a "power comparison" where you can get a card by comparing the strength of the cat and winning! When the deck runs out, the game ends, and the victory or defeat is determined by the total points written on the fish card at that time.

The feature of this game is that everyone starts the game with the same number of fish cards. Some fish cards range from high scores to negative points, and it is unknown who started the game with how many points.

As the game progresses, you will gradually see who is best to play against and who is best to exchange cards with. It is a card game that children and adults can easily play, guessing in the hands of other players and bargaining which card to leave last.
mechanics: Events, Move Through Deck, Take That

name: HAKONE
description:
HAKONE is a coastal town in Japan, lying some 100km southwest of Tokyo. It is famous for hosting the Hakone Ekiden, a two day, five marathon road-race. Ekiden, long distance road racing, is a very popular sport in Japan, and the Hakone Ekiden is notoriously hard, with five legs run from central Tokyo out to Hakone on day one, and then five legs run back to central Tokyo on day two. Each leg is over 20km, and the race is run by teams of university students.

In the dice game Hakone, players are coaching their university team to win the Hakone Ekiden. Each leg is run by different athletes, and the coach must select the best one to suit the stage. The athlete cards show their abilities, their time over 10k, how they do at climbing or descending, against the wind or sea breezes. In addition, the players use special action cards to improve their performance, or nobble the opposition.

The dice are used as in CATAN, with one dice roll applying to all runners. The courses are printed on cloths and there are eight university teams to choose from.
user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: HAKONE 拡張カード (HAKONE expansion cards)
description:
HAKONE 拡張カード (HAKONE expansion cards) is a very limited edition of expansion cards to HAKONE. There are only 90 copies sold. The pack includes new university teams with matching pieces, new runners including foreign students, new event cards.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Variable Player Powers

name: The Wiggles SNAP! CARDS
description:
Goal: to SNAP! Up as many cards as you can and be the last player with cards left after all the other players have run out of cards.
Instructions: Shuffle the deck of 36 cards and deal an equal amount to each player which they place in front of them in a face down pile.
Each player takes turns placing a card from the top of their pile face up in the centre of the table. Whenever two matching cards are placed on top of each other the first player to shout “wiggles SNAP!” collects the centre cards and puts them face down below their pile.
When a player runs out of cards they are out of the game. The last player remaining is the winner.

name: Am-Duat
description:
A Mahjong variant themed to ancient Egypt, players draft tiles from a pyramid of face-down tiles and replace their starting 'book' of 16 tiles in order to complete mosaic sets (2, 3 and 4 pieces).

When a player has a full set of 'completed' mosaics OR the discard pile - a pyramid that builds up during play - the round ends and proceeds to scoring.

—user summary

name: AtomBlitz: Operation Epic Poem – Shakespeare's Tragedy
description:
This is an add-on for AtomBlitz: Operation Epic Poem. WARNING: to play this, you must have a base game set!

The add-on contains:


a new three-mission raid-campaign;
a big [60,9x58,2 cm] map of Swedish capital city Stockholm and its surroundings;
compact, but heavily mechanized post-hybrid battleforce of Danish army, an ally of Sweden.


—description from the publisher

Britain vs. Sweden
Naval and AirLand combat.
OGRE-like structured ships mechanic.
Nuclear weapons available for both opponents.
categories: Modern Warfare, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Starsmith
description:
In the dice-rolling battle game Starsmith, you are constellations dueling over elements in the galaxy in order to build your own stars. What will be your strategy: capturing, stealing, or performing fusion/fission?

—description from the publisher

name: Open Cases
description:
Open Cases is a fast and fun card game. Find the truth behind unsolved crimes!

Be the first investigator to find the culprit, the weapon used and the real motivation. Don't let other players get in the way of your investigation and prove that justice always prevails.

name: Gentsu
description:
Gentsu is a card game from Japan. The designer works in the advertising industry in Japan, and modelled the game on the experience of an account executive. Players are trying to complete projects for famous brands (with mock IDs like Tayota) by working overtime. But events and accidents take their toll and cause problems. The player who completes the best projects is the winner.

The game was first produced in 2018 in a limited design with simple packaging, and then re-issued by the designer with improved cards and box design.

--user summary

name: gentsu 拡張版 v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic- (gentsu Expansion v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic-)
description:
gentsu 拡張版 v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic- (gentsu Expansion v1.0.1 -Road to Molympic-) is an expansion pack for the Japanese game Gentsu. It adds in new cards to satirise the run up to the 2020 Tokyo Olympics in the advertising industry.

Players have a big chance to be promoted to the "Extreme Paradise Account Manager" that all employees long for. This means working long hours in the agency Nightless Castle, so called because they never turn off the lights.
user summary

name: Como Perros y Gatos...
description:
An illustrated card game with different dogs and cats that compete to see who is the tallest of all. It can be played in 3 different ways:

1. Higher-lower numerical relationship: Competing among all the players which is the highest number.

2. Mathematical game: Where the cards are related looking for additions and subtractions, whose results are the key to winning.

3. Coincidence Memotest: Playing with characters and numbers.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Number

name: このドラマがすごい！ (Kono Drama ga Sugoi!)
description:
このドラマがすごい！ (Kono Drama ga Sugoi!) is a card game from Japan based on making a TV drama. The players are television producers, and are trying to come up with a hit TV drama. The game title means something like 'This draam is amazing!'. Putting together hands in a poker style, players want to combine screenwriters, actors, directors and more to create the best TV dramas.

In the game, the numbers equate to the audience rating and are important. But an excellent producer also needs to win prestigious awards, decide on overseas remakes, and synergize with the theme song. The players try to create a wonderful Japanese TV drama that will impress many viewers, convince the office, and make everyone happy!
user summary

name: Canté Pri!
description:
Game of speed and visual acuity. Super fun and engaging! The deck is distributed among all the players and a card is placed in the middle to start, then everyone at the same time turns over a card from their deck until a participant finds the coincidence of the images or shadows.

At that moment it is discarded and the game continues with that card. Whoever runs out of cards first wins.

name: Toque y Gol
description:
To know and enjoy football, whatever the result!

Each manager chooses his team, arranges it on the court and the game begins.

The winner is the first to convert two goals to the opposing team. Each play is said out loud and then the number the die rolls decides what will happen. For example, if you reached the area you can kick directly to the goal only if you get 3, 4 or 5, and it is a goal only if the goalkeeper rolls a number greater than yours, but if the goalkeeper rolls the same number as you or more high means you saved that attempt.

name: Fuego Card Game
description:
Fuego! is a race to get rid of all your cards!
In this game of shifting alliances, players are encouraged to openly plot against each other to prevent opponents from playing all of their cards!

But, beware! When you are about to go out, the other players will try to stop you! Deliberate, strategize and cooperate before “Ya Burnt!”

name: Fuego Caliente!
description:
Fuego Caliente! is a race to get rid of all your cards! Just like the original version, players are encouraged to openly plot against each other to prevent opponents from playing all of their cards! But, beware! When you are about to go out, the other players will try to stop you! Deliberate, strategize and cooperate before... "Ya Burnt!"

This new version is supercharged with new cards, and a 6-sided die for a gaming experience you will never forget!

name: カワーズ (KAWARS)
description:
カワーズ (KAWARS) is a two player duelling card game from Japan. Frogs are at war, and both armies face off in a battle.

Both players draw from a single deck, which has only 16 cards, and play (summon) frog cards face-down or face-up on their playmat. The frogs have values for attack and defence, and if an attacking frog has a higher attack than the opponent's defence value, it wins.

Cards are either played up as attack cards, and immediately attack, or sideways as defence cards. Cards played face down do not have to be revealed until attacked.

Some of the frogs have special abilities, which are triggered immediately they make an attack. For example, a Knight can switch the mode of one of the opponent's summoned Frogs from ATTACK to DEFENSE, and vice versa.

Each player has ten hit points at the start, and if an attack penetrates the defence, the player loses hit points. Crucially, if the deck is exhausted, the player with the fewest hit points wins. But if the deck is still in play, the player at zero hit points first loses.

The game is published in a Black edition and a White edition, with different frog armies with different strengths and special abilities.

user summary
mechanics: Action/Event, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Pitas Pitas Palomitas
description:
Players play city pigeons who must find the best place to feed. Fortunately, the parks with their little old men and their bags of crumbs are the best option to do it. Although the park is very large and the number of idle old people is high, so is the population of pigeons, so the players will wage a fierce battle to be the pigeon that has worn the most boots for 12 days.

You will need a great intuition and animal instinct as well as a good dose of luck to achieve it.



Los jugadores encarnan a palomas de ciudad que deben buscar el mejor lugar donde alimentarse. Afortunadamente los parques con sus viejecillos y sus bolsas de migas son la mejor opción para hacerlo. Aunque el parque es muy grande y la cantidad de viejetes ociosos alta, también lo es la población de palomas por lo que los jugadores libraran una encarnizada batalla por ser la paloma que más se ha puesto las botas durante 12 días. Necesitaras una gran intuición e instinto animal además de una buena dosis de suerte para lograrlo.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Hidden Victory Points

name: The Princess and the P's
description:
The Princess is in quite a predicament—the Prince’s parents have put her to the test of pinpointing a plethora of preposterous paraphernalia planted beneath a pile of 20 poofy mattresses. If she passes the prerequisite, she’ll gain the Prince’s proposal, bringing peace and prosperity to the province. But how could anyone perceive such puny protuberances beneath all that padding?
The palace peons are here to help her prevail.

The Princess and The P's is a playful parlor word game in which all but one of the players (the Palace Peons) prompt the remaining player (the Princess) to guess a collection of secret objects whose names contain the letter P. If a Peon prevails, they’ll procure pearls as prizes. But they must take precautions not to use ANY words that contain the letter "P” (lest they procure penalties)... Players help the Princess prevail, and compete for the title of MVP (most valuable peon) in this semi-cooperative game.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry
mechanics: Communication Limits, Hand Management, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Pigeon Pie
description:
The queen has grown tired of the same old pies. Potatoes, onions, pigeons, blackbirds…all of these ingredients have been declared ho-hum by her majesty. In an attempt to inspire her kitchen staff to be more innovative with their cooking, her Royal Highness has invited culinary experts from lands near and far to gather for an international feast in the Great Hall. She has chosen members of the court with the most discerning palates to taste these exotic pies, take notes, and give her their assessment of the flavors inside each dish. The taster with the most robust pallet will be promoted to head of the kitchen staff—a very prestigious position indeed.

In Pigeon Pie, players assume the roles of the queen’s royal pie-tasters. Each round, they will be served a pie with 6 slices (letters). They must try to detect all the subtle flavors contained in the pie by writing down as many “ingredients” (words) as possible using only the letters in the pie. They’ll gain points for original words, higher letter counts, and for identifying words with a culinary theme.

Game Crafter Word-Up Challenge contest entry

name: Mini Blitz Medieval
description:
Blitz Built Games is the card game that brings a core rule system to your favorite characters. Use one of the four Mini Blitz decks to equip four of your Lego​™ Minifigs with Medieval, Firearms, Lasers, or Magical Equipment. ​We provide a unique system made to open up into any and all of your favorite genres and you provide the rest. Bring your own characters, victory conditions, and game style.

Medieval brings sharp weapons and pointy objects to your army.

Gameplay:
This Mini Blitz Deck can equip four units with a total of 8 BV (Battle Value). Assign a Form/Class card to a Minifig, which defines the basic rules for a single unit, then assign Equipment cards; each assigned card provides special rules but reduces the unit's Top Speed.

The scenario sets, or players agree, a Round BV. During your round, pay a unit's BV to activate it. When your Round BV is exhausted, play passes to the next player. During a unit's turn, it can Play an equipped card, Attack, or Move. Attacks are resolved by rolling 1d6 and checking the Attack Table on the equipment card, plus any special rules. Range and movement is measured in studs.
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Simulation

name: Ich will dein Führer sein
description:
Each player gets 17 figures: 12 soldiers, 3 officers, 1 general and 1 leader.

At the start of the game the leader is placed on the half globe and the general on space e or f. The 3 officers are placed on the 3 spaces beside the general. The soldiers go on the 12 spaces in front of the officers and general.

The goal of the game 1 to take the opponents leader or to occupy the opponents home space (half globe) or the two general-spaces (e and f).

The leader and the general move 1 space in any direction. The officers move 1 space diagonal in any direction while the soldiers may move only 1 space diagonal forward. Soldiers or officers that get on an opponent general- or officer-space may get promoted.

All figures may take opponent figures only on diagonal adjacent spaces and may take more than 1 opponent if they are standing in a straight line behind the 1st figure.

In a second version of the game a die is used to determinate the number of spaces a figure may move. In this game movement is only diagonal.
mechanics: Catch the Leader, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Wordl3s
description:
Wordl3s is a word deduction game for two players. Guess the secret three-letter word of your opponent within 12 attempts using a combined process of deduction and elimination.
On each turn, a player will:
1. Optionally flip a new word card
2. Pick a word to use for a question
3. Write it down on their form
4. Ask the opponent a question
5. Record the answer.

The game ends when both players have guessed each others’ words. A player cannot exceed 12 attempts at filling out their form, in which case gets no score.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Word Game

name: Toons and Towers
description:
Toons And Towers is a card game that is loosely connected to a web comic series. The game involves two players who compete to try to drop their opponent's points to 0 before the end of the agreed time limit. Both players start a game with 80,000 points. Each player will have a deck of 50 cards consisting of cartoon, upgrade, and counter cards.

Both players start the game by drawing five cards from the top of their deck of cards. Each turn is broken into seven steps where players attack and defend aginst each other.

The game ends when one of two things are achieved; a player has been eliminated or the agreed time limit has been reached.

A player wins by successfully attacking his opponent's side of the field until they have reduced their opponent's points down to zero. This can also be achieved by having more remaining points than your opponent by the end of the agreed time limit.
categories: Card Game, Comic Book / Strip, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Elapsed Real Time Ending, Player Elimination

name: Onbashira:  Log Rider Festival
description:
The Onbashira Festival has been held every six years for 1,200 years when the shrine's buildings of Suwa Taisha are rebuilt at Suwa City, Nagano Prefecture, in the Chubu region of Japan. The climax of the festival consists of the Kiotoshi (people riding the gigantic logs as they slide down a steep slope to prove their bravery) In this game you'll build up a crew of Kiotoshi and train them to make sure you have the best odds on surviving the steep slope to prove your bravery as they ride the logs down. Discover ancient survival technics and craft necessary gear that will help you to succeed as the bravest log riding crew for the next six years.

The game is played in multiple phases.

Worker placement phase: On your turn, you'll take 3 actions found around the city, move on around the board to gather resources including recruiting brave new Kiotoshi.

During the Action phase, you'll construct and place your Kiotoshion the logs and push them down the hill to score points.

Scoring phase: Each player will score the necessary points they earned around the board for easy tracking.

The game ends after 5 rounds or the fist player to construct a new tree to symbolize the reunification of nature and the elements. The person who has scored the most points wins.
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Worker Placement, Different Worker Types

name: Pendulum Fighters
description:
This a TCG to takes a twist on the usual TCG formula and brings something new to the table and hopefully TCG enthusiast will enjoy. Pendulum Fighters is a dice rolling anime TCG where the goal is to get your opponent's character cards health down to 0,

this can be done by normal battling, or turn up the heat with amplifier cards to assist you in battle and help you catch your opponent off guard or if you are in a pinch, use finisher to jump right back into the game. Just note that using these cards may have a drawback when used that can affect you.

The goal of Pendulum Fighters is to give you the feeling of a heated battle of who is really stronger...As well as some lore into the world and a full story told within the cards themselves.

If you feel that this game has peaked your interest then check down in the "Links" to find out how you can get your hands on this game.

—description from the designer
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Dice, Fighting, Horror, Real-time
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Chaining, Cooperative Game, Critical Hits and Failures, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Interrupts, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Stat Check Resolution, Take That, Turn Order: Stat-Based

name: Dare or Dare
description:
The fast paced, dare based adult party game. See how far you’re willing to go to come out on top. You will be embarrassed, laughing at others, and if all goes right (or wrong), feeling very good.

Roll the tri die, and draw a card from the deck with the corresponding color. The choice is now yours: either perform the dare on the top half of the card, complete it, and collect the points; or decline, lose a life, and put the card face down.

Keep the contents of the bottom half to yourself, because any other player may pick it up and attempt it. Provided they succeed where you failed, they get to collect the points.

Ultimately collect twelve points and crown yourself as the dare champion!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Token Economy
description:
Token Economy is set in the world of modern finance, where you can buy tokens as a share of an object, which can or cannot be divided in real (soccer stadiums, clubs, oldtimers...). The currency you pay with and you can bet on, are crypto currencies, like the well known BitCoin.

Players move around the track in a Monopoly-style, having junctions in some places. The space where you move to, determines which share you may buy, or how much rent you have to pay. Some spaces cause events, or changes in stock prices. At the end, the player with the most valuable assets is the winner.

name: Hostile Environment: Special Forces
description:
Hostile Environment: Special Forces is a fast-paced tactical 28mm miniatures game that is designed to be played on a battle mat with a 1” grid. The game is based on the Hostile Environment world, but players may use whatever modern or futuristic miniatures they have from Vietnam, Cold War or Science Fiction eras.

Hostile Environment uses a die-pull initiative system to keep players on their toes. Better soldiers get greater odds of more activations, but lesser soldiers are allowed more numbers to keep fights balanced.

Each miniature represents a single unit ranging in skill from green to elite. There are over 15 different weapon types and 6+ armor types from modern weapons and armor to alt-future tech.

Most matches take about 90 minutes using at most two dozen miniatures.

H.E.: Special Forces can be played solo, using the Hostile Tactical AI card deck (sold separately).

2050, the world has entered total chaos. P68P, a poisonous pollen has killed over a billion people, while the toxic gnidia plant, once bred in labs, continues to spread like wildfire. Governments that once ruled humanity have fallen into darkness.

“The Great Wipe,” a hacker attack by the Red 76’ers in 2038 has virtually erased the internet. Now, only a few left have the knowledge to bring back the sciences that have been forgotten. Only the READ, a source of collective consciousness, allows mankind to share information. But, Paven the creator of “the language of God,” rules from the grave, spreading his mesmerism into weaker minds, leaving the zombies to his controlling thoughts.

Failure of silver, the nano blood that cured cancer and heart disease has left mankind grappling with age old viruses thought to be extinct. Scarmine Lab’s mercenaries formed a special force of Population Insurance Tactics (PIT) to find humans that can still create antibodies that have become dormant in most humans.

All that is left of the world is a Hostile Environment.

—description from the publisher
categories: Dice, Miniatures, Modern Warfare, Science Fiction, Vietnam War, Wargame
mechanics: Action Points, Chit-Pull System, Grid Movement, Movement Points

name: The Valley
description:
Deep in the hidden wilds of the New Zealand bush, an engineered wilderness is flourishing. After years of intensive, secret research, edible species from Aotearoa and all over the world finally flourish year-round in the Valley, a forager's paradise in a climate-controlled biodome.

You are a Cottager, leading your team of Gatherers to forage for harvest goods, learn your craft from local Artisans, and craft the best recipes to sell to your customers. Move around the modular hex tile Valley, choosing from actions to harvest, make recipes, visit Artisans, complete Goals, and get those sales. Choose recipes from a river of cards that include good and bad event cards - play the standard game or add the Spice cards for increased complexity - but take care, as every card drawn can precipitate Nightfall, the end of the day, where the board resets, the overnight growth cycle restocks the resource tiles, and all Gatherers return to the Cottage with their laden baskets.

The game ends when the Recipe cards run out and the final Night falls. After you have added your Goal points to your recipe card values, the player with the highest score is the winner.

The Valley is very flexible - with 2 to 6 players, and gameplay from 20 minutes to several hours, you can play a quick game by ending the game on the first or second Nightfall card, or play with up to 6 rounds, each ending in a Night. You can also control the complexity by adding in Spicy Recipes, Event cards, Goals, and by using your Cottager abilities.

The Valley is set in New Zealand, so it also features recipe ingredients and cultural terms which only apply in Aotearoa. While these are covered briefly in the Glossary, we encourage you to jump down that rabbithole and learn more about this beautiful country!
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Set Collection, Turn Order: Pass Order, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement

name: The Carniverse: Dark Eden
description:
Eden has gone dark, but your survival is just beginning. Dark Eden is the 1st major expansion for the Carniverse skirmish game. Within its pages you'll find additions to features that already exist in the game, as well as a host of completely new mechanics to keep you on your toes as you try to fend off the dinosaurs.

This 80+ page PDF is jammed packed with content to give your campaigns new life as you continue your survival in the new world!

—description from the publisher

name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Terraplanistas
description:
We don't believe in witches, but there are, there are.

Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about popular beliefs, conspiracy theories, superstitions and paranormal events.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: ¿Vivimos en el Mismo Mundo?
description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions designed for you who enjoy being told incredible curiosities, watch a documentary on Discovery and are shocked for weeks and store piles of useless information in your head... And you often wonder how can it be that that and I live in the same planet?
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Wits & Wagers: Las Vegas, Baby! – Expansión: Nocturna
description:
Exlusive Print & Play expansion for the Argentinian edition of Wits & Wagers: It's Vegas, Baby!, that can be obtained by messaging the publisher on Instagram (as stated in the base game rulebook).

It includes a cover card and 7 new question cards, where there were gathered questions about zombies, ghosts, nightmarish creatures and serial killers that have struck fear into the hearts of fans for decades. This expansion is our gift to those who cannot read these sentences without getting chills:
"Here's Johnnyyy!"
"Whatever you do... Don't fall asleep!"
"I see dead people"
"We all go a little crazy, sometimes"
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game, Print & Play, Trivia

name: Mid-Life Crisis: Helpline!
description:
Players are divided into counselors and a caller, and the caller changes every round.

As a counselor, race to to piece together advice from the words scattered in front of you in a humorous attempt to solve the caller's problem.

The caller picks their favorite response.

For 3-4 players, the first player to be awarded five cards wins. For more than five players, the first player to be awarded three cards wins.

name: Traff Park
description:
This is a game based on the similarly named Hungarian browser Flash game. It can be found at "traff.hu", but unfortunately it has not worked since Flash Player was discontinued in 2020.

This game, like the website and books published over the years, teaches children how to drive safely on the roads.

In this game, players must be the first to get their car home after going through each station in the four corners of the game board. They roll a dice in each round to determine how much they can advance on the board by following the traffic rules. The game is hampered by certain events, such as puddles or roadblocks.

The first player to get home to the garage after washing their car, charging their battery, inflating their tires and refueling their car wins the game.

name: KTA: Krack that auto!
description:
Steal the cars, escape then police chasing, crash and shoot your competition to earn big cash! In this game each player takes a role of car burglar in the city where no car is safe.

The game contains two packs of cards (cars and missions), tokens (police, pistol, speed and damage), dice and figures of thieves. Game is released under Creative Commons license and is available for download, print and play.

Each player start with three random secret missions. During each player's turn one of following action can be performed: scouting (exploring) cars, stealing them, arm with firearms, ride and/or crash, shoot and accomplish a mission.

Violent actions can trigger police chasing of different levels which has to be avoided at the start of the turn by dice rolling.

First player who manage to accomplish missions worth $21.000 wins the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Fighting, Humor, Print & Play, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Turn Order: Pass Order

name: Atlantic Records
description:
A roll-and-move race from Great Britain to the United States from the golden age of parlour board games: the early 20th century.

Players are assigned a starting port and a finish port by taking a mock 'ticket'; they then proceed across the board by rolling the six-sided dice and resolving any effects of special spaces they land upon.

The board offers multiple tracks from each port. Events spaces are noted in 2 letter Morse Code abbreviations.

The first player to reach their designated destination is declared the winner!

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: BattleTech: Shrapnel Magazine – Issue 8
description:
Shrapnel: The Official BattleTech Magazine delivers tales of tragedy and triumph amid the struggles of BattleMechs on the battlefields of the 31st century and beyond! A spurned Solaris gladiator enacts a unique brand of payback. A Federated Suns mission to take down the infamous “Lady Death” Trevaline runs afoul of pirate ingenuity. A ex-mercenary on Outreach must risk everything during the Fourth Succession War to protect those who cannot protect themselves. In this issue, you’ll venture into the jungles and avoid native predators while racing to recover lost Star League-era data; discover the truth lurking behind a seemingly unbeatable Word of Blake ’Mech; and fight to preserve a MechWarrior’s right to crack open a cold, frosty beverage after the battle is done. Then return to the shadows and danger of the Game World with the penultimate part of our Solaris VII serial.

Contains Rules for:

TRO Executioner B
Unit Digest - First Augustine Arquebusiers
Campaign - A Short Stop in Astrokazy
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Quilters
description:
In this tile laying game players are fighting over who can make the best quilt. Every round there will be a set number of tiles that players will draft, placing them on their own quilt. At the end of each round players will compare groupings of the different colors in the hope of getting stars that will give them points that they will need to win the game. However, be careful, as you must place your stars on top of squares that break will break up your groupings.

The game ends after a set number of rounds (4/3/4), and at that point players score points for their stars and for the shape of their quilt. The player with the most points will be crowned the victor. Quilting has never been this competitive!
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, End Game Bonuses, Open Drafting, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Wordy Laundry
description:
In this groovy tug-of-words game, players push and pull 1970s laundry items (letter cards) on clotheslines to form words and score points. Spell words on the line to earn instant points (Pegs), then organize laundry in your Laundry Basket for game-end bonuses. To win, score the most points by the time the game ends.

- Manage a Hand of Laundry (letter) cards - Each card is worth 1-4 Pegs (points), and has 1 of 6 funky patterns. Decide exactly when to hang each item, and when to collect it. Watch out for neighbors (and windy weather), which may snatch up desirable cards before you can.

- Use Action Points to hang, push, pull, remove, and collect cards.

- Spell Words by arranging letters on the Clothesline.

- Collect Funky Patterns in your Laundry Basket to score game-end bonuses. Collect 4 of the same patterns or 4 different patterns in each column to maximize your points.

Race to fill your Laundry Basket and trigger the end of the game. Then add together your in-game points and game-end bonuses. The player with the most points wins.
