mechanics: Action Points, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Spelling

name: Village of Legends: Adhara
description:
This new expansion is easy to learn and features new adventures, heroes, cards, and tokens.

As well as a lot of new material that can be used in the classic competitive version, with this new box you will have also the opportunity to create a party and set out to discover new mysteries and face incredible beasts in the cooperative mode.

The beautifully illustrated Adventure Book with unique illustrations by Lorenzo Lupi is also included in this expansion box.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Legacy Game, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Everlight: The Collectible Card Game
description:
Everlight the Card Game is a living card game that is played on a grid and adds elements of tactical warfare that a conventional tabletop wargame may provide

Build a deck of 4 Characters; Players may choose a Champion and their three companions all with their unique abilities to head in to battle.

The game is played on a grid of 5x5 and players activate turns trying to outmaneuver and out-play their opponents on the field and by playing knowledge cards from their hand to gain advantages.

Defeat your opponent's Characters and gain victory points to win the game!
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting

name: Sagacity
description:
Sagacity is an abstract strategy game where players will compete to core the agreed upon amount of points by connecting a line of four of their own pieces. The twist comes from the game's four tiered board.

Each tier has a clear plastic 5x5 grid. A line of four pieces can connect on a single level or by using all four of levels of the board either vertically, horizontally or diagonally. Each line of four pieces will score a single point. If a player is able to complete two lines of four pieces in a single turn they will score 3 points, and if a player is able to complete three lines of four pieces is a single turn they will automatically win the game.

Similar to Connect Four, players will take turns adding a single piece to any unoccupied space on any of the four tiers. When all pieces have been placed if neither player has won, the pieces are removed and play continues.

name: Wig Masters micro
description:
Play as the fanciest wig merchants in 18th century France. Buy wigs, sell wigs, and manipulate the ever changing wig market to make the most money and win.
Each turn has 4 phases
Phase 1: players place wigs on the various areas of their
player card to enable actions during subsequent phases.
Phase 2: players can adjust market demand or prices (if they
enabled this ability).
Phase 3: players may sell their wigs to the market for money.
Phase 4: Players may take wig(s) from supply if they enabled
this ability.
This game uses coins as pieces. Not included.
This game is completely different from the original Wig Masters game that is is based on. This game has no element of luck and is decided by pure skill and strategy but is also very light and quick. Version A includes 8 characters, each with a unique special ability. Version B includes 6 characters and the 4 player market board. Combine both versions to play with up to 4 players.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: First Strike
description:
A fast and fun game of missile warfare for two players. Victory depends on both skill and luck.

Use your small missiles to knock out an incoming attack while your larger missiles go after your opponent's command post. Or hit with consecutive massive waves of both missiles and trust your luck!

Develop new tactics with each game you play and become invincible!

On your turn roll the dice and move your various missiles while keeping your command post protected. Destroy your opponent's missiles when yours strike theirs, and win by destroying your opponent's command post!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Zone of Control

name: Stowe
description:
Stowe evolves the game of Chess to a new level by allowing a player's pieces to stack on top of each other through any legal Chess move. As stacks grow, each one may move like the normal movement of the top piece or may use a secondary movement ability determined by the height of the stack. Each piece has a number on it that corresponds to the height stack needed to use its movement ability. Stacked pieces can unstack, but only one at a time and can only move like the piece unstacking.

Turn Overview: On a players turn, they may move any one of their 16 pieces according to traditional Chess piece movements. A player may use any of these movements to stack one or more pieces on top of another. If a stack of pieces already exists, a player may unstack the top piece according to it's Chess movement ability. Only one piece can unstack at a time. After a player makes one move, play proceeds to the next player.

Like traditional Chess the game ends when one player Wins by capturing their opponent's King, or results in a Stalemate if no players posses the ability to capture their opponents King.

Other variants of play include:
Minimizing the board to 3 or 5 lanes, and following the recommended setup.
Using the Stowe Backgammon Dice to have players moves be determined by rolling a dice.
In Wild West Chess players simply stack on top of opponents when capturing pieces. If de-stacked opponents gain back control of their piece(s).

name: Tile Bridge
description:
A board game very much based on Bridge, the card game with 4 players, two per side but instead of cards there are 52 tiles, a rack for each player and a felt play mat.
The tiles are shuffled and randomly dealt face down, 13 to each player.
Bidding takes place as per Bridge and the hand opposite the final declarer is revealed.

Possession of a pencil/pen and a bridge score pad is advised as they are not included in the box.

name: The SETTAI ~ヘッポコ専務を勝たせろ~
description:
The SETTAI ~ヘッポコ専務を勝たせろ~ is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a four-player only cooperative version of Hearts, themed around corporate culture, and trying to keep your boss looking good.

Each round a different player is the Executive Director, and they have four cards in front of them, face-down, which will guide their algorithmic play. During the round, these cards are eventually revealed.

The players may not communicate, but their goal is to have the Executive Director perform the best each round; the scores of the employees are not recorded.

name: Capture the Flag
description:
Capture your enemy's flag, while also managing to protect yours and win the game.
Use your move points to move your kids around on the map. Use your kids' different abilities to surprise the other player.

Pick the best spots and hit the enemy kids with water balloons enough times that they can't continue the fight.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Player Elimination

name: BattleTech: Battleforce Quick Start Rules
description: BattleForce is the BattleTech game of lightning-fast combat. These rules ramp up standard-style game play to a fast-playing system that retains the feel of BattleTech. While the full rules are contained in Strategic Operations, these quick-start rules contain everything needed to play a BattleForce game, including maps and counters.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Hidden Movement, Multiple Maps, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Turn Order: Random, Variable Player Powers, Variable Set-up

name: Zero Waste Chef Cardgame
description:
With this card game, Food Circle aims to bring the value back to food, and for that reason, if you waste food in the game, you lose points.

Each player represents a food organisation, and needs to create meals out of the ingredients they receive. They can also freeze, dehydrate or pickle some ingredients, to save them to use in another moment in the game. For meals they get points.

Each player starts with 1 preservation card, receives ingredient cards on their turn, and can use any recipe. The recipes are open in the middle of the table for everyone to see what they can make.
As chefs, your goal is to collect and trade ingredients to make as many meals with as little food waste as possible. Remember to be strategic: ingredients without a recipe will spoil, and you’ll lose points!

The winner is the player with most points and is declared to be the Zero Waste Chef!

name: Baby Shower: The Card Game
description: You have just had your baby shower and now the gifts are everywhere. Collect matching cards to organize your new baby swag, but there is so much that gets in the way! Roll the dice to get through going to the bathroom, needing a snack, etc...Who can organize their gifts the fastest?

name: Imminent Respawn
description:
Transports crystals along a short path to score them or frag players to score crystals and spaceships. Players will call upon specialized spaceships which immediately take effect but place limitations on the player too. Nothing lasts forever as a respawn is always imminent!

Battle back and forth dealing out fatal blows, reflect attacks or even directly score from another player's cargo.

Cloak, warp and upgrade ships whilst strategically decoding the opposition's next move.

Players play crystals and spaceships on their turn or alternatively move with the option to play additional cards to boost forward, gain a core action or purchase a community crystal.

The first to score 15 points worth of crystals and/or spaceships wins!
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Science Fiction, Transportation

name: Grün heißt gegen, rot bleibt stehen!
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space "Start". The first to reach space 94 "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces cards are drawn which contain traffic situations that hinder or benefit the players.

If a player gets on a space with a traffic sign, he has to explain the sign to advance 1 space. If he can't do this, he has to go 2 spaces back.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Der Kampf um den Himalaja
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 70 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinder-Kalender 1938.
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Zoologisches Kettenspiel
description:
The 18 cards are dealt equally among the players. The player who got the "Aal" places the card on the table. Now the player with an animal beginning with a "L" places his card behind the "Aal" card and so on, building a chain of cards. If a player has to place 2 cards after another, he has to take the first card in the chain. If a player has to place 3 cards he has to take 2 cards from the front of the chain.

The first player to get rid of all his cards wins the game.

Published in Auerbachs Deutscher Kinder-Kalender 1919. The cards had to be cut out from the paper sheet and glued on cardboard. Gifted children were encouraged to color the cards.
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Aktion Futterraufe
description:
Each player gets 14 numbered tokens and places then on the corresponding spaces on his half of the game board. Movement is one space in any direction. The players move to get their tokens on the corresponding spaces on the opposite side of the board (mangers).

Opposite tokens may be taken by jumping over them to an empty space. Tokens that are already on their destination manger may not be jumped over.

At the end of the game the numbers of all tokens on their mangers are added and the player with the highest result wins the game.

—user summary

name: Kadoova Dash
description:
The goal of the game is simple, roll your way to 10,000 points first, and stay there ahead of the other players. The heart of the game however is really all about using your cards to effectively get in the other player's way and stop them from getting there before you or steal their points if they get to 10,000 first.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Sudden Death Ending, Variable Player Powers

name: Cults & Covens: Vampire
description:
A game of vampire coven building and herd management. Players take on the roles of different vampires, each with its own unique abilities, and try to use the villagers to create the most powerful coven. Players must take villager cards from the play area into their herds to feed upon and convert the best members of their herds into vampire minions to join their quest for power and prestige. Players must balance their need to feed with their need to produce powerful vampires from the right families to win.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Vampire is one of the three games included in Cults & Covens.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: Cults & Covens: Werecats
description:
Werecats are lycanthropes,(like a werewolf but a cat instead.)
Players take on the roles of different werecats, each with its own unique abilities, and try to use the 50 villager cards to create the most powerful team of werecats. Villagers can be eaten to give strength to your werecats, or turned into werecat minions. Players must balance their need to feed with their need to produce powerful werecats from the right families to win.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Werecats is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.
mechanics: Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Player Powers

name: トリック&ゴール (Trick & Goal)
description:
Trick & Goal is one of the finalists for the 2020 Trick Taking Party Awards. It is a must-follow, fixed trump, one round, trick-taking game where players will earn 2 points for each trick they take and 1 point for each goal they complete.

At the start of the game, 10 goals are revealed from a larger pool of goals. The goals are things such as "play a 4", "lead with a club", or "lose a trick with a K". Some goals may be achieved immediately, and others require waiting until a trick is finished. Once a goal is achieved, it is taken and immediately replaced.

The player with the most points after one hand is the winner.

name: Manöverspiel Pionierstafette "Immer bereit"
description:
The players take turns to roll and move one of their two meeples (couriers). They start at a snowman at the lower edge of the game board. The first to reach the flagged space at the "STAB" igloo wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

There are obstacles placed on the black spots at the beginning of the game. The obstacles may only be passed, if a courier gets on the same space as the obstacles. Then he may place the obstacles on any other space he chooses.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Static Capture, Take That

name: Mit Kundi gesund und munter durch den Tag
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space "Ziel" wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Wir reisen durch Rheinland-Pfalz
description:
Game 1 (4 players)
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 in Mainz. The first to reach space 70 back in Mainz wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

Game 2 (3 players)
Each player gets 15 produce tokens. The players take turns rolling 3 dice. The results of the dice are added and a corresponding produce token is placed on the city of the same number. If a player isn't able to place a token the result of his next roll is added to the current one. The first player to get rid of all his tokens wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Würfelspiel
description:
The players roll the special die to determine the color of their starting and destination spaces. The players then take turns to roll and move. On some spaces the players have to answer questions about traffic rules and other safety issues.

Beside the colors to determine the starting and destination spaces, the die has the following faces:

go 1 space forward (yellow)
go 2 spaces forward (blue)
go 1 space backward (red)
go 5 spaces forward (green)
miss a turn (yellow)
roll again (red)


The first player to reach his destination space wins the game.

The game was published in the October 1971 issue of the GDR magazine "Die ABC-Zeitung".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Dan Dare Rocket Ball
description:
Dan Dare Rocket Ball is a simple game based on the British Science Fiction Comic book hero of the 1950's.

Game play uses small coloured wooden balls, one for each player and players take turns tossing the balls onto a game board divided into small box like compartments. Each compartment has a picture of a planet or space themed object and a score. The player obtains a score by their ball falling into the box.

the winner is the first player accumulating a total score of 100 points.

—user summary

name: Dan Dare Mountains of Mars Expedition
description:
Dan Dare Mountains of Mars Expedition is a simple roll and move race game based on the British Science fiction Comic hero from the 1950's.

The playing board is 3 dimensional square based pyramid, made from 4 Triangular sections. Players each have a small coloured peg like playing piece that is inserted into holes in the playing board. Players move by the roll of a dice. The holes create a path up each mountain side, from the mountain base to its apex.

First player to ascend the mountain and reach the top is the winner.

—user summary
categories: Children's Game, Science Fiction, Space Exploration

name: Brainbox: Senior Moments
description:
From the box: "Why should children have all the fun? This Brainbox will help improve observation, memory and conversation skills and is a fabulous trip down memory lane."

This is a Game of the Brainbox series, focused on senior people (in fact, the game displays age as 55+)

It contains 55 Cards, 1 rules card, 1 sand timer and a die.

name: Ein Flug von München nach Venedig
description:
The players draw lots to determine which vehicle they use for their journey. The starting point is Munich. The players take turns to spin and move. The spinner shows separate results for each vehicle. On some spins the slower vehicles may let themselfes be taken along by a faster vehicle.
If a slower vehicle meets a faster vehicle along the way, it may make an extra move using the actual speed of the faster vehicle. On some spaces events hinder the players.

The first player to reach Venice wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the book "Wie Hans von München nach Venedig flog" and "Der Blaue Kinderkalender 1923".

—user summary

name: The Original Skaterhappy Card Game
description:
Get ready for a real skate session, your physical skills will not be needed.
The practice of Skateboarding requires two parts, the physical and the mental, The Skaterhappy Game Card will challenge your ability to conceive new tricks, which you will be tempted to try.
The objective of the Game is to combine real Skateboarding basic tricks to achieve the most extreme trick among your friends. The trick with the highest score wins the game.

name: Disney's 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea Electric Quiz Game
description:
A typical 1950's electic matching quiz game. Comes with 6 cards printed on both sides, each containing 12 illustrations and 12 descriptions. There are 5 additional Kiddie Quiz cards included in this set.

Players select a quiz board to use and answer trivia questions. Right answers are indicated by the quiz board lights.

To play, hold one selector tip in your left hand and place it on a contact station, or question. With the card above, we will select ‘Life Boat’ in the upper left corner. Then, holding the other selector tip in your right hand, place it on another contact station, or answer.

In this case, it would be the metal disk just below ‘Anchor’ on the upper side of the Nautilus, between the Vertical Fin and the Rudder & Propeller. When you have made this final contact, the circuit is completed and the red light will glow to indicate a correct answer. If you were to place the selector tip in your right hand on the wrong metal disc, say in the lower left corner by the Anchor, nothing would happen, and you would have given a wrong answer. Play would then pass to the next player.
categories: Children's Game, Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia

name: Das neue geographische Würfelspiel
description:
The Players take turns rolling 3 letter-dice. Now the players have to find a city or river with one of the 3 letters shown. The first to do so with each letter get to stick one of his pins to the map.

The first player to get rid of all his pins (8 to 12) wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to "Meidingers Kinderkalender 1927".

—user summary

name: Die Walfisch-Jagd
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 51 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players or the players gain or lose game coins.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Tempo! Das neue Märchenspiel
description:
The players take turns rolling an moving. They start at space 1 and have to get to space 100 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: Verlag von Auerbachs Deutschem Kinder Kalender

name: Conquest of Indarium
description:
Teleported to a new world, the Players find mounts and gain the ability to ride them, causing them to become Riders. Riders move their Mount Pieces space to space on tiles based on the roll of a d4, discovering more of the world as they do by setting new tiles when they reach the end of a tile. Riders take different actions depending on the type of space that is landed on when they run out of movement. These actions cause you to gain items, equipment or spells, meet interesting characters, participate in wacky events, or fight Akuwu which are the monsters of the land in order to either Liberate towns or remove them from the road. When fighting Akuwu, Riders use their equipped equipment and miscellaneous items and spells to attempt to have more Kapow than the Akuwu they are fighting, rolling dice when necessary to raise Kapow by the roll, in order to defeat them and gain rewards that add to the Riders worth. Riders have 16 turns to gain the most worth before the final Boss appears, whether it be in the form of pure Gilver obtained throughout the game or assets such as items, equipment, spells and Liberated Towns that are automatically sold at the end of the game. The Riders must defeat the boss, either together or on their own to reap the rewards or else face the consequences of failure.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Finale Ending, Map Addition, Modular Board, Point to Point Movement, Tile Placement

name: Im Kampf mit dem Auto
description:
The players represent either an automobile (black track), a bicyclist (red track) or a pedestrian (blue track) ant take turns to roll and move. The first player to reach space 50 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Dan Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus
description:
Dare Big Game Hunt on Venus is a target game based on the Science fiction Comic book hero Dan Dare.

The target board features a base that is standing on wooden stands. Weird and wonderful space creatures with prehistoric and reptilian features sit atop of the base.

Players win the game by knocking down the space creatures using a primitive spring loaded gun that fires a wooden bead.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction

name: コンクエスター (ConqueStar)
description:
コンクエスター (ConqueStar) is a science fiction game from Japan. The game was published in a wide cylinder.

Players each run a well-known family business throughout the galaxy. However, they are also notorious planetary collectors behind the scenes.

In this newly discovered galaxy of unique stars, players compete to see who can best collect stars!

Through the means of trades and invasion, add stars to your valuable planetary collection!

あなたたちは銀河に名の知れ渡る宇宙実業家一族です。
しかし！なんとその裏の顔は、悪名高い惑星コレクターでもあるのです。
このたび発見されたユニークな星の集まる銀河で、誰が一番うまく星をコレクシ
ョンできるか競争することにしました！
交易と侵略を駆使してより貴重な惑星コレクションを増やしましょう！
user summary

name: Assumption
description:
Assumption is a game from Japan.

On the island of Mariehamn, which is surrounded on all sides by great powers across the sea, 3 tribes (Red/Blue/Yellow) vie for supremacy. Players, each as the chancellor of a major power, manipulate informers and intervene in conflicts for their country's profits.

海を挟んだ四方を大国に囲まれたマリエハム島では、赤/青/黄の3つの民族が島の覇権を争っていた。プレイヤーは大国の宰相となり、内通者を操り、紛争に介入し、自国の利益の増大を目指す。
user summary

name: Orion's Gate
description: Rules for giant space ship or naval battles with lots of customization. Each round the ships can move, cruise, ram and shoot depending on what type of ship it is. The different ship types is scouts, fighters, destroyers and battleships. The game ends after four rounds and the player that controls most objective markers wins.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Nautical, Print & Play, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Modular Board, Player Elimination

name: Katz und Maus
description: The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and must reach space 60 to win the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Events, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Luft-Rennen
description: Each player gets a special air vehicle on a separate track. The slower vehicles get a start bonus. The players take turns to roll and move. The first player to arrive on space 50 on his track wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Borstel und die Kräuterkobolde
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. The first to reach space 37 wins the game. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players.

The game was published as a supplement in the book of the same name.
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Doubloon Lagoon
description:
Ahoy privateer! A hurricane the likes of which ye’ve never seen is bearing down on Doubloon Lagoon, the site of the lost wreck of the treasure-teeming megaship, The Dorado. Rumors have it that the storm is shaking the booty free of the clutches of the reefs, and rife for the taking. However, ye not be the only pirates in these parts, and the hurricane winds are filling sails, me hearty. So get all hands on deck and beat those bilge rats to the treasure, or send them to the briney deep.

This is a grid-based, pirate-themed, battle royale sailing game that uses mechanics such as wind direction, dice battling, and movement economy to race and battle your friends to be the last ship afloat with the most treasure aboard when the storm hits. You command 3 ships; a slow and heavily armored/gunned Galleon, a balanced Brigantine, and a weak yet fast Sloop. Each of these ships have different attributes in regards to bonuses they receive in movement, cannon power, and defenses.

Rather than chess-style movement, each turn the wind will (or may not) change direction, effecting all of the ships ability to sail on certain headings. Learn the actual points of sail used by sailers to maximize your movement and chart the best course to play the wind and best your opponents.

Each turn, a randomly generated chest of treasure will surface somewhere in the play area, creating an ever shifting goal for you while you fend off other players and dodge cannon fire. Win the game by being the last one afloat with most treasure when the turn-based timer runs out and the hurricane hits. Randomly generated wind, treasure locations, unnavigable-island tiles, and up to 8 players make for different play styles and outcomes with every session.
mechanics: Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Moving Multiple Units, Player Elimination, Square Grid

name: One-Stop Grocery Shop
description:
This polyomino tile-laying, push your luck game is a two dimensional retelling of the classic grocery store dilemma- "Should I carry more bags with fewer items inside, or can I just pile it all in one bag and carry it all at once?"

Each player will start with a gridded card of their standard grocery bag, with a communal field of polyomino foods between them, separated into departments by color. On their turn, they will roll a die dictating which department they must draw from and place within the confines of their bag. You may exceed out of the "top" of your bag, but when you do so you risk dropping items or worse, the dreaded "bag rip."

At their discretion, players may draw another bag card from a pile (aka bags just in your car) to create more space to carry more items into the house. These bags have different dimensions - such as a convenience store bag, wine shop bag, clothing store bags, recycled totes, and more.

Scoring is resolved at the end of the game by totaling the scores indicated on each of the food items that you successfully brought to the house, dividing by the number of bags you used, and subtracting the scores of any of the food items that were dropped or suffered a bag rip.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Coverage, Market, Push Your Luck, Tile Placement

name: Lasso
description:
A deceptively simple tile placement and enclosure game, Lasso pits two players against each other to rotate, flip, and exchange hexagonal tiles to be the first player to create a full contiguous loop around the center cow tile.

There are at least one of the two patterned ropes on every tile in play, striped and solid. There are special tiles with two of one pattern, or a "wild" rope that can be used by either player. On your turn, you may do one of the following: A) rotate a tile in its current position B) exchange two tiles in the play area without changing their orientation or C) exchanging a tile in the play area with the single tile you have in your hand. You may not take an action to simply reverse the other player's previous turn.

Weigh the odds of every tile you place and keep track of all of your possible lassos while looking out for your opponent's lasso. Be the first to round up that cattle before the other wrangler! Giddy up!
mechanics: Enclosure, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Pieces as Map, Tile Placement

name: Ridley's Games Room: Pub Quiz
description:
Points are scored by answering quiz questions correctly. To win the trophy you need to be in the team with more points at the end of the game.
Each team should take a pencil, a chance chip and a joker chip.
There are 200 Quiz question cards (1000 questions in total) divided in ten categories.
For a quick game select 10 question cards, one for category.
For a full-length fame select 20 question cards, two for category.
The Question Master reads questions and each team write their answers on their answer sheets.
Additionally once per game, per team a joker chip or a chance chip can be played (not in the same round).
With joker chip: each correct answer of that team in this round counts double, but each wrong answer counts a -1 point.
Chance chip: When a question is read, a team can pass for it and get one point without answering, by spending the chance chip instead.
The team with more points at the end wins.

name: Wer sagt zuerst "Hundert"?
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. For their next move the players perform the mathematical operation printed on the space they are standing on with the result of the die roll to determine to which space they have to move. The first player to reach space 100 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the children's book "Die Perle der grünen Nixe"
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Der sichere Weg
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On the roll of a 6 they start at the Kindergarten, School, Shopping Mall or House Nr. 12 and have to reach the location in the opposite corner of the game map, while minding the traffic rules.

The players have to stop on the red and yellow spaces. To move from a yellow space the player needs to roll an even number, to move from a red space a 6 is needed.

If the player wants to use the tram, he has to wait on the blue spaces till he rolls an odd number. Additionally he loses 3 turns while riding the tram. On the fourth turn he arrives at his destination stop and continues on foot.

The first player to reach his destination location wins the game.

The game was published as a cardboard assembly kit.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Play the Ball Australian Football
description:
Play the Ball is based on the popular sport of Australian Rules Football. The game has two opposing teams that move a disc (the ball) up and down a numbered path on a rectangular board using a teetotum.

A player may land on a favorable spot such as "Mark" or "Play On" and get another spin. The player may also land on a penalty spot and turn the ball over to the opposing team. The opposing team then moves the ball to the opposite position and has a spin.

Teams score points by advancing the ball along their side until they reach spot 17 or 21 and receive 6 points (a goal) or 16 or 20 for one point.

Play time is agreed by players at the beginning of the game and the team with the highest tallied score at the end of time is the winner
publishers: The Valentine Publishing Co. Pty. Ltd.

name: Das Dan Cooper-Weltraumspiel
description:
Each player chooses one of four planets for his base. They get a spaceship and 7 conquest marker. The players take turns spinning the spinner and moving the spaceships accordingly. On unoccupied planets conquest markers are placed.

On planets marked with a red number, the players have to draw an action card and follow the instructions printed thereon.

If the spinner shows a robot, the player may place a robot on an unconquered planet, which now is reserved for later conquest.

If the spinner shows a monster, the player may conquer an already conquered planet for himself.

The game ends when all planets are conquered or an agreed on time limit has passed. The players add the numbers on their conquered planets and the player with the highest result wins the game.

The game was published in the comic magazines "Zack" Nr. 21 and 22 (1980).
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Science Fiction, Space Exploration
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ツクローマ (Tsukuroma)
description:
ツクローマ (Tsukuroma) is a card game from Japan. Players are trying to build the highest rank of three cards using only the Roman numerals I, V and X. But each card they discard has an effect which is applied at discard.

The game has only 16 cards; 8 I Cards, 5 V and 3 X cards. The deck is shuffled, payers are dealt three hand cards and the remainder go as a draw pile. On a player's turn, they draw one card and either place one card in front of themselves or discard one card. each card has a special effect, and the one they discard is applied immediately.

The game ends when the deck is exhausted. the player who built the highest combo, from III to XXX, is the winner.
user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: BattleTech: Spotlight on Manyfold Paths
description:
Few Com Guard commands claim a more storied history than the Manyfold Paths. History remembers them fighting the Jade Falcons to great effect on Tukayyid and elsewhere. They also took the fight to the Word of Blake in the Chaos March. Later, they fought in the Great Refusal before the formation met its final end on Terra during Case White. Today the Manyfold Paths legacy continues in both spirit and will in the White Lions mercenary company, commanded by Seth Nicholson, a direct descendant of one of Manyfold Paths’ commanders. The White Lions made a name for themselves fighting Malvina Hazen’s Jade Falcons.

Spotlight On: Manyfold Paths includes a Unit History, Personalities, Personnel Rosters, Mission Tracks, and data for use with all scales of BattleTech play.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。 ミニ拡張セット ─トニカクカワイイ─ (Instant Propose: Tonikaku Kawaii)
description:
たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。 ミニ拡張セット ─トニカクカワイイ─ (Instant Propose: Tonikaku Kawaii) is an expansion pack for the game Instant Propose (たった今考えたプロポーズの言葉を君に捧ぐよ。). It adds 24 new cards to the base game. The pack is themed on a popular romantic manga called Fly Me To The Moon.
user summary
publishers: ClaGla (クラグラ), Crimage, 小学館 (Shogakukan)

name: Nur der Tod träumt nicht
description:
You and three friends slip into the roles of the four characters for one evening, solve the tricky puzzles together, find the culprit among yourselves, solve the murder and spend an exciting and fun evening with "Nur der Tod träumt nicht" ("Only Death Doesn't Dream").

Background
Drenched in sweat, you wake up, having been rudely awakened. You are a participant of an experiment about dreams with Prof. Dromen. Last night you went to bed under his care in the sleep laboratory together with other test persons. That same night, Prof. Dromen was murdered in the diagnostic room. Did someone have a score to settle with him? Does the murder have something to do with the experiment? Or is it all just a bad dream? Uncover the secrets of the other players and find the murderer.

—description from the publisher

name: Satchel Quest
description:
Satchel Quest is a rogue-like bag-building puzzle game where players take on the role of dungeon-crawling adventurers, trying to make it the furthest into the dungeon to claim the most valor! Players will build a satchel of weapons, spells, items, traps, monsters, and loot - creating synergistic combinations in order to be victorious! Players also gain power-ups that let them manipulate their bags and the dungeon, and mitigate the luck-of-the-draw!

—description from the publisher

name: ダイエットリテ (Dietrick-taking)
description:
ダイエットリテ (Dietrick-taking) is a trick-taking game from Japan.

Your fat tummy, upper arms, and thighs have continued to advocate for a diet.
And finally, you decided to listen to their voice (that's so great).
The player who finds the balance between diet and exercise and has the most successful diet will be the winner.

Trick-taking with a card with numbers 1-9 and 4 suits, the winner of trick raises 2 types of the gauges. The lowest player gives each player a hand of cards and replenishes his or her hand from the deck.

The player with the smallest difference between the numbers on the two gauges wins.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Ferret Games Factory (フェレットゲームズファクトリー)

name: Cults & Covens: Cults
description:
In this Cults & Covens game. Players take on the roles of Lovecraftian gods competing to grow the most influential cult. Villager cards from the play area can be taken as priests that can take actions and give their god influence over their families or cultists who can be drained for strength. Players must balance their need for initiative with their need for power and their need for influence over the 5 noble families.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens: Cults is one of three games included in Cults & Covens.

name: Auf Vorposten
description:
Auf Vorposten ("On the Outpost") is typical roll and move game about WWI. The first player, who cross the route with 60 stops first - wins the game.
There are two separate routes (Germans vs. French) with equal stops but with different pictures and stories about actual war in different side.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Cults & Covens
description:
Cults & Covens includes 3 completely different games that are played with the same set of victim cards.

The victim deck contains 50 delicious victims from 5 powerful aristocratic families (10 each).

In each of these games, players play as monsters who are either eating these villagers or turning them into cultists, or vampire minions, or werecats, or drinking their blood. Players can play as vampires, werecats, or Lovecraftian gods and their associated cults. The 3 games play in the same environment and are fully compatible, allowing players to play vampires against gods, gods against cats, etc.

—description from the publisher

Cults & Covens is a boxed set, containing three games: Cults, Vampire, and Werecats.

name: Beast Clans
description:
Beast Clans is a collectible trading card battle game, set in a post-apocalyptic world ruled by beasts.

Humans have vanished from Earth without a trace leaving only the animals to take their place. Over many years, they evolved becoming creatures able to fight. They created their own world of eight kingdoms: Ocean, Marsh, Jungle, Desert, Mountain, Savannah, Arctic, Outback and the Rebels.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Collectible Components, Fighting

name: Reel 'Em In
description:
In Reel 'Em In, one player takes on the role of a fisherman, and two or more players take on the role of fish. Fish players compete to get the most points, while the fisherman tries to catch one of the fish to steal their points.

While fish gain points by snatching up food cards, the fisherman steals points from the fish. Fish Players take turns selecting Fruit cards, which give them points!
Hidden among the food cards is a hook placed by the Fisherman, and when a fish picks it up the Fish and Fisher compete! Each shouts their Powerphrase, and the first to finish their word wins.
This results in either the Fisherman stealing all of the fish's points, or the fish swimming away. The fisherman benefits more when the fish has lots of points, so must place their hook down strategically.

The game ends when there are no more fruit cards left in the deck. The player with the most points wins!
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Push Your Luck, Real-Time

name: Yea o Nay
description:
Yea o Nay is a simple but very competitive game.

90 cards divided into 5 categories of math questions/ IQ statements/ patterns observations/ quantities and colours.
Each card features a simple conundrum and each player have to be the first to guess/ estimate/ work out or remember if the card on the table is true or not ie yea o Nay.
If the answer is yea – be the first to put down a green card and a red card if the answer is Nay.
Now with a new card on the table, the process repeats and so on.

Whoever is the first to get rid of all his cards is the winner.

name: 妖精の施し (Fairy's Alms)
description:
妖精の施し (Fairy's Alms) (フェアリーズアームス) is a co-operative game from Japan. Players are working together to get the two characters Rū (ルー) and Kū (クー) (a cat-girl and a rabbit-girl). The two friends are 'dream world dwellers', and the aim is to make all their dreams come true together with them.

Each player gets a character to help the friends, and some numbered cards they keep secret. The player lays their cards face-down in front of them, from lowest to highest, with the negative numbers to the left, and the positive to the right of their character. In tis way, players give an idea to each other what cards they might hold.

The dream world is a set of Dream cards laid out face-down in the middle of the table. The cards are staggered from one to four and back to one. The players must guide the two friends Rū and Kū on a path through these dreams, but they only win if they can complete all seven steps.

Each time a Dream card is turned up, the players decide which number card they will contribute. They have to combine their cards to add exactly to the one of the numbers on the Dream card. So if the Dream card has a number 1, players can use a +5, -3, -4 and +3 to get a total of 1. Players can discuss what they might offer, but not the exact values of their cards.

If the players fail to satisfy one Dream card, the game is lost.
user summary
publishers: RaqesQue (ラクエスク), あそぼうや (Asobouya)

name: fairy light
description:
fairy light (フェアリーライト) is a two player card game from Japan. Players build up a 5x5 grid of cards and try score the most hearts from the cat fairy コットン (Cotton).

Each player is the Sun or the Moon, and they shine down on the forest where Cotton lives. The Sun brings warmth and growth to the forest. The Moon brings safety and guidance at night to the forest creatures. Which does Cotton love more?

The players have a small deck of cards with either Sun or Moons showing, including two double symbol cards. They also shuffle in 4 cards each, showing Cotton walking through the forest. The players draw three face-up cards from the deck, and a neutral Cotton card is placed to start the grid.

Players take turns adding a card to the grid and drawing a fresh card. The cards can only go adjacent to existing cards, not diagonal, and the grid cannot be larger than 5 cards in either direction.

The Cotton cards have arrows pointing in different directions (up/down, left/right, diagonally). The goal is to get the majority of Sun or Moon symbols along the lines that Cotton points to. Each player's Cotton cards also include their opponent's symbol too.

At the end of the game, Cotton awards hearts to the player with the most Sun or Moon symbols on the paths, and the player with the most hearts wins the game.
user summary
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Square Grid, Tile Placement

name: Betopolis
description:
Players move their pawn around the board. Most spaces allow to invest in a building project. First player may buy the material, next player (may be the same) landing on this space may buy the work needed for this specific project. If a player lands there again, the project will be realized on a vacant place in the center of the board but the player who paid for the material must buy an allowance. After that, the indicated revenue will be shared equally. From now on, the player who paid for the material may earn a rent if another player lands on that space. There are less places than projects. When all places are occupied, the richest player wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Ownership, Roll / Spin and Move, Semi-Cooperative Game
publishers: Betomax, Identity Games International B.V., Jumbo

name: Marvel Batleworld Series 3: Ultimate Armory Mega Pack
description:
Pick your favorite Hero, rescue your friends, and win battles to defeat Thanos!

Battleworld is a revolutionary cooperative, expandable, collectible adventure game featuring dozens of characters from all over the Marvel Universe! Players get to crack open the mysterious Thanostones during the course of play to reveal the mystery character inside for a constant sense of surprise and delight!

Series 3 introduces us to brand new locations, battles, and exciting new game mechanics that will continue to challenge players and test their strategies!
categories: Children's Game, Collectible Components, Dice, Fighting, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Battledodes
description:
Battledodes is a two-player, turn-based, dice-throwing boardgame. The aim is to land high rolls on high-numbered spaces while also attacking your opponent’s position.

Players take turns rolling up to four dodes (d12 dice), one at a time, bouncing them off the central wall, aiming to land on their side of the board in a numbered space (1-5) – not in the dead zone (0) or out.

Players add 1 point to their game score for every multiple of 12 scored on a turn (after taking an attack). The first player to reach 12 game points wins.

To play, you will need to:


Download and print the board (or buy it)
Build the wall
Get some dodes
Learn the rules
Find another player or play by yourself


—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Dice, Print & Play

name: Hoppin' Garage
description:
This game is a "cooperative draft game" in which players do not compete with each other, but cooperate with each other to achieve their respective goals. Players will become craftsmen who make different beers at each brewery and aim to complete the beer listed on the goal card.

Players are the artisans who make different beer in each brewery and aim to complete the beer on their goal card. In the process of collecting and completing your beer ingredients, you can enjoy learning all 10 major beer style tastes, raw materials, and the process of making beers.

name: Realm of Thraul: Stones
description: 2-player game of strategy. Stones is a grid style board game with different colored squares defining a different type of movement. The goal of the game is to create a continuous stream of your color stones without getting stuck while accumulating more points than you opponent. Points are earned by landing on pink diamond squares; however, the pink diamond squares are also where your opponent can steal your stone and collect extra points for themselves.

name: Schnauferl und Eisenbahn
description:
The players form two parties. Everyone puts a bet to be determined in advance into the till. Two players take over the positions of the signalmen and handle the closing and opening of the railway barriers. One party starts at C, the other at D. The players take turns rolling the die and moving. After the first throw has fallen, the work of the signalmen begins. If a straight throw (2, 4, 6) has been thrown, the strip representing the railway is positioned on II, if odd (1, 3 , 5) is thrown, it is on I. This is to be done after each throw, and this will alternately block the blue stripe representing the country road. If the railway crossing is closed, the players have to stop till it opens again.

E-F presents a bridge on which 2 cars cannot drive side by side. If a player comes to the bridge and this is occupied by an oncoming car, he has to wait at E or F until the bridge is free. Also, no player can overtake a car moving in the same direction, but must occupy the next space behind it.

If two oncoming cars come to a stop on the same space on the road, this means a collision. The two players then have to roll the dice together. The lower throw is eliminated from the game, the other moves back 10 spaces.

Whoever reaches the opposite end of the lane first gets half the contents of the till and his party a point, and for each additional car that arrives earlier than the first car of the other party, another point. The first winner of the opposing party receives a quarter of the contents of the till. The last quarter remains in the till. The game is repeated until one party has 30 points. This party distributes the remainder in the till evenly among its members.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Meer-Fahrt vor 3000 Jahren
description:
The game is based on the following idea: A number of Greek youths and maidens intend to visit the "Island of Friendship". Each player initially receives 30 tokens, of which he pays 10 into the till. If the cash runs out during the game, each player pays in another 10 tokens. The Players take turns to roll and move. The ships depart from space A, but are immediately caught up in a storm that pushes the vessels in different directions until the player manages to get past space B or C. From then on, the ship follows the chosen direction until it finally reaches space
A again to win the game.

If a ship comes to a green space, the player receives as many tokens from the till as his roll counted eyes. If he comes to a red space, he has to pay the same amount into the till. If a player is unable to make their payments, it means "shipwreck"; he receives a lifeboat and swaps his previous colored ship for a black one. With this he may continue to move; he is waived from paying twice if he stands on red. If he gets into payment difficulties again, this boat sinks and the player is eliminated from the game.

Scylla and Charybdis: As before, the player advances his ship by the number of columns equal to the number of eyes he rolled, but must place himself on the square of the column in question that shows the same number of eyes as his roll.
Friendship Island: In front of the island there are two squares to jump over. If unsuccessful, the attempt must be repeated the next time. If ships coming from different directions meet on the island, they share their wealth equally among themselves.
Vortex: The player stays around the circle with his ship until he comes to one of the exit spaces.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Reise durch Schlaraffien
description:
After everyone has agreed on the amount of the bet, the order is determined by rolling the die. Since laziness is trumps in the Land of Cockaigne, the last ones naturally go first, that is, whoever has the lowest number of points begins. Those who have thrown an even number of eyes are assigned the right ribbon, the others the left, after which the game begins.

The players take turns rolling the die and moving their pawn. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. The first player to reach space 31 wins the Game.

—user summary
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Segel-Regatta
description:
The players choose a game master (GM) who accepts the registrations, raffles the starting places, directs the races and manages the till. The tools required are: 4 cruiser yachts (A), 4 racing yachts (B), 1 escort steamer (C) for the game master, 1 black and 1 white die and a large number of tokens.

It is at the discretion of the GM to organize races for cruiser yachts or races for racing yachts. The stake for the former is 20, for the latter 10 tokens. If more than 4 participants register for a race, preliminary races will be held; only the first and second winning boats take part in the main race. If there are still more than 4 participants, further elimination races are held.

The fairway for the yachts is marked by the colors yellow, red, green and blue, in addition, the white gully to the right of it is also part of the legal fairway.

The white die is used to advance on the track. On the roll of 3 or 6, the yacht goes straight ahead, with a roll of 2 or 5 the same number of spaces in the next right fairway, on 1 and 4 the number of spaces forward in the next left fairway.

If two yachts land on the same square, the one that is in the wrong fairway is eliminated from the race. If both meet in the wrong fairway, the one that is furthest away from its rightful fairway is eliminated. Furthermore, whoever comes off the racetrack, is eliminated too.

Any participant who believes that he is in danger of being eliminated may turn up on his lawful fairway as soon as it is his turn to throw the dice. He reports this intention to the GM, uses the black die and moves back as many squares as he rolls in the next fairway against his legal fairway. For each roll of the black die, 3 tokens must be paid into the till.

The goal has been reached if the player rolls at least one eye more than there are still spaces left up to the end line.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Seven Ravens
description:
A fairly simple abstract strategy game for two with a Nordic feel, which combines elements of hnefatafl and chess. Stated to be a traditional folk game with rules handed down in the family, when marketed online, but it appears not to have been previously recorded.

Played on a square wooden board, divided into 7×7 undifferentiated squares (the game can also be played on an 8×8 chess board).

One player takes 6 light / natural coloured discs, termed ravens, and sets them up in one corner of the board, one in the very corner, another in each of the adjacent squares, and the remaining three in the squares adjacent to those. The opponent takes six dark / stained discs, and similarly sets them up in the opposite corner. Each player's specially marked disc, termed Odin's Raven, is placed at the head of this flock. Players then take turns in moving one of their ravens, with the aim of winning the game by capturing all of the opposing ravens.
Odin's raven moves like a knight in chess, and captures by landing on an opposing disc. Other ravens move like chess rooks, and capture by flanking an opposing disc, as in hnefatafl. Odin's raven may also participate in these flanking captures.
There are several slight variants with differing movement / capturing rules.

name: Aggretsuko Office Rage Card Game
description: Be the first to empty your hand by placing Coworker Cards in the workspace to make or add onto sets and sequences. The first player in each round to empty their hand gets to flip a Karaoke Token, and a new round begins. Flip three Karaoke Tokens to win this fast-paced game!

name: Cat Traveler In Asia
description:
The Theme
Travel all over Asia to complete Mission.

Game-Play
Players will travel through eight places in Asia.Whoever has the most points wins.
At the beginning, each player has two travel cards and chooses a place as the starting point,they can use the tool card on that place.

1.When it comes to your turn, first draw two travel cards,
2.discard the travel cards to go to other nearby places, but if you are directly adjacent, it is free, and then you need 1 card for each step.

3.Going to this place will trigger the square work tool card below. If the player does not want to trigger the tool card, they can choose to grab a travel card instead.
Then, you can play a travel card with a place at hand to complete the task.

4.Then, you can play Unlimited travel cards with a place at hand to complete the task.

move to other player until who have got 5 missions.

after a round end,the second player will become first player.
(In addition, the event card is an expansion accessory. you can add event cards to make the game more fun. There will be an event every round start, Events affect everyone,and players can use the event to win.)

Goal Of The Game
A player completes five Missions, and the game ends in that round. Whoever has the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Party Game, Travel
publishers: HK Board Game Studio(Lssy ltd), 香港桌遊工作室

name: Blockazzle Craze
description:
Blockazzle is an elastic bar which is composed of 12 cube blocks tied with an elastic rope. With special groove on each cube, Blockazzle allows kids to rotate cubes to build many different 2D & 3D structures. Kids can also use Blockazzle to challenge 3D puzzles included in this game set to practice on logic thinking, vector & space basics. Blockazzle is well designed to carry & play wherever you go. Enclosed USL cubes work as an aide to little kids or beginners.

For 2 players, they can compete against each other for building the given structure on flash cards. While for 1 player alone, one can use the two Blockazzle bars to create more puzzles with challenging fun, it is also encouraged to create more puzzles with your own thoughts.

name: Escape Comics: The Alien Ship
description:
Earth is under threat by a mysterious Alien presence. Your mission is to get into the ship, learn their master plan and then escape in time to save the planet!

The Alien Ship is the first escape room board game incorporating an illustrated comic book to deliver the narrative. Players will encounter obstacles as they read through the book, then gain access to tactile puzzle pieces from the game box which will allow them to find a solution. The pieces mirror the situation in the book, delivering a uniquely immersive experience.

Solving each puzzle unlocks the next part of the story. "The Alien Ship" will have you yelling, "what happens next!?" every time at the end of every page.

—description from the publisher

name: Punn Pyramid
description:
Punn Pyramid is a game about words and their meaning. It is based on a unique relationship that exists between some words called a Word Pyramid.

The word 'Pyramid' can be used to illustrate the concept of a Word Pyramid. When P is removed from the pyramid the remaining letters are rearranged to form MYRIAD. When M is removed from myriad the remaining letters are used to form the words DAIRY and DIARY. By removing I, R and D in succession the words YARD, DAY, and AY are formed respectively. See box cover.

Players must determine words from definitions and other related clues given. Players must solve a series of unrelated words and from one to four word pyramids.

Before the game begins, Players decide how many word pyramids each player will solve and how many of them are to be solved starting with the smallest word and how many with the largest word.

When one or two word pyramids are to be solved by each player, one revolution of the perimeter must be made. When three to four word pyramids are to be solved by each player, two revolutions of the perimeter must be made.

The winner of the game is the first player who completes the required number of revolutions of the perimeter and solves the required number of word pyramids.

name: Factor
description:
The family-game of multiplication.

Steal your friend's factors, combine factors to new products, use the unknown x-factor well to win the game. And get better at math in the meantime.

Included: The Fctor challenge for solitary play. Who can solve the Factor puzzle?

A fun and quick card fame for the whole family. The game improves your understanding of numbers and multiplication, while you collect tricks, and steal the best cards from your opponents.

name: BattleTech: Pseudotech – Arcade Operations
description:
So, you call yourself an “Elite MechWarrior,” huh? What’s your top score in Grand ’Mech Melee, huh? Your longest chain in Tankertris? Have you ever beaten the Stinger Challenge? Where’s your Legendary Duelist medal? Bet you can’t even complete a single wave of Droneroids on your first life without a Shield buff! Go back to your Maraudero Party games, you noob!

Just because there’s a war on and you’re driving fifty-five tons of high-tech armor and weaponry in a giant, walking avatar of death doesn’t mean you can’t have a little fun, does it? Of course not! PseudoTech: Arcade Operations presents ways to spice up your BattleTech games in a manner that will amuse even the grimmest and most jaded of veterans. From power-ups that can offer your ride anything from instant death to temporary invincibility, to medal-worthy challenges beyond the humdrum monotony of win-or-die missions, show the Inner Sphere what you’ve got in nearly a dozen new scenario types—all presented in bright, colorful, holographic splendor, right on your very own tabletops! Special rules provide the classic arcade flavor your battles have been missing ever since you left the academy for the front lines, with bold new battle ribbons to be earned as you build a new kind of legendary status as king of your local military entertainment center!

Oh, and be sure to load up on extra tokens. The competition looks pretty fierce out there!

—description from the publisher

April Fool's 2022 release
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: The Biggest CHONK Card Game
description:
The cards list CHONK information and the aim of the game is to compare these values to try to trump and win an opponent's card.

Each pack includes 36 playing cards, instructions, 3 blank cards you can customize yourself and a helpful CHONK chart.

Rules:

2 or more players can play
Player to the left of the dealer chooses their best stat they want to compare
The highest stat (number) wins and the player takes both cards
Winner of the previous round gets to choose the next stat
If both stats are the same, the players tap their cards (meaning they turn them sideways), then they each add an additional card turned upside down on top, and finally they play the stat game again with a third card. The winning player takes all six cards
Instead of playing a stat, players can also guess the cat's favourite food (chicken, fish, beef, pork, lard or treats). If they guess correctly, they win both cards
The game ends when all cards are drawn, and the player with the most cards wins
categories: Animals, Card Game, Educational, Humor, Memory, Trivia

name: Oster-Rubbel-Kalender
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1. If a player gets on a space with a shrub he gets to scrub the shrub away to reveal a picture of what is hiding behind to hinder or benefit the player. Obviously the scrubbing part works only for the first time playing the game. The first player to reach shrub 12 wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the magazine "Journal für die Frau" No. 7/1991.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: What I Meant Was
description:
Enjoy a fun light-hearted card game made up of 2 types of cards. Expression Cards and Speech Cards. Each round a judge is chosen to pick who had the best scenario. Scenarios are created when the judge flips over the top card of the Speech Card Deck. Each Player then places down one of their 5 Expression Cards onto the table that they thought would be a good reaction to the phrase written on the Speech Card. The judge hands the Speech Card to whomever they thought had the best "reaction." Players draw a new Expression Card and the next round begins. The game ends after one player wins 10 Speech Cards.

—description from the designer

name: Path of Rivals
description:
Path of Rivals is a take on a TCG battling game with a dexterity mechanic to obtain cards. Path of Rivals is the first TCG-style game where players must physically collect the cards they will use to battle with.

To start the game, both players will start at opposite ends of a single path made up of creature cards. As the players move along the path they will be trying to catch creature cards until the two players meet along the path. Once players meet the epic battle begins. There are four different creature types that are assigned to each poker suit with type advantages. Battling in Path of Rivals uses a rock paper scissors style mechanic that allows for a fresh and streamlined take on traditional TCG gams.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Auction: Dexterity, Modular Board, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Set Collection, Single Loser Game

name: Build or be Killed
description:
Build or be Killed is a solo zombie-themed solitaire game where you play as a survivor trying to build a barrier of cards around a zombie-infested city to keep it from being overrun. Throughout the game, you will be collecting cards to use as weapons to remove zombies from the city or to use as barriers to place around the city. Manage your collected cards well or risk the city being completely overrun and losing the game.

—description from the designer

name: Pentagon
description:
Pentagon is a quick yet strategic head-to-head area control style game. In Pentagon, two players will be competing to hold the majority of their colored cards in the play area. With simple rules and strategic decisions, players can pull off some big combos and pull out ahead to win. Pentagon is unique in the way players will also have their opponent’s cards in their hands and can use them to their advantage.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Hand Management, Modular Board, Tile Placement, Tug of War

name: Roll 'em In!
description:
Roll 'em In! is a fishing tournament in a tiny mint tin. Move around the lake, roll dice to catch fish, and be the first to score 10 points.

To catch fish players will roll 3 dice trying to match the dice face on all 3 dice. Players can choose which number on the dice to pursue. The higher the dice number the higher the value of fish can be caught. As the game progresses players will be able to unlock better abilities and higher valued fish.

With a randomized game board made of cards, choose your own path player upgrades, and a few lucky dice this game is a real catch!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Re-rolling and Locking, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hobbe Manor
description:
Hobbe Manor is a light, fast competitive game of memory, trickery, and magic! Take on the role of the family and servants leaving gifts for a sneaky magical house-elf.

Can you be the first to match The Hobbe with either The Food or The New Clothes in a single room of the Manor house?

To complete this task requires some cleverness, because the Mystery cards move around, and the Hobbe is the slipperiest character of them all! Your role also changes at every turn -- from the Lord to the Bootboy and everyone in between.

Hobbe Manor is simple to play, but hard to master! With several different modes of play, everyone can enjoy the magic and mystery of this crafty BeCrofty game!

—description from the publisher

name: It's Obvious: Free Trial Version
description:
A tiny free promotional demonstration version of It's Obvious.

In standard It's Obvious, there are 300 cards, 8 number tokens, 10 round tokens and 6 voting wheels and player count is 3 to 6 players.

In this free demo version, there are 15 cards and no other components and player count is 3 to 4 players.
mechanics: Communication Limits, Connections, Cooperative Game, Deduction

name: Sauriana
description:
Sauriana is a dynamic 32mm skirmish wargame from fossilpunk foundry, set in an alt-history 1800s. Players build a posse of daring agents from one of four main factions vying for dominance in a strange new frontier of time-displaced dinosaurs, steam-powered automatons, rogue science and Victorian-era weirdness!

Join the ranks of the Othniellians or Cope Collective, waging the 'bone wars' across the American frontier, delve into the jungle depths as a member of the explorer's club, or field mercenaries and monsters of the world's faire in this narrative, gunslinging game where every choice matters, every character can be customized to your liking, and danger lurks everywhere!

—description from the publisher
categories: American West, Miniatures, Prehistoric, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Moving Multiple Units, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Turn Order: Stat-Based, Variable Set-up

name: ¿Quién Será?
description:
Knowing Jesus that one of his disciples was going to deliver him, because that is how it was detailed in the Scriptures, and it had to happen for the prophecy to be fulfilled. He finds Judas, who exchanged gold coins to sell him. The other disciples entered into doubt and suspicion, but what is written is written, and this cannot be changed.

A mini party game, with a Christian parody theme. The game is casual with a single goal and 2 rules!

Cards are separated according to the number of players (always ensuring that the card of Jesus and Judas are there), once the cards have been dealt, all the players look at their cards and leave them face down, only the one who has the card of Jesus is the one who shows the other players, and obviously leaves it face up.

The goal of the game is to find Judas among the other players. Whoever has the Judas card must make Jesus discover him before the other disciples.

If Jesus finds Judas, Jesus and Judas win (the prophecy is fulfilled). If the disciples found Judas, the disciples win (and the prophecy is not fulfilled).

—user summary

name: La Carpinchada Junior
description:
A children's game based on La Carpinchada.

In this case, the small capybaras do their thing, and go through the Iberá estuaries in two challenges (two games) and train to be the new owners of the ibera.

Lead three capybara brothers from the same family and beat the other families in these challenges.

name: Complete Murder Mystery: Murder at the Tower of London
description:
A murder has been committed in the Tower of London.

Players assume the character of one of ten people, all present at the Tower of London at the time of the murder. Over the course of the gathering, the players must mingle, converse, and consequently determine who is the murderer.

Each player is given a list of 6 statements that must be made during the game. These statements should lead the best investigator to the guilty party.

Perfectly presented in an elegantly finished whiskey style gift box it is a perfect way to entertain your friends and family for an evening.

Contents:
Newspaper containing plots and recipes
10 x character booklets
10 x murder cards
2 x sheets of name stickers

name: Three Ages of Rome
description:
For seven centuries, the history of Rome was central to the history of Europe. This story of expansion and decline is the inspiration for these wargames' rules.

Designed for ease of play, Three Ages of Rome offers a player experience based on the commander’s problems. The rules are designed to create a feel for the uncertainty of ancient battles. Most games should take 2-3 hours to play. No rebasing required, can be played with all current basing styles and conventions.

Keeping your men going, even when things don't seem too good, is critical for success. Units are likely to become progressively disabled and cohesion begins to suffer. If commanders don’t take care to maintain cohesion, then they could be heading for disaster!

The six historical battle scenarios span the Three Ages and provide different challenges. They offer players an insight into the nature of command in ancient warfare. The Terrain Generator and Scenario Generator allow the players to develop their own games. For competitive games, a system of points gives players all the information needed to exactly balance their forces.

In battle nothing is certain but generals that practice their skills are more likely to be victorious.

—description from the publisher

name: Kein Festmahl für das Teufelchen
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. The player who rolls a 1 first begins the game. On some spaces events concerning the cultivation of potatoes hinder or benefit the players. The first to reach pace E wins the game.

The game was published as a supplement to the children's book "Kein Festmahl für das Teufelchen".

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Hex Chex
description:
This game is an abstract strategy game. Consisting of hexagonal tiles arranged to form a much larger hexagon, and 18 moveable pieces.

This is a 2 player game where you can eliminate all your opponents' pieces or capture their starting tile. The game is played by taking turns moving pieces. Each player starts the game with 4 canons and 5 soldiers. The soldiers are restricted to walking and jumping forward. The canons can walk and jump in any direction. The canons also have the ability to launch a piece overtop of themselves to either get a soldier to go backwards by a space, or to crush an enemies piece. You can capture pieces by crushing them or jumping them.

name: Squary Movey
description:
A Sudoku variant on a 9 x 9 spaces grid.
Players may move their pawn (numbered from 0 to 8) one space onto an adjacent vacant space, if in the column and row and 3 x 3 zone this number is not present yet. The player who first has 5 of his pawns in the indicated area (varies according to the number of players) wins.
Variation 1: You must have 6 instead of 5 pawns in the designated area.
Variation 2: Throw the die to determine which pawn is to be moved.

name: Nine Muses
description:
Answer the call of the muses to earn your place in the history books as a great sage, leaving your rivals in the footnotes.

Nine Muses is a 2-4 player competitive card game where you can set yourself up to gain or steal humanity's most powerful resource: knowledge.

With the help of famous philosophers and the Nine Muses of Antiquity, you'll gather knowledge to gain points and put yourself ahead of the competition.

—description from the designer

name: Patient 0
description:
Patient Zero is a strategic and very challenging game with a lot of player interaction and few simple rules. It’s a visual puzzle game that works with layers and has a strong and unusual table presence with chromatic combinations with an isometric and amorphous look (each turn the board will be reshaped and the board will always have different shapes from game-to-game).

The game uses tile laying, pattern recognition/building and area control mechanics to promote interesting decisions and cognitive work. It has a fast setup and a short game length.

SAMPLE #28 // MEDICAL REPORT

The sample was taken 12 days after the first symptoms. At the time the patient showed several symptoms and the infection was spreading throughout the lungs, stomach, liver and kidneys.

This game takes place inside a laboratory where each player will be a scientist working to discover a vaccine against a fast spreading virus discovered on patient zero. Time is of the essence and each player has to work on the taken sample (tile-laying on a common board) in order to fulfil the immune system’s demands (therapeutic objectives) and getting antibodies (Y disc) which are necessary to neutralize the antigen agent in each of the four affected organs.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Medical, Puzzle

name: Qvalitetstid: Parforhold
description:
Do you want to have fun and cozyness?
Do you want to have great contact?
Do you want more intimacy in your relationship?


This quiz-game will strengthen you as a couple, and you certainly don't need to have problems to play the game. It's a tool to bring you closer together.

The 200 cards in 8 categories, will help you to get to know each other, and bring you closer, while you have fun, laugh, and develop your relations, and talk about subject that you might have forgotten in your day-to-day life.

Qvalitetstid - Parforhold is a quiz-game which is cozy and fun to play. You will closeness and more positive contact in your conversations, and your will have som real talks, which will give your a closer relationship, more intimacy and a greater understanding of each other.

The game is developed by couples-therpist Anna Østergaard and game-designer Jake Inlove.
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Héroes y Mitos
description: Thematic board game with mythological content.

name: Casino Night Game
description:
POG Casino night let’s you play all your favorite casino games POG style!
Casino War,Blackjack Attack, Texas Hold’em Poker and more.
You can even invent your own games with the 52 POG’s and 2 Jokers.

name: In The Shadow Of Jupiter
description:
In The Shadow Of Jupiter is a 1-4 player cooperative resource management game set on four moons of Jupiter.
The year is 2075. Earth is running out of resources.
