Countries and global corporations are growing desperate and have taken to the outer planets for a new source of energy to replace our dwindling reserves. A deep space probe discovers a new rare element in the lower troposphere of Jupiter which scientists name Exonium. This element will provide significant relief to the energy crisis on Earth.
In a move to beat its competitors, the Power Dynamics Corporation (PDC) has decided to take matters into its own hands. PDC has built a large carrier spacecraft containing four drop ships and sufficient resources to initiate development of stations on four of the moons of Jupiter, Io, Europa, Ganymede, and Callisto.

You and your fellow PDC teammates will serve as the Commanders of these moon stations. You will each strive to establish a base camp, build the necessary production facilities, and become self-sufficient all the while working with your fellow commanders to get the Orbital Platform running at full strength. The environment around Jupiter is an extremely hostile one. Radiation, magnetic storms, moon quakes, and uncounted quantities of small debris rain down on every moon within the Jovian system. Life on an inhospitable foreign moon can be dangerous, but if the human race is to survive, failure is not an option…….

Welcome to In the Shadow of Jupiter, a strategic co-op game where you and your fellow PDC colleagues will strive to build stations on the different moons of Jupiter and survive against the dangers of space long enough to complete construction on the orbital mining platform. You are up against the clock, you can only last for so long before running out of supplies!

—description from the designer

name: Dice Flower
description:
Get secateurs, flannel shirts, vases and… gray matter! Play as the owner of one of a kind flower shop! Manage, plan, plant, cut and create beautiful, colorful bouquets. Don’t let the flowers and your growing ambition wither, to get as many Happiness Points as possible and win the competition. Are you ready to meet the demands of an endless queue of customers? Play and see for yourself!

Rool & write game with:

unique board layout in each game
deep and strategic gameplay
unique mechanics
high replayability


—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Re-rolling and Locking, Set Collection

name: La feria de Tristán
description:
La feria de Tristán ("The Tristan Fair") is a competitive card game, where you will represent a fair walker trying to find everything you need for your shopping list (objectives). You will buy product cards, which will give you benefits and victory points at the end of the game.
On a day of the Tristan Fair sudden events can happen that will modify the course of the game a little. Prices will change as the game progresses, becoming cheaper to buy at certain stalls, but keep in mind that other players will also compete for better prices.
So try to go to the shopping stalls first, managing your money very well so as not to run out of it.

The goal of the game is to make the most points at the end of the game.
Each player will try to get product cards and will have to combine them with others, which will give them victory points, in different ways, at the end of the game.
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Movement, Hand Management, Market, Set Collection, Trading

name: Four Score
description:
Four Score injects a modern and strategic twist into a classic gaming mechanism. Players compete with wooden sticks to complete a line of four on both sides of the game board. Diagonal, horizontal or vertical will do the trick. To be victorious in Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye and a plan two steps ahead of your opponent.

Players take turns inserting wooden sticks through both sides of the game board, selecting which holes on either side as they play. Sticks can only be controlled from a players own side, not manipulated from within the game board.

The player who completes a line of four on both sides of the game board first is crowned the winner!

As games progress dexterity plays an increasing role. Dislodge a stick while attempting your move and your turn is over.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Action / Dexterity, Children's Game

name: Die Rad-Wettfahrt
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the player. The first player to reach space 57 wins the game.

The game was probably published in the 1920's.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Ticket to Europe
description:
Ticket to Europe is a socially engaged, cooperative role-playing board game for 1-4 people. The player assumes the role of a refugee traveling from Africa to Europe. The game portrays the reality of the smuggling world and confronts players with morally difficult choices.
As part of the documentation, the creators visited a refugee camp on the Greek island of Lesbos, in order to present the phenomenon of the migration crisis as accurately as possible.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Network and Route Building, Role Playing, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Neues Luftballonspiel
description:
The goal of the game is to rise 7000 m into the air and then land your balloon safely. Movement is determined by 3 dice. Two numbered dice determine the rise and descent of a balloon, whereas the letter die determines movement to the left or right.
On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. If a balloon rises above 6300 m it risks its passengers freezing to death or the balloon blowing up.

The first player to safely land his balloon wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Square Grid

name: Ya-La-Vi
description:
Ideal for family play and easy to play alone between childhoods. Between 2 cards… Which image is repeated??? mmmm… I ALREADY SAW IT!

You have to say it quickly, as soon as you found the match. The more attention you have, the easier you will see them! Hurry up, concentrate, wake up because in this game, speed rushes us and fun awaits us. If you take two cards and look closely, you will see that they always have one image in common (one and only one). So the goal of the game (in its 5 variants) is to find that common image between two cards and name them as quickly as possible.

1- Pile, Pile with challenges!
A card with images is distributed to each participant and the rest are placed in a pile in the center, with the images visible. You must look for the common image between the card that touched you and the first of the stack. Whoever names the match first draws the center card and places it on top of their own pile. when a challenge card appears, whoever meets it first wins the indicated cards. The game ends when there are no more cards in the center of the table and whoever collects the most cards wins.

2- Discard with challenges!
Opposite of "Stack, stack": a card is placed in the center of the table and the rest are distributed among those who play. Each participant has to find the common image between the card that is on the table and the first of their stack. When the match is found, it quickly drops it on the table, discarding itself. Whoever runs out of cards first wins. In this variant they also play the 4 challenge cards, each time a participant reveals one of these cards, they must read it aloud to the rest... So everyone participates!

3- The jersey (without challenges)
In the center of the table 9 cards are placed face up. The jersey is assembled by finding the same image on three different cards. Whoever forms them first and names the image that matches, takes all three cards (which must be replaced so that there are always 9 cards on the table). Once the cards are finished, whoever collected the most wins.

4- Take it yourself! (no challenges)
Each participant receives a card face down. The remaining cards are placed in a stack face up in the center of the table. Each participant has to find the common image between the card of the center and that of any participant (except their own). When the match is found, give the center card to whoever has the card with the match. Whoever keeps the most cards loses.

5- Pass it fast! (no challenges)
Each participant puts a card on the palm of his hand, in view of the rest. When someone finds the image in common between one card and another, he puts his own card on the matching card. Here nobody wins, but whoever keeps all the cards at the end loses.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Conquest
description:
“Conquest” dates back to the 19th century and is one of the many games inspired by Checkers and Chess and which are also inspired by real historical episodes, such as battles, sieges, military events; among these games we remember “Asalto”, “Assault” and “Siege of Paris”. The game is developed on a 9x9 chessboard; each player has eight Soldiers and a King, initially arranged in the 3x3 lower right and upper left areas; the King is placed in the center of these areas and is completely surrounded by the eight Soldiers. The goal of the game is to conquer the Fortress, which is the 3x3 area in the center of the game board.
Information on this game is not readily available: it is mentioned in “Il Grande Manuale dei Giochi da Tavolo” by Giuseppe Meroni and Aldo Spinelli (1996).

name: Schmuggler und Grenzwächter
description:
One player has 7 red pawns (smugglers), which start on the spaces marked with an "A" and has to to cross the border and escape by leaving the game board via one of the spaces marked with a "C". For every escaped smuggler the player is awarded points.

The other player has 4 green pawns (border patrol) on one side of the border and 3 blue pawns on the other side. He has to prevent the smugglers to reach their goal. Members of the border patrol are not allowed to cross the border, but they may occupy spaces on the border.

Movement is one space for one pawn per turn. If a pawn gets on a space with is connected to a space which is already occupied by an enemy pawn, ist is lost and eliminated from the game and the enemy takes it's place.

After a second game with reversed roles the player with the most points is the winner.

—user summary

name: Affen-Theater
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. On some spaces events hinder or benefit the players. Sometimes the player has to take a detour. The first to reach space 50 wins the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Guano! Guano!! Guano!!!
description:
Based in 19th century American history, Guano! Guano!! Guano!!! takes players from the excrement-laden islands in the Pacific to the mansions of Newport, Rhode Island. Are you a philanthropist, an investor, or a social climber? To reach your goals, you'll have to discover new guano sources, ship it (by land or sea) to warehouses, and find the right buyers. Weather the storms, beat the competition, and enjoy the most ostentatious pastimes of the Gilded Age.

Players start with a small fleet on the way to building their guano empire. On each turn they place workers and ships to explore islands and take guano to various markets (ports). As their empire grows, players build bigger fleets and then spend their profits on luxuries of the Gilded Age.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, End Game Bonuses, Events, Worker Placement

name: Vivir para contarlo
description:
Live to tell the tale is a competitive card game, in which you must come in second place to win the game.
You will represent a member of the royal council who must have knowledge of botany, politics, influences with the guilds and inhabitants of the city to achieve his best strategy, but without being the best.
The object of the game is to be the player with the second highest score.
For this, each player will start with 7 cards that will run out as the game progresses. These cards have a value from 0 to 7, they are of different suits, they contain various bonuses and in each round all players must reveal a card in their playing area.
In each round, through a draft of cards, the current starting player will decide how many cards should be passed, until the cards are finished.

name: Guess The Fake junior
description:
1000 amazing statements. Which is true and which is false? It’s exciting who knows what the whole family knows. Is the highly successful True or False back? board game with another release - specifically for kids! Do you believe everything? Now it turns out who is the smartest!
In the special quiz-show board game, you will hear statements from the funny presenter, and you will have to decide whether the statement is true or false. If your answer is correct, the master will reward you with a point, but if you guessed wrong, a "reward" will be deducted. The game gets twisted from round to round, so it always stays exciting and fun. Is it True or False? There are a total of 1,000 amazing statements in the memory of Junior Board Game. The game can be played by up to 5 players, but can also be practiced alone. It’s also perfect for traveling, as all you need is a star-shaped toy. Works with 3 R6 (AA) batteries included in the box.

name: Szuper Farmer Midi
description: With the Super Farmer Midi board game, you have the opportunity to gain an insight into the life of a farm, find out what the work of farmers really is, along with the pros and cons. You can increase the number of your flock simply by rolling the dice, but you have to be on the lookout all the way because the wolf is lurking around them and can grab one of them at any time. Swap each other to collect farm animals, get at least one of each species, and become the Super Farmer! The set includes 1 rules of the game, 2 twelve-sided dice, and 128 animal pictures.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Push Your Luck, Set Collection

name: Gockola
description: Gockola is a fun board game in the yard of Gerzson Farm with lots and lots of pets. Everyone gets three stables and a deck of cards. Players flip through the animal cards at once and then knock down the cards they want to get ahead of each other. The goal is to be the first to populate the stables. Caution! There can only be one male in a barn and one or more females of the same species! Unwanted animals can be transported by truck, but if someone gets a faulty cow or a flying horse into their barn, they are in trouble because their animals are running away.

name: The Heart of Cthulhu: Father Dagon Mystery Deck
description: This is a new stand alone deck of 110 cards that can be seamlessly added to the original game. This deck adds new elements of mystery and mechanisms for fighting other players. This deck costs 5 integrity to draw from and is full of card types from the original 3 decks but introduces new mystery cards that make the game change dramatically.
categories: Adventure, Ancient, Exploration, Fantasy, Nautical, Pirates, Travel
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Kill Steal, Stacking and Balancing

name: Four Score
description:
Four Score combines strategy and dexterity in a multidimensional space. Use wooden sticks to complete lines of four on both sides of the board to win. To claim victory at Four Score you will need a steady hand, a keen eye for blocking and a passion for strategy.

Our board has a modular, minimalist design and all game components are wooden, sustainable and environmentaly friendly.

Four Score has four rules:

Red plays first and can play only on outer holes for their first move.
To win, you must complete a line of four on both sides of the board. Horizontal, vertical or diagonal will do the trick


﻿# Sticks can only be controlled from your side of the board (no reaching in to the centre of the board to complete your move)
﻿# If you dislodge a stick on your go, that stick is replaced and your turn is over
﻿Final note: in the rare event of a stalemate, if one player has competed a line of four on 1 side they are declared the winner

—description from the publisher

name: Smart10: Fotbolls-EM
description: Fifty new cards with 100 new questions and 1,000 new answers about the European Football Championship.

name: Die Kolonisten
description:
The players alternately place a cardboard strip, beginning with the double red bordered harbor square, which must be filled first; this is followed by the 5 squares of the port city, then the 3 of the track. When all of these squares are closed, each player can place his strips anywhere on the board. Exceptions are the gold fields marked with a red dashed border, which may only be occupied when the red border of the mountain squares surrounding them is occupied. Furthermore, the inner lines of the farms may only be occupied when the red border is completely closed.

As often as a player manages to close a square with four of his stripes, he may place markers of his color in this square, namely 2 markers each in the port city, on the railway line and on the mountains, 3 on the red-bordered farms, on the gold fields 5, on all other squares one each.

If a player succeeds in enclosing a small group of fewer than 16 of his opponents stripes in such a way that he can no longer establish a connection with a group nearby, he can remove these stripes and the latter may not occupy these lines again.

When all lines are occupied or one of the players can no longer place a strip, the game is over. Whoever has placed the most markers is the winner.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Enclosure, Square Grid

name: Air Sloop
description:
In Air Sloop you play the role of the captain of a sleek and fast air ship called an Air Sloop. You will travel to acquire goods which you use to fulfill orders and earn gold. The Air Sloop Captain with the most at the end of the game is the winner.

Air Sloop is played over several rounds.
Each round consists of each captain taking one turn.
Each captain performs one action each turn.
Turns proceed clockwise, beginning with the starting captain.

Core Loop

When it is your turn, you must do one of the following actions:

MOVE: Choose one column in your cargo hold. Pilot your air sloop to adjacent districts based on the number of open spaces in the column you choose. Take goods from each district you visit. You may not visit the same district twice during one turn. Captains may also land on a contract card to (fulfill)

BUY: Use gold to buy a stock

End of Game

The end of the game is triggered once one captain has exchanged gold for their THIRD (3rd) AND FINAL CONTRACT CARD.

All captains then take turns so that all captains have an equal number of turns.

Determining a Winner

The winner is the captain who has the most gold. Total gold is calculated by totaling up the following:


The total gold earned by the captain.
The cost of each contract card bought by the captain.
Gold earned by cargo remaining in a cargo hold by the text on the captain’s bought contract cards.
mechanics: Action Points, Area Movement, End Game Bonuses, Map Addition, Market, Modular Board, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement

name: Monsters and the Things That Destroy Them: The Deep – Baby Kaiju Promo Card
description:
A special promo card included with all copies of The Deep (KS). This card is a bit too over-the-top to include in the retail edition. It's a really fun card for wild combos, and great for lighter games. Digital version will be available as well.

Power: 0. You may swap hands with another player.

name: The Band Card Game
description:
The Band is a card game easy to learn and fast to play. The goal of the game is to form your own band (singer, guitarist, bassist, drummer), but watch out for other players: they will have the same goal as you! Opponents will be able to get in your way with fierce Groupies, Producers ready for anything and unscrupulous Head Hunters. Don't worry, though: your Bodyguards will protect you from any malicious player.

Draw from the main deck and play as many cards as you want. The cards you play go into your personal discard pile, called the backstage pile. If you draw an event you skip the turn and suffer (or all players suffer) the effects of the event. Events discard onto a common discard pile and cannot be owned by players. You must have a maximum of 4 cards in your hand to end your turn. If you have more, you can discard the excess cards to the backstage (without using them) and pass the turn. The first to form a complete band wins!

name: FUSS
description:
The nightmare of a few teenagers in a suburban housing estate comes true when on a weekday evening walk they see an alien spaceship landing at the end of their street. The kids have no idea what are the aliens up to but the situation seems to be serious, so they need to run away and it might be a good idea to warn the neighbours that something is going on! Players are moving on a board from point to point and try to avoid aliens who are after them, while they try to alert the residents.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Network and Route Building, Point to Point Movement

name: Estet'ik
description:
Install, overlay, turn to create a gallery of portraits. Noses, eyes, mouths, hair and moustaches ... a crazy Tangram to recreate a portrait gallery! Or create your own wacky portraits!

With over 150 colourful cut-out shapes, players can choose one of 3 different games that are suggested in the rulebook.


Recreate the portrait on the template card.
Make a fun portrait using the pieces shown on the card.
Select your own pieces and board and mix and match to make your own gallery of wacky portraits.


This components lend themselves to open-ended play.

—description from the back of the box

Released by Djeco as part of the éduludo line: "A recreational and educational collection to accompany your child in his or her first learning stages."

name: Drugs/Alcohol: Play It Straight
description:
Drugs/Alcohol Play it Straight Game is very educational for Red Ribbon Week or Alcohol Prevention Program


Use this during Red Ribbon Week and provide a wide variety of activities that can be used with children and adults. Players move around the board by the "safe" or the "risk" path and must look at options, make decisions, and answer questions about drugs and alcohol. It's packed with hard-hitting information and thought-provoking real-life and imaginary situations. 2-5 players. Grades 2-Adult. Please check our more Red Ribbon Week items on our website!

name: Hatterasopoly
description: A custom board game, similar to Monopoly, but based on Hatteras, NC.

name: Kings of War: War in the Holds 2 Player Starter Set
description:
This starter set contains two starter armies for Kings of War - The Tabletop Game of Fantasy Battles.

The set contains 44 Goblin and 42 Ratkin miniatures, a softback rulebook with army lists for 14 factions, plus a getting started booklet to help you with your first games.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Line of Sight, Measurement Movement, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Share and Sparkle Unicorns
description:
Preschool cooperative game where players are all trying to fill their unicorn's crown and necklace with gems, before the troll fills his bag with gems. Players roll and blindly take gems out of the bag and place any that match openings on their unicorn board. Any that can't be played are given to the troll. Any red gems will go straight to the trolls bag and a red gem token is drawn that will either be good for the unicorns or good for the troll. Players can also roll to share the gem they draw and they'll share all the gems they draw once they finish their unicorn. Play until all of the unicorns have all of their gems or the troll has filled his sack with gems.

—description from the designer

name: Highlights: Hidden Pictures – Flashlight Search Game
description:
Team up and work together to search for 150 things to find in this nighttime carnival scene loaded with surprises. Use your Flashlight wand to make the scene on the game board magically appear, and hunt for cleverly hidden things to find on a game board measuring over 3 feet long. Look carefully, because all objects are cleverly disguised in a variety of Hidden Pictures ways. The trickier the search, the more points you can score. Race to be the first team to find enough things to score the most points and win!

—description from the designer

name: Feisty Dice
description:
A roll and write game where players are trying to be the first to fill in their colored dry-erase boards. Roll your dice and decide what to keep and what to re-roll. After 2 rolls decide which dice to score on your board; you can choose all dice of one color or exactly one of each color. Then keep any dice showing your color and yellow, all other players grab dice showing their color, and there are any dice left pass those to the player on your left and it's their turn. Use special "spit fire" power two times during the game to score twice on your turn. No reading required to play this family-friendly game.

—description from the designer

name: Keep It Clean
description:
A player reads seemingly dirty clues to the group and like "Full Service" or "Hot and Ready" and players have only a quick flip of the timer to come up with something that fits that description that is NOT dirty. Only squeaky clean answers will score.

—description from the designer

name: The Great Cooper's Hill Cheese Roll
description:
The Great Coopers Hill Cheese Roll is a fast racing game of chasing a roll of cheese down a hill, based on the very real activity of doing the same. Participants are racing to be the first ones to reach the bottom hill. Alternatively, players can attempt to catch the 9-pound double Gloucester cheese as they race down the hill to be instantly victorious.

Cooper's Hill is a write and roll game where layers simultaneously will write a number between 1 and 20 and then reveal at the same time. Writing the highest number will grant the player with the fastest speed but will also make them more likely to take a injury. Based on the number you wrote and how you move on the hill you will roll dice indicating what kind of injuries you sustain.

Attempt to push you luck just enough to avoid being eliminated while still reaching the bottom the fastest.

name: Anno Domini 1666: Octavia
description: Octavia is a 28mm metal miniature from the Hot & Dangerous range that is not only a collector item, but also a playable model in Anno Domini 1666. She is a mercenary character available to most factions. In addition to her miniature, she comes with a character card and four equipment cards.
categories: Adventure, Age of Reason, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Player Powers

name: Lucanus
description:
You command an army of stag beetles. They are fighting each other on a cloven oak tree. The winner takes the ultimate delicacy – the oozing sap. The rules are simple, yet the tactical and strategic approaches are nearly endless. The goal is to get three of your stag beetles to the opponent's front row first. To get there, you'll need to push the enemy bugs off onto other branches, crush them, and drop them from the tree.

The game is played on a 10 x 10 square board. You can use two or three beetles to displace one or two enemy beetles in columns and in rows. But watch out! Diagonal push moves are mandatory. Even if you don’t like the direction! It will often be convenient for you to let your opponent push your stag beetles out during the game as this will weaken their position. And you can use these weaknesses to your advantage.

Some weaknesses can become strengths during the game. It works both ways. In the beginning of a game, it is generally good to keep a lot of stag beetles in diagonals. However, the more you move into your opponent's territory, the more you must be vigilant that they don't take advantage of your diagonals. For instance, they could place their beetles behind yours just to make you push them towards your front row.

A popular tactic is to sacrifice some of your stag beetles by letting them fall off the tree or be crushed. This destabilizes your opponent's position, and you can easily sneak this move in. You can also let your opponent reach your first row with two of their beetles. By doing this, you gain a positional advantage. You can quickly place three of your beetles on the enemy's first rowg and win. The game is very dynamic. A position that may seem wrong can quickly turn everything around and let you win. You just need to find the right way.
mechanics: Grid Movement, Physical Removal, Point to Point Movement, Slide/Push, Square Grid, Static Capture

name: Les Mille pas
description:
In Les Mille pas you play women in their professional lives. But this life is not a long, quiet road! Who will manage to beat the red lights and make a thousand steps?

A professional career is all about personal choices, decisions made by others, meetings, allies... In this game, you will have to find the right balance between blocking your opponents by distributing pitfalls symbolised by red lights, and helping them by finding solutions symbolised by green lights. The game tries to synthesise and make you live the adventure of a professional career between individuality and sisterhood. Throughout the game, players place step cards. The first player to accumulate 1000 steps wins the game!

Les Mille pas was created thanks to the testimonies of 700 women interviewed in 2020 about the obstacles and accelerators they encountered during their professional career. They also gave us their solutions for dealing with these inequalities. Les Mille pas is a reflection of these testimonies.'

—description from the designer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Take That, Team-Based Game

name: COASTER games
description:
Worthy of protecting any coffee table, this pack of random, fun coasters will also keep all party guests challenged, puzzled or simply in hysterics!

Games include:
-Coaster Construction
-Flip and Catch Game
-Flippers
-Coaster Curling
-Conveyor Belt Game
-Decision Spinner
-Dance Tips
-Peanut Basketball
-Soccer
-Tangram puzzles
-Thumb War Arena
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Humor, Memory, Party Game, Puzzle, Sports
mechanics: Flicking, Memory, Real-Time, Solo / Solitaire Game, Stacking and Balancing
publishers: Ginger Fox Games, Hacche Retail Ltd.

name: Dort: O Supremo Concílio
description:
As long as Reformed doctrine is challenged by a few different theological lines emerging in the 17th century, one meeting will define everything! Britons and Gaels, Germans and Helvetics, cross its borders and unite with the Batavians in DORT for the supreme council.

Designed by Duca Siqueira and Bruno Baptista, and illustrated by André Santana, Dort: The Supreme Council is a card game for three to six players. The dynamics are simple, and involve presumptive action, voting, simultaneous action, hand management and a special touch of “take this”!

Approve some issues and reject others, use each minister's strategy and special skills to win Tulips and win the game! The fate of the Reformed faith is at stake. Are you prepared?

So, gather and vote wisely, as each choice will determine the composition of the Canons of Dort.

name: Stratospharenflug
description:
Stratospharenflug is a German board game produced to celebrate the first human accent into the Stratosphere On 27 May 1931 by Auguste Piccard and Paul Kipfer

The game is a simple roll and move in both a horizontal and vertical directions. The game board has a grid overlaying a landscape with red and blue numbers along the Y and X- axis (similar to the game Battleship). The dice is marked on three sides with red numbers (1 to 3) and the other sides marked with blue numbers (1 to 3).
Players start at the bottom taking turns. If the dice shows a red number, a player ascends vertically, if it shows a blue number, then the player moves to the right into the landscape. Depending on the coloured numbers on the dice, players will ascend and travel right across the board. Once a player ascends to red 16 they are at the highest altitude and can go no higher. If a player has already reached red 16 and rolls red again, they must miss a turn.
To win the game the players in turn continue to roll the dice for a blue number and move to the right. This is continued until number Blue 30 and Red 16 is reached (top right corner). Whoever reaches this number first is deemed the winner.
One space on the game board shows a meteor (Red 9 - Blue 18). If a player lands on this square the player is out of the game, because his balloon burns as a result of being struck by the meteor.

The game celebrates a milestone in human endeavor. The front box shows the yellow balloon and black and silver capsule that Piccard and his assistant used in 1931. They were the first people to visually observe the curvature of the earth.

Of interest to other board games, Auguste Piccard was the inspiration for Professor Calculus in The Adventures of Tintin and Captain Jean-Luc Picard in Star Trek was named after one or both of the twin brothers.
categories: Aviation / Flight, Children's Game, Space Exploration

name: Rosengarde: Legends of Spheria
description:
Rosengarde is a cooperative role-playing adventure miniature board game for 1-4 players. The contents can also be combined with other future PROJECT ROSE System board games.

Set in the fantasy world of Spheria, it revolves around the legends of the Rosengarde and their fight against the monstrous plight threatening the world.

For centuries, the misshapen, malignant Antholons have plagued the underworld of Loriaé. The Rosengarde – stalwarts of war, who are bestowed with mysterious power and armed with steeled purpose – are all that stands between the monsters emerging from the depths of the mountains and the surface world.

In this game, you assume the role of a character and embark on dangerous quests into the monster-ridden subterranea. As you embark on a quest, fight through monsters, overcome challenges, and acquire more treasure and power, you must build up your momentum, and maintain a delicate balance between risks and rewards, in order to achieve ultimate victory.

It is also a story. Acquiring knowledge of the world and its people, proceed to make alliances, unravel mysteries, and seek the truth. Only through this you and the world in peril can attain salvation – or so it seems…

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Hexagon Grid, Role Playing, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Meytamon: Mega-Form
description:
Participate in the Meytamon duel! These powerful and
mythical creatures are your allies and will allow you to
reach victory! This family card game is accessible to
all and introduce players to collectible card game
mechanics. The games are quick to start with a single
deck, shared by all players and its simple strengths
and weaknesses system and multiple effects cards will
give you everything you need to develop complex
strategies. You can, both in group and solo mode, travel
around the Meyta region. The solo mode includes a
brand new way of playing named Gotta Draw ‘em All!
Explore all roads and cities and face the Tournament of
the 4 and your lifelong rival in the Journey mode, a
unique role-playing card game!

—description from the designer
categories: Card Game, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Deck Construction, Hand Management, Interrupts, Solo / Solitaire Game, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Smart10: Sommarspelen
description: Fifty new double-sided cards with a hundred new questions.

name: Ritual
description:
Ritual is a social deduction game based on the comedy web series “The Cultists”, available on YouTube. The Yellow is everywhere, and the devoted followers of Yog-Sothoth, Dagon, Cthulhu, and Azathoth believe the cultists of the Yellow King are preparing to sacrifice the town to their dread master. There is only one thing the intrepid band of cultists can do to stop them — summon Cthulhu!
With Cthulhu on our side, the cult of the Yellow King won’t stand a chance!
To summon Cthulhu, the cultists must complete five esoteric rituals, but they often go wrong! Is this because the cultists are just inept, or have the cultists of the Yellow King infiltrated the cult and are sabotaging it from within?
Players are secretly divided into two teams - the Loyal Cultists and the sinister Agents of the Yellow. Players are free to make claims and accusations at any time throughout the game. The game will require discussion and deception, and, perhaps a bit of logic and luck.

—description from the publisher

name: Wer schafft es am schnellsten?
description:
The players take turns moving their meeple. The start at the numbered spaces at the bottom of the board and have to get to the target spaces at the top of the board.

Movement is one space per turn or one or more jumps over red spaces (similar to halma or checkers). The fastest player to reach a target space wins the game.

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/80.

—user summary

name: Alwin Weihnachts-Würfelspiel
description:
The players take turns to roll and move. They start at space 1 and have to reach space 68 to win the game. If they get on a space with a heart, their next roll counts double. On a space with a star the next roll counts double too, but to move backwards!

The game was published in the magazine "Frösi" Nr. 12/87.

—user summary
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: City Control
description:
City Control is a worker placement and area majority game where the aim is to have control of as many buildings in the city as possible.
The placement of workers allows combinations that can change the game.
To do this, you will have to send your teams into the buildings and gain influence on the eminent people
who are inside.
Whoever scores the most points wins. Points are earned by controlling buildings with your own teams.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Hand Management, Worker Placement

name: Chakravyuha: Trading Card Game
description:
Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by ancient Indian texts of Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Puranas.

Ancient texts from India are filled with stories of Yodhas (legendary warriors) with extraordinary skills and strength that they had acquired through Education (Shiksha), Practice (Sadhana), and Penance (Tapasya).

Equipped with Vardaans (divine blessings) and Astras (divine weapons of incomparable strengths) these Yodhas elevated themselves to the level of Rathi (5000 times stronger than a Yodha); Atirathi (12 times stronger than a Rathi), or Maharathi (12 times stronger than an Atirathi). So a Maharathi has the strength of 720,000 Yodhas!

However, some Yodhas were also weakened by curses (Shraaps) by divinities that these warriors had wronged through their actions (Karma).

In Chakravyuha TCG, you command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

Chakravyuha Trading Card Game (TCG) is a battle strategy game that is inspired by this part of the ancient Indian texts. In this game, you as a General command an army (Sena) of Yodhas and strengthen them with Astras and Vardaans while weakening the opposing army with Shraaps and other effects of your superhuman warriors and their weapons.

—description from the designer

name: Mechanisms
description:
Mechanisms is a game of moving tiles and scoring points.

Players compete to add points to their own towers and keep points away from their opponents. Each turn, players use 1-3 action cards to move tiles and cards around the play space.

In addition to the actions they take on their own turn, players may place Chain tokens on cards they have previously played to take additional actions during opponent turns.

Finally, players gain access to various upgrades, including deckbuilding, whenever someone draws a tile from the top of their tower. Each round players must weigh whether to take an early upgrade or wait for a larger draw and, thus, a better upgrade.

—description from the designer
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Print & Play
mechanics: Action Points, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Follow, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Modular Board, Pieces as Map, Push Your Luck, Slide/Push, Take That

name: Netsvis
description:
The game is inspired by the Etruscan divination art and is an interpretation of how dice could have been used more than 2500 years ago.
The Netsvis board reproduces the sacred Etruscan space and can be used both alone, to draw the wishes of the day, and in competition with other players, having as its objective the challenge to Fate with the simple throw of the dice.
How to play.

Netsvis is a solitaire where you face pure destiny, destiny and what governs all the daily events behind it. It can be used as a divination tool (do I win or does Fate win?) But it is also a competitive pastime towards oneself. In fact, it is possible to numerically evaluate the outcome of the single game and gradually try to obtain better and better results. In this way it is also possible to compete with the participation of more players in succession of time.
The two dice act alternately as dice and checkers. The white die W is favorable, the one that could win. The black die B is the unfavorable one, the one that could make you lose.
At the start of the game, B is placed in the gray box in the lower center. It doesn't matter what value is shown on the top face of him.
You roll W with your right hand and, starting from the square occupied by B, advance it to the right to the first square that shows the same image of the face that came out in the roll of the dice. Here the die W stops while B remains in his place.
Now take B and throw it with your left hand. The result of the shot causes B to move to the first square corresponding to the exit face, starting from the position of W but in the opposite direction, ie to the left. Now two clarifications are necessary. The first, completely connected to superstition, is linked to the traditional beneficial influence of the right hand (which must be used to roll the white dice) while the left has always been considered a bearer of misfortune. The second clarification is fundamental for the purposes of the game. When the rule says: "Bring B into the first square on the left starting from the one occupied by W" it means that a possible release of the colors magenta, yellow or blue in this first throw of B will make it move to the right with respect to its initial position but " however "to the left of the white die.
After placing B in the corresponding square, W is taken from the square in which it is and raised (with the right hand) and then moved to the right up to the first square equal to the exit face. Also in this case the reference to the starting point of the displacement of W is the square in which B stands.
And so on, toss after toss in a continuous back and forth that leads W to the right arm of the board and brings B back to the left. The game continues until one of the two dice cannot move because it is in such a position that there is no square in front of it with the symbol that came out in that roll. If it is W, it is placed on the top white square and the player has won.
If it is B, it is moved to the top black box and the player has lost. So it's fate that won the game!
You can only win with an odd number of rolls and lose with an even number. This distinction also has its own symbolic meaning ... And you can win with a few moves or after a tiring sequence of rolling the two dice. Likewise, if Fate is adverse, a few moves may be enough to reach the nefarious black box. If you manage to stall, you must never lose hope: the arrangement of the numbers on the board can often turn the tables in our favor.
